We have an abundance of kid-friendly activities, but there’s nothing quite like catching a kids’ theatre show in Singapore or a fun kids’ musical in Singapore! From puppet shows to concerts, plays and special kids’ theatre shows, there’s lots to look forward to on stage. Bookmark this page to keep current on all the upcoming kids’ theatre happenings in 2025. Be sure to scroll to the bottom for some exciting shows taking place later this year, including Beauty and the Beast and CoComelon Live! We’ve even listed some free kids’ concerts for a pocket-friendly weekend outing!

P.S. While you’re looking for fun kids’ shows to catch, check out these cinemas with free kids’ tickets! Parents, you can also check out our list of concerts and theatre shows for adults in Singapore.

Read more: Fun Things To Do This Weekend In Singapore With the Kids

Disclaimer: These external events are not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the event organiser for event changes or cancellations before heading down.

Kids’ Theatre Shows, Musicals, Concerts & Kids’ Plays In 2025:

1. Flipside 2025: FREE kids’ theatre shows, circus, comedy, puppetry & more

The month of June is going to be a busy one for kids’ theatre show enthusiasts, as Flipside 2025 arrives at Esplanade. This performing arts festival has tonnes of FREE live performances including comedy shows, puppetry, circus shows and more to fill your weekends in Singapore! Look out for a roller rink battle, lots of acrobatics, juggling and balancing acts and more, plus workshops on these circus skills!  Here are some FREE highlights to look forward to at Flipside 2025:

Les Patineurs: Roller skate battle
When: 30 May – 1 June 2025, 6.35pm & 8pm
Where: Esplanade Forecourt Garden
How much: Free!

Ketch Comedy Show: Clown, juggling, magic & more
When: 30 May – 1 June 2025, Fri 7pm & 9pm; Sat 2.30pm & 4pm; Sun 4pm & 7pm
Where: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
How much: Free!

Aerial Open Stage: Aerial performance
When: 5 – 7 June 2025, Thu 7pm & 8.15pm; Fri 9.45pm; Sat 7pm
Where: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
How much: Free!

Witty Look Show: Unicycle acrobatics
When: 6 – 8 June 2025, 5pm & 7.30pm
Where: Esplanade Courtyard
How much: Free!

Stylish Comedy Show: Comedy magicians & jugglers
When: 6 – 8 June 2025, Fri 7pm & 8.30pm; Sat 2.30pm & 9.45pm; Sun 7pm & 9.45pm
Where: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
How much: Free!

OVVIO: Balancing tricks
When: 6 – 8 June 2025, 8.15pm
Where: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
How much: Free!

A Show with Strings: Puppetry & clowning
When: 7 – 8 June 2025, Sat 4pm & 7pm; Sun 4pm & 8.30pm
Where: Esplanade Concourse
How much: Free!

More info on Flipside 2025 here.

Read more: Live Concerts & Theatre Shows For Adults In Singapore

2. Children’s Season at CMSG: Kids’ theatre & musical performances

There’s plenty happening at Children’s Museum Singapore’s Children’s Season 2025 including some fab kids’ musicals and theatre performances. Kids will get plenty of laughs and hands-on play surrounding the food heritage of Singapore at ‘Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey’. They even get to bring home a heritage snack kit! There’s also the interactive performance ‘For a Better Future’ where kids are encouraged to take part in the show. More info on CMSG’s Children’s Season 2025 here.

Where: Children’s Museum Singapore
When: For a Better Future: 31 May & 1 June 2025; Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey: 7, 13 & 14 June 2025
How much: $25/person – get tickets here.

3. Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ kids’ concert

Who knew the pipe organ could be so magical? Introduce the kids to this fascinating classical music instrument with Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ. This kids’ concert promises an evening filled with magic, as it tells a tale of a wizard, Mr Majeika by the popular UK composer Bob Chilcott. This kids’ performance is part of the SSO Organ Series, and includes fringe activities such as exhibitions and pipe organ demos!

When: 8 June 2025, 5pm
Where: Victoria Concert Hall
How much: $10. Get tickets here.

4. Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert: Kids’ concert in Singapore

Got a little Disney fan at home? They’ll surely recognise all the tunes at Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert. The legendary Chinese pianist will be performing in Singapore for two days only. Watch him perform some of Disney’s most iconic songs, such as Let It Go, We Don’t Talk About Bruno, You’ll Be in My Heart and When You Wish Upon a Star.

Click here to get 10% off tickets!

 

When: 12 & 14 June 2025, 7:30pm
Where: The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre
How much: From $38. Get tickets here.

5. Peter & Blue’s School Holiday 2025: Kids’ ballet performance

School’s out! Bring the kids for this school holiday special. This kid-friendly ballet performance by the Singapore Ballet follows the journey of Peter and his faithful dog, Blue. See what they’re up to on their school holiday escapade, and expect lots of laughter, friendship and imaginative play.

When: 26 – 29 June 2025
Where: Esplanade Theatre Studio
How much: $35. Get tickets here.

6. The Puppet Master – A Night With Disney Songs

Cellography, Singapore’s first cello pop orchestra, is putting on a musical story about a puppet who comes to life and goes on a journey with the man who made him. Think adventure, tough choices, even a witch! Disney songs like Beauty and the Beast and A Whole New World are reimagined by local composer Hughes Chong. Kids can dress up as their favourite characters—it’s a family-friendly show with music, heart, and a little magic.

When: 12 July 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Gateway Theatre
How much: From $38 – get tickets here.

7. Symphony in the Gardens: FREE concert for families

Picture this: you pack a picnic, grab your beloved family (and furkids!), head to the Singapore Botanic Gardens, and then enjoy live music by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO). That makes the perfect FREE weekend activity, in our books. That said, we’re always excited for Symphony in the Gardens, where the SSO will perform classical tunes at the gorgeous Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage. The best part? It’s all free!

Symphony in the Gardens
When: 12 July 2025, 6pm
Where: Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage, Singapore Botanic Gardens
How much: Free!

Read more: Theatre Shows, Musicals & Concerts In Singapore 2025

8. Roald Dahl’s Fantastic Mr Fox: Kids’ play in Singapore

Roald Dahl’s Fantastic Mr Fox takes the stage at Victoria Theatre. At this kids’ play in Singapore, follow the adventures of the cunning and courageous Mr Fox, who needs to outsmart some greedy farmers to save his family. Paired with music, song, dance, humour and memorable characters, this fun kids’ theatre show is all about saving the animal community, so it’s sure to be a hit with the little ones. Fantastic Mr Fox will also be available in Mandarin shows!

15% off early bird promo, TBA.


When: 16 July – 16 August 2025
Where: Victoria Theatre
How much: From $22. Get tickets here.

9. Disney’s Fantasia film screening with live orchestra

Disney’s Fantasia is no doubt iconic. This August, you can watch the visually captivating film accompanied by live classical music performed by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra! Expect iconic tunes by Beethoven, Stravinsky, Tchaikovsky, Bach and more. Note that the show is two hours long with a 20-minute intermission, thus, it’s suitable for older kids.

When: 7 & 8 August 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Esplanade Concert Hall
How much: From $28 – get tickets here.

10. Koko The Great: Kids’ theatre show

The perfect kids’ theatre show for little ones with big imaginations, Koko The Great follows the adventures of a little village boy, Koko. Watch him overcome his fear of the unknown and embrace the unexpected fun it brings!

When: 15 – 31 August 2025
Where: Esplanade Theatre Studio
How much: From $23. Get tickets here.

11. Disney Jr. Live On Tour: Kids’ theatre show in Singapore

Join Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, the Puppy Dog Pals, and more for the biggest playdate ever, but will ominous weather dampen the fun? Find out if Team Spidey from “Marvel’s Spidey and His Amazing Friends” can uncover who’s behind the mysterious weather and save this playdate!

When: 5 – 7 September 2025, Friday, 6:30pm; Saturday, 10:30am, 2:30pm & 6:30pm; Sunday, 10:30am & 2:30pm
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium, 2 Stadium Walk, Singapore 397691
How much: From $28 – get tickets here from 28 May 2025 at 10am.

12. The Tiger Who Came to Tea: Kids’ musical in Singapore

A tiger shows up at Sophie’s door just in time for tea—and chaos follows! This playful stage adaptation of the classic story, The Tiger Who Came To Tea, is full of songs, magic, and laughs. It’s perfect for kids aged 3 and up, and runs just under an hour with no intervals.

When: 12 – 14 September 2025, Friday 4.30pm & 7pm; Saturday & Sunday 11am, 2pm & 4.30pm
Where: Victoria Theatre
How much: From $42 – get tickets here.

13. SSO Babies’ Proms: Kids’ concert for littles

The Singapore Symphony Orchestra’s (SSO) Babies’ Proms is back! There’s no need for the kids to sit still–families are encouraged to move along to the music and explore different orchestra instruments!

When: 13 & 14 September, 11am & 2pm
Where: Victoria Concert Hall
How much: From $35. Tickets on sale here from 3 June.

14. Ballet Under the Stars: Family-friendly ballet show

Looking for a family-friendly night out? Ballet Under The Stars offers a relaxed picnic vibe where you and the kids can enjoy beautiful dance performances together. Singapore Ballet will showcase both classic and modern pieces, like ‘Paquita’ and ‘Incomparable Beauty’. It’s a great chance to introduce your little ones to ballet while enjoying fresh air and a wholesome picnic.

When: 19 – 21 & 26 – 28 September 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Fort Canning Green
How much: $48 – get tickets here.

Read more: Theatre Shows & Live Concerts In Singapore

15. CoComelon & Blippi Sing-A-Long Live: Kids musical in Singapore

Fans of CoComelon, buckle up because you’re in for a treat! Snag your tickets to join JJ and friends as they take the stage for the first time in Singapore at Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands. Warm up your voices and get ready to sing along and groove to your favourite songs including “If You’re Happy and You Know It,” “Wheels on the Bus”, “Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes” and more!

When: 27 & 28 September 2025
Where: Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands, 10 Bayfront Ave, B1-69/70 The Shoppes, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018971
How much: From $78. Get tickets here.

16. Cirque Alice: Kids’ circus show in Singapore

Cirque Alice is Alice in Wonderland meets acrobatics, contortionists, puppetry, aerialists and more! At this ‘Wonderland’, be mesmerised by acrobatic performers who’ll keep you at the edge of your seat, paired with classical hits that have been given a contemporary spin.

When: 9 – 10 October 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: From $78. Get tickets here.

17. The Three Billy Goats Gruff: Kids’ play in Singapore

This childhood tale is one for the memories! The Three Billy Goats Gruff is given a fun musical spin by the Singapore Repertory Theatre. The story follows the three goats’ adventure to cross a bridge in search of food amidst a drought, where they’ll encounter a terrifying troll! Expect lots of laughs with this one, as well as catchy tunes by award-winning duo George Stiles and Anthony Drewe.

When: From 10 October 2025, Monday – Friday 9.30am & 11.30am; Saturday – Sunday 11am & 2pm
Where: Drama Centre Theatre
How much: From $22. Tickets will be on sale here.

18. Temasek Foundation x SSO Halloween Spooktacular!

Here’s a fun way to celebrate Halloween this year: bring the kiddos to a fun spooky kids’ concert! Temasek Foundation x Singapore Symphony Orchestra present the fun-filled Halloween Spooktacular! Ready yourself for witches, ghouls, skeletons and more, and don’t worry about the kids sitting still as this one’s a relaxed performance. P.S. be sure to wear your best Halloween costume, too!

When: 1 & 2 November 2025, Saturday 11am & 2pm; Sunday 11am
Where: Victoria Concert Hall
How much: From $30. Tickets on sale here from 3 June.

19. The Emperor’s New Clothes: Kids’ theatre show

The Hans Christian Andersen literary folktale takes on a musical spin in this Wild Rice production. The Emperor’s New Clothes is all about the flamboyant Emperor who’s tricked by two cheeky tailors who are out to teach him a lesson. Just in time for the year-end holiday season, this kids’ play is going to be filled with laughter, catchy tunes and of course, fashionable fits.

When: From 13 November 2025
Where: Wild Rice @ Funan
How much: TBA – tickets will be available here.

20. Beauty and the Beast The Musical: Kids’ musical in Singapore

Step into a magical world this December as Beauty and the Beast The Musical comes to Singapore—its only stop in Asia! Get ready to sing along to your favourite songs like ‘Be Our Guest’ with dazzling costumes, amazing sets, and all your beloved characters brought to life in a totally new way. This kids’ theatre musical a fairytale adventure you won’t want to miss!

Where: 11 December 2025 – 4 January 2026, various days and timings
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: From $70. Get tickets here.

Read more: Best Theatre Shows, Live Concerts & Comedy Shows For Adults In Singapore

21. Magic Hour @ Raffles Hotel Singapore: Free kids’ concert

Raffles Hotel Singapore has free kids’ concerts that take place every other month! Bring the little ones to enjoy classical music performed by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra, pack a picnic and enjoy light bites and drinks that’ll be present at the venue. Stay updated here.

When: 21 July, 23 August, 18 October, 6 December 2025, 6pm
Where: The Lawn, Raffles Arcade at Raffles Hotel
How much: FREE!

22. SSO Christmas Concert

Celebrate the year-end festivities at the SSO Christmas Concert at the Esplanade Concert Hall. You can bet your favourite wintry tunes will make an appearance; you’re even encouraged to sing along!

When: 12 & 13 December 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Esplanade Concert Hall
How much: From $48. Get tickets here.

23. Candlelight Concerts: Family concerts in Singapore

Take the kids to one of the many Candlelight Concerts for a magical experience of listening to music by candlelight in different locations around Singapore from SEA Aquarium to Chijmes! Best for kids 8 years old or older.

When: Various dates
How much: from $63 per person – Get tickets here.
Where: Various locations

Read more: Things To Do This Weekend In Singapore With Kids

Past kids’ theatre, concerts & circus shows in Singapore 2025:

WICKED The Musical in Singapore

Introduce the kids to the world of Broadway and theatre shows with the iconic WICKED The Musical. This Broadway hit is in Singapore for a whole month, and you can bring the kids to follow the story of what happens in Oz after Dorothy’s visit.

When: 19 March – 27 April 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: From $78.

ZOOOM: Kids’ theatre show in Singapore

Are you ready for ZOOOM? With music, lasers and projections, this kids’ theatre performance is sure to be a memorable one for young ones aged 4 to 8. ZOOOM is inspired by the children’s book Harold and The Purple Crayon, following the adventure of a lost star that’s trying to find its way home. It promises to be an interactive performance, one that explores what dreams are made of.

When: 1 – 5 April 2025
Where: Victoria Theatre
How much: From $28

Peter, the Wolf and Friends

Brought to you by Temasek Foundation and SSO Concerts for Children, Peter, the Wolf and Friends is a great way to get the kids to appreciate classical music. Combining the tunes of the Toy Symphony, the tale of The Tortoise and the Hare, and the production of Peter and the Wolf, this musical tale will feature a live performance accompanied by an orchestra. Note that the show is recommended for kids aged 4 and above.

When: 22 – 23 March 2025
Where: Victoria Concert Hall
How much: From $25

Disney On Ice: Find Your Hero

Disney On Ice invites you to explore the true meaning of heroism alongside Mickey, Minnie, Donald, and Goofy, as beloved Disney characters take to the ice with breathtaking figure skating, dazzling costumes, and enchanting set designs. Watch as Mirabel bravely saves her family’s cherished Casita, join Moana on her epic voyage, and follow Rapunzel on her thrilling adventure!

When: 15 – 23 March 2025, various timings
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium, 2 Stadium Walk, Singapore 397691
How much: From $23

Red Riding Hood: Kids’ play in Singapore

Bring your child to see this iconic children’s story come to life–with a local twist! Little Red is delivering tingkat food to her grandmother. Instead of the woods, she’s riding through Woodlands, where she meets the Wolf. Paired with comedic moments, original songs and recognisable local scenarios, this play promises to be a hit with the young ones.

When: 7 – 16 March 2025
Where: Wild Rice @ Funan
How much: From $35

Check out these other fun things to do with the kids in SG!

The post Fun Kids’ Theatre Shows & Musicals In Singapore 2025: Puppet Shows, Circus Acts & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: FREE Bouncy Castle, Giant Ball Pit, Workshops & More At PA Family PLAYGround!
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for a fun way to bond with the kids over the school break? Look forward to hands-on workshops, life-sized board games and a whole lot of fun at PA Family PLAYGround 2025! The school holidays are here, a perfect time to put the textbooks away and create core memories with the kids! This June, […]

The post FREE Bouncy Castle, Giant Ball Pit, Workshops & More At PA Family PLAYGround! appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a fun way to bond with the kids over the school break? Look forward to hands-on workshops, life-sized board games and a whole lot of fun at PA Family PLAYGround 2025!

The school holidays are here, a perfect time to put the textbooks away and create core memories with the kids! This June, PA Family PLAYGround 2025 invites you to bond with your family and meet other parents at the ultimate fun-filled family day out. This mega family playground is packed with free activities for kids (and grown-ups) of all ages, from nostalgic childhood games to hands-on learning experiences. Spend quality time with your family to Play, Learn, Appreciate and care for Your family and the community–school’s out, adventures’ in! Find out what’s happening between 8 June and 5 July 2025:

Life-sized board games & family workshops

Get ready for some friendly competition as you team up with the kids to play a life-sized board game or challenge them to a game of Mega Jenga. Little ones can unleash creativity to doodle and colour or learn a new skill like Paper Quilling or Acrylic Pour Painting workshop at the interactive family workshops. Older kids can try their hand at a DIY Recycling Bin workshop, while you can inspire your child to kickstart an active lifestyle with a parent-child workout class.

When the kids need some downtime, head to the SG60 Wishing Wall and Digital Pledge Wall to practice the art of gratitude and reflection. Write a “thank you” note to family members and the community, or create a plan to care for your community and spark joy. In the spirit of giving, take part in the CARE in Every Bottle initiative, where you can purchase a juice bottle for $10, decorate it, and have all proceeds go directly to the Community Chest.

Get a sneak preview through ROBLOX PA Family PLAYGround FamilyVerse

If you can’t wait to get started, check out the ROBLOX PA Family PLAYGround FamilyVerse, the first PA Family PLAYGround metaverse. This interactive pre-event teaser allows you to experience some family bonding fun ahead of the event, from the comfort of your home. Simply hop online and work together to complete in-game quests to redeem a limited quantity of cute isometric stickers that depict 3D scenes.

Locate the PA Family PLAYGround in your hood

PA FamilyPLAYGround is happening at five locations islandwide from 10am to 6pm:

  • 8 June 2025: Tengah Community Club
  • 14 June 2025: Braddell Heights Community Club
  • 21 June 2025: Toa Payoh West Community Club
  • 28 June 2025: Nee Soon South Community Club
  • 5 July 2025: One Punggol

As part of PA’s continued commitment to support families, exclusive promotions will also run throughout this period and extend through July 2025. These include a 30% discount on selected Parent-Child and Children’s courses, Two-for-One Family Kayaking packages at participating PAssion Wave outlets, and exclusive merchant deals for PAssion card members.

Save the date and bring the kids down to the nearest PA Family PLAYGround for unforgettable memories and a fun family day out!

People’s Association, www.pa.gov.sg

The post FREE Bouncy Castle, Giant Ball Pit, Workshops & More At PA Family PLAYGround! appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Find Art Classes For Kids In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Is your child into art and being creative? From pottery and painting to drawing and crafts, here’s our roundup of art classes for kids in Singapore! These kids’ art classes in Singapore give kiddos the opportunity to explore their creativity through painting, pottery, drawing and decoupage. Making art simply for the sake of art is […]

The post Where To Find Art Classes For Kids In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Is your child into art and being creative? From pottery and painting to drawing and crafts, here’s our roundup of art classes for kids in Singapore!

These kids’ art classes in Singapore give kiddos the opportunity to explore their creativity through painting, pottery, drawing and decoupage. Making art simply for the sake of art is absolutely wonderful, but it’s also been shown to help kids with motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, decision making and so much more. If you are looking to encourage your child’s creative talents, there are plenty of fab art classes for kids in Singapore.

Read more: Where To Go for Kids’ Speech & Drama Classes

Art Classes For Kids In Singapore:

Abrakadoodle Singapore: Learn about different artists and their styles

Not sure if your child will enjoy an art class? Why not sign up for a non-obligatory art trial class ($58 for 1 class, $120 for 3 classes) at Abrakadoodle? Here, kids will get to learn about different artists and their art styles. They will be exposed to a variety of art materials and mediums and develop their confidence, by sharing their ideas and masterpieces, during gallery time!

 Abrakadoodle, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, River Valley and Jurong East, Tel: (+65) 6235 9568, www.abrakadoodle.com.sg

The Art People: Learn animation and game design

The Art People was started in 2011 by a team of fun and passionate art teachers who dreamed of inspiring young children through art, and has grown to four art class locations around the island today. The Art People employ The Artlytical Method® to provide specialised training in art as well as Animation and Game Design. With the motto “No one should be deprived of learning” this school caters art classes for kids to both mainstream and special needs students.

The Art People, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Beauty World and Tampines, www.theartpeople.com.sg

Artary: Themed art courses

Artary offers holistic and thoughtful art classes for kids 3.5 to 12 years old. Membership provides access to other studio activities and there are plenty of holiday options available too, including art jams and themed courses using games, stories and songs. Art class trial sessions are available if your child (or you) are keen to get messy before committing to an art programme.

 Artary, multiple locations in Singapore including Admiralty, Punggol, and Jurong, www.artary.sg

Artify: Art classes with small group sizes

In addition to regular art classes for kids aged 4 and up, Artify on Jalan Sultan has a cool slate of one-off art jams for kids, with all materials and guidance provided, so little ones need only bring a healthy dose of imagination! They also pride themselves on their one art instructor to four little artists ratio to ensure plenty of personal attention.

 Artify, 200 Jalan Sultan, #12-07, Singapore 199018, www.artifystudio.com

Art Boot Camp: Art classes from 18 months onwards

With themed programmes across three different sites, Art Boot Camp offers art classes for kids between 18 months and 17 years. Little ones can begin with Art Playdate classes, where each parent-tot combo can get stuck into some one-of-a-kind creativity, while older ones will learn about painting and drawing techniques, colour theory, perspective and many other art themes in their own drop-off art classes!

 Art Boot Camp, two locations in Singapore, including Hillview Avenue and Upper Bukit Timah, www.artbootcamp.com.sg

Art Zone: Different art packages available

Art Zone is dedicated to interactive art classes for kids, with friendly teachers and packages available if you want to make it a regular gig for your little one (classes start from 4 years of age). With painting and drawing as the foundation of each kid’s art class, you can even opt to have your child’s artwork framed at the end of each session.

Art Zone, multiple locations in Singapore including Bukit Batok, Bukit Timah and East Coast, www.artzone.com.sg

Chalk n Pencils: 2D and 3D art classes

Stoke the fires of your kids’ imaginations by letting them get creative with art studio Chalk n Pencils. Art classes for kids here explore both two-dimensional art like drawing, painting and printmaking as well as three-dimensional art of clay moulding and construction work. Teachers use Teaching for Artistic Behaviour, a recognised choice-based art education approach to teaching art. Art classes are small with a great 1:8 art teacher-to-student ratio so your kid will get lots of attention!

Chalk n Pencils, 46 Kim Yam Road #04-11, Singapore 239351 and 451 Joo Chiat Rd, #03-08, Singapore 427664, www.chalknpencils.com

The Drawing Mint: Art classes for different age groups

With art classes for kids from the age of 3 all the way up to 15, The Drawing Mint is all about catering to each unique individual, specialising in – well – drawing out each child’s personality and style and encouraging them to create artworks that reflect their inner world. Through small group learning in its cosy, quiet and inspiring classroom space, the studio’s chief aims are promoting independence, decision-making skills and a sense of reflection.

The Drawing Mint, 6 Mohamed Sultan Road, #02-01, Singapore 238956 and 406 Joo Chiat Place #03-25/26 Singapore 428084, www.thedrawingmint.com

Our Art Studio: Certification art classes

Offering structured certification courses as well as personalised art classes for kids from the age of 2.5 years old, Our Art Studio caters to each individual’s interests and pace of learning. We love the small class sizes and flexible timings – class art packages are valid for a full year, and can even be shared between family members! Students can choose from disciplines like acrylic/oil/watercolour and Chinese painting, along with Nagomi, sketching/manga drawing or clay.

Our Art Studio, #04-20, 10 Paya Lebar Road, Singapore 409057 and 1 Vista Exchange Green, #01-36, Singapore 138617, www.ourartstudio.com.sg

Little Artists Art Studio: Award-winning art studio

Little Artists Art Studio has two award-winning fine arts studios that offer art classes for kids on the East Coast. Kids’ art classes here cater to littles from 2.5 years of age and up. Little Artists Art Studio is among Singapore’s leading centres for fine arts learning and contemporary events. Whether your child is serious about going to art school or just wanting to learn for fun, there’s a class for everyone! There is also an art class for kids with special needs (dyslexia, ADHD, Asperger syndrome, learning difficulty, language delay).

Little Artists Art Studio, 15 Siglap Road, #01-07, Singapore 448912 & 55 Siglap Road, #02-18, Singapore 455871, www.little-artists.com/

The Fort Studios: Open-studio art classes

No two children are the same, and at The Fort Studios they know that means no two artworks should ever be the same. Children aged 6 to 14 are challenged to think, talk and create as artists do in the Fort Studios’ art classes for kids. We love the open-studio approach that encourages kids to be responsible for their own learning while allowing their artistic voices to be respected, valued and honoured.

The Fort Studios, 56 Kallang Pudding Road, #08-06, HH@Kallang, Singapore 349328, www.thefortstudios.sg

3Arts: Pottery classes

Get behind the wheel and master the art of pottery making at 3Arts art classes for kids! Craft your own clay masterpiece using an electric or manual pottery wheel with guidance from experienced teachers. Regular art classes are aimed at kids (and adults) of varying ages, and no previous experience is required.

3Arts, 394 Joo Chiat Place, Singapore 428078, www.3arts.sg

HiArt: Art classes catered to 2.5 years old

Instructors at HiArt strive to bring the joy of art and learning to everyone regardless of age and abilities! They offer art classes for kids as young as 2.5 years old and work closely with each student to nurture artistic skills and inspire creativity. The art classes for kids allow them to express their thoughts and feelings through painting, drawing and more!

HiArt, multiple locations in Singapore including Esplanade, United Square and Woodleigh Mall, www.hiart.com.sg

Jay Jay Jolly: Take-home craft kits

This fun crafts shop Jay Jay Jolly has a variety of hassle-free craft kits perfect for rainy stay-at-home afternoons. In addition to their range of environmentally friendly craft tools and supplies, they also hold fun-filled art classes for kids and even do art-tastic birthday parties too!

 Jay Jay Jolly, 1008 Toa Payoh North, #02-01, Singapore 318996, www.jayjayjolly.com

Global Art: Comic and cartoon art classes

Art classes at Global Art encompass visual art, handicrafts, cartoons, comics, acrylic painting, and more. These classes aim to encourage imagination and expression among children while enhancing their mental development. Designed for ages three and up, art classes allow even the youngest artists to create their own games, stories, and puzzles through engaging art activities.

 Global Art, multiple locations in Singapore including Anchorpoint, Bishan and Bukit Panjang, www.globalart.com.sg

Ki.Li.O Art: Art jamming in East Coast

Ki.Li.O Art is a popular East Coast spot for an hour of art jamming, but the team also runs kid-friendly art workshops for children aged between 2 and 12. They’ll learn about the various elements of art and design while refining their motor skills and learning how to express themselves creatively.

 Ki.Li.O Art, 85 East Coast Road, #02-01, Singapore 428787, www.kilioart.com

Little Arts Academy: Art camps for kids

Little Arts Academy offers art classes for kids and camps for mini artists, with a range of options available for kids of all ages and abilities from the age of 6. There are also regular personalised programmes and short courses for students of art schools in Singapore. There are lots of performing arts options, too.

 Little Arts Academy, Yishun Avenue 2 and 1 Northpoint Drive, www.thelittleartsacademy.sg

My Art Pencil: Art studio with birthday party packages

Art jams, art supplies, art classes, birthday parties and more — My Art Pencil in Hougang is a hit with mamas for their respectful approach to art classes for kids, though they also believe artistic talent is a skill that can be cultivated rather than just an inherent gift. This studio offers art classes for kids aged 3 years old to teens!

My Art Pencil, 50 Serangoon North Avenue 4 #09-16 Singapore 555856, www.myartpencil.com

Rafayet Studio: Variety of art packages

Rafayet Studio offers a variety of art packages, each of which is carefully designed to cater to different age groups and skill levels so that kids can reach their full artistic potential. Through these art classes, not only will your child acquire new artistic abilities, but they will develop confidence, improve their fine motor skills and enhance their problem-solving skills.

Rafayet Studio, Bukit Timah Shopping Centre, #02-40, Singapore 588179, www.instagram.com/rafayetstudio

Soul Deelight: Calligraphy and watercolour

Dee is the lovely calligrapher behind Soul Deelight offering calligraphy and watercolour workshops in her home. Dee offers a range of adult and kids classes (by appointment only) so older kids can explore brush calligraphy or delve into the wonderful world of watercolour. Dee also carries out online art classes for kids and adults so you can pick up a new skill from home!

Soul Deelight, Bukit Batok, Singapore 650288 (strictly by appointment only), www.souldeelight.com

TREE ART: Graphic design, sculpture, ceramics

TREE ART offers an enriching and imaginative space for young artists to grow, designed especially for children aged 3 and up. With a wide range of art forms – from graphic design and painting to sculpture and ceramics—TREE ART’s classes introduce kids to creative expression in a nurturing, hands-on environment.

TREE ART, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, East Coast, and Tampines, www.treeart.co

We Art: Personalised art classes

We Art boasts personalised teaching methods and courses that are inspired by the Korean art curriculum. The Little Explorers class is designed for kids aged 5 to 9 years old, where they will be introduced to drawing, painting, collage and mixed media. Older kids aged 10 to 19 years old will get to grasp the fundamental elements of drawing, watercolours and acrylic painting, as well as try their hands at silkscreen and relief printmaking.

 We Art, 176 Orchard Road, CentrePoint,#04-02/03/03A, Singapore 238843, www.weart.sg

Ready to hone the skills for your little artists?  Sign them up for an art class in Singapore today!

Read more:

 

The post Where To Find Art Classes For Kids In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Go For Counselling & Therapy In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
If you need help getting through life’s challenges, consult our list to find a therapist, psychiatrist, psychologist and other services for counselling and therapy in Singapore Looking for counselling or therapy in Singapore? Life can hit us hard sometimes, and it’s okay to ask for help! Whatever your mental health struggles are, know that you’re […]

The post Where To Go For Counselling & Therapy In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
If you need help getting through life’s challenges, consult our list to find a therapist, psychiatrist, psychologist and other services for counselling and therapy in Singapore

Looking for counselling or therapy in Singapore? Life can hit us hard sometimes, and it’s okay to ask for help! Whatever your mental health struggles are, know that you’re not alone and there’s much to be gained from counselling or therapy in Singapore. Counselling services can help you if you’re on the lookout for marriage counselling (this couple found having a child with autism put a strain on their marriage), or whether you’d like to speak to a therapist to help with your self-worth, counselling for postpartum depression, a listening ear for your child or teen, or just someone to help your family navigate life harmoniously.

Jump to:
– Counselling, therapy, psychology: know the different terms
– Where to find counselling services in SG

Counsellor, Psychologist, Psychotherapist: Know the Difference

Confused about the differences between a psychotherapist and a psychologist, counselling or therapy? Here’s a simple breakdown to get you started.

  • Counselling vs. therapy: These terms are often used interchangeably, but typically, counselling focuses on problem-solving specific issues that are happening to you in the present and is usually applied for shorter terms than therapy.
  • Psychotherapy: This long-term, in-depth solution zooms into a wider range of issues, and involves dissecting your past experiences and childhood to find answers for your current behavioural patterns and issues.
  • Psychotherapist: This umbrella term applies to any professional trained to treat people for their mental health, and can encompass psychiatrists, counsellors and clinical psychologists.
  • Psychiatrists: These mental health experts have a medical degree and specialise in preventing, diagnosing, and treating mental illness. Unlike most psychotherapists, they can also prescribe medication.
  • Psychologists: They usually have a Master’s Degree or PhD in psychology and talk therapy. They perform psychological testing and are qualified to do counselling and psychotherapy for mental disorders. A counselling psychologist will tend to work with clients with emotional and social issues, whereas a clinical psychologist will normally work with people suffering from more complex mental health conditions, such as personality disorders and major depressive disorders.
  • Counsellors: They typically help clients explore the challenges or difficulties being faced, whether it’s dissatisfaction with life or even a loss of purpose.

Sources: Psychology Today and WebMD

Where to Go for Counselling Services in Singapore

Our roundup of places to get counselling in Singapore isn’t exhaustive, but we hope it’s a good starting point for you to find a therapist that suits your needs.

Read more: Can We Normalise Mums Talking About Maternal Mental Health?

The Counselling Place: Multilingual mental health experts

Trusted since 2006, The Counselling Place is a leading mental health provider in Singapore. They offer expert support for individuals, couples, and families navigating life’s challenges. Their diverse, multilingual team of experienced psychologists, counsellors, and parent coaches speaks 11 languages, including German, Spanish, French, Japanese and Korean. Their parent coaches work with parents to develop effective parenting strategies to create a more harmonious home environment. Their Sex & Intimacy Therapist and Relationship Counsellors work with couples to build stronger, more fulfilling connections, as well as address intimacy and sexual health concerns.

Therapists also specialise in issues affecting women at every stage of life—from postpartum depression and infertility to sexual assault recovery and burnout. Other services include psychological assessments (e.g. for ADHD, ASD), EMDR, crisis support, EAP services and mental health workshops. You can engage their counselling and therapy services in Singapore in-person, in their CBD office, or online for optimal convenience. Their 24/7 online booking system allows for confidential appointment booking in the privacy of your own home.

The Counselling Place, 105 Cecil Street, #11-00, The Octagon, Singapore 069534, admin@thecounsellingplace.com, www.thecounsellingplace.com

All in the Family Counselling: Specialises in relationships

Tammy Fontana is a US-trained mental health therapist specialising in relationships. She successfully helps individuals and couples with relationship issues ranging from communication, sex and intimacy, to conflict management and parenting. She can help couples navigate issues around divorce. Ms. Fontana works with individuals with anxiety, depression, fraud and impostor syndrome as well as relationship and boundaries issues.

She specialises in difficult cases and those with complex developmental trauma from difficult childhoods. Ms. Fontana helps couples and individuals through specialised retreats, group retreats and solo travel therapy trips. Ms. Fontana has trained with some of the powerhouses in the mental health field, from the Gottmans to other international therapists. Now, she has developed an online portal to help clients achieve success and get 24/7 support at www.mynewbeginningsclub.com. Her rates start from $250/50 minutes, with packages available.

Tammy M. Fontana, MS NCC CTRT Relationship & Clinical Sex Therapist, All in the Family Counselling, 60 Paya Lebar Road, #11-06, Singapore 049051, tammy@allinthefamilycounselling.com, Tel: (+65) 9030 7239, www.allinthefamilycounselling.com

Play Therapy Singapore by Therapy Inc.: For kids & teenagers

Traditional talk-based therapy can feel overwhelming for many kids and teens, especially those who struggle to express themselves with words. That’s where Play Therapy Singapore by Therapy Inc. comes in. Their team of therapists help children and teens communicate through the language they know best: play. Using toys, games and creative activities, the therapists gently guide young people to express emotions, build resilience, and work through challenges on their terms.

Whether your child is navigating anxiety, grief, divorce, bullying, or struggles like ADHD, ASD, or learning difficulties, Play Therapy provides a safe, non-judgmental space to grow. They also support key areas like emotional regulation, problem-solving, social skills, sensory processing, academic motivation, and even teen coaching. Play Therapy can help your child feel heard without having to say a word.

Play Therapy Singapore by Therapy Inc., 1 Scotts Road, #15-04, Shaw Centre, Singapore 228208, fechayap@therapyinc.com.sg, Tel: +65 9100 0752 (Whatsapp), www.playtherapysingapore.com

Dynamics Psychological Practice: Offers child counselling services

Dynamics Psychological Practice delivers evidence-based counselling from accredited psychologists in Singapore. Using CBT, DBT, Motivational Interviewing and mindfulness, their team of therapists craft personalised programmes within a holistic bio-psycho-social framework. They provide comprehensive psycho-educational assessments to pinpoint ADHD, Autism, Dyslexia, Dyscalculia and other learning or developmental needs. They also offer therapy and support for children, teens and adults facing anxiety, mood or behaviour difficulties, trauma, relationship stress and school or work challenges.

Under the wider Dynamics Therapy Group, clients can seamlessly benefit from Speech and Occupational Therapy, ABA, Educational Therapy, Social-Skills classes, an inclusive primary school and a leading Early Intervention Programme, creating a one-stop hub for lifelong progress.
Sessions are flexible. Opt for weekday, evening or Saturday slots based on your availability and choose to meet your therapist in the clinic or online, in English or Mandarin. Transparent fees and insurance-friendly billing make getting help easy.

Dynamics Psychological Practice, 583 Orchard Road, #15-02, Forum The Shopping Mall, Singapore 238884, www.dynamics-psychology.sg

Encompassing Therapy and Counselling: Therapy for life transitions

Couples and individuals going through life transitions or existential crises can find their safe space at Encompassing Therapy and Counselling. Founded by Dr Magdalen Cheng, the practice is one of the few in Asia and the first in Singapore to specialise in existential therapy. Encompassing’s care philosophy is rooted in the belief that mental health is not just for those feeling helpless but for anyone navigating the twists and turns of everyday life.

Dr Magdalen sees existential therapy as a collaborative endeavour with clients–whom she sees as the ultimate experts of their own lives–to help them build inner resources and skills to explore honesty with themselves and regain control over their personal and professional lives. Encompassing Therapy and Counselling offers in-person and online chemistry sessions to help individuals discern what therapy means to them before committing further. Customised group workshops for corporates or others to learn more about existential psychology are also available.

Encompassing Therapy and Counselling, 16 Mohamed Sultan Road, #06-02, Singapore 238965, encompassing.co

Fertilityconnectz: Expert therapy and support for fertility, IVF and donor programmes

Since 2012, Fertilityconnectz has been providing mental and emotional support to individuals and couples navigating their fertility journey. With a team of compassionate counsellors and coaches, they utilise effective self-help tools, therapeutic methods, and research-based strategies to empower and encourage families through challenging times. Whether in person or online, their dedicated team offers a safe, supportive space where clients can explore their emotions and navigate their journey with confidence and clarity.

Backed by 13 years of experience, their methods have been tried and tested in over 10,000 sessions, and they take pride in being the only counselling service in Singapore offering fertility support with ANZICA membership. Committed to staying at the forefront of their field, they regularly visit IVF clinics and represent the psychological aspects of infertility at the annual reproductive health conferences. By collaborating with leading medical specialists, they continue to deepen their understanding of assisted reproductive technologies and strengthen the vital bridge between emotional and clinical care. With your well-being as their top priority, you are never alone on your journey. They also offer other counselling services at Counsellingconnectz.

Fertilityconnectz, 11 Keng Cheow Street, #04-07, The Riverside Plaza
Singapore 059608, WhatsApp: (+65) 9784 4889, www.fertilityconnectz.com

Incontact Counselling & Training: Encourages positive change

Incontact Counselling & Training is a Singapore-based therapy centre devoted to helping individuals, couples, and families navigate life’s complexities through integrated, compassionate care. Grounded in multicultural values and community-focused practices, Incontact offers a wide range of counselling services tailored to the diverse needs of modern society. The team of therapists uses a holistic, collaborative approach, working closely with functional doctors, holistic general practitioners, psychiatrists, in-house health coach, and in-house executive coach to ensure every client receives well-rounded support.

Whether it’s managing stress, healing from trauma, addressing LGBTQIA2S+ concerns, or coping with chronic illness, Incontact’s care model supports the entire person—mind and body. The therapists at Incontact bring more than clinical expertise; they bring lived experience, which fuels their passion for guiding others through change and healing. Believing that true growth happens with support for all levels, Incontact is a trusted place for those seeking meaningful, lasting transformation

Incontact Counselling and Training, 7 Maxwell Road, #04-04, Annexe B, MND Complex, Singapore 069111, www.incontact.com.sg

In Focus Counseling & Therapy Services: Professional counselling services for individuals and couples

In Focus Counseling & Therapy Services has been providing counselling and psychotherapy services in Singapore since 2004. They help people facing personal emotional and behavioural struggles, as well as relationship or family challenges. With more than 20 years of experience combined, their team of therapists are well-equipped to help those struggling with depression, anxiety, stress, anger, grief and loss, identity crisis, life transition challenges, traumatic experiences and relationship problems. Built on the belief in empowering clients and helping them realise their potential, this therapy service in Singapore offers a safe and conducive space for collaborative counselling and therapeutic work.

Their goal is to help each person towards deeper self-understanding, acceptance, healing, reconciliation, growth and learning. As registered professional counsellors and therapists in Singapore, they maintain professional standards to ensure quality of care and customised therapy to meet each individual’s needs. They offer counselling and therapy services in Singapore for individuals, couples, youth and families from all walks of life. Leadership training, coaching and employee assistance programmes are also available.

In Focus Counseling and Therapy Services, 150 Orchard Road, #07-10, Singapore 238841,  enquiry@in-focus.com.sg, Tel: (+65) 8725 9303 (strictly by appointment only), www.in-focus.com.sg

Listening Ear Counselling & Consultancy: Premier counselling centre

Listening Ear Counselling & Consultancy is a premier therapy centre in Singapore, led by Karl deSouza—an experienced and compassionate psychotherapist with over 20 years of practice. An accredited therapist with both the Singapore Psychological Society (SPS) and the Singapore Association for Counselling (SAC), Karl brings a warm, culturally sensitive approach tailored especially for expats, third culture kids (TCKs), and globally mobile families. Karl is trained in a diverse range of therapeutic modalities, including EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitisation and Reprocessing), MEMI (Memory Reconsolidation and Eye Movement Integration), Brainspotting, Somatic Experiencing, Internal Family Systems (IFS), as well as Solution-Focused and Cognitive Therapies to support individuals.

Karl also offers couples therapy and family therapy, often integrating Emotionally Focused Couple Therapy (EFCT), the Gottman Method, and Satir Transformational Systemic Therapy to deepen connection, improve communication, and promote healing. Whether you are navigating trauma, cross-cultural identity issues, infidelity, parenting challenges, or major life transitions, Karl offers a respectful, affirming, and effective space to explore what matters most. His therapy services in Singapore are available both in-person and via secure Zoom sessions.

Listening Ear Counselling, 10 Anson Road, #28-14, Singapore 079903, karl@listeningearclinic.com, Tel: (+65) 8950 2162, www.listeningearclinic.com

Livingston Counselling: Offers equine-assisted therapy

Cathy Livingston is an American who has lived in Singapore for 25 years. She offers therapy services in Singapore and has been in clinical work since 2010. Having worked with expats and locals aged 12 and above, Cathy is ever-ready and equipped to come alongside you and offer the support you need through therapy. She has clinical work experience in the areas of trauma and abuse, attachment injuries, depression, and anxiety. She offers traditional talk therapy sessions in the office or online. She is certified in Trauma Focused Equine-Assisted Therapy, EMDR, CTRT, and trained in TF-CBT. She also incorporates attachment theory into her work.

In equine-assisted therapy, you will partner with a horse to address areas where you may be struggling. As an individual who is hardwired for connection, there may be times when you feel like you have lost that connection with yourself, others and the world. As sentient beings who are also wired for connection, horses can help you discover familiar relational styles, ways of communication and familiar thoughts and feelings that may arise. This gives individuals a chance to experience new ways of being.

Livingston Counselling, livingstoncounselling@gmail.com, www.livingstoncounselling.com

Lotus Psychotherapy: Marriage and family therapist

A licensed marriage and family therapist from California, Anita Barot’s expertise includes couples and family counselling, depression and anxiety management, adolescent counselling, and women’s issues (separation/divorce, self-esteem, body image, career, etc) and more. She believes that therapy is a journey involving both the client and therapist, and it involves building trust, skill and hard work.

Her caring and honest approach has helped many people. She works with you–based on your mental health and life history–so your life choices offer happiness and fulfilment, helping you achieve your life goals. She offers a safe space in which to explore your feelings, allowing you to let go of past wounds and find productive coping mechanisms to deal with tough challenges. Anita’s background has also enabled her to work well with expats and third-culture children who are dealing with multiple moves and grief, helping them find meaning and connection in a new country. For ease of payment, Anita is panelled on EAP’s with Optum and many insurance companies in the United States.

Lotus Psychotherapy, 10 Winstedt Road, #01-04, Singapore 227977, info@lotustherapy.com, Tel: (+65) 9177 9326, www.lotuspsychotherapy.com

RANGE Counselling Service: Counselling for children & families

RANGE Counselling Services is a counselling centre in Singapore that is dedicated to providing comprehensive and inclusive mental health services, including psychotherapy, counselling and parent coaching. Understanding that mental health is a vital aspect of an individual’s well-being, their experienced team of counsellors and therapists take a client-centred approach, tailoring each therapy session to the client.

They offer counselling for children (ages four and up), teenagers, adults, couples and families. Whether you need support for your personal growth, a helping hand in navigating a major transition or trauma, or strengthening your relationships, their team is here to support you. They also offer coaching and support for parents and caregivers and proudly serve as certified facilitators for the Circle of Security Parenting programme, one that empowers parents to build secure and meaningful relationships with their children.

RANGE Counselling Services, Woodlands Cl, Primz Bizhub, Singapore 737854, hello@rangecounsellingservices.com, Tel: (+65) 8905 5274, www.rangecounsellingservices.com 

Restoring Peace Counselling & Consultancy: Individual & couples therapy in Singapore

Founded in 2018, Restoring Peace was born out of its founder’s passion for helping trauma survivors. They provide counselling and psychotherapy to people struggling with anxiety, addictions, body dysmorphia, depression, eating disorders, grief, personality disorders, phobias, PTSD and trauma. Understanding the complexities of relationships and family dynamics, they also offer marital therapy and parenting counselling. They serve children, youth, and adults, including individuals, couples, and families.

Their team of experienced therapists employ a trauma-informed, attachment-based approach, using techniques such as EMDR, Internal Family Systems, Brainspotting, Somatic Experiencing, Emotion-Focused Therapy, and the Gottman Method. They also offer clinical supervision, trauma-informed coaching, and support groups for anxiety and parenting. Those who wish to learn how to support others can participate in our training workshops in psychology and mental health.

Restoring Peace Counselling & Consultancy Pte Ltd, Tel: (+65) 8395 5471, www.restoringpeace.com.sg

Samant Psychotherapy: Individual therapy for adults

Anita Samant–founder of Samant Psychotherapy–is passionate about making a difference in the lives of her clients. Her multicultural practice serves both the local Singaporean and international expat communities. She is an experienced, UK-trained and accredited psychotherapist and offers psychodynamic psychotherapy for a range of psychological, emotional and relational concerns. Anita also offers dynamic interpersonal therapy, a structured, time-limited approach with a particular focus on difficulties in relationships.

Whether you are experiencing big life transitions, anxiety, trauma, burnout, or just a more general sense of dissatisfaction or uncertainty, Anita provides a safe and non-judgmental space where you can explore your inner world with care and insight, helping you to uncover unconscious patterns and understand yourself more deeply. Anita, who is a parent of two neurodiverse children, also has expertise in supporting individual parents of children with additional needs, helping them work through the emotional complexities and overwhelm that are unique to this parenting journey.

Samant Psychotherapy, 6 Handy Road, Singapore 229234, info@anitasamant.com, Tel: (+65) 9030 1092, anitasamant.com

Alliance Counselling: Multilingual team of therapists

The team of counsellors and psychologists offers empathetic professional support and guidance for couples, parents-to-be, children, teens, families and individuals. Each client is carefully assigned to the right therapist, so they feel supported in a safe environment. The multilingual team can conduct sessions in English, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean, Hindi, Dutch and Norwegian. Alliance Counselling also offers free monthly support groups.

Alliance Counselling, 501 Bukit Timah Road #04-03 & #03-02, Cluny Court Singapore 259760 and 121 Upper East Coast Road, #02-01 Singapore 455245, Tel: (+65) 6466 8120, www.alliancecounselling.com.sg

AWARE (Association of Women for Action and Research): Counselling for women

AWARE is Singapore’s leading gender equality advocacy group, providing counselling services in Singapore as well as advocacy and training. Anyone can call AWARE’s helpline for emotional support and direction to AWARE’s counselling services and further resources.

AWARE, Tel: 1-800-777-5555 (weekdays, 10am – 6pm), www.aware.org.sg

Body with Soul Singapore: Holistic counselling with medical support

Body with Soul dispenses a holistic approach to wellness, which includes counselling in Singapore alongside medical and nutritional support. Clinical psychologist Shri uses a scientific, integrated model based on neuroscience and tailored to client needs, drawing on the strengths of different approaches such as cognitive-behaviour therapy, attachment theory and positive psychology.

Body with Soul Singapore, 79 Anson Road, #22-01, Singapore 079906, www.bodywithsoul.com

Care Corner Singapore: Therapy for children, youth and adults

Care Corner Singapore is a non-profit organisation in Singapore that offers social and healthcare services to those in need. From children to youth, adults, families and seniors, this therapy centre in Singapore offers counselling, intervention, emotional support and mental health education for individuals and workplaces. Children who are struggling may benefit from Play Therapy, while couples can seek marriage counselling to navigate life’s challenges.

Care Corner Singapore, Blk 62B Lorong 4 Toa Payoh #02-143 Singapore 312062, www.carecorner.org.sg

CARE Singapore: Individual counselling services

Catering to children, youths and their families, CARE Singapore offers support through individualised counselling in Singapore, casework management and group work. The counsellors and therapists here work closely with parents, teachers and the community at large to help enhance their clients’ way of life. CARE Singapore also offers counselling services to individuals or families experiencing emotional, psychological, relationship and marital issues.

CARE Singapore, 428 Pasir Ris Drive 6 #01-21 Singapore 510428, www.care.sg

The Center for Psychology: Evidence-based therapy

This therapy centre in Singapore provides evidence-based therapy for children, adolescents and adults. Helmed by highly trained and fully committed individuals who provide quality psychological consultations and therapy in Singapore, the team here uses the latest clinical tools and methodologies to advance your mental health, and your emotional, spiritual and behavioural wellbeing.

The Center for Psychology, 1 Fifth Avenue, #02-03, Guthrie House, Singapore 268802, www.center4psy.com

CLARIE Psychotherapy: Empowers and supports individuals

The experienced counsellors at CLARIE Psychotherapy adopt a holistic approach to help adults unpack and overcome trauma from their childhood. Understanding the unique challenges in different family dynamics, the therapists focus on empowering individuals and families to break free from the cycle of trauma to foster resilience and build secure attachments with their loved ones. They offer specialised support for parents and parents-to-be who are navigating through pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and parenthood.

CLARIE Psychotherapy, 10 International Plaza, Anson Road, #28-14, Singapore 079903, Tel: (+65) 8380 0126, www.clariepsychotherapy.com

Clarity Singapore: Free counselling and therapy in Singapore

Clarity Singapore is a charitable organisation endorsed by the Catholic Archdiocese of Singapore that provides resources and support to persons struggling with mental health issues and offers counselling to support you and adults. Read the self-care tips to help mamas with their mental health by Joyce Charley, Senior Mental Health Counsellor, at Clarity Singapore here.

Clarity Singapore, Block 854 Yishun Ring Road, #01-3511, Singapore 760854 and 7A Lorong 8 Toa Payoh, #04-01, Singapore 319264, www.clarity-singapore.org

Coloured Canvas: Art therapist in Singapore

Art psychotherapist, author and doctoral researcher Dr. Huma Durrani provides art psychotherapy to children with developmental and behavioural problems, psychological and emotional issues relating to autism and learning difficulties.

Coloured Canvas, www.colouredcanvas.net

Counselling and Care Centre: Therapy for individuals and couples

This non-governmental, non-profit organisation offers psychological counselling and therapy  in Singapore. Employee Assistance Programmes (EAP) are also available.

Counselling and Care Centre, Blk 536 Upper Cross Street, #05-241 Hong Lim Complex, 050536, www.counsel.org.sg

Counselling Perspective: Experienced therapist in Singapore for men

Dr. Glenn Graves’ name comes up a lot when you ask for a recommended psychologist in Singapore – particularly for men. Dr. Graves holds a PhD in Psychology and provides counselling in Singapore on a variety of issues, including post-traumatic stress disorder, anger management, anxiety, stress, alcohol abuse, marital conflicts and divorce, sex addiction, sexual abuse and more.

Counselling Perspective, three locations in Singapore including Raffles Place, Science Park and Joo Chiat, www.counselingperspective.com

Elephant Therapy & Training: Therapy for individuals, couples and groups

With extensive experience in caring for private clients in Singapore since 2013, Elephant’s Therapy is dedicated to providing psychological treatment and therapy for people impacted by a wide variety of issues such as anxiety, depression, relationship difficulties, low self-esteem, grief, trauma, challenging life transitions, work-related difficulties, sexuality, gender identity and more.

Elephant Therapy & Training, 8 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 1, 43rd floor, Singapore 018960, www.elephant.com.sg

Fernhill Psychology and Counselling: In-person and online therapy

Serving both Singaporeans and expatriates from all walks of life, the Fernhill team offers psychological services, meditation, coaching and therapy in Singapore in multiple languages. They work with a whole range of issues, from depression and anxiety to relationship issues, trauma and personality disorders. Their team provides both in-person and online therapy and counselling sessions.

Fernhill Psychology and Counselling, 27 Woking Road, Wessex Estate, Singapore 138705, www.fernhill.com.sg

International Counselling & Psychology Centre (ICPC): Community-based counselling centre

The team of counsellors, psychologists and professional therapists at International Counselling & Psychology Centre (ICPC) provides supportive mental health services whether at home, in school or in the work environment. ICPC can help address issues such as depression, infidelity, eating disorders, anger and weight management, addictions and third culture kids, self-harm and stress, and much more.

International Counselling & Psychology Centre, 360 Orchard Road, #06-08 International Building, Singapore 238869, www.intlcounselling.com

International Medical Clinic (IMC): Works closely with GPs and paediatricians

With a team of three highly trained clinical psychologists specialising in various areas, International Medical Clinic (IMC) is equipped to conduct assessments and therapy for patients of all ages and backgrounds. Their in-house psychologists work closely with GPs and paediatricians to discuss diagnoses and treatment plans, streamlining the healthcare process for patients who require multidisciplinary care.

International Medical Clinic, four locations in Singapore including Serangoon, Camden, Holland Village and Katong, Tel: (+65) 6733 4440, www.imc-healthcare.com

Mount Elizabeth Hospital: Therapy services at a hospital

The psychiatrists here are qualified to diagnose and treat a range of psychiatric and mental health disorders. Other areas of specialisation include addiction, anger management, eating disorders, PTSD and more.

Mount Elizabeth Hospital, 3 Mount Elizabeth Singapore 228510, www.memc.com.sg

MSF Family Services Centres: Community-based support centres

Family Service Centres (FSCs) are key community-based support centres for individuals and families in need. FSCs are staffed with social workers and other professionals to provide a helping hand. Anyone, regardless of age, race, language or religion, can benefit from FSC services. There are currently 48 such centres in Singapore. Find the list of FSCs here.

MSF Family Services Centres, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Tampines and Marine Parade, www.msf.gov.sg

Dr. Oberdan Marianetti: Professional therapist and sexologist

As a qualified psychologist and clinical sexologist, Dr. Oberdan works with individuals, couples, business owners and leaders to live a more purposeful life and enhance their sense of fulfilment and satisfaction. He works with individuals and couples on matters ranging from sexual identity and orientation to sexual function and education.

Dr. Oberdan Marianetti, 63b Temple Street, Singapore 058608, www.oberdanmarianetti.com

Online Counselling on Family Assist (OCFA): Anonymous online counselling services

If you’re struggling with family or marital problems, then you can speak to a counsellor via live chat (available on weekdays from 9am to 6pm) or drop an email with your enquiries instead. The website also has a handy FAQ guide if you’re new to online counselling in Singapore.

Online Counselling on Family Assist (OCFA), www.familyassist.msf.gov.sg

The Other Clinic: Evidence-based approach for therapy

The Other Clinic is committed to offering good quality psychological services, thanks to its friendly team of professional counsellors and psychologists supporting mental wellness. The Other Clinic offers a safe space through therapy in Singapore, where tending to your mental well-being is as natural as tending to your physical health. The multilingual, multicultural team is dedicated to providing an evidence-based international approach to mental health with you.

The Other Clinic, 35 Lorong 23 Geylang, Singapore 388369, www.theotherclinic.sg

Padma Jairam: Counsellingi psychologist in Singapore

Padma Jairam is a psychotherapist, counselling psychologist, and life coach in Singapore. She does individual, family, couples therapy, and group therapy, and also provides LGBTQIAP+ counselling services. Padma is particularly passionate about helping those who struggle with trauma, personality disorders, sexual behaviours, and any offending behaviour. She speaks English, Malay, Tamil, Bahasa Indonesia and simple conversational Mandarin.

Padma Jairam, 3 Temasek Avenue, Centennial Tower, Level 21, Singapore 039190, www.padmajairam.com

Promises Healthcare: Family counselling & marriage therapy in Singapore

Founded by Dr. Munidasa Winslow, a renowned expert in the addiction field, Promises Healthcare now has an experienced team of psychiatrists, psychologists, and therapists, each offering counselling and therapy in Singapore for addiction and mental health treatment and recovery, family counselling, marriage counselling and more.

Promises Healthcare, #09-23, Novena Medical Centre, 10 Sinaran Drive, Singapore 307506, www.promises.com.sg

Psychology Blossom: Individual and couples therapy

The Psychology Blossom team are qualified to help you with individual and couples therapy, child and family therapy and marriage counselling in Singapore. Clients are ushered into cosy, welcoming spaces that are non-judgmental, and sessions may take place over a few weeks or months, depending on your needs. The psychologists and therapists here enable you to evolve into your own therapist by equipping you with the right techniques and coping methods. Click here to read about one of our team’s experience with Psychology Blossom.

Psychology Blossom, 150 Cecil Street, #07-02, Singapore 069543, www.psychologyblossom.com

The Psychology Practice: Offers parenting workshops

The Psychology Practice is made up of a team of senior to principal-level Clinical, Counselling and Educational Psychologists, who have an average of over ten years of experience serving in public and private healthcare settings both locally and overseas. Their team is highly trained in individual, family and couple therapy as well as in the assessment and treatment of mild to severe mental health concerns for kids as young as four years old through adulthood.

The Psychology Practice, 178 Clemenceau Avenue, Level 3, Haw Par Glass Tower, Singapore 239926, Tel: (+65) 9880 1154, www.thepsychpractice.com

Psynaptica: Uses scientific and evidence based approaches

Psynaptica’s team of psychologists led by clinical psychologist and director Shrimathi Swaminathan, uses current, scientific and evidence-based approaches to mental health assessment, diagnosis and therapy.They offer therapy for a variety of mental health conditions including OCD, trauma, psychosis, eating disorders, depression and anxiety, and they also support those with issues related to stress, relationships, parenting, relocation and adjustment.

Psynaptica, 312A Tanglin Road, Unit 01-02, Phoenix Park, Singapore 247982, Tel: (+65) 6779 0770, www.psynaptica.com

Redwood Psychology: Multi-lingual therapists

With a team of professional, empathic and compassionate psychologists and counsellors, Redwood Psychology is well-equipped to help children, adolescents, adults, couples and families with a wide range of emotional and psychological difficulties. Understanding that everyone’s experience is unique, their multi-lingual therapists tailor their approach to meet each clients’ specific needs. Whether you are struggling with anxiety, depression, relationship issues, or any other concerns, the team is here to listen without judgment and provide the tools you need to cope and thrive.

Redwood Psychology, 1 North Bridge Road, High Street Centre, #06-11, Singapore 179094, hello@redwoodpsy.com, WhatsApp: (+65) 8885 5424, www.redwoodpsy.com

SACAC Counselling: Well-qualified and experienced team of therapists

Established in 1973, SACAC Counselling is the oldest and one of the largest mental health practices in Singapore. It offers counselling, psychotherapy support, psychometric and personality assessment services to children, adolescents, adults, couples, and families. Their well-qualified and experienced team works with the broader community of doctors, psychiatrists, dieticians, educators, and other specialists, adopting a holistic approach to mental health.

SACAC Counselling, 15 Scotts Road, #09-04, Thong Teck Building, Singapore 228218, www.sacac.sg

Scott Psychological Centre: Counselling and therapy services

Scott Psychological Centre provides psychological and academic assessment, psychotherapy, and counselling services. Their team of experienced psychologists and psychotherapists are well-equipped to help you with a variety of emotional or psychological difficulties. They provide therapy in Singapore for ADHD, post-traumatic stress, educational/socio-emotional issues in children, family therapy, depression, anxiety and more.

Scott Psychological Centre, 360 Orchard Road, #10-10, International Building, Singapore 238869, www.scottpsychologicalservices.com

Singapore Counselling Centre: Professional counselling & psychotherapy services

Singapore Counselling Centre is a member of the Academy of Certified Counsellors. Here, you can find professional counselling services if you are facing interpersonal, intrapersonal and mental health challenges. Full-time students, seniors, holders of CHAS Blue card and Orange card, recipients of other forms of financial assistance and those with an official referral letter can receive subsidised counselling. For client convenience, Singapore Counselling Centre also offers video counselling.

Singapore Counselling Centre, 51 Cuppage Road, #03-03, Singapore 229469, www.scc.sg

Sofia Wellness Clinic: Evidence-based counselling techniques

A private counselling and therapy centre in Singapore, Sofia Wellness Clinic offers support for teenagers, adults, couples and families to help them achieve their greatest potential. Their team of therapists use effective, evidence-based counselling techniques including Cognitive-Behavioural Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioural Therapy (DBT), Acceptance Commitment Therapy (ACT) and Emotionally Focused Therapy. You can opt for in-office therapy sessions or online counselling sessions.

Sofia Wellness Clinic, 190 Clemenceau Avenue, #02-07, Singapore Shopping Centre,
Singapore 239924, www.sofia.com.sg

White Canvas Therapy: Offers therapy for adults, teens and couples

One of the few psychoanalysts in Singapore, Rebecca Versolato offers psychotherapy through a psychoanalytical approach, ideal to better understand relationships, patterns of behaviour, career crises, underlying trauma and more. She works with adults, teenagers and also couples. She is also a popular choice for parents looking for parenting advice, especially for immigration matters, couples going through sexuality issues and divorce.

White Canvas Therapy, 16 Mohamed Sultan Road, Singapore 238965, www.rebeccaversolato.com

Need more health-related reads? We’ve got you covered!

The post Where To Go For Counselling & Therapy In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Students At This School Gain A Competitive Edge At Universities With College-level Academics (+ $500 Off!)
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Discover how the International Community School’s Advanced Placement (AP) courses prepare students for university and beyond through rigorous, college-level academics – with students consistently outperforming global benchmarks! Looking for a school that equips your child with the right skills and foundation for university and beyond? Choosing the right school plays a big part in helping […]

The post Students At This School Gain A Competitive Edge At Universities With College-level Academics (+ $500 Off!) appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Discover how the International Community School’s Advanced Placement (AP) courses prepare students for university and beyond through rigorous, college-level academics – with students consistently outperforming global benchmarks!

Looking for a school that equips your child with the right skills and foundation for university and beyond? Choosing the right school plays a big part in helping your child reach their full potential, and preparing them for success at the right university is just as important.

At the International Community School (ICS) in Singapore, students don’t just excel academically, they also grow into confident individuals who are prepared to thrive in any environment. With a globally recognised American curriculum, ICS equips them with the tools, values, and real-world experience they need to thrive.

Recognising students’ potential for academic success and beyond

ICS offers 25 Advanced Placement (AP) courses that challenge students with college-level academic work in high school. With an average score of 4 out of 5, ICS students consistently outperform global averages, giving them a competitive edge when applying to top universities. These strong results also often allow students to earn early college credit.

As the Class of 2025 prepares to graduate, their university acceptances reflect not just academic excellence but also personal growth and a readiness to lead in a rapidly changing world. This year’s seniors are heading to prestigious universities across the United States, United Kingdom, Asia, and more.

Alumni like Sann Nu Wai (PhD from Imperial College London) and Nathan Low, who has earned his B.A., cum laude, from UC Berkeley and his Juris Doctor (JD) from UCLA School of Law, further amplify that ICS prepares students for success in every field. Yushi Liao (Class of 2024) is studying Materials Science at City University of Hong Kong and contributing to sustainability projects. “ICS taught me that service is action,” she says, emphasising the school’s focus on purposeful learning.

Personalised pathways with a supportive community

At ICS, every student is encouraged to explore their passions and goals. With one-on-one academic counselling, students receive the personalised guidance they need to plan and prepare for university applications. A low student-to-teacher ratio also means students get the individual attention they need every step of the way.

The school’s supportive community doesn’t end at graduation, many ICS alumni stay connected to the community, with some even returning to teach, coach, and guide the next batch of students! Ready to explore how ICS can prepare your teen for university? Sign up for their upcoming virtual Open House on 4 June 2025 to learn more!

Join ICS’s Virtual Open Houses to enjoy a $500 waiver on your application fee! Secure your spots here.

International Community School (ICS), 27a Jubilee Road, Singapore 128575, www.ics.edu.sg

The post Students At This School Gain A Competitive Edge At Universities With College-level Academics (+ $500 Off!) appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: KitchenAid Has A New Cordless Collection That Makes Whipping Up Family Meals A Breeze
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Does your little one often want to help out in the kitchen? KitchenAid’s newest Cordless Collection makes meal prep a breeze, even if it’s with the kids. Cook anytime, anywhere! Do you find yourself scrambling to get meals on the table after a long day at work? KitchenAid has just made life easier. The new […]

The post KitchenAid Has A New Cordless Collection That Makes Whipping Up Family Meals A Breeze appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Does your little one often want to help out in the kitchen? KitchenAid’s newest Cordless Collection makes meal prep a breeze, even if it’s with the kids. Cook anytime, anywhere!

Do you find yourself scrambling to get meals on the table after a long day at work? KitchenAid has just made life easier. The new KitchenAid Go Cordless Collection helps you prep, mix, and blend without worrying about power sockets or messy cords. Whether you’re making smoothies for the kids or baking treats together, these cordless tools offer the freedom to move around the kitchen with ease.

Cord-free convenience with one powerful battery

The KitchenAid Go Cordless Collection includes four must-have tools for every kitchen: the Go Cordless Hand Mixer, Go Cordless Hand Blender, Go Cordless Food Chopper, and Go Cordless Personal Blender (USD$299 per appliance). Without cords getting in the way, you can cook safely and freely—perfect if the little ones want to help. These tools are designed to move with you, so you can meal prep wherever the kids need you.
