On 9 August from 6pm – 9pm, Pororo Park Singapore transforms into its own NDP with carnival games, balloon sculpting, Pororo & Friends tattoos, a mascot parade, and more. Enjoy live streaming of the NDP, and since Pororo Park is located in Marina Square, there will be a special fireworks viewing segment where you can watch the stunning display live! Your little ones will also receive a special goodie bag worth $100, filled with Pororo merchandise, snacks, and vouchers.

Buy two admission tickets and get a Pororo merchandise of your choice for only $5.90! Plus LITE membership for 1 Adult + 1 Child is going for just $59! These promotions are valid from 1 – 31 August 2024.

Where: Pororo Park Singapore, Raffles Blvd, Marina Square, Singapore 039594
How much: from $69 (1 adult + 1 child). Ticket sales begin 8 July

NTUC x NDP Bay Celebrations

NTUC will be hosting its first large-scale NDP event as part of the extended National Day Parade celebrations at the Promontory @ Marina Bay. This event, NTUC’s biggest in over a decade, will take place on 3 and 9 August and will consist of live musical performances, a live broadcast of the NDP, the state flag flypast, the “Salute to the Nation” bomb burst by the Republic of Singapore Air Force, the presidential gun salute sail-past, the Total Defence 40 dynamic defence display’s high-speed chase, and a fireworks display. Attendees will receive an NDP fun pack, and there will be a photo booth, interactive installations, and more.

When: 3 & 9 August, 3pm – 10pm
Where: Promontory @ Marina Bay
How much: Balloting is now closed.

National Day Celebrations at One Punggol

Good news for north-easties, because plenty of National Day celebrations are popping up! Celebrations will take place on two separate days with plenty of activities for the whole family. On 3 August, look forward to various activities, including stage performances, craft workshops that include making your very own Merlion plushies, movie screenings, arcade games and even bouncy castles! There’ll also be a sing-along segment, where you can show your patriotism by singing to your favourite NDP tunes. On 9 August, there’ll be plenty of live screening of NDP. However, the highlight would have to be the State Flag Flypast and the Six F-16s Flypast that’ll pass through the Punggol district!

When: 3 & 9 August
Where: One Punggol, 1 Punggol Dr., Singapore 828629
How much: Free!

MAJULAH FIESTA: National Day Celebrations at Singapore Sports Hub

The Singapore Sports Hub brings back its National Day festivities this year with plenty of activities across three weeks! With the theme: ‘Together We Play, As One United People,’ there will be several aspects to ensure everyone’s at their patriotic best. Try a new sport at the Sports Tryouts, or get your groove on at the Majulah Fiesta Fitness Party. You can even bring your furry friends along for Pets Play Day. Some other programme highlights include the Lion City Dance Convention, the Active Health Fitness Challenge, and the live telecast of the NDP, flypast and fireworks on 9 August! Check out the full itinerary of programmes here.

When: 27 July – 11 August
Where: Singapore Sports Hub
How much: Free!

National Day Celebrations at Community Centres

National Day celebrations kick off a week early at several heartland locations in Singapore, featuring various exciting weekend activities for the whole family. From carnivals and fitness events to durian parties and even fireworks, these heartland festivities are perfect for getting into the National Day spirit!

When: from 3 August
Where: Various locations
How much: Free!

We will be updating this page with more information on the NDP 2025 events and side activities when more information is released.

Want to be in the know about everything NDP 2025? Click here to sign up for our newsletter!

The post NDP 2025: National Day Celebrations & Rehearsals At The Padang & Marina Bay, NDP Events & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Shop Cute Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Whether you want comfy baby clothes or stylish kids’ clothes in Singapore, we’ve got you covered with this list of physical and online stores for cool clothes for kids! Where do I find cute baby clothes and kids’ clothes in Singapore? We’ve found all the best baby gear and kids’ clothing brands and shops in […]

The post Where To Shop Cute Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Whether you want comfy baby clothes or stylish kids’ clothes in Singapore, we’ve got you covered with this list of physical and online stores for cool clothes for kids!

Where do I find cute baby clothes and kids’ clothes in Singapore? We’ve found all the best baby gear and kids’ clothing brands and shops in Singapore and beyond so you can plan matching outfits for the fam, pick up gorgeous clothes for kids of all ages (how hard is it to find tween clothing!?), or get ready for your little one’s arrival with organic baby clothes and more. Happy shopping!

If you’re looking for outfits for festive seasons or special occasions, check out our guides on where to buy Indian traditional clothes for kids, kids’ cheongsams and baju kurung for kids.

Best Shops and Online Stores for Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes in Singapore:

PlayYard: Homegrown children’s clothing brand

Looking for cute limited edition pieces for your little ones? PlayYard is a local children’s clothing brand nestled in the heartlands with pop-up stores in Novena Velocity and Raffles Xchange. We love their variety of playful prints that bring out the flair in every child. Specialising in small batch collections, this kids’ clothing store in Singapore crafts each piece of clothing with love and care so each child can move and play in ultimate comfort.

Here, you’ll find something for newborns to 12-year-olds, so there will always be a reason to come back for more. Making adorable outfits accessible to all, PlayYard keeps prices affordable, so you can update your child’s wardrobe as they grow. If you have a special occasion or simply need outfit ideas, their kids’ fashion experts can help! So, why not add bold and happy prints to your child’s wardrobe for an extra ray of sunshine? We certainly want to!

PlayYard, 1 Ghim Moh Road, #01-179, Singapore 270021 and pop-up stores in Novena Velocity and Raffles Xchange, www.playyard.sg

Angelibebe: Luxury baby & kids’ clothes

A curated collection of brands offering luxury clothes for kids and babies aged between 6 months and 12 years, Angelibebe offers quirky and exclusive pieces from both established designers (Milly Minis, Sonia Rykiel Paris) and up-and-coming brands (Tutu de Monde, Mini Rodini) from all around the world. For selected locations, they offer free shipping with a minimum order value. Plus, there’s a live chat and a fabulous kids clothing sale section!

Angelibebe, www.angelibebe.com

BaeBeeBoo: Kids’ clothes made with 100% luxe cotton

We’ve been lusting after their gorgeous kaftans since forever, so it’s been super exciting to see BaeBeeBoo expand into other stylish, sustainable kids’ clothing that’s perfectly suited for hot and humid Singapore. This socially-conscious fashion label’s clothes are made from 100% luxe cotton, much of it hand-sewn by women in Jaipur, India. We also love that a portion of their profits goes toward supporting underprivileged children. Keep an eye out for mama-daughter twinning sets.

BaeBeeBoo, 442 Orchard Road, #02-01, Claymore Connect, Singapore 238879, www.baebeeboo.com

Bochechas: Premium kids’ clothes in Singapore

Breathable clothes are so important if you want to stay cool in Singapore, and this local fashion brand has everything you need. Created by a mama who had trouble finding beautiful, practical clothing that was also safe for a child’s delicate skin, Bochechas blends functional designs with premium, hand-selected fabrics. Bochechas carries clothes for kids aged 1 to 12, and for adults, too, so it’s easy to match your looks for a day out as a family.

Bochechas, 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #01-158A, Singapore 237994, www.bochechas.sg

Carter’s: US brand for baby & kids’ clothes

Carter’s is a popular brand that retails clothes for kids and babies. Hailing from the US, their range of multipack onesies and clothing sets are sure to be in many kids’ wardrobes in the first couple of years! They always have fun designs you can’t resist and are exclusively available online at Amazon.sg and KidStyle stores across the island.

Carter’s, www.carters.com

Château de Sable: French-style kids’ clothes

Created by a French mama and inspired by French style and impeccable clothing quality, Château de Sable has five boutiques across Singapore. From exclusive Liberty prints to adorable hand-smocked dresses, every gorgeous piece of clothes for kids – ranging from newborns to kids aged 12 – sticks to the brand’s philosophy that children should dress like children! Free local shipping for orders above $50.

Château de Sable, five locations in Singapore including Tanglin Mall, Great World and i12 Katong, www.chateaudesable.com

CottonOn Kids: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes

If you’re looking for a bright pop of colour, CottonOn Kids is bound to have something that fits the bill. With a great range of clothes for kids in breathable thin materials that suit this hot climate (did we also mention wallet-friendly prices?), CottonOn Kids is always a winner, especially for little kids up to around 10. For teen clothing and adults, check out CottonOn.

CottonOn Kids, multiple locations including Wisma Atria, United Square and Plaza Singapura, Singapore, www.cottonon.com

The Elly Store: Clothes for kids aged 0 to 14 years

A perennial stalwart in our CNY cheongsam roundup, Elly is a local label that makes gorgeous baby wear and clothes for kids aged 0 to 14, all year round! It’s also one of our go-to’s when choosing special, new baby clothes to send to friends overseas! Never one to compromise on comfort or practicality, The Elly Store’s collection of fun prints were designed with tweens in mind, with a matching baby collection so siblings can coordinate and make it a family affair!

The Elly Store, multiple stockists in Singapore including Orchard, Tanglin Road and VivoCity, www.theellystore.com

Gingersnaps: Fashionable kids’ clothes

Gingersnaps is always on the list when we are kids’ clothes shopping for a new birthday dress or smart shirt – they do such sweet prints and colours. They stock enviable gear for babes, tweens and older kids too.

Gingersnaps, multiple locations in Singapore including Raffles City, Paragon and IMM (outlet store), www.sg.gingersnaps.com.ph

H&M: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes

You’ll find adorable affordable clothes for kids, babies and teens at H&M. Get baby clothes in Singapore easily, thanks to their range of pieces from newborns to 24 months (all-in-ones in super-soft organic cotton!), while older kids can try styles like dungarees, soft jersey pieces and fun animal print tees.

H&M, multiple locations in Singapore including JEM, Vivo City and Suntec City, www.hm.com

Kiddy Palace: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes

You can often find Kiddy Palace in neighbourhood malls all around Singapore, offering affordable children’s clothes for every occasion! We love their range of comfy onesies and casual clothing for wearing around the house, plus they’ve also got multi-sets that are great for building bub’s wardrobe of clothing essentials. Have a wedding or birthday party to attend? Kiddy Palace also has plenty of options for flouncy dresses, smart shirts, pants and fancy shoes!

Kiddy Palace, multiple locations including Causeway Point, Marina Square and Westgate, Singapore

Kids21: Kids’ clothes from designer brands

Calling all mini fashionistas! Kids21 carries baby clothes and kids clothes from more than 80 designer brands. Their kids’ clothes are designed for kids aged 0 to 16. They’ve also got a wide range of accessories, plush soft toys, and other fun gift ideas for kiddos.

Kids21, multiple locations in Singapore including Dempsey, Forum and Marina Bay Sands, www.kids21.com

Le Petit Society: Kids’ clothes made of certified organic cotton

As parents to two little girls, the founders of Le Petit Society vowed to create safe and comfortable clothes for kids with every collection. Le Petit Society believes in using only choice fabrics that children will want to wear daily and last generations!

Le Petit Society, multiple locations including Paragon and Downtown Gallery, Singapore, www.lepetitsociety.com

Little Baby Singapore: Baby clothes & nursery products

Little Baby Singapore is a one-stop shop for baby products! Mostly known for their nursery products from bedding to furniture, feeding accessories and more, Little Baby Singapore also offers cute and comfy baby clothes from brands including Elly Milley, Hoppetta, Agabang x Disney Baby and more. Plus, don’t miss the adorable baby romper inspired by the traditional Japanese kimono!

Little Baby Singapore, 38 Ang Mo Kio Industrial Park 2, #Level 7, Lobby A, Singapore 569511 (visit by appointment only), www.littlebaby.com.sg

Little Ground: Premium Korean baby & kids’ clothes

You can shop cute baby clothes and kids’ clothes from popular Korean kids’ fashion store Little Ground at Forum The Shopping Mall, Singapore! Little Ground is a fashionable premium baby’s and children’s store brand from Korea that provides discerning and fashionable mamas and dads with a one-stop shop for the best of quality, trendy kids’ clothes.

Little Ground, three locations including Forum The Shopping Mall, Great World and Raffles City, www.littleground.com.sg

Little Happy Haus: Organic baby clothes & toys

Little Happy Haus has Insta-mamas covered with their curated, IG-worthy clothes for kids aged 0 to 10 years. There’s also a range of open-ended toys and handmade home decor. We love how pretty everything is, and we’d highly recommend them for baby and kids’ gifts for fellow mum friends.

Little Happy Haus, www.littlehappyhaus.com

Little Kooma: Seasonal kids’ clothes

Your tot will be the apple of everyone’s eye when you dress them up in outfits from Little Kooma. Specialising in baby clothing in Singapore, this online store has adorable clothing options for babies and kids alongside baby feeding accessories, baby gifts and all the essentials you’ll need.

Little Kooma, www.littlekooma.com

Read more: Where To Find Kids’ Cheongsam In Singapore

Mango Kids: Chic kids’ clothes for aged 5 and up

Mango is known for their trendy, chic outfits for men and women, but did you know they also have a kids’ section? At Mango Kids, you’ll find all of the kids clothes in Singapore that you’ll need from shorts to t-shirts, tops, jumpsuits, swimwear and more. They have minimalist looks to floral print so you can find something for every style!

Mango Kids, multiple locations in Singapore including Ion Orchard, Tampines and Serangoon, www.shop.mango.com

moodytiger: Activewear for kids

Have a little athlete in your midst? moodytiger offers tech-driven and design-led athletic apparel for kids ages 4 to 16 years old, covering a variety of sports activities such as running, swimming, tennis, ice skating, skiing or gymnastics. Their selection of kids’ clothes is stylish, comfortable and multi-functional for everyday outdoor activities and even perfect for your budding pros!

moodytiger, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, #B1-61, 8 Bayfront Ave, Singapore 018955, www.moodytiger.com

Mothercare: Go-to store for kids’ clothes & accessories

Singapore’s go-to for all things kids-and-baby, Mothercare is also a great all-rounder if you’re looking for kids’ clothes in Singapore! With 11 stores across the island (including the experience stores at Paragon and Harbourfront). They also have some great cold-weather clothing, as well as cute sleepsuits and pyjamas too!

Mothercare, multiple locations including Harbourfront Centre, Paragon and Jewel Changi, Singapore, www.mothercare.com.sg

NEXT: Online kids’ clothes store

We love the extensive range of clothes for kids offered at online store NEXT. Whether it’s cute baby clothes, kids’ clothes or clothes for older teens, they have a ton of designs and styles, and we’re always spoiled for choice. Plus, delivery is just a standard $7 for all orders!

NEXT, www.next.sg

Nimbu: Buy-Use-Return policy for kids’ clothes

Online, sustainable kids’ clothing store Nimbu offers a circular platform for all things kids, ranging from handmade comfy ethnic wear to cotton dresses, shirts and handcrafted shoes for newborns to kids aged 14 years old. Their unique Buy-Use-Return policy allows you to return kids’ outgrown outfits in exchange for credits that you can use to offset your next purchase.

Nimbu, The Green Collective, #02-18, Funan Mall; OG People’s Park, Level 4; Design Orchard, www.nimbu.sg

PatPat: Affordable baby wear & kids’ clothes

From cute baby clothing to must-have clothes for kids, PatPat has it all at prices that won’t break the bank! PatPat doesn’t just do cute kids’ clothes, they’ve also got plenty of Disney-inspired threads that your tot will love. They also have adorable baby clothes and matching family sets for your next family photoshoot!

PatPat, www.sg.patpat.com

Read more: Best Photo Studios & Family Photographers In Singapore

Plume Active: Lightweight children’s sportswear

While we love all the adorable, cutesy kids’ clothes available, activewear is what you should really stock your kiddos’ wardrobes with because these kids get sweaty all. the. time! Online clothing store Plume Active has the perfect wear for this, with minimalist, lightweight essentials that are great for kids aged 3 to 10 years old.

Plume Active, www.plumeactive.co

Read more: Best Football Academies & Football Clubs For Kids

PreLouLou: Pre-loved kids’ clothes from designer brands

PreLouLou was born out of the belief that dressing up our kids fabulously shouldn’t cost the planet! This online marketplace is a one-stop shop to buy and sell preloved and past season children’s clothing. You’ll find over 200 brands available on their site, including Ralph Lauren, Jacadi, Chateau de Sable, Our Mini Nature and more at up to 70% off retail price.

PreLouLou, www.preloulou.com

PONEY: Kids’ clothes from Malaysia

Hailing from Malaysia, this kids’ clothing brand offers oh-so-cute (not to mention super stylish!) clothes for boys and girls. Their designs definitely steer more towards the dressier side, so if you’re a fashionista parent who loves dressing your little ones up, PONEY is worth checking out.

PONEY, www.poney.com.sg

RAPH&REMY: Organic cotton baby clothes

This homegrown Singapore brand features gorgeous organic cotton baby swaddles and bamboo zippies and onesies that are perfect for our hot and humid climate. If you’re looking to order a new baby gift for a mama friend, RAPH&REMY is the spot, mamas!

RAPH&REMY, also available at Motherswork in Great World City and Tanglin Mall, Mummys Market in Suntec City and Tang Plaza Orchard, www.raphandremy.com

Retykle: Pre-loved kids’ clothes by designer brands

Want cool kids’ threads without increasing your carbon footprint? Go green, and get preloved designer clothes for kids at Retykle. This online store retails designer kids’ clothing at a fraction of their retail prices, and you can expect kids’ clothes from brands such as Petit Bateau, Jacadi, Ralph Lauren and more.

Retykle, www.retykle.sg

Sea Apple: Sustainable baby & kids’ clothes

Sea Apple is a local go-to kids’ clothing store for parents who want organic baby clothes and eco-friendly clothes for kids. They use GOTS-certified organic cotton for all of their original prints, which come in bold, modern, functional designs for babies, toddlers and kids up to 14 years old.

Sea Apple, United Square, 101 Thomson Road, #01-68, Singapore 307591 www.seaappleshop.com

Seed Heritage: Trendy kids’ clothes

Seed Heritage is one of our firm faves when it comes to clothes for kids (and our trendy selves!). Their kids’ apparel spans baby clothes in Singapore plus threads for small kids and teens – the designs are always spot on, too.

Seed Heritage, three locations in Singapore including Paragon, Takashimaya and Wisma, www.seedheritage.com

TANGS Baby & Kids: Department store with kids’ clothes

If you’re looking for stylish kids’ clothes, pop into TANGS Baby & Kids for a handpicked selection of fab kids’ fashion, kind of like a fashion edit for littlies. There’s a great selection of local talents, too, like Sea Apple, Anothersole, and Vik (by local multi-label lifestyle store The Assembly).

TANGS, multiple locations including Tang Plaza and Vivo City, www.tangs.com

Thea Kids: Linen & organic cotton kids’ clothes

Thea Kids makes one and two-piece sets in linen and premium basic onesies made of organic cotton elastane. We love the muted shades and wearable prints their kids’ clothes come in! This local brand is also one of our go-to’s for sustainable kids’ Hari Raya outfits. They also offer a range of matching headbands for girls and stylish baby teethers.

Thea Kids, www.theakids.co

Uniqlo: Affordable kids’ clothes with prints

Uniqlo is great for staples and affordable kids’ clothing – as well as clothing for adults, too. Don’t you just love Uniqlo’s AIRISM range? Now, you can share the love with all your kiddos, no matter their age. We also love that we can get the whole family’s winter gear stocked in one shop (anyone else fans of the Heattech and ultralight down jackets?).

Uniqlo, multiple locations in Singapore including Bugis+, Great World and ION Orchard, www.uniqlo.com

When I Was Little: Chic baby & kids’ clothes

Here you’ll find anything from cute baby wear to kids’ swimwear, and cute kids’ clothes such as dresses, bottoms, bodysuits, tops and loads more. Plus, don’t miss their adorable rompers for the littlest ones in your family!

When I Was Little, www.wheniwaslittle.co

Zalora: Kids’ clothes with prints

Find clothes for kids from a wide range of different brands at this online store. Pick out cute tropical prints for toddlers and bigger kids, graphic tees, dresses and so much more at Zalora. We love that you can buy clothes for kids from H&M to GAP and Adidas all in one place here!

Zalora, www.zalora.sg

Zara Kids: Trendy kids’ clothing

You can always count on Zara to have the most on-trend clothing for kids of all ages! We love their adorable onesies and rompers that will keep your little one trendy and cool. Plus, if you browse long enough you may even find matching outfits for yourself!

Zara, multiple locations including 313@Somerset, Marina Bay Sands and Jewel, Singapore, www.zara.com

Click below for more kids’ fashion picks!

The post Where To Shop Cute Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Top Places For Middle Eastern, Turkish, Greek & Mediterranean Food In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Craving fluffy pitta, hummus and grilled meat platters? Here’s where to find the best Greek, Turkish, Middle-Eastern and Mediterranean food in Singapore Looking for the best Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Greek or Turkish food in Singapore? From creamy hummus and fluffy pita to smoky grilled meats, fresh salads and generous mezze platters, these vibrant cuisines are […]

The post Top Places For Middle Eastern, Turkish, Greek & Mediterranean Food In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Craving fluffy pitta, hummus and grilled meat platters? Here’s where to find the best Greek, Turkish, Middle-Eastern and Mediterranean food in Singapore

Looking for the best Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Greek or Turkish food in Singapore? From creamy hummus and fluffy pita to smoky grilled meats, fresh salads and generous mezze platters, these vibrant cuisines are packed with bold, sun-kissed flavours perfect for sharing. While Singapore is famous for its amazing Italian restaurants, sushi and dim sum, there’s something special about the communal, flavour-rich experience of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food. Whether you’re craving a cosy Greek taverna, an authentic Turkish grill, or Middle Eastern mezze with friends, we’ve rounded up the best spots in Singapore for Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Greek and Turkish food that’ll transport your tastebuds straight to the Med.

Best Middle-Eastern & Mediterranean Food In Singapore 2025:

Alaturka: Mediterranean Food & Turkish Hospitality

Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant has been a solid choice for many years for those craving a taste of Turkish food. Go for the Meze Tabag – a sharing platter of hummus, babaganoush, saksuka, tarama salata, muhammara, feta, olives and lavas. Then tuck into Falafel and salads to go with the house-made Pide (similar to pizza) or jump straight to the Grilled Meats and kebabs section. Save room for the flaky sweet Baklava and a strong black coffee!

Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant, 15 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199436, www.alaturka.com.sg

Alati Divine Greek Cuisine: Greek restaurant in Singapore

Sporting a very Greek blue and white interior, Alati on trendy Amoy Street offers all the usual Greek staples. Think whole grilled fish and other seafood (flown in directly from the Aegean Sea), beef moussaka (a traditional Greek casserole) and Greek salads and dips.

Alati Divine Greek Cuisine, 73 Amoy Street, Singapore 069892, www.alati.sg

Aniba: Middle-Eastern restaurant with views

Aniba puts a new spin on Middle Eastern cuisine with its European style and Asian influences. This spot is part Middle Eastern restaurant, part chef’s kitchen, and cocktail bar and is by the same people behind our other Middle Eastern food go-to, Miznon. Tuck into Arabic Salad Ceviche, grilled Middle-eastern Cauliflower with Tahini and Pecan-Parsley pesto, and sharing mains of Chilean Sea Bass with Freekeh Pilaf or Grilled Grouper, Bouillabaisse with Hummus Cream and Couscous.

Aniba, 6 Battery Road, #05-03, Raffles Park, Singapore 049909, Tel: (+65) 9668 8036, www.aniba.com.sg

Artichoke: Middle Eastern-inspired Mediterranean food

Artichoke has to be the granddaddy of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food in Singapore. Chef-owner Bjorn Shen brings a playful twist to traditional Middle Eastern dishes with a modern, bold approach. Must-try dishes include lamb shakshouka, halloumi fries, Jewelled Hummus and Muhammara for Turkish bread dunking, and don’t skip the Fried Cauliflower and the famous Feta Burrata.

Artichoke, 46 Kim Yam Road, #01-02 New Bahru, Singapore 239351, www.artichoke.com.sg

Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant: Turkish food prepared tableside

Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant along Bussorah Street is a Muslim-owned eatery that offers a diverse menu crafted by OG Turkish chefs. Signature dishes include the theatrical Pottery Kebab, which comes with lamb and vegetables baked in a clay pot and opened tableside, and the Mixed Grill platter, ideal for sharing. Complement your meal at Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant with traditional starters like hummus and baba ghanoush, and conclude with their signature Kunefe dessert.

Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant, 51 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199467, www.ayasofyarestaurant.com.sg

Bakalaki Greek Taverna: Mediterranean restaurant in Singapore

Bakalaki is a bustling Greek taverna in the heart of River Valley. This Mediterranean hotspot in Singapore is known for its buzzing atmosphere and great dips and starters from tzatziki to the sinful Saganaki Kefalotyri cheese and fava bean spread that goes great with fluffy pitta bread. If you’re in a group order the Mmeat or seafood platters or hoard the delish lamb chops all to yourself.

Bakalaki, #01-01, 38A Martin Road, Singapore 239072, www.bakalaki.com

Blu Kouzina: Popular Greek restaurant in Singapore

Blu Kouzina offers an authentic Greek dining experience with a focus on fresh ingredients imported from Greece. At this Greek restaurant in Singapore, tuck into grilled octopus, moussaka, and a selection of traditional Greek dips like tzatziki and taramosalata. It’s always super lively here (and it’s sometimes hard to get service) but the Mediterranean food at this Greek restaurant keeps us coming back again and again.

Blu Kouzina, multiple restaurants in Singapore including Dempsey, Siglap and Sentosa, www.blukouzina.com

Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant: Famous restaurant in Bugis

Located at the vibrant Bussorah Street just steps away from the iconic Sultan Mosque, Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant is always bustling with customers that flock daily to try their famous Kunafa, and trust us, it’s worth the journey. The Turkish and Mediterranean dishes here might be a little pricier, but the consistent crowd suggests it’s a spot well worth checking out.

Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant, 69 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199482, www.cappasg.net

Éla Jalan Sultan: Greek restaurant with brunch sets

Nestled in the heart of Kampong Glam at Jalan Sultan, Éla is a Muslim-owned eatery by the famous The Black Hole Group (the same guys behind Tipo!) that combines affordability with authenticity, serving up hearty Greek dishes like grilled meats, fresh seafood, and classic dips. Popular picks in Éla Jalan Sultan include the Farmhouse platter, melitzanosalata with fluffy pita, and their signature brunch sets.

Éla Jalan Sultan, 33 Jalann Sultan, #01-09/10, Singapore 198965, www.ela.sg

Kazbar: Middle-Eastern restaurant in Singapore

Leaning towards Middle-Eastern flavours rather than Mediterranean food? Check out Kazbar with its comprehensive menu of Lebanese dishes. Order Kazbar’s Hot Mezzeh Platter if you’re in a big group and graze on sambousek lamb, arrayes, spinach borek, kibbeh, jawaneh and falafel. The vegan mezze platter is always a winner and the artichoke stew is super tasty.

Kazbar, 25 Church Street, #01-03 Capital Square, Singapore 049482, www.kazbar.com

Miznon: Greek restaurant in Singapore CBD

Good food and a light-hearted fun atmosphere? Step this sway! Miznon’s pita sandwiches are somewhat legendary by now. And for good reason. The pitas at this Greek restaurant in Singapore are fluffy and soft and encompass hearty fillings that are a real meal in itself. Try the pita with egg, sour cream, tomato, and onion or tuck into a pita with cheeseburger, sour cream, chili, pickle, onion, tomato, and a sunny side egg.

Miznon Singapore, 6 Stanley Street, #01-01, Singapore, www.miznonsingapore.com

Mykonos on the Bay: Greek food in Sentosa, Singapore

You’re sure to get Mediterranean vibes when you sit al fresco at Mykonos on the Bay on the Sentosa Quayside waterfront, with beautiful views of the marina. This Greek restaurant in Singapore gets points for romantic vibes but it’s also buzzing and fun enough for a group. Tuck into souvlaki, grilled seafood platters, and baklava for dessert.

Mykonos on the Bay, 31 Ocean Way, #01-10 Quayside Isle, Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098375, www.mykonosonthebay.com

North Miznon: Mediterranean food by Michelin-starred chef

When we get asked where to go for a fun evening out we very often recommend North Miznon! Serving up modern Mediterranean food with a buzzing vibe, North Miznon on Amoy Street is the brainchild of Michelin-starred MasterChef Eyal Shani. The service can feel a little rushed (especially for the first seating) but the atmosphere makes up for it. Foccacia is free and free-flow, best eaten with the hummus and prawn dish, Lamb Shawarma and the Bish Bash salad.

North Miznon, 110 Amoy Street, #01-01, Singapore 069930, www.northmiznonsg.com

Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant: Established in 1999

Sofra Turkish Café & Restaurant has been a top go-to restaurant for Turkish food since 1999, serving up hearty, homestyle dishes. Located at Marina Square, Sofra Turkish Café & Restaurant is known for its generous portions, friendly service, and comforting classics like lamb shank, beef moussaka, and freshly baked pide. Don’t miss their signature Sofra Platter if you’re dining in a group!

Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant, 6 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square #03 – 129A, Singapore 039594, www.sofra.sg

Whether you’re planning a casual meal with friends or a romantic dinner, these top Middle Eastern and Mediterranean restaurants in Singapore offer authentic flavours and unforgettable dining experiences.

Read more: 

The post Top Places For Middle Eastern, Turkish, Greek & Mediterranean Food In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 7 Urban Vegetable & Fruit Farms In Singapore To Visit With The Kids
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Take your kids on an urban farming tour around these great organic vegetable and fruit farms in Singapore to see where our food comes from! If you are looking to teach your kids where fruits and vegetables come from, there are actually a ton of urban farms in Singapore producing organic fruits, vegetables and herbs! […]

The post 7 Urban Vegetable & Fruit Farms In Singapore To Visit With The Kids appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Take your kids on an urban farming tour around these great organic vegetable and fruit farms in Singapore to see where our food comes from!

If you are looking to teach your kids where fruits and vegetables come from, there are actually a ton of urban farms in Singapore producing organic fruits, vegetables and herbs! Some even practice hydroponic farming and vertical farming, and many of them welcome visitors for tours. There are even cow and goat farms in Singapore too! Whether your kiddo is into learning about the natural environment or growing plants themselves – a trip to one of these farms makes a fab kids’ activity in Singapore. Some of these vegetable farms even have on-site cafes for you to enjoy the fresh produce… a true farm-to-table concept. Keep scrolling for urban farms in Singapore that you can visit now!

Read more: Kid-Friendly Animal Farms In Singapore

Vegetable & Fruit Farms In Singapore:

Bollywood Farms: Organic Vegetables & Fruits

Bollywood Farms (formerly Bollywood Veggies) is the place to be if you want to get your hands on fresh and organic vegetables, herbs, and fruits, including uncommon varieties like wintermelon, dill, breadfruit and butterfruit. Grown without the use of chemical fertilisers, pesticides, and growth hormones, this vegetable and fruit farm is probably most well known for the 20+ varieties of bananas they grow each year – and all are sweet, succulent and hand-selected by the co-founder too. Bollywood Farms also makes a good family field trip with independent and guided tours of the farm, hands-on horticultural programmes, and culinary classes all available for families to enjoy. Kids can have a go at planting rice (and getting all muddy in the process) and take part in other hands-on activities to understand urban farming better. An on-site bistro, Poison Ivy, and a culinary school set against the quaint backdrop of the quiet Kranji countryside make this a truly memorable vegetable farm visit.

Bollywood Farms (formally Bollywood Veggies), 100 Neo Tiew Road, Kranji, Singapore 719026, bollywoodfarms.com

ComCrop: Sustainable Urban Farming

ComCrop is Singapore’s first and only commercial rooftop farming company that also focuses on sustainable urban farming, growing the freshest, tastiest and pesticide-free produce in the city. They offer free tours monthly, but if you’d like to drop by on a specific date it’s best to reach out to them before you visit.

Comcrop, Rooftop, 15 Woodlands Loop Singapore, Singapore 738322, www.facebook.com/ComCrop

Edible Garden City: Hydroponic Farming

Edible Garden City designs, builds and maintains food gardens in Singapore, including a number of restaurants, hotels, schools, residences, and more! Over the last 7 years, they’ve completed hundreds of food gardens in Singapore, in notable locations such as Marina Bay Sands, Resort World Sentosa and Fairmont Hotel, just to name a few. Edible Garden City supplies fresh herbs, flowers, and vegetables to food and beverage outlets, as well as families through their Citizen Box programme. Their farm is open for farming and gardening workshops, and they also create and run farming curriculum in schools to benefit teachers and students.

Edible Garden City, 60 Jalan Penjara Singapore, Singapore 149375, www.ediblegardencity.com

Green Up Singapore: Kampong-style Urban Farming

Green Up Singapore is also known as The Nature Nook, a charming garden within Gallop Kranji Farm Resort that makes for a great day trip with the kids. The garden has over 80 types of herbs, vegetables and fruit trees, and kids are even allowed to harvest some leaves and fruits to take home!

Green Up Singapore, The Nature Nook, 10 Neo Tiew Lane 2, Kranji Gallop Farm Resort, Singapore 718813, www.facebook.com/GreenUpSingapore

Kin Yan Agrotech: Organic Edible Cactus & Wheatgrass Farm

Another gem in the Sungei Buloh Wetlands Reserve-meets-Kranji countryside pocket, Kin Yan Agrotech is Singapore’s largest organic wheatgrass farm and grower of fresh edible cactuses, aloe vera, mushrooms, and roselle fruits. This cute urban farm is open to the public too for families who want to wander around and see how organic wheatgrass is actually produced! You can also pick up a select range of fresh produce whilst you’re there, taste their products, or join in on any of their live cooking demos or wheatgrass juicing sessions.

Kin Yan Agrotech, 220 Neo Tiew Crescent, Singapore 718830, www.kinyan.sg

Kok Fah Technology Farm: Hydroponic Farming

For a day of fun and discovery, Kok Fah Technology Farm will keep the kiddos entertained! The farm is a local family-owned business that’s been selling leafy vegetables in Singapore for the past 30 years. They have a mini ‘zoo’ area, a sheltered area with tables and benches for picnics, and a showcase R&D hydroponics greenhouse featuring their salad greens and herbs. Their Weekend Market is well-loved by regulars and stays open through the weekend from 9am to 5pm selling freshly harvested vegetables, exotic imported vegetables and dried goods. They also do guided tours! Tours for the greenhouse include a guided tour through the hydroponics greenhouse, an aloe vera demonstration and a lettuce sample pack to take home with their homegrown Honey Aloe Vera Drink. Kok Fah Technology Farm has an extensive list of activities you can add on when you have the farm tour experience, depending on your family’s interests. You can also find their fresh produce available at leading supermarket chains, and online, for home delivery and group buys.

Kok Fah Technology Farm, 18 Sungei Tengah Road, Singapore 698974, Tel: (+65) 6765 6629, www.kokfahfarm.com.sg

World Farm: Edible Plants & Trendy House Plants (FREE entry)

While more of a plant lover’s haven than an urban farm, World Farm still makes it to our list for its extensive range of potted herbs, edible plants and IG-worthy landscape! It’s one of the larger plant nurseries in Singapore, with rows and rows of greenery and beautiful blooms that make for plenty of great photo ops. Psst… This is also the place to get coveted house plants, including the trendy monstera deliciosa and fiddle leaf fig tree, at wholesale prices.

World Farm, 2 Jurong Gateway Road, #01-01, Singapore 608512, www.facebook.com/worldfarm

Quan Fa Organic Farm: Organic Fruit, Veggie & Herb Farm

Update: Quan Fa Organic Farm no longer operates farm tours, but you can find their stall at Ang Mo Kio and order online.

Free of pesticides, nasty chemicals and harmful fertilisers, this family-run vegetable and fruit farm grows organic fruits, vegetables and herbs that can be bought onsite at their little farm shop or at any of the regular farmers’ markets they participate in. They even organise regular educational farm tours for families – all you need to do is give them a call to find out when the next one is!

Quan Fa Organic Farm, 527, Block 527 Ang Mo Kio Ave 10, #01-19 Market and Food Centre, 560527 www.quanfaorganic.com.sg

(Closed) Green Circle Eco-Farm: Organic, Eco-friendly Farming

Located in the grassy expanse near Kranji Reservoir, Green Circle Eco-Farm takes utmost care to ensure nature is treated with respect. All of their hardworking farmers tend to the land without the use of artificial chemicals or pesticides, growing organic fruits, vegetables and herbs that are delicious. Orders can be placed on their online store for delivery or if you have a car you can drive out to the farm and pick them up yourself. If you’re feeling adventurous in the kitchen, you can opt for a mystery ‘vegetable bag’ that contains a surprise selection of handpicked vegetables and fruit. This vegetable and fruit farm even welcomes visitors, with their special programmes for school children, allowing little learners to learn first-hand about environmental conservation and the effects of organic farming. Kiddos learn how to appreciate nature, as they see, smell, and feel the plants themselves… all under the tutelage of experienced trainers. If you’d rather tour the farm as a family, Green Circle is open to the public (you’re just asked not to disturb the farmers while they work!), although some areas are off-bounds to unescorted visitors.

Read more:

The post 7 Urban Vegetable & Fruit Farms In Singapore To Visit With The Kids appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Kid-friendly Guide To Qian Hu Fish Farm In Singapore: Longkang Fishing & Fish Spa!
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Take the kiddos to Qian Hu Fish Farm, where entry is FREE. There’s a fish spa, and little ones can fish for their own guppies (longkang fishing!) to take home. Have you taken the kids to Qian Hu Fish Farm? If they’ve already been to the Singapore Zoo, Bird Paradise and River Wonders, perhaps it’s […]

The post Kid-friendly Guide To Qian Hu Fish Farm In Singapore: Longkang Fishing & Fish Spa! appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Take the kiddos to Qian Hu Fish Farm, where entry is FREE. There’s a fish spa, and little ones can fish for their own guppies (longkang fishing!) to take home.

Have you taken the kids to Qian Hu Fish Farm? If they’ve already been to the Singapore Zoo, Bird Paradise and River Wonders, perhaps it’s time for a more laid-back kids’ activity in Singapore. Qian Hu Fish Farm gives kids a fun opportunity to interact with nature. One of the bigger fish farms in Singapore, Qian Hu Fish Farm is home to over 1,000 species and varieties of ornamental fish from all over the world.

What started as a family business has now turned into a hot spot for aquatic fish owners from all over the island seeking colourful fish, unique marine life (like albino turtles and Polkadot stingrays) and aquarium accessories like aquatic plants and tanks. But what families love most about Qian Hu Fish Farm is the free entry and super fun longkang fishing for the little ones.

Jump to:
– What To See At Qian Hu Fish Farm
– Things To Do At Qian Hu Fish Farm
– Where To Eat At Qian Hu Café
– Where To Shop At Qian Hu Fish Farm
– Tips For Visiting Qian Hu Fish Farm
– How To Get To Qian Hu Fish Farm: Free Shuttle Bus
– Qian Hu Fish Farm Opening Hours

Guide to Qian Hu Fish Farm In Singapore:

Things to do at Qian Hu Fish Farm: Longkang fishing & fish spa

Longkang fishing at Qian Hu Fish Farm

‘Longkang’ is the Malay word for ‘drain’, referring to the well-loved pastime of catching fish along canals and streams in olden-day Singapore. Qian Hu Fish Farm features a cluster of ponds and canals that allows kids to catch guppies with a little net and fish tank! The fish you catch are yours to keep at no extra charge.

How much: $7 per person for 30 minutes of longkang fishing. $12 per person for 60 minutes of longkang fishing. Price includes a net and plastic fish tank.

Read more: Petting Farms In Singapore Where Kids Can Interact With Animals

Fish spa at Qian Hu Fish Farm

Treat yourself to a little spa moment (albeit ticklish!) by soaking your feet in the Qian Hu Fish Spa! The Garra Rufa fish thrives on dead skin cells and will help to provide your tired feet with natural exfoliation with their painless nibbling.

How much: $10 per adult; $5 per child or senior citizen for 30 minutes

Fish Gallery at Qian Hu Fish Farm

If you’re an ornamental fish aficionado, Qian Hu Fish Farm will be a haven for you! For the rest of us regular fish-admiring folk, the aisles of tanks at the entrance and in the Fish Gallery at Qian Hu Fish Farm are more than enough to keep us looking in awe at all the colourful fish and marine life, including prawns, stingrays, frogs, eels and turtles. There’s also a section at Qian Hu Fish Farm, displaying a variety of aquatic snails and plants!

How much: Free entry!

Farm tour at Qian Hu Fish Farm

If you’re keen to take your experience one step further, choose from a range of Qian Hu Fish Farm’s farm tour packages. Each farm tour package includes a guided informative tour, where you’ll learn more about their fishes, where they come from and their natural habitats.

How much: Qian Hu Fish Farm’s farm tour packages start from $5 per child and senior citizen and $8 per adult for a Guided Tour and 45-minute Fish Spa experience.

What to eat at Qian Hu Fish Farm

After a day of longkang fishing and discovering all that this fish farm in Singapore has to offer, you’ll be happy to know that there’s an on-site café at Qian Hu Fish Farm with snacks, steamed buns (pau) and other hot finger food, drinks and ice cream!

Where to shop at Qian Hu Fish Farm

Whether you’re looking to add fish to your aquarium at home or are simply craving fresh seafood, you’ll find just what you need at Qian Hu Fish Farm’s retail stores. Get recommendations and tips from their friendly retail staff or browse their wide variety of freshwater livestock. Keen to indulge in seafood? Head to Qian Hu Seafood to pick up succulent oysters, juicy lobsters and many more!

Tips for visiting Qian Hu Fish Farm with kids

As with most outdoor areas in Singapore, make sure you slap on lots of sunscreen and have some mosquito repellent handy when visiting Qian Hu Fish Farm. Dress comfortably too, as it is an entirely open-air fish farm with almost no air conditioning.

If you’re visiting with young kids, feel free to bring your stroller along! There are plenty of smooth, paved paths around Qian Hu Fish Farm, which makes it easy to manoeuvre your stroller around the Qian Hu Fish Farm. Most parts of Qian Hu Fish Farm were sheltered, except for the fishing ponds and car park.

How to get to Qian Hu Fish Farm

Besides getting to Qian Hu Fish Farm by car, taxi or private hire, you can hop on the free Qian Hu Fish Farm Shuttle Bus Service to and from Choa Chu Kang MRT/LRT Station Exit A Bus Bay 1. Simply make your way to Choa Chu Kang MRT and walk straight towards Exit A (in the direction of Lot 1 Mall). Then turn left. Follow the path and direction signs towards Bus Bay 1, where the Qian Hu Fish Farm Shuttle Bus will pick up visitors.

Qian Hu Fish Farm Shuttle Bus Service is available Mondays to Sundays, including Public Holidays, unless otherwise stated. Check out the Qian Hu Fish Farm Shuttle Bus Service schedule here.

Qian Hu Fish Farm opening hours

Qian Hu Fish Farm is open daily. Their opening hours on Monday to Friday and the eve of Public Holidays are from 9am to 6pm; and on Saturday, Sunday and public holidays it’s from 9am to 7pm.

So there’s everything you need to know about Qian Hu Fish Farm. Enjoy admiring the fish and trying out longkang fishing in Singapore with the kiddos! 

Qian Hu Fish Farm, 71 Jalan Lekar, Singapore 698950, www.qianhudiscover.com

Read more: 

 

The post Kid-friendly Guide To Qian Hu Fish Farm In Singapore: Longkang Fishing & Fish Spa! appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Watch The UEFA Champions League 2025 In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Calling all football fans! We’ve got the lowdown on where to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 in Singapore on Sunday, 1 June 2025, plus deets on which games to look out for! Watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 finals this Sunday, 1 June 2025! Who’s in the UEFA Finals? Paris Saint-Germain F.C. will be […]

The post Where To Watch The UEFA Champions League 2025 In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Calling all football fans! We’ve got the lowdown on where to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 in Singapore on Sunday, 1 June 2025, plus deets on which games to look out for!

Watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 finals this Sunday, 1 June 2025! Who’s in the UEFA Finals? Paris Saint-Germain F.C. will be going head-to-head with Inter Milan. UEFA Champions League 2025 is one of the most anticipated events of the year, as football fans gather around their TVs or head to football stadiums to cheer on their favourite soccer teams once again. This year, Germany will host the UEFA Champions League 2025, which is also the 70th edition of Europe’s premier club football tournament. The football matches for UEFA Champions League 2025 will take place at various stadiums across Europe. We’ve got all the deets on where to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 from the comfort of your home–just bear in mind that Germany is six hours behind us!

Jump to:
– When is the UEFA Champions League 2025?
– When and where will the UEFA Champions League 2025 final take place?
– Which cities are hosting the UEFA Champions League 2025
– How to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 with cable?
– How to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 online?
– Where to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 in Singapore?
– UEFA Champions League 2025 Match Schedule
– Top Three UEFA Champions League 2025 Games to Watch

When is the UEFA Champions League 2025?

The UEFA Champions League 2025 is currently ongoing. It started with the qualifying rounds on 9 July 2024, and the final match will take place at the Allianz Arena in Germany on 31 May 2025. The UEFA Champions League 2025 is currently in its semi-final stage.

When and where will the UEFA Champions League 2025 Finals take place?

The final of the UEFA Champions League 2025 will take place on 31 May 2025 at Allianz Arena in Munich, Germany, which is 3am on 1 June 2025 in Singapore time!

Which cities are hosting the UEFA Champions League 2025?

The UEFA Champions League 2025 is being hosted across numerous cities in Europe, corresponding to the home venues of the 36 participating clubs during the league phase. Each team played four home and four away matches, resulting in fixtures spread across various European cities.

This includes Munich, Germany with Bayern Munich, Paris, France with Paris Saint-Germain, Milan, Italy with Inter Milan and London, England with Arsenal.

How to Watch UEFA Champions League 2025 with Cable

If you’ve got cable service, you’ll likely find the UEFA Champions League 2025 matches on beIN Sports from 17 September 2024 for Singtel or Starhub members.

How to Watch UEFA Champions League 2025 Online

Get Express VPN to Watch UEFA Champions League 2025

If you’d like access to overseas coverage of the UEFA Champions League 2025 (plus the option to watch movies and TV shows not accessible in Singapore), get a VPN, which allows you to stream content from anywhere in the world. Just connect to a server location of your choice (such as Berlin or Munich for the UEFA Champions League 2025), and you can stream the game for free via Telekom Deutchsland, ARD, RTL Germany and ZDF.

Get a VPN here for fuss-free live match viewing!

Where to Watch UEFA Champions League 2025 in Singapore

Cafe Football

Cafe Football is the place to be for all football fans. Head to their outlet at Woodleigh or East Coast Park to watch all of the UEFA Champions League 2025 football action on a big screen. Cafe Football serves juicy wings, braised lamb shank, chargrilled lamb rack and more.

Cafe Football, 920 East Coast Parkway Singapore 449875 Parkland Green #01-28 and 48 Woodleigh Park, Singapore 357844 The Arena @ PUB Recreation Club, www.instagram.com/arfc.sg

Lau Pa Sat

This heritage hawker centre might not be the first place that comes to mind for where to watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 in Singapore, but you can catch all of the action here while feasting on your favourite late-night snacks. With an eclectic atmosphere, 24-hour food and even live band performances, Lau Pa Sat transforms into the ultimate destination for football fans to catch the football action. Details of the UEFA Champions League 2025 screening aren’t out yet, but stay tuned to their social pages for more info!

Lau Pa Sat, 18 Raffles Quay, Singapore 048582, www.facebook.com/laupasat.sg

Harry’s Bar

Harry’s is a sports bar in Singapore, where you can enjoy your favourite matches with cold beer and a wide selection of casual food. Soak in the energy of the crowd as you support your favourite team. Book a table to join the football fever and watch the UEFA Champions League 2025 live on the big screen.

Harry’s Singapore, 3D River Valley Road, #01-01 Clarke Quay, 179023, www.harrys.com.sg

UEFA Champions League 2025 Match Schedule

Want to block out time in your calendar to watch your favourite team? Click here for the full UEFA Champions League 2025 match schedule so you can park yourself on the couch for football fun!

Top Three UEFA Champions League 2025 Games to Watch

Whether you’ve got FOMO or want to know how to select the best football matches to watch, we’ve got the deets on which teams to keep an eye on at UEFA Champions League 2025.

UEFA Champions League 2025 Semi-Finals (Second Leg): Inter Milan vs. Barcelona

The second leg of the UEFA Champions League 2025 semi-finals is currently underway, with Inter Milan set to face Barcelona on 7 May 2025.

UEFA Champions League 2025 Semi-Finals (Second Leg): Inter Milan vs. Barcelona Match Time: 7 May 2025, 3am SGT

UEFA Champions League 2025 Semi-Finals (Second Leg): Paris Saint-Germain vs. Arsenal

The second leg of the UEFA Champions League 2025 semi-finals will also see Paris Saint-Germain and Arsenal on 8 May 2025.

UEFA Champions League 2025 Semi-Finals (Second Leg): Paris Saint-Germain vs. Arsenal Match Time: 8 May 2025, 3am SGT

UEFA Champions League 2025 Final

We can’t wait to find out who will be battling it out in the final! Be sure to secure your spots and catch the matches live on beIN Sports via StarHub, Singtel, or stream it on ExpressVPN!

UEFA Champions League 2025, Final Match Time: 1 June 2025, 3am SGT

Happy watching the UEFA Champions League 2025, and may the best team win!

Read more:

The post Where To Watch The UEFA Champions League 2025 In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Best Buffets In Singapore 2025: Seafood Buffets, Halal Buffets & International Hotel Buffets
item.dc:creator: Aisyah Amin
item.description:
From seafood buffets with lobster, crab and oysters, to Halal buffets, ice cream buffets with 48 flavours, and the cheapest buffet in town, we’ve rounded up some of the best buffets in Singapore for a family feast! Singapore’s food scene has it all—from sizzling steak restaurants and delightful ice cream cafes to bubble tea shops […]

The post Best Buffets In Singapore 2025: Seafood Buffets, Halal Buffets & International Hotel Buffets appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
From seafood buffets with lobster, crab and oysters, to Halal buffets, ice cream buffets with 48 flavours, and the cheapest buffet in town, we’ve rounded up some of the best buffets in Singapore for a family feast!

Singapore’s food scene has it all—from sizzling steak restaurants and delightful ice cream cafes to bubble tea shops on almost every corner, food hunting has become a favourite pastime here. And for those with insatiable appetites, the buffet scene in Singapore promises no less. From brunch to mookata and afternoon tea, there’s a buffet restaurant for everyone. Check out this list of the best buffets in Singapore, featuring amazing hotel buffets, international buffets, halal buffets, unique ice cream buffets, and seafood buffets featuring lobsters, crabs and oysters. Many of these are located in hotels in Singapore!

Read more: Guide To Best Kid-friendly Restaurants & Cafés With Playgrounds

Best Buffets In Singapore: Hotel Buffets, Halal Buffets, Seafood Buffets & More:

Novotel Singapore on Stevens: Unlimited lobster buffet

Food Exchange at Novotel on Stevens invites seafood enthusiasts to indulge in its “Lobstermania Buffet” every Saturday, featuring sumptuous dishes, including fusion favourites. Start your buffet meal with the Creamy Lobster Bisque or the Lobster and Apple Salad with Tobiko Roe. Then, head to the mains, where you can choose from a variety of lobster dishes, including unique ones such as Lobster Masala and Lobster Mornay. There are also non-lobster mains to be enjoyed, such as Wok Fried Noodles and Chicken and Lamb Satay.

Don’t miss out on the seafood ice bar, live stations featuring Roast Duck, Chicken, and Pork Belly, the desserts station, as well as Bottomless Booze, where you can enjoy a free flow of selected spirits for an additional $38 per person. If you’re a seafood lover, Food Exchange at Novotel on Stevens also has the Oh Shucks! It’s Wednesday Buffet ($68++ per adult), where you can enjoy over 15 unlimited seafood dishes, including snow crab legs and Japanese oysters.

Where: Food Exchange, Novotel Singapore on Stevens, 26 Stevens Road, Singapore
Buffet prices: Dinner: $98++ per adult
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: 1-for-1 Dining Deals & Promos in Singapore

Princess Terrace: Authentic Penang buffet

Princess Terrace is the go-to spot for authentic Penang cuisine, and its buffet spread guarantees that you’ll leave as a lover of Penang dishes if you’re not already! This buffet in Singapore features traditional delights such as Ark Thu Mee Sua, Penang Hokkien Mee Soup, and Signature Char Kway Teow.

Plus, you can indulge in free-flow servings of handmade Nyonya kuehs, adding a sweet and nostalgic touch to your meal. Head over on the weekends for the Penang Heritage Weekend Feast, where exclusive specialities like Lobster Hokkien Mee Soup and Penang Lok Lok await. You’ll also get to enjoy unlimited crispy Ban Chang Kueh pancakes! And the best part? Kids under 5 dine for free!

Where: Princess Terrace, 403 Havelock Road, #1F Copthorne King’s Hotel, Singapore
Buffet prices: Lunch: $53++ per adult, $27++ per child; Dinner: $65++ per adult, $33++ per child; Penang Heritage Weekend Feast (Dinner on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays) $78++ per adult, $39++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Best ‘Kids Eat Free’ Deals In Singapore

Crossroads Buffet: Lobster buffet in Singapore

Seafood lovers, this one’s for you! Crossroads Buffet is offering two irresistible seafood buffet feasts this July with unlimited seafood dishes. If you always head straight to the lobster section at buffets, don’t miss Lobsterlicious Nights, featuring over 15 unique crab and lobster dishes. Indulge in delights like Black Truffle Lobster Risotto, Lobster and Sea Urchin Risotto, Mentaiko Mayonnaise Crab Roll, Lobster with White Wine Cream Sauce, and Bamboo Lobster with Miso Cheese.

The buffet also includes Roasted Bone-In Ribeye and Beef cheek stew for meat lovers. End your meal with desserts like Malibu Mango Cake, Rose Panna Cotta with Lychee, and a Chocolate Fondue. On the other hand, the Ultimate Seafood Feast offers 80 dishes of fresh seafood and premium meats, including Snow Crab Legs, Poached Live Prawns, Baby Lobsters, Roast Beef Striploin, Roast Pork Loin, and Romesco King Prawn Skewers. Check out the full menu here.

Where: Crossroads Buffet, Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, 320 Orchard Road, Singapore
Buffet prices: Dinner: from $88++ per adult, $42++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Best Kid-Friendly Hotels In Singapore With Staycation Packages

Atrium Restaurant: Halal buffet in Singapore

Note: This deal has since expired. Check out the latest 1-for-1 buffet deals here.

Atrium Restaurant is celebrating Singaporean flavours this month with a special Singapore Food Fare 2024, running until 1 September. This halal buffet in Singapore is dishing out a mouthwatering spread of local delights. Look forward to traditional and modern favourites like Chicken Bak Kut Teh, Soto Ayam, Wok-fried Duck with Spicy Hot Bean Sauce, and Beef Rendang.

The highlight would have to be the Durian selection! Indulge in unique dishes like Fish Fillet in Spiced Gravy with Durian, Durian Chicken, Durian Prawn, and of course, the beloved Durian Pengat. If you’re in the mood for something international, there’s plenty to choose from, including Seafood Shepherd’s Pie, Chicken Jambalaya, and Beef Bourguignon. Don’t miss the live stations, featuring the Chef’s Signature Singapore Laksa, a Congee station, and a BBQ corner. The best part – there’s a 1-for-1 offer for adults for both lunch and dinner!

Where: Atrium Restaurant, Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium, 317 Outram Rd, Singapore 169075
Buffet prices: from $94++ per adult, $25++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: 1-for-1 Buffets, Dining Deals & Promos in Singapore

Beach Road Kitchen: Seafood buffet with Chefs-on-Show live stations

Craving an all-seafood buffet packed with your favourite ocean-fresh delights? Beach Road Kitchen at JW Marriott Singapore invites you to dive into the ultimate seafood feast, featuring Seafood on Ice, a Charcoal Grilled Station, oven-baked specialities, and more. Start at the Cold Seafood Room, where you’ll find daily freshly shucked oysters, snow crab legs, poached prawns, and assorted sashimi – perfectly paired with house-made sauces like the refreshing Garden Mint-Mango Mignonette. Dining on the weekend? Treat yourself to Half Boston Lobsters (available exclusively for the Friday & Saturday Dinner Buffet) and Boston Lobster Claws (available for Weekend Lunch Buffet and Daily Dinner Buffet).

For those who love bold, savoury flavours, head to the oven-baked seafood section. Enjoy handcrafted pizzas like the new Mariana Pizza and Barbecue Chicken Pizza (available for Weekend Lunch Buffet and Daily Dinner Buffet). Over at the Charcoal Grill Station, feast on smoky, grilled seafood and premium meats, including Grilled Canadian Scallops (available for Weekend Lunch Buffet and Daily Dinner Buffet). And don’t miss the exciting live stations, where the Chefs-on-Show will impress you with their culinary skills as they prepare your mouthwatering seafood creations.

Where: Beach Road Kitchen, JW Marriott Hotel Singapore South Beach, 30 Beach Road, Singapore 189763
Buffet prices: from $78++ per person
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Edge: Hotel buffet with 7 open kitchens

Edge at Pan Pacific Singapore offers an impressive spread of delectable local and international dishes and is renowned as one of the best buffet restaurants in Singapore. The extensive buffet is prepared in seven live open kitchens that will be a feast for your senses. There’s something for everyone, from fresh seafood on ice featuring Boston Lobster, Tiger Prawn, White Clam, Half Shell Scallop and Sea Conch, and delicious sashimi to grilled delights featuring Angus Beef Short Rib, Lamb Chop and Fresh Tiger Prawn and Squid, and even a pizza station featuring Neapolitan Sourdough Pizza.

Little ones will love the dedicated station featuring kid-friendly favourites like fries, mac & cheese, and chicken nuggets. The buffet experience is elevated by live, à la minute presentations from chefs, including a pasta station and an Asian live station featuring Penang Wok Hey Fried Kway Teow and more.

Where: Edge, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Level 3 Pan Pacific Singapore, Singapore 039595
Buffet prices: from $68++ per adult, $34++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Fab Restaurants To Book For Father’s Day

Food Capital, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore: Sakura Serenity Buffet

It’s cherry blossom season! But before you wish you were in Japan, here’s some good news, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore is bringing the magic of sakura right to our shores with its Sakura Serenity Buffet. Held at Food Capital, which boasts stunning waterfront views, this buffet is a must-visit for fans of Japanese cuisine.

Curated in collaboration with Michelin-trained Chef Elson Lee, the menu masterfully blends Japanese traditions with refined Western influences. Expect a spread of Japanese and fusion specialities, from timeless classics to bold modern flavours. Indulge in tuna and beef tataki, kami nabe seafood kaisen, sake-infused duck confit, shirobuta tomahawk steak, golden crab, and crispy soft-shell crab. Diners can also enjoy live chef demonstrations featuring must-have favourites like salmon mentaiko, Japanese ramen, and curry udon!

Quote SASSYMAMAJPN20 to enjoy 20% discount! Promotion is valid from 16 April 2025 – 15 June 2025.

Where: Food Capital, 392 Havelock Road, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore, Singapore 169663
Buffet prices: from $72++ per adult, $36++ per child.
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Peppermint: Halal buffet with Peranakan fare

Peppermint is another top choice for Halal buffets in Singapore, consistently impressing with its seasonal menus that offer a wide array of dishes from various cuisines. This buffet restaurant in Singapore will be bringing back its popular  ‘Savour The Straits Peranakan Buffet’, held in collaboration with Beh Gaik Lean, chef-owner of one-MICHELIN-starred Auntie Gaik Lean’s Old School Eatery in Penang, Malaysia. Look forward to popular signature dishes that will be making a comeback, including the Black Angus Beef Belly Pongteh (Angus beef belly, stewed with fermented soybean paste), Assam King Prawns, Inchi Kabin (Nyonya-style fried chicken) and more.

The buffet, which is crafted together with Peppermint’s Chef de Cuisine Leon Yee, will also feature new dishes like the Sambal Udang, Cincaru Rempah, a hard-tailed scad stuffed with turmeric and lemongrass sambal and Kerabu Bee Hoon with Tiger Prawn. The buffet is also held in conjunction with the National Day celebrations, and guests will be thrilled to know that there will be free flow of the nation’s favourite fruit, the durian, available on Friday and Saturday evenings at Peppermint’s Urban Farm. Savour the Mao Shan Wang, Red Prawn, and D24 varieties delivered fresh from Malaysia. You can also opt to have your durian grilled for that extra caramelised sweetness!

Where: Peppermint, 6 Raffles Boulevard, Level 4 PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay, Singapore
Buffet prices: from $72++ per adult, $36++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Where To Find The Best Peranakan Food In Singapore

Carousel: Affordable Halal buffet

Carousel is a popular spot for Halal buffets in Singapore, and it’s happily one of the most affordable spreads too. There’s an extensive array of dishes from various cuisines, including Japanese, Mediterranean, Asian, and local delights.

Look forward to sashimi and teppanyaki stations, seafood on ice, barbecued meats, a cheese station, pizzas, and more. The dessert buffet selection is just as impressive, featuring a wide range of hot and cold treats such as classic Crème Brûlée, Black Forest Cake, Chocolate Lava Pudding, and Bread and Butter Pudding with Vanilla Sauce.

Where: Carousel, 25 Scotts Road, Royal Plaza, Singapore 228220
Buffet prices: from $42++ per adult, $22++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Guide To Halal Restaurants & Cafes, Muslim-Friendly Food In Singapore

CLOVE: Hotel buffet with international and local dishes

CLOVE at Swissôtel The Stamford is a buffet restaurant known for its extensive selection of local and international cuisine. Open for both lunch and dinner, this buffet in Singapore features classics such as seafood on ice, sashimi, and a cheese station. Notable buffet highlights include various live stations and carving stations, such as the Croffle station, slow-roasted striploin, and roasted pork belly.

Fans of local cuisine will love the noodle station and a wide selection of elevated local dishes, including Beef Shank Rendang and CLOVE Braised Pork Belly. Complement your meal by indulging in a variety of desserts, including Salted Caramel Choux Puffs, Hojicha Tea Cake, Chocolate Bon Bon, gelato, and more.

Where: CLOVE, 2 Stamford Road, Level 2 Swissôtel The Stamford, Singapore
Buffet prices: from $68++ per adult, $34++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Colony: Hotel buffet with Asian faves

If you ever crave an ultimate Asian feast, Colony has the perfect buffet menu for you. Looking for Chinese food or Indian cuisine? This buffet in Singapore has it all, plus a wide array of local, Indonesian, Malaysian, and Western dishes to satisfy your cravings.

Prepared in seven open kitchens, the dishes are inspired by the trade and commerce culture of the late 18th century. Highlights include a sandwich station with locally-infused flavours such as Otak Otak, Rendang Chicken, and Kaya, as well as a Wok station featuring favourites like Mamak Mee Goreng, Kung Pao Prawn, and Salted Egg Crab Meat Fried Rice.

Where: Colony, Level 3, The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore, 7 Raffles Avenue, Singapore
Buffet prices: from $74++ per adult, $37++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Estate Restaurant: Cooked-to-order buffet experience

Estate Restaurant lets you elevate your buffet experience with its new à la minute specialities, featuring ten cooked-to-order chef’s handpicked signatures. Look forward to beautifully crafted dishes such as Pan Seared Foie Gras, Slow-Roasted Tomahawk, Sarawak White Pepper Slipper Lobster, and Frog Leg with Yunnan Mushroom Rice.

These specialities are served alongside an expansive buffet spread, including a seafood and oyster bar, Asian and Western favourites, a dessert station, and more. The best part? Kids below five dine for free!

Where: Estate, Hilton Singapore Orchard, 333 Orchard Road, Level 5, Singapore
Buffet prices: from $98++ per adult, from $49++ per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

RISE Restaurant: International buffet at MBS

RISE Restaurant at Marina Bay Sands offers delectable buffet menus available for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The menu showcases a variety of local and international cuisines, including beloved local classics like Singapore Chilli Crab and elevated favourites such as Australian Wagyu Beef Cheek Rendang. Guests can also enjoy fresh sashimi, sushi, seafood on ice, and Western dishes like Wagyu Beef Rib Eye and Slow-cooked Iberico Pork Ribs.

On weekends, diners receive a complimentary welcome drink, and children can enjoy a special kids’ buffet menu featuring burgers, pizzas, and cupcakes!

Where: RISE, Marina Bay Sands, Lobby, Hotel Tower 1
Buffet prices: from $72 per adult, $36 per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Swensens Unlimited: Halal ice cream buffet

A buffet in Singapore with 48 rotating ice cream flavours and unlimited servings? Count us in! Swensen’s Unlimited is a Halal buffet restaurant beloved by locals for its affordable prices and extensive selection of ice cream. There are 48 rotating flavours, complete with a variety of toppings and even a chocolate fondue.

Must-try flavours include Osmanthus Wolfberry Pear, Ondeh Ondeh, Milo, and Kaya. In addition to ice cream, the buffet menu also features seafood on ice, Asian and international dishes, pizzas, and more.

Where: Swensens Unlimited, Singapore Changi Airport, Terminal 2, #01-03
Buffet prices: from $35 per adult, $15 per child
How to book this buffet: Reserve your table here.

Read more: Where to Go for Gelato & Ice Cream in Singapore

Have you got a fab buffet restaurant that’s not featured on our list? Email us to let us know at sassy@sassymamasg.com

Read more:

The post Best Buffets In Singapore 2025: Seafood Buffets, Halal Buffets & International Hotel Buffets appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Bird Paradise Singapore Review & Guide: Bird Feeding, Show Times & Tickets (+ Up To 26% Off Tickets!)
item.dc:creator: Beate
item.description:
Here’s what to know about Bird Paradise Singapore (formerly Jurong Bird Park) in Mandai Wildlife Reserve. Read our Bird Paradise review and find out everything from ticket prices (+ promos!) to bird feeding times, animal show times and kids’ playgrounds! Bird Paradise is home to 3,500 birds across 400 species from loris to pelicans, flamingos, […]

The post Bird Paradise Singapore Review & Guide: Bird Feeding, Show Times & Tickets (+ Up To 26% Off Tickets!) appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Here’s what to know about Bird Paradise Singapore (formerly Jurong Bird Park) in Mandai Wildlife Reserve. Read our Bird Paradise review and find out everything from ticket prices (+ promos!) to bird feeding times, animal show times and kids’ playgrounds!

Bird Paradise is home to 3,500 birds across 400 species from loris to pelicans, flamingos, emus, and cassowaries and is one of our favourite kid-friendly activities in Singapore. The new bird park, Bird Paradise, made an epic move to Mandai, Singapore from its original location in Jurong in 2023. Bird Paradise is one of the Mandai Wildlife Reserve parks together with the Singapore Zoo, Night Safari and River Wonders, as well as the new Rainforest Wildlife Asia.

Here’s what to know to plan your trip to Bird Paradise with kids including what’s new, and all the recent Bird Paradise 2025 ticket promotions (don’t miss up to 26% discounts on Bird Paradise tickets).

Read more: The Ultimate Guide To Kids’ Activities & Things To Do In Singapore

Bird Paradise Singapore Review & Guide For Families: 

Bird Paradise Backstage Pass: Penguin Encounter

From 7 June, you can book an exclusive behind-the-scenes experience to get up close with adorable penguins! With Backstage Pass: Penguin Encounters, you will meet the king, gentoo and northern rockhopper penguins and find out how the zookeepers care for these magnificent birds. We loved the exclusive guided tour of Ocean Network Express Penguin Cove and got a sneak peek into how the keepers prepare food for the penguins. We even got to snap pictures with the birds! More info here.

Mandai Wildlife West Entry to Bird Paradise

When you first arrive at Bird Paradise, you’ll get to Mandai Wildlife West, where there’s a waterfall feature and three free play areas for kids inspired by a native Singapore species. There’s no entry fee to pay – you can enjoy entry to these free playgrounds and access the F&B like Starbucks and Birds of Paradise ice cream cafe without entering Bird Paradise park.

Pangolin Hideout at Mandai Wildlife West outside Bird Paradise

This free outdoor playground is inspired by the burrows of a pangolin. Kids can mimic the movement patterns of pangolins like climbing up the large netted climbing structure, burrowing into the tunnels and sliding down the metal tube slide.

Pangolin Adventure at Mandai Wildlife West outside Bird Paradise

‘Pangolin Adventure’ is another free playground with swings and lower climbing structures.

Forest Stream Trail outside Bird Paradise

At the Forest Stream Trail, kids can learn about the riverine forest ecosystems as they climb onto logs and weave through the root-like structures inspired by mangrove forests. We love how parents can sit at the Starbucks next door and watch kids play in full sight!

Bird Paradise tickets

After walking through Mandai Wildlife West, you’ll get to the Bird Paradise ticket counter. You can buy tickets at the counter, or you can purchase them online before your visit.

Bird Paradise park tickets are as follows for general admission:

Adults: $49
Children: $34
Senior Citizens: $20

Take note that there are discounts for Singapore residents who are WildPass holders (read more below!), and there are promotions available as well.

Ticket promotions for Bird Paradise

It’s worth checking the Bird Paradise website ahead of your trip to see what promotions are on offer for tickets.

From now till 31 August 2025, local residents who are valid WildPass holders get up to 26% off when they purchase their Bird Paradise tickets online. T&Cs apply.

Bird Paradise map

To make the most out of your day at Bird Paradise park, we recommend checking out the map before you go so you can plan your route. You may want to do the majority of walking early and then end up at the cafes for lunch where there are playgrounds for kiddos. You should also take note of the bird shows and bird feeding times (more below).

Download this map of Bird Paradise to explore the bird park.

Highlights at Bird Paradise

Nine Walk-Through Aviaries at Bird Paradise

A highlight of Bird Paradise is the nine walk-through aviaries with different habitats of the world and several bird species. Stroll through the dense African rainforests and South American wetlands to Southeast Asian paddy fields, Australian dry eucalyptus forests, and more.

1. Bird Paradise: Hong Leong Foundation Crimson Wetlands aviary

This was our favourite aviary just for the burst of colour, plus that stunning massive waterfall is incredible! If you love colourful birds, this enclosure is where you’ll see some of the world’s most brilliantly coloured birds amongst wetland vegetation and crimson blooms – from Scarlet and Red-and-green Macaws to Scarlet Ibises, Roseate Spoonbills and American Flamingos.

There’s also a 20m-tall waterfall inspired by the San Juan Curi waterfall in Colombia, as a tribute to the much-loved Waterfall Aviary of Jurong Bird Park.

2. Bird Paradise: Nyungwe Forest Heart of Africa aviary

This is the largest aviary of Bird Paradise (1.55 hectares) with elevated canopies and suspension bridges overlooking forest streams. Here you’ll find 80 African bird species.

I loved catching sight of some of the African birds that I remembered from my childhood growing up in Kenya like grey parrots and Black-crowned Cranes. Watch out though – because at feeding time, the birds swoop down, and you may just get a White Superb Starling perching on your head!

3. Bird Paradise: Kuok Group Wings of Asia aviary

Huge Australian Pelicans, different types of beautiful Hornbills, Spoonbills, long-legged Storks and other birds of Asia can be found wading the rice paddy terraces – they also have the option of flying overhead in the large enclosure. The kids will love throwing the storks little fish, so make sure you look into the bird-feeding sessions (more below).

4. Bird Paradise: Amazonian Jewels aviary

This aviary is home to charming species like the Golden Parakeet, Andean Cock-of-the-Rock, Saffron Toucanet and Chestnut-eared Aracari plus doves and pigeons.

5. Bird Paradise: Songs of the Forest aviary

Singing songbirds of Asia live here – don’t miss the pretty Victoria Crowned Pigeon, plus other birds like the Bali Myna, Snow-white Bali mynahs and the Straw-headed Bulbul (and see if you can spot additional mammal species such as the Lesser Mousedeer).

6. Bird Paradise: Lory Loft aviary

Reminiscent of our favourite spot the Lory Loft at Jurong Bird Park (the old bird park in Singapore), this new aviary at Bird Paradise is filled with colourful cute lories and parrots. These little guys are not shy, so you can get up close and watch them water bathe and feed – get your camera ready! If you opt for feeding them with the special food cups, you may get a Lory perching on your wrist!

7. Bird Paradise: Mysterious Papua aviary
