item.title: When Should Your Child Be Bathing Independently?
item.dc:creator: Swetha Vigraham
item.description:
Bathtime is more than just hygiene. Parenting coach Swetha Vigraham explains when parents can let go of the reins and how it teaches important lessons in independence, body respect, and personal boundaries. When my son was born, I received three baby rockers as gifts from friends. Like many new parents, I learned the importance of […]

The post When Should Your Child Be Bathing Independently? appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Bathtime is more than just hygiene. Parenting coach Swetha Vigraham explains when parents can let go of the reins and how it teaches important lessons in independence, body respect, and personal boundaries.

When my son was born, I received three baby rockers as gifts from friends. Like many new parents, I learned the importance of better communication to avoid duplicates. But since I had three, I made the best of them: one as a dining chair, another as a naptime bed, and the last—most unusually—as a bathing buddy.
Yes, one of the rockers found its home next to the glass shower partition. My son, like many babies, had an uncanny ability to sense when I was showering. Even if he was napping, the sound of water would wake him, and he’d cry inconsolably until he could see me through the glass. This began our unique bathing adventures.

As my workload increased, so did my son’s hours in childcare. To compensate for missing playtime, I created two sacred routines: his bath time and bedtime. These moments became our special bonding rituals, filled with giggles, bubbles, and heartwarming questions.

Until one day, as he threw a curious question about my body, I realised it was time to respect both our privacies. It was time for him to start bathing independently.

Read more: How To Talk To Kids About Their Bodies & Inappropriate Touch

How do you know your child is ready?

Ability: Does your child have the physical coordination to stand steadily in the shower and handle the showerhead?
Capability: Can they understand bathroom safety? For example, mixing hot and cold water safely and avoiding water play near electrical appliances.
Curiosity: Are they asking questions about their bodies and showing signs of self-awareness?
Confidence: Are they expressing the desire to bathe themselves, perhaps starting with soaping or rinsing?

While I worried whether my son could clean his back properly or dry himself thoroughly, I knew I had to support this milestone while treasuring the memories we had built.

Why is bath time more than just hygiene?

For toddlers, bath time is about splashing and playing. For older children, it transforms into an important lesson in independence, body respect, and personal boundaries. These are crucial for their self-esteem and body positivity, especially as they approach puberty.

With my son, we took it step by step—starting with washing his legs and stomach, then moving to his face and tricky back. By age six, he was confidently managing his bath time, and I felt a mix of pride and bittersweet nostalgia.

Read more: Why You Shouldn’t Force Kids To Give Hugs

How can parents navigate this transition?

Take Small Steps: Introduce independent tasks early, like soaping their body (ages 3 to 5), washing their body but not hair (ages 6 to 8), and gradually building up to full independence by age 9-12.
Have Conversations: Respect their readiness. If they express interest, encourage them. If not, gently ask how they feel about starting.
Provide Support: Equip them with age-appropriate tools like anti-slip mats, light towels, and visual checklists to remind them of the steps.
Be Nearby: Stay close enough to assist if needed, especially during the early stages.

Cultural differences and individual preferences play a role in this transition. Remember to adapt based on your child’s personality and developmental pace.

Bathing is a milestone in the Parent-Child Journey.

I will always cherish the splashes and giggles of bath time. But as my son grows, our bonding moments have shifted. Now, we enjoy long walks, cosy reading sessions, or lazy afternoons at the pool.

Letting go of caregiving responsibilities can be bittersweet, but it’s also an act of love. So, the next time your child says, “I can do it myself,” take a deep breath and let them try. You’re not just teaching them independence; you’re strengthening your bond in new ways.

The post When Should Your Child Be Bathing Independently? appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Guide to Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG): Children’s Season 2025 & Into The Hawkerverse
item.dc:creator: Cherilyn
item.description:
Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) invites all kiddos under 12 for an interactive learning experience with Children’s Season 2025, plus a special exhibition that lets you explore our hawker culture with food trails, kids’ cooking workshops and more! Looking for a fun kids activity in Singapore? Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) is the first kids’ museum in […]

The post Guide to Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG): Children’s Season 2025 & Into The Hawkerverse appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) invites all kiddos under 12 for an interactive learning experience with Children’s Season 2025, plus a special exhibition that lets you explore our hawker culture with food trails, kids’ cooking workshops and more!

Looking for a fun kids activity in Singapore? Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) is the first kids’ museum in Singapore dedicated to children 12 years and below. Built on the vision of creating a place of wonder and joyful learning for children to learn about Singapore and the world, Children’s Museum Singapore believes in the power of play and provides opportunities for little ones to explore and engage with Singapore and the world around them.

If you’re looking for a creative way to teach your kids about Singapore’s history, Children’s Museum Singapore is the answer. With engaging exhibitions and safe spaces for kids to roam, explore, and play, there is no better way to get your kids excited about history. Young toddlers can explore the Play Pod–a fun area for free play–while older kids can travel back in time to learn why our forefathers came to Singapore. Aside from its ongoing exhibitions, Children’s Museum Singapore has exciting special exhibitions throughout the year, including Children’s Season 2025 (31 May to 29 June 2025), which returns with plenty of exciting activities.

   Read more: Kid-friendly Museums & Art Exhibitions in Singapore

Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) – here’s what’s in store:

Children’s Museum Singapore Children’s Season 2025

Children’s Museum Singapore Children’s Season is an annual programme offering a delightful blend of cultural and educational experiences designed to ignite curiosity in little ones about Singapore’s rich heritage. This year’s Children’s Season 2025 theme is ‘Belonging’, and you can expect an array of thoughtfully designed experiences for children at Children’s Museum Singapore and its Museum Roundtable partners, guaranteed to put your June holidays to good use.

Here’s a breakdown of what’s happening at CMSG’s Children’s Season 2025:

  • Children’s Season 2025 Stamp Booklet: Kids can collect stamp prints at each venue around CMSG and redeem fun prizes. From 31 May – 29 June.
  • Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey: A workshop with storytelling and hands-on play featuring Singapore’s food heritage. Kids get a take-home kit of heritage snacks! 7, 13 & 14 June; $25/person.
  • For a Better Future: Theatrical performance with lots of laughs and interaction that ignites the senses. Participants even get to take part in the show! 31 May & 1 June; $25/person.
  • Alien Vacation: A Cosmic Adventure: Another kids’ musical that’s all about friendship and belonging. Kids get to use and take home a mini toy camera as part of the show. 14, 20 & 21 June; $25/person.
  • Class from the Past!: This nostalgic experience will leave parents yearning for their younger days, and sharing them with their children! Kids get a set of kuti kuti, too. 31 May, 6 & 7 June; $25/person.
  • Char Kway Teow Rhapsody: A multi-sensory journey about the hawker trade that starts at Armenian Street. 31 May, 1, 6, 7, 8, 13 & 14 June; $35/person.
  • FREE workshops & self-guided activity: Time Travellers’ Guide (25 & 26 June); 3D Paper Lighthouse craft (4, 12 & 18 June); Painting with Gems (5, 11 & 19 June); Armenian Street Advnetures with Bloopy and Friends (31 May – 29 June).

When: Various dates between 31 May and 29 June 2025.
How much: Both free and ticketed programmes here. Free programmes require general admission tickets to Children’s Museum Singapore.

Into the Hawkerverse: Children’s Museum exhibition at Level 2


Children’s Museum Singapore is home to the fab Into The Hawkerverse, a special exhibition spotlighting Singapore’s iconic hawker culture and how it became Singapore’s first inscription to the UNESCO Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 2020. The exhibition was curated with insights from children and shed light on this uniquely Singaporean heritage, what goes into creating these delicious, award-winning dishes and more.

It takes over the museum’s second level, and kids will be engaged across three galleries, including Play Pot, a dedicated playspace for the little ones under four. Here, there’s a masak-masak playspace where kids with hawker food Mee Goreng and more. The Play Pot is a safe space for children aged 2 to 4 to run around, crawl through tunnels, pick play-pretend produce, and explore the delicious treats that nature has to offer. They can even run their own food cart and “cook” meals for you.

When: Now till 2026

A Voyage Back in Time: Level 1 at Children’s Museum Singapore

Little ones can embark on a time-travelling voyage with Captain and WonderBot to explore how Singapore came to be. Unlike most museums, kids are free to touch anything and everything within their reach. From picking up the fruits and vegetables to climbing into the barber’s chair, nothing is out of bounds.

The Hidden Chamber, an immersive show on a projector screen, is where Captain will open his secret stash of treasure and share stories about the origins of each object.

A highlight for kids will be the mini boat, crocodile (don’t feed him!) and the ship where kids can crouch down into the berths or tuck themselves into a hammock in the cabins! Along this time-travelling journey, the kids will get to experience sailing through stormy weather and eventually disembark at the port of Singapore to unleash their exploratory instincts at Ahoy Singapore!

As you wander through the streets of old in Singapore at The Marketplace, your kids will get to explore the bustling shophouses, handle shop products, pump old-fashioned water pumps, learn about different spices, listen to stories of shopkeepers, and try heritage trades like acting as a street barber or traditional letter writer.

Little ones will be captivated by the colourful sights and busy sounds of the old Singapore streets.

The path will eventually lead you to the present day, where the kids can design their own stamps in the neighbourhood post office. They can even write a letter and deliver their message across the room through a message tunnel – watch their little faces light up with excitement as the message capsule zips through the tunnel!

When: Now till 2027

Events at the Children’s Museum Singapore


Children’s Museum Singapore constantly has a lineup of educational and engaging workshops for families like arts & craft activities, roving performances, and more. Be sure to check their website for an updated list of upcoming events that you can attend with your kids.

How to get to the Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG)

By train: The Children’s Museum Singapore is an 8-minute walk from City Hall MRT Station.
By bus: Alight at any of these bus stops – Old Hill Street Police Station, Grand Park City Hall, Armenian Church, or After City Hall Station Exit B.
By car: Park at the Registry of Marriages (ROM), Peranakan Museum, Grand Park City Hall, Capitol Piazza, Peninsula Excelsior Hotel or Funan Mall.

Where to eat near the Children’s Museum Singapore

To protect the exhibits and keep the museum clean, food and drinks (except water) are not allowed in the Children’s Museum Singapore. However, Children’s Museum Singapore is only a 5-minute walk from shopping malls like Funan Mall, Peninsula Shopping Centre, and Capitol Singapore, where you will find a variety of delicious options for hungry little tummies.

How much are tickets to Children’s Museum Singapore?

Tickets for the Children’s Museum Singapore are FREE for Singaporeans and PRs (pink and blue NRIC only).

Admission fees apply for tourists and all other foreign residents (other coloured NRIC cards): $10.90 per child and $16.35 per adult.

Walk-ins are not recommended so, book your tickets to Children’s Museum Singapore online in advance to secure your spot! As the Children’s Museum Singapore is a children’s museum you may only enter as an adult if you come with a child.

Book tickets here!

Read more: 101 Family-Friendly Activities in Singapore 

Parent tips for visiting CMSG:

  • Visits to the Children’s Museum Singapore are limited timeslots: 9am; 11am; 2pm; 4pm entry timings only.
  • Bring water bottles. Water coolers are available at Level 1 for refills.
  • There is one nursing room available on Level 1.

Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG): All the Deets:
When: Tuesday – Sunday (closed on Monday), closed daily 12:45 – 2pm for cleaning. 
How much: Free for all Singaporeans and PRs; $10.90/child and $16.35/adult for Standard Rates – get tickets here.
Where: Children’s Museum Singapore, 23-B Coleman Street, Singapore 179807, www.nhb.gov.sg/childrensmuseum

Want other SG spots where kids can learn and play? Keep scrolling for a few awesome ideas!

The post Guide to Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG): Children’s Season 2025 & Into The Hawkerverse appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Go For English Tuition In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for English enrichment or an English tuition centre for your child? We round up where to find the best English tuition in Singapore for improved phonics and creative writing for preschool, primary and secondary students. If your child is struggling with English in school whether they are in preschool, primary or secondary school, signing […]

The post Where To Go For English Tuition In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for English enrichment or an English tuition centre for your child? We round up where to find the best English tuition in Singapore for improved phonics and creative writing for preschool, primary and secondary students.

If your child is struggling with English in school whether they are in preschool, primary or secondary school, signing them up at an English enrichment or tuition centre could help them master difficulties and boost their confidence! With plenty of English tuition centres in Singapore, seemingly in every shopping mall (alongside coding and music classes), we’ve done the heavy lifting to round up some fab English tuition centres for kids of all ages. Most enrichment curricula encompass literacy (phonics and reading) as well as writing skills but some go further and help with communication skills and public speaking!

Here are some tips on how to choose a tutor for your child plus it’s always good practice to check if the English tuition centre is MOE-registered or operated by MOE Teachers so you can be sure they are best qualified for the subject. We round up some suggestions for English enrichment, creative writing classes, phonics lessons and even online tuition. When considering an English tuition centre in Singapore, ensure the location works for you and ask to do a trial tuition session before purchasing any long-term tuition programs so you and your child can check that the English tutor is a good fit.

Scroll through our list below to find the best English tuition centre that suits your child’s needs

      Read More: Top Ranking Tuition Centres in Singapore

English Enrichment & English Tuition In Singapore:

Lil’ but Mighty: Personalised English tuition up to Secondary 4

At Lil’ but Mighty, children from Primary 1-6 and Secondary 1-4 embark on a journey to master English through dynamic and comprehensive lessons. Their innovative approach centres on the Learn, Share, Replay strategy and adopts a step-by-step teaching method, ensuring students are well-prepared for academic success. Their teachers continually undergo stringent training to re-align with the MOE syllabus. They are proud of their proven track record of many students who have made significant progress and achievements in national exams. This English tuition centre in Singapore features interactive elements such as the Star Junior Teacher Mirror, Fry-Yay Wall, and Neon Lights, creating a vibrant and positive learning environment.

With class sizes capped at six students, each child will receive individualised attention, fostering better learning outcomes. Lil’ but Mighty’s Junior Teacher Segment, a structured peer teaching process, not only allows students to apply their knowledge but also cultivates presentation skills, confidence, resilience, empathy, and a growth mindset. Students also have access to a variety of resources, including workshops, self-paced online courses, Lil’ but Mighty’s YouTube channel, and blog, enhancing their learning experience. It’s no wonder that they receive raving reviews from parents and students who have graduated from their English tuition programmes.

Use promo code Lil Sass to enjoy a Free Trial Class at Lil’ but Mighty. This can only be used for first-time enrolment and is not stackable with other ongoing discounts or promotions. 

 Lil’ but Mighty, multiple locations in Singapore: Clementi, Bukit Timah, Hougang, Goldhill Plaza, Marine Parade Central and Tampines, Tel: (+65) 9646 0930, www.lilbutmightyenglish.com

Read more: All Things Enrichment & Tuition for Kids 

WRITERS AT WORK: Specialises in exam-smart and proven strategies

WRITERS AT WORK is an English tuition centre in Singapore that empowers students to think critically and communicate clearly. They offer a comprehensive English programme for students from Primary 1 to Secondary 4. Aligned with the MOE syllabus, this English programme equips students to master the English language for academic success, while nurturing their confidence and love for English. Their unique in-house STORYBANKING® Method teaches students to build a personal bank of story ideas drawn from real-world inspiration, so they can write stand-out stories in school, national examinations and beyond.

The English teachers undergo intensive W@W-specific training to ensure consistency and high quality across all levels, and you can rest assured that WRITERS AT WORK only hires passionate English educators who are aligned with their teaching philosophy. A testament to their methods, 2 out of 3 W@W PSLE graduates score AL1–AL2, and 90% of W@W secondary students improve by 3 grades after joining our programme. Many have received international recognition through competitions including The Queen’s Commonwealth Essay Competition and UNSW Global ICAS English Competition.

WRITERS AT WORK, eight locations in Singapore including Clementi, Bukit Timah, Ang Mo Kio, Marine Parade, Tampines, Hougang, Tiong Bahru and Bishan, Tel: (+65) 6774 2618, www.writersatwork.com.sg

The Learning Lab: English tuition from Nursery 2 to Junior College

At The Learning Lab, 2 in 3 students scored AL1 or AL2 for English in the 2024 PSLE. With over 20 years of experience and nine centres across Singapore, The Learning Lab is the only English tuition centre in Singapore offering English programmes from Nursery 2 to Junior College 2. Their proprietary curriculum is developed by over 40 in-house specialists and is aligned with the MOE syllabus. Their proven teaching approach combines academic rigour with real-world relevance, covering everything from grammar and comprehension to current affairs and global events that build critical thinking and communication skills.

Real-world events such as Polling Day or the wildfires in L.A. are integrated into lessons, cultivating a global perspective in young learners to show them that what they’re learning matters. From preparing for Primary 1 to navigating the PSLE and A-Levels, students are equipped with retrieval practice tools, error analysis handouts and other strategies to strengthen exam performance. Teachers are English subject specialists, carefully selected and trained to deliver engaging lessons tailored to each child’s pace and learning needs. Parents stay informed through frequent progress reports, while students have unlimited access to lesson materials, quizzes and worksheets via the TLL.360 online platform, plus new reads through the curated SORA e-Library.

Be one of the first 50 parents to sign your child up to enjoy a complimentary trial class for a new subject. This promotion ends on 30 June 2025.

The Learning Lab, multiple locations in Singapore, including United Square, Marine Parade Central, Rochester Mall and The Woodleigh Mall, Tel: (+65) 6957 9688, www.thelearninglab.com.sg

Academia: English tuition elevated through rigour, refinement and results

Founded in 2013 by a Princeton graduate and a top local student, Academia is a popular English and GP centre in Singapore with a learner-oriented pedagogy that makes learning enjoyable and effective. Their experienced English tutors are on a mission to make learning intuitive so that each student can achieve their academic goals. Thanks to their practical, evidence-based education and learner-centric approach, Academia has consistently seen more than 50% of its students achieve an AL1 in PSLE English since the current system was introduced.

Aligned with the MOE syllabus, their English Term Class programmes sharpen thinking, enhance vocabulary, refine writing strategies and deepen the students’ understanding of literary texts. Guided by an elite team of educators, including Ivy League and Oxbridge alumni and top scorers from Singapore’s most competitive schools, every lesson is an immersive intellectual experience that is challenging yet inspiring. Students benefit from small class sizes, which allow for personalised feedback, meaningful discussions and steady academic growth. Beyond academic outcomes, they nurture discerning, articulate thinkers, preparing students not just for the next exam, but for the complex world ahead.

This June Holidays, quote SASSYPACKAGE when registering with their Front Desk to enjoy an exclusive trial of their signature term classes with their Sassy Mama Experience Package. Your child can enjoy four classes for the price of two! This perk is valid until the end of June 2025.

Academia, 6 Sin Ming Road, #01-15, Singapore 575585, www.academia.com.sg

British Council Singapore: English enrichment courses for kids

The English tuition programmes at the British Council are designed to build your child’s confidence in English speaking and writing skills. Specially curated for students as young as three years old to 17-year-olds, British Council offers a comprehensive range of English courses for every level. Young learners can join their engaging English Enrichment courses to get a head start in English and discover the joy of learning English. They can also join English camps during the school holidays for a learning boost!

The British Council’s English enrichment courses are aligned with the MOE syllabus, so your child can step into their classroom with confidence. Whether you want your child to learn in a small group with friends or prefer 1-on-1 English tuition, the British Council is ready to support your child’s English learning journey. Your child can take English tuition at Napier Road or Toa Payoh, online or at a location of your choice. Book a consultation to find out how the British Council’s English tuition courses can help your child thrive!

British Council in Singapore, 30 Napier Road, Singapore & 480 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh, #09-01 HDB Hub, East Wing, Tel: (+65) 6807 1599, www.britishcouncil.sg

The Eton Academy by EtonHouse: Personalised English tuition

The experienced English tutors at The Eton Academy by EtonHouse help students become confident communicators and curious learners. Backed by the trusted EtonHouse International Education Group, their MOE-aligned English programmes support children from Nursery 1 to Primary 6 across five convenient locations in Singapore. Through a literature-based approach, students build strong reading comprehension, expressive writing, and vocabulary skills, all while learning grammar, character development, and storytelling in a fun and meaningful way.

Younger learners learn phonics through songs, rhymes, and multi-sensory experiences to build early reading fluency, while older students gain confidence in public speaking, debate, and persuasive writing. This English tuition centre keeps parents in the loop with regular feedback and personalised feedback. Beyond academics, their English tutors help students build confidence, practice critical thinking and nurture a growth mindset, essential skills for life.

 The Eton Academy by EtonHouse, Canberra Plaza, Great World, 223 @ Mountbatten, Sengkang Grand Mall, The Woodleigh Mall, WhatsApp: (+65) 6994 3002, enquiry@theetonacademy.com.sg, www.theetonacademy.com.sg

Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall

The Alternative Story: O-level English tuition & PSLE prep

The teachers at this English tuition centre in Singapore adopt new teaching methodologies while still being in line with the PSLE syllabus to encourage curiosity in their students in order to develop a love for learning English. This will ultimately allow good composition skills to flourish in a supportive environment. They also offer O-level English tuition so the students can feel confident about taking the O levels!

The Alternative Story, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Upper Bukit Timah, Marine Parade, Tel: (+65) 6914 6601. www.thealternativestory.com

Artistic Strategies Academy: Weekly English writing courses

Artistic Strategies Academy hosts weekly English writing classes, private coaching, holiday programmes and even online English tuition for creative writing. Parents are kept up to date on their child’s progress at the end of each lesson, and there’s a real personal approach to each child’s learning. Some students have even published their creative writing efforts. Click here to read more!

Artistic Strategies Academy, 21 Bedok North Street 1, Common Ground, Singapore 469659, Tel: (+65) 9234 7568, www.facebook.com/artisticstrategiesacademy

Cambly: Online English tutors

Want your child to learn English from the comfort of your home? Cambly offers 1-on-1 online English tuition for kids aged 4 to 15 years old. Their team of certified native English speaking teachers from around the world adopt a conversation-based approach to help kids gain confidence in speaking, listening, and reading. Plus, kids can enjoy individualised instruction and get the support they need through their 1-on-1 English lessons.

Cambly, www.cambly.com

English Explorer: English tuition for kids

English Explorer offers English tuition for kids using a syllabus that is accredited by the University of Oxford. The English tutors understand that every child is different and has a unique learning style, so each English lesson is personalised to the needs of each student. Their English enrichment courses are designed to spark creativity and imagination, encouraging students to learn how to effectively communicate their ideas and collaborate with others.

English Explorer, 10 Anson Road #22-07B, International Plaza, Singapore 079903, Tel: (+65) 9028 7560, www.englishexplorer.com.sg

English Ninjas Enrichment and Tuition Centre: English composition courses

Teachers at English Ninjas give each student the opportunity to think critically, ask questions and bounce ideas off their peers. Rather than providing model compositions that take away students’ confidence and opportunities for learning, students get a chance to exercise their imagination to create their own engaging storylines. Also, every English class is deliberately kept small so that the teacher can provide individualised attention and feedback.

English Ninjas, 1 Fifth Avenue, #03-08 Guthrie House, Singapore 268802, Tel: (+65) 8428 0026, www.englishninjas.sg

My English School: English literacy classes

My English School is a popular English tuition centre in Singapore that nurtures the joy of learning in little ones. Their in-house reading programmes help students master phonics so they can read independently before Primary 1. Primary School students can build a strong foundation in core English skills with their MOE-aligned Primary Programme. We love that English classes as My English School are small, ensuring that each student receives the personalised attention they need.

My English School, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Tiong Bahru, and Novena, Tel: (+65) 6567 2374, www.myenglish.com.sg

Golden Compass School

The English tuition classes at Golden Compass School help students prepare academically by improving their understanding of concepts, techniques and knowledge on how to ace the English language! The highly qualified academic board and English tutors at this language school in Singapore were formerly school principals of Mee Toh School, St. Nicholas Girls School, Dunman Secondary School, Woodgrove Primary School, so you know your kiddos will be in good hands.

Golden Compass School, 20A Temple Street, Singapore 058565, Tel: (+65) 6220 6228, www.goldencompass.edu.sg

 Read more: Affordable International Schools in Singapore

illum.e: Interactive English tuition lessons

illum.e is a MOE-registered English tuition centre in Singapore that boasts award-winning teachers and impressive academic results across all levels. English lessons here are engaging, interactive, and designed to spark inspiration and foster student engagement. Students have access to both on-site and online lessons. In addition to English tuition, the centre offers IP Language Arts and Humanities Tuition for Primary and Secondary School students.

illum.e, four locations in Singapore including Jurong, Novena, Bukit Timah and Parkway, Tel: (+65) 8889 8705 (WhatsApp); www.illum.education

Jan & Elly: Low teacher-to-student ratio

Jan & Elly is an English tuition centre in Singapore with more than 20 years of experience. The English tutors here make reading fun and easy, while incorporating age-appropriate activities like singing and arts & crafts into their comprehensive curriculum. All of the English tutors are English-speaking degree holders, and the low 1:10 teacher-to-student ratio ensures that your child will get all the help they need!

Jan & Elly, three locations in Singapore including Seletar Road, Upper Bukit Timah Road and Bidadari Park Drive, Tel: (+65) 6481 8892, www.jan-elly.com

Julia Gabriel: Unique English tuition programme for kids

With a renowned “Readers & Writers” programme, along with Speech & Drama courses that kiddos find tons of fun, Julia Gabriel is an English tuition centre in Singapore that’s all about bringing the exceptional student out in every child and helping them find their voice (sometimes literally!). They even offer English tuition for early learners and teens.

Julia Gabriel, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Tampines, Greenwich V, Tel: (+65) 6733 4322, www.juliagabriel.com

Kumon: Well-known English tuition centre

Kumon is a well-established name in the local tuition scene, having enrolled over 4 million students since its inception. Kumon offers English tuition for preschool, primary, and secondary school students, aiming to improve English skills holistically. Their classes cover literacy, communication, reading, writing, and more. Additionally, Kumon focuses on teaching time management and helping students understand and comprehend exam questions better.

Kumon, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Bishan and Bukit Panjang, Tel: (+65) 6733 4322, www.sg.kumonglobal.com

LCentral: English tuition centre for reading comprehension & phonics

LCentral’s reading programme offers a comprehensive approach that not only teaches reading but does so in a way that ensures children enjoy learning and are equipped for future academic success. LCentral ensures that foundational skills are mastered such as phonemic awareness (recognising sounds), phonics (linking letters and sounds), decoding (reading words), and reading comprehension.

LCentral, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Bukit Timah, Punggol, Tampines, Jurong East, Tel: (+65) 6570 3775 (Buona Vista Outlet), (+65) 8260 9097 (WhatsApp), www.lcentral.net

 Read more: Best Language Schools in Singapore

Learning Point: English tuition for kids aged 5 & up

Learning Point has been a trusted centre for English tuition in Singapore for more than 30 years, offering top-notch English programmes with comprehensive curricula for students aged five to 16. Experienced educators use the Read for Success programme to methodically teach phonics from basic to complex sounds, incorporating high-frequency words so your little one will be reading books on their own in no time!

Learning Point, multiple locations in Singapore including Thomson Plaza, Bukit Timah Plaza, Century Square, Oasis Terraces and Marine Parade, WhatsApp: (+65) 8547 8865, www.learningpoint.com.sg

Read more: Best Educational Games & Apps For Kids

Lorna Whiston: English enrichment programmes

Lorna Whiston is a school that has built a reputation over the past 40 years with teaching excellence and high-quality education, including English tuition classes. Their English Enrichment class helps students master the English language and become confident communicators and critical thinkers.

Lorna Whiston, 101 Thomson Rd, #03-18, Singapore 307591
Phone: 8223 6316, Tel: (+65) 8223 6316, www.lornawhiston.com

Master Class Learning Centre: English & General Paper specialists

Master Class is a well-trusted English tuition centre in Singapore along East Coast Road. They offer English tuition classes for Primary 4 to 6 and Secondary 1 to 4 English and Junior College General Paper in a conducive and supportive learning environment. The English tutors have over 50 years of accumulated teaching experience and are eager to help their students master the English language.

Master Class Learning Centre, 79 East Coast Road, #02-01, Singapore 428784, Tel: (+65) 6344 4991, www.mclass.com.sg

Wonderlit: English enrichment classes for kids aged 2.5 & up

Wonderlit offers English tuition for children aged 2.5 years and up. Their English tuition lessons help develop literacy and communication skills through self-discovery and self-expression. Children aged 2.5 to 16+ can look forward to phonics & reading, creative writing, public speaking, and speech & drama programmes that meet internationally recognised certifications, as well as fulfilling the demands of syllabuses in Singapore schools.

Wonderlit, 442 Orchard Road, #03-08 to #03-12, Claymore Connect, Singapore 238879, Tel: (+65) 6980 5670, www.wonderlitworld.com 

The Write Connection: MOE-registered English tuition centre

The Write Connection is a popular English tuition centre in Singapore that provides English enrichment courses to help kids in primary school improve their critical reading, writing, and reading skills. Their passionate English tutors even offer short holiday courses for an extra learning boost during the summer.

The Write Connection, multiple locations in Singapore, including Woodlands, Ang Mo Kio and Bukit Timah, Tel: (+65) 6011 8405, www.thewriteconnection.com.sg

The Writer’s Place: English enrichment centre for creative writing

A specialist enrichment and English tuition centre in Singapore that’s focused on creative writing, their teaching methodologies adhere to the latest MOE syllabus and are proven to help children learn effectively. With ‘fun’ being one of their core methods, students always look forward to their English tuition classes and quickly develop a love for creating writing and reading.

The Writer’s Place, Galaxy Community Club and Junction 10 Mall,  www.thewritersplace.com.sg

Read more: Fab Venues For A Kids’ Birthday Party

Scroll through our list to find other educational activities and lessons for your little one!

The post Where To Go For English Tuition In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 22 Fun Things To Do With Teenagers In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for fun activities for teenagers in Singapore? From thrill-seeking activities to more chilled hang out spots, here are some ideas on things to do with teenagers in Singapore! One of the things we love about living in Singapore is how safe it is compared to other places meaning kids can often commute solo from […]

The post 22 Fun Things To Do With Teenagers In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for fun activities for teenagers in Singapore? From thrill-seeking activities to more chilled hang out spots, here are some ideas on things to do with teenagers in Singapore!

One of the things we love about living in Singapore is how safe it is compared to other places meaning kids can often commute solo from a younger age than in other countries. With teenagers, we can afford them more freedom with independent outings than we would if we were living somewhere else. And in Singapore, there are plenty of activities for teenagers. From checking out water parks, go-karting and outdoor parks to hanging out at the best cafes selling amazing ice cream and gelatos. If you’re looking for some inspiration to keep your teens busy in Singapore, here’s our list of fun teen activities – whether your teen chooses to go on these adventures with you or with their friends! Obviously, you can’t be the one to suggest these ideas to your teens – that’d be way uncool. But hey, a subtle hint never hurt anyone. Maybe casually mention a weekend hangout? You know, just in case they’re suddenly interested in exploring fun things to do in Singapore during the weekend!

            Read more: Best Water Parks and Play Areas in Singapore

Best activities for teenagers in Singapore:

1. Make a splash at teen-approved water parks

If you’re new here, you should know that water parks are a favourite with the Sassy Mama team. They’re perfect activities for all ages (yes, even parents!) and they’re the best places to be to escape Singapore’s tropical heat. Wild Wild Wet at Downtown East is a longtime favourite, with rides that range from easy-going to seriously thrilling. It’s compact enough that you won’t lose sight of your tweens, but still packed with enough splashy action to keep your teens buzzing. Got a daredevil? Point them straight to the Torpedo – they’ll thank you for the adrenaline rush.

Adventure Cove Waterpark is another great water park in Sentosa and a trip here can easily fill a whole day. Thrillseekers will love the Riptide Rocket or for something calmer visit the Rainbow Reef or the Adventure River. Splashworks is where to head for various challenges including climbing ropes, balancing beams and more!

Wild Wild Wet, 1 Pasir Ris Close, Singapore 519599, www.wildwildwet.com

Adventure Cove Waterpark, 8 Sentosa Gateway, Sentosa Island, Singapore 098269, www.rwsentosa.com

Read more: Things To Do In Sentosa With Kids: Attractions, Activities, Restaurants & More

2. Go on a nature walk at Singapore’s parks

If you’re up for some fresh air and quality time, exploring Singapore’s beautiful parks is a great way to reconnect with your teen. Whether you’re cycling through scenic trails, taking on a treetop walk, or ziplining through lush greenery, there’s something for every kind of adventure level. You’ll also find wide-open spaces perfect for kite-flying, kicking a ball around, or just chilling on a picnic mat!

3. Try an escape room challenge with your teens

Want something to get those teenagers thinking and brainstorming together? Why not try out these escape rooms where teens can uncover clues and solve riddles together? Designed with a theme in mind, escape room games are incredibly immersive with detailed storylines that make you feel like you’re a movie character. But these games aren’t just pure fun. In fact, teens will have to pool together critical thinking skills to pick out clues that will help them progress forward and find the exit! Consult our list of escape rooms in Singapore to get started.

4. Try out winter sports at Trifecta

Yup, you read that right! Teens can master winter sports right here in sunny Singapore! Whether they’re a beginner or a pro, Trifecta is designed for thrill-seekers. There’s a dry slope to practice skiing or snowboarding, or teens can have a go learning to surf in the wave pool. It’s the ultimate hangout, with a skateboard area as well as a cafe on site. Read more about our writer’s fun-filled experience at Trifecta here.

Trifecta by The Ride Side, 10A Exeter Road, beside Somerset Skate Park & Somerset MRT, Singapore 239958, www.trifectasingapore.com

5. Burn off their energy at SuperPark

SuperPark is fun for all ages, but it’s especially a hit with older kids and young teens who are always up for some heart-pumping action. The newly revamped space now boasts 34 exciting activities, including 13 brand-new games! Whether they’re showing off tricks in the Freestyle Hall, burning off energy in the Adventure Area, or going head-to-head in the Games Arena, there’s no shortage of fun for your kids to stay active and entertained.

SuperPark Singapore, 3 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec City Mall, #02-477 (North Wing), Singapore 038983, www.superpark.com.sg

6. Challenge the kids to a splashing good obstacle course at HydroDash

HydroDash Singapore in Sentosa reopened in February and now features over 30 adrenaline-pumping obstacles, including 12 brand-new ones! Teens can challenge themselves and scale the towering Action Tower XXL or leap off the Springboard into the waves. Or if their dream is to be launched sky-high, Flip lets their friends (or parents!) do the honours (cue: the big splash). Read all about HydroDash Singapore here.

HydroDash, 54 Palawan Beach Walk, Singapore 098233, www.hydrodash.com.sg

7. Let your teen channel their inner racer at go-karting

Too young to drive for real? Teens can try out go-karting instead! Older kids can experience the thrill of manoeuvring high-speed karts around twisty tracks. Check out our top go-karting picks in Singapore for an adrenaline-fueled racing experience! There’s even an indoor go-kart experience in Sentosa for when it is too hot or raining.

8. Hop on thrilling rides at Universal Studios Singapore

Located on Sentosa, Universal Studios Singapore is definitely worth a trip. The Revenge of the Mummy Ride as well as the Battlestar Galactica ride are firm favourites. The Transformers Ride and Shrek 4D are also popular and are sure to get your heart pumping without all the twists and turns. Be sure to also check out the adorable new Minion Land while you’re there!

Universal Studios, 8 Sentosa Gateway, Singapore 098269, www.rwsentosa.com

9. Conquer heights at Forest Adventure

Forest Adventure’s Grand Course has 50 obstacles including trapezes, bridges and the not-to-be-underestimated “leap of faith” plus four scream-inducing zip lines that will have your teenagers flying over the Bedok Reservoir!

Forest Adventure, Bedok Reservoir Park, Singapore 479244, www.forestadventure.com.sg

10. ‘Fly’ safely at iFly

Teens can defy gravity at iFly on the Sentosa Beachfront. This indoor skydiving experience lets kids experience the simulated skydive in a flight chamber. Definitely not for the sensitive, as it gets loud and windy in there! Perfect for thrill-seeking teens.

iFly, 43 Siloso Beach Walk #01-01, Singapore 099010, www.sentosa.com.sg

11. Cuddle with adorable felines at a cat cafe

Let’s be real–visiting a cat cafe in Singapore is a fool-proof activity for all ages. Whether or not you’re a cat lover, these cosy spots offer the perfect mix of relaxation, cuteness overload, and stress relief. Teens will love spending time with the friendly felines, snapping adorable photos, and sipping on a drink (or enjoying a treat). After all, there’s nothing like bonding over purring kitties.

12. Go wakeboarding or wakesurfing

There are two ways to do this. For cable skiing and wakeboarding, head to Singapore Wake Park. Kids can start off in the training area at East Coast Park lagoon where they will get pulled along by a suspended motorised cable. If the teens prefer more of a challenge, check out these wakeboarding or wake surfing operators who will happily tow them from their speedboat.

13. Visit Mega Adventure Park

Not enough of a challenge? Then check out Mega Adventure Park, home to the Megazip–the 75-metre high, 450-metre long, 50 km/ph flying fox that will give teens the flight of their life!

Mega Adventure Park, 10A Siloso Beach Walk, Singapore 099008, www.sentosa.com.sg

14. Go rock-climbing

If your teens are keen for some more action, then get them climbing at an indoor rock climbing spot or the sky-high obstacle course and rock climbing centre at Adventure HQ Khatib, or try these rock climbing options in Singapore.

15. Unleash their creativity with an art jamming sesh

If you are looking for a calmer activity for your teenager, try art jamming! There are plenty of studios around Singapore offering relaxed, no-pressure art jamming sessions which are perfect for unwinding and getting creative. Want to switch things up? Try a neon art jamming experience for an extra glow-up on those creative vibes!

Read more: Where To Find Art Classes For Kids In Singapore

16. Conquer obstacle courses at Adventure HQ

Adventure HQ at Khatib is home to many first-of-its-kind indoor adventure courses geared for tweens and teens. Slide down Singapore’s longest indoor slide, which is 4.5 stories high or attempt the two-tiered, 16-obstacle indoor challenge rope course. Teens can also try out the 15m Cloud Climb, indoor artificial caving and Singapore’s first ever indoor Roll Glider which is 233m long. Find all the deets here!

Adventure HQ HometeamNS Khatib,2 Yishun Walk, Singapore 767944, www.hometeamns.sg

Read more: Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages

17. Battle it out with the kids in a game of laser tag

Enter the thrilling realm of laser tag, where teenagers transform into fearless warriors amidst neon-lit battlegrounds! Imagine heart-pounding, glow-in-the-dark battles where strategy meets teamwork. Check out these best laser tag places in Singapore!

18. Get crafty with a tufting session

Tufting is the art of creating your own customised rug using a tufting gun, and yes, it’s as satisfying as it sounds! Perfect for teens who love to craft or express themselves through design, tufting workshops in Singapore let them turn their ideas into fluffy works of art in just a few hours. Who knows, you might just walk away with a new rug and a new shared hobby!

19. Go on an ice cream adventure

Desserts are always a great idea, especially when it comes to ice cream! If your teen has a sweet tooth, turn it into a bonding adventure and discover some of the best ice cream spots in Singapore. Whether it’s artisanal gelato, fluffy waffles with ice cream, or even local-inspired creations (think ondeh ondeh or teh tarik flavours!), there’s something for every kind of dessert lover.

20. Score vintage finds at a local flea market 

Flea markets are a goldmine for quirky finds, vintage gems, and affordable fashion, which is pretty much everything a teenager loves! Whether they’re hunting for Y2K accessories, retro tees, or handmade trinkets, there’s always something unexpected to uncover. Check out our list of the best flea markets in Singapore here.

21. Get bouncing at a trampoline park

Trampolining is a perfect way to get your teens moving and burn off some energy! With the different fun trampoline spots around Singapore, your teen can leap into a range of activities from free jumping to dodgeball games.

22. Check out a new shopping mall

Shopping malls in Singapore have long been the hang-out spots for too-cool-for-school teens. There’s lots of food available to fuel up on too! One of our favourites is Far East Plaza, which is great for pocket-friendly prices and the number of fashion blog boutiques’ that offer the latest fads. There are also plenty of exciting new malls to check out from Punggol Coast Mall to the revamped Cathay at Dhoby Ghaut, Geneo @ Singapore Science Park and more!

Read more:

The post 22 Fun Things To Do With Teenagers In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 2025 Guide To Awesome Birthday Treats & Birthday Deals In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Elevate your birthday celebration with these fab 2025 birthday deals in Singapore, from complimentary cake and dining discounts to free entry to Wild Wild Wet, free rock climbing and more! Birthdays are the best time to go all out and treat yourself. After all, you deserve more than just a great birthday cake and lavish […]

The post 2025 Guide To Awesome Birthday Treats & Birthday Deals In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Elevate your birthday celebration with these fab 2025 birthday deals in Singapore, from complimentary cake and dining discounts to free entry to Wild Wild Wet, free rock climbing and more!

Birthdays are the best time to go all out and treat yourself. After all, you deserve more than just a great birthday cake and lavish dinners. That’s why you should check out our list of birthday deals and freebies in Singapore to score free coffee and birthday cake, spa dates for two and other fun birthday treats. Some of the freebies we’ve got on our list require memberships or minimum spends, but plenty of these fun offers during your birthday month are free to enjoy.

If you can’t resist a good deal, stay tuned to our list of deals and promos in Singapore which include Sassy Mama exclusives. Plus, we’ve got a list of ‘kids eat free’ deals and lunch deals. Keep scrolling for the best birthday deals in Singapore!

             Read more: Best Birthday Party Venues In Singapore

Jump to:
– F&B Birthday Deals in Singapore
– Fashion, Beauty & Homewares Birthday Deals in Singapore
– Travel & Leisure Birthday Deals in Singapore
– Kids, Pets & Groceries Birthday Deals in Singapore
– Banks, Credit Cards & Mobile Companies Birthday Deals in Singapore

Food & Beverage Birthday Deals in Singapore

1. Auntie Anne’s: 1-for-1 pretzels

Whether it’s a birthday or not, it’s always a good time to get a pretzel at Auntie Anne’s! For birthday celebrants, Auntie Anne’s offers its Blue Tier members a 1-for-1 on pretzels, while Gold Tier Members are entitled to a free pretzel of your choice.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

2. Beauty in The Pot: Free slice of cake

Popular hot pot chain Beauty in a Pot will gift you a free slice of cake to every diner celebrating their birthday at its restaurants, just be sure to inform the servers! Popular flavours include rainbow cake and fruit cake.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

3. The Boiler Seafood Bar & Beer: Free Boston lobster

Diners at this restaurant celebrating their birthday can enjoy 1 free Boston Lobster with purchase of Boiler’s Bombdiggity Bag! Best part, multiple birthday celebrants for the same table can enjoy the same offer, although it’s limited to one redemption per birthday celebrant.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

Read more: Great Singapore Deals & Promos On F&B, Activities, Shopping & More

4. Boost Juice Bars: Free birthday Boost smoothie

Sign up for a Vibe card (it’s free!) and in addition to earning points to put toward free smoothies throughout the year, you’ll also get a free “Birthday Boost” on your actual birthday (or two days before/up to two days after).

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

5. Cajun on Wheels: Free lobster

When you buy the Olympian Bucket on your birthday month – it’s good for a party of 5 to 6 people, and is filled with Sri Lankan crabs, prawns, white clams, mussels, and baby potatoes  – you’ll get a succulent lobster for free! You’ll need to book a table in advance at this restaurant and indicate “Birthday Lobster” in the booking comments. This birthday deal is only available at the Plaza Singapura outlet.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

Read more: Where To Find Party Planners & Party Entertainers In SG

6. Cedele Singapore: Free cake, dining discounts and more

Cedele Rewards members are entitled to some fun birthday deals in Singapore! Tuck into a complimentary slice of cake, enjoy a 15% discount when you dine in at any point during your birthday month, and 15% off online vouchers with a minimum spend of $80!

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

7. COCA Steamboat: Free steamboat buffet on your birthday

Do you love steamboat? We think it makes for the perfect birthday dinner. Sign up for a free COCA membership and you can dine for free at this restaurant on your birthday with 3 paying guests. Kids dine free with every two paying adults, too!

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

Read more: ‘Kids Eat Free’ Deals In Singapore

8. Coffee Bean: Tasty birthday freebies

If you love Coffee Bean, signing up for a Coffee Bean Rewards account will give you tons of exclusive benefits and birthday freebies– including a tasty birthday treat! Simply download the app and collect points as you purchase your items at Coffee Bean to unlock the exclusive perks.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

9. Collin’s: 20% off e-Voucher

Upgrade your membership at Collin’s to enjoy their brand new birthday deals – all silver and gold Collin’s members will qualify to receive one 20% off e-Voucher during their birthday month.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

10. Famous Amos: Free 100g of cookies

Sign up as a member of Famous Amos Cookie Club and you’ll get to enjoy a free 100g of Cookies in Bag on your birthday, with a minimum spend of $10!

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

11. Fruit Paradise: Free slice of tart

A birthday dinner isn’t complete without dessert. And if you’re not a big fan of cakes, Fruit Paradise has the perfect birthday deal for you. Sign up for a Japan Food Holdings member and you’ll get to enjoy a free slice of tart (min. spend $30) or 10% off for 1 whole tart preorder.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

12. Hai Di Lao: Birthday gifts

Besides having an extra special meal at the restaurant for your birthday celebration – servers singing birthday songs with LED-light displays – birthdays at Hai Di Lao also come with a free fruit platter or sometimes, a cake, depending on the outlet! Lucky patrons might also get birthday freebies like a free Pulut Hitam dessert, ice cream platter and for seniors, longevity buns! Sign up as a member and you’ll score yourself even more perks.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

13. Ikkousha Hakata Ramen: As many dumplings as your birthday age

This just might be our very favourite birthday dining promotion in Singapore (so long as you love dumplings): head to Ikkousha Hakata Ramen for your birthday dinner and you’ll get the same amount of gyozas to match your age. Hitting the big 4-0? That’s 40 yummy gyozas to share with your friends and fam. There is only one rule: there must be a minimum of four diners, all of whom must order a bowl of ramen. This awesome birthday treat is valid on your actual birthday or one day before or after and you can also get it with your online order (only for self pick-up).

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

14. Koi: Free upgrades to order

Given how popular bubble tea is in Singapore, this is one of the most talked-about birthday treats that we’ve come across. Depending on your membership tier, KOIThélicious members get to enjoy benefits such as a free medium drink, free toppings or even a free upsize!

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

15. Lawry’s The Prime Rib: Free birthday dessert, 50% off your second main

Wondering where to celebrate your birthday dinner in Singapore? Lawry’s The Prime Rib will give you a free birthday dessert and 50% off the second main course during your birthday month. Other birthday promotions include an instant photo print and specially-priced Champagne.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

16. Liberty Singapore: 50% off one main course

We’re stoked about this new smokehouse restaurant in the CBD that blends Asian cuisine with wood-fire techniques of a Texas-style barbecue. This East-meets-West menu features Korean Kalbi-marinated whole rib, Short-Rib Dumplings, Prawn Tagliatelle and more. Plan a birthday meal here and enjoy 50% off one main course with every $150 spent.

17. Marche’s: Free birthday treat

Show a valid photo ID to the staff during your birthday month and get a sweet birthday treat to celebrate! The birthday deal is available with any purchase.

Download the McDonald’s app (not the McDelivery app – that’s different!) and get a free 20-piece box of McNuggets with a minimum spend of $10 during your birthday month.

27. Swensen’s Singapore: Free sundae vouchers, birthday cake discounts

Fashion, Beauty & Homewares Birthday Deals in Singapore

29. Cotton On: Free birthday gift

30. Etude: discounts on e-coupons

Etude members can expect some smashing birthday deals. Members in different tiers will receive different birthday deals, from 5% off birthday coupons to 10% off birthday coupons.

31. Gifts Greetings: $10 e-voucher & two times cash rebates

Gifts Greetings members can look forward to a $10 e-voucher (valid for a year) that will be automatically credited to their accounts at the start of their birthday month. Members can also enjoy two times cash rebates with a minimum $5 spend in a single receipt with this birthday deal.

32. IKEA: Triple points on your birthday month

There’s a birthday deal in Singapore almost everywhere you look, and IKEA is no exception. Sign up for a free IKEA Family Membership (in which you earn 1 point for every $1 spent at IKEA) and you’ll get triple points for your first purchase during your birthday month. This birthday treat includes the IKEA store, online shopping, IKEA Restaurant, IKEA Bistro and the Swedish Food Market. Points can be used to offset purchases.

You also receive a free welcome gift just for signing up, and we love that they encourage a green ethos by awarding 50 points for every empty bottle returned to the store for recycling (max 3 per month for point accumulation).

35. Kiehl’s: 10% discount and travel goodies

You can get up to 10% cashback with your membership points and you can also earn sweet goodies just by bringing in used bottles for recycling.

38. MUJI: 15% off e-voucher

39. Sephora: Double points, free birthday gift & free brow wax

All Sephora Beauty Pass members (it’s free to join) earn 2x bonus points on one purchase during their birthday month. Every $1 spent earns you points, which can be put toward deluxe samples and other goodies. Members also get a complimentary brow wax and styling service at Benefit Brow Bar during their birthday month.

40. Sulwhasoo: Double points and a free birthday gift

Become a Sulwhasoo Member with any purchase and earn double points and a free birthday gift during your birthday month. Members also get a complimentary facial, another birthday treat with a $600 minimum spend and 10% off regular-priced items in the boutique.

41. Timberland: Up to 30% in birthday discounts

Use Timberland’s birthday discounts to upgrade your outdoor wardrobe! Members get up to 30% in discounts during their birthday month with a one-time purchase.

Travel & Leisure Birthday Deals in Singapore

42. Golden Village: Complimentary slice of cake

Join the GV Movie Club to enjoy tons of benefits anytime you catch a movie! These great deals for members include 10% off Gold Class tickets, priority viewing and a complimentary cake on your birthday month when you order a main course at the Gold Class lounge.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

43. Mandai Wildlife Reserve: Zooperb birthday deals

Sign up as a Friends of Mandai or Friends of Mandai Plus member and receive exclusive birthday deals in your birthday month! From free Amazon River Quest rides at the River Wonders to 30% off Wildlife Tours and a free souvenir birthday badge, celebrate your birthday at any of the four Mandai Wildlife Reserve parks with these great birthday deals. WildPass holders also get FREE entry to Bird Paradise, River Wonders or Singapore Zoo within seven days of their birthday, with a full-paying adult (signing up for a WildPass is free!).

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here (Friends of Mandai) and here (WildPass holders)

44. T–Hall.sg: Free rock climbing

Sign up for T–Hall.sg membership and receive one complimentary entry to T-Hall rock climbing on your birthday month. You will also receive 30% off all single-entry ticket purchases within your birthday month.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

45. Timezone: Free game credits

Arcade chain Timezone has been a favourite hang-out place for almost every age group in Singapore, and its 22,000 square feet arcade in Orchard gives us yet another reason to head there ASAP! Birthday celebrants get up to $50 worth of free game credits on their birthday month, so time to achieve new high scores!

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

46. Trapped: Free escape room challenge

Fancy an escape room game to ring in your birthday? Bring four paying guests and the birthday baby gets to play for free.

Score this birthday deal in Singapore here!

47. Uniqlo: $5 coupon

Local favourite Uniqlo also has a birthday treat for its members! Members get an exclusive $5 coupon credited to their account in the first week of their birthday month!

48. Wild Wild Wet: Bring a friend for free

Premium members get to pick one lucky friend to spend their birthday with at Wild Wild Wet for free! This birthday deal in Singapore is applicable for a single free day pass.

Kids, Pets & Grocery Birthday Deals in Singapore

49. Pet Lovers Centre: Birthday month offers

Use this birthday deal in Singapore to make that bulk dog food purchase that you’ve been putting off, as VIP Members get special birthday offers and discounts (with a minimum spend of $35) during their birthday month. It costs just $7 to join (and renew annually). You can also earn loyalty points on purchases throughout the year.

50. Smiggle: a free birthday treat

If your kiddos love Smiggle and all their colourful, sparkly goods, be sure to join the Smiggle VIP membership (for free) for a special birthday treat on your kiddo’s birthday month.

Banks, Credit Cards & Mobile Birthday Deals in Singapore

51. UOB: Travel discounts, free cake and more

UOB’s birthday deals in Singapore include travel discounts with free birthday cakes, free cooking lessons and bottles of wine – are available in various tiers for UOB’s Wealth Banking, Privilege Banking, and Privilege Reserve customers.

52. M1: Discounts on Shopee, Lazada & More

The various M1 birthday deals in Singapore that are available through the M1 app include deals from Lazada, Shopee, Fairprice and much, much more!

Sign up for Singtel Rewards and get unique birthday deals in Singapore at the likes of The Pine Garden, Elements Wellness and much more!

54. Starhub: Redeem birthday rewards on the app

55. Standard Chartered: $20 TANGS voucher, 10% off Capella Singapore

item.title: Hari Raya Haji 2025: How Is It Celebrated In Singapore & What’s The Difference With Hari Raya Puasa?
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Hari Raya Haji 2025 falls on 7 June 2025. Here’s all you need to know about the significance of Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji, and how they’re celebrated in Singapore. “Wait, it’s Hari Raya again? Didn’t we just celebrate it two months ago?” and “Why are there two Hari Raya celebrations in a […]

The post Hari Raya Haji 2025: How Is It Celebrated In Singapore & What’s The Difference With Hari Raya Puasa? appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Hari Raya Haji 2025 falls on 7 June 2025. Here’s all you need to know about the significance of Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji, and how they’re celebrated in Singapore.

“Wait, it’s Hari Raya again? Didn’t we just celebrate it two months ago?” and “Why are there two Hari Raya celebrations in a year?” are probably common questions you’ll see every year. Hari Raya Puasa or Hari Raya Aidilfitri falls on 31 March 2025, and this festival celebrates the end of the month of Ramadan, AKA the Islamic holy month of fasting. Not to be confused with Hari Raya Haji, which is referred to as the Festival of Sacrifice. Hari Raya Haji falls on 7 June 2025!

Here’s a lowdown of all you need to know about these two special days, and how it’s celebrated by Muslims in Singapore

Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri

Also known as Eid al-Fitr, Hari Raya Puasa marks the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan and is one of the most important celebrations of the year. “Puasa” means fasting, and during Ramadan, Muslims around the world fast from dawn to sunset.

But fasting isn’t just about abstaining from food and drink (yes, even water!), it’s a spiritual practice that promotes self-discipline, empathy for the less fortunate, and a deeper connection with God.

There is no fixed date on the Gregorian calendar for both Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji. Like all Islamic festivals, the dates for Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji are based on astronomical calculations that rely on the sighting of the new moon.

Because of this Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji differ from year to year. In Singapore, the Islamic Religious Council (known in Malay as Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, or MUIS) is responsible for determining the date of the festival each year.

Read more: Where To Get Hari Raya Traditional Outfits In Singapore

Hari Raya Haji

On the other hand, Hari Raya Haji is relatively a quieter celebration in Singapore. Hari Raya Haji (which means “great day of the haj” in Malay), also known as Aidiladha (also spelt Eid al-Adha or Eid Adha) or the Great Day of Sacrifice, is a Muslim festival that falls on the 10th day of Zulhijjah (the 12th month in the Islamic calendar).

Hari Raya Haji also coincides with the annual Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca, a significant event for Muslims worldwide and also one of the Five Pillars of Islam.

What’s the difference between Hari Raya Haji and Hari Raya Puasa?

Hari Raya Puasa aka Eid-ul-Fitr was celebrated on 31 March 2025 and signified the end of the fasting month of Ramadan, while Hari Raya Haji (7 June 2025) is celebrated to mark the Muslim pilgrimage (hajj), and is a day when Muslims usually perform the annual ‘korban’ ritual.

Read more: Guide To Halal Restaurants & Cafés

Are Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji public holidays in Singapore?

Yes, Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji are designated as public holidays in Singapore.

What is the ‘korban’ ritual?

Hari Raya Haji commemorates the willingness of the Islamic prophet Ibrahim to sacrifice his son Ismail in an act of obedience to God. The korban is one of the main rituals and involves the sacrificial slaughtering of livestock such as cows, sheep or goats.

The sacrifice ritual is done quickly (the jugular vein at the animal’s throat is slit quickly to ensure the quickest death possible), then the meat is cleaned and distributed to the community, the poor and needy.

How is Hari Raya Puasa and Hari Raya Haji celebrated in Singapore?

Hari Raya Puasa:

In Singapore, Hari Raya Puasa is a vibrant celebration, with Muslim families donning their finest colourful ethnic costumes as they spend the day visiting loved ones. The festival emphasises unity, forgiveness, and the importance of family. The day kicks off with special prayers at the mosque, followed by a sermon.

You’ll also see Ramadan bazaars popping up around Singapore during the month of Ramadan leading up to Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri, including the biggest bazaar in Geylang Serai. These bazaars will consist of delicious food, Hari Raya goodies, festive costumes, performances and much more.

Hari Raya Haji:

Besides the korban ritual on Hari Raya Haji, Muslims usually congregate to perform Hari Raya Haji prayers in the morning at the mosque and then visit close family members just like they do during Hari Raya Puasa. Muslims use it as an opportunity to gather and strengthen family bonds.

No Hari Raya celebration is complete without the delicious festive food! Expect a spread of festive dishes like ketupat (rice cakes), rendang (spicy meat stew), ayam masak merah (chicken in spicy tomato paste), and more. For sweet treats, every home you visit will be filled with a variety of goodies, with favourites like Makmur, Suji, and Kueh Tart.

Read more: Prepping Your Kids For Family Celebrations & Witty Comebacks To ‘Kepoh’ Relatives

Read more:

The post Hari Raya Haji 2025: How Is It Celebrated In Singapore & What’s The Difference With Hari Raya Puasa? appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 13 Family Chalets In Singapore From Just $23 Per Person!
item.dc:creator: Cherilyn
item.description:
Looking to book a family-friendly cheap chalet in Singapore for the upcoming holidays? Check out these chalets and bungalows in Singapore, where you can get your group together and enjoy the pool, BBQ pits and more! Booking a stay at a chalet in Singapore is a great way to unwind with the family over the […]

The post 13 Family Chalets In Singapore From Just $23 Per Person! appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking to book a family-friendly cheap chalet in Singapore for the upcoming holidays? Check out these chalets and bungalows in Singapore, where you can get your group together and enjoy the pool, BBQ pits and more!

Booking a stay at a chalet in Singapore is a great way to unwind with the family over the holidays. While hotel staycations are fab for some indulgence and glamping at the beach or camping in Pulau Ubin is great for a rustic adventure, chalets offer something unique. They often have large dining rooms or communal areas with a BBQ pit, so they are great for large gatherings and make a super birthday party venue! Staying at a chalet in Singapore gives you a lot more freedom, not to mention space, for a much cheaper price. Here’s our pick of the top family-friendly chalets in Singapore that have something for everyone!

Read more: Family-Friendly Hotels In Singapore For Staycations With Kids

Best Chalets In Singapore For Families And Large Groups:

1. Aranda Country Club: Pasir Ris chalet with BBQ & karaoke

The Aranda Country Club chalet is nestled in Pasir Ris with a variety of family-friendly facilities that provide an indulgent family staycation. From an aqua fitness workout to a BBQ and karaoke sessions, your family will never run out of things to do at this chalet in Singapore.

Younger kids can let loose in the kids’ playroom equipped with slides, a pretend play kitchen, and many toys that will keep them entertained, while parents can unwind in the Momley Loft with a self-care session to recharge for the next toddler tantrum. Executive suites at this chalet include a living room, dining area, a pantry with a refrigerator, and two bedrooms with two bathrooms.

Singapore chalet prices: From $201.65/night for members & $457.80/night for the public.
Aranda Country Club chalet booking: Call (+65) 6584 6811 or email reservation@arandaclub.org.sg.

Aranda Country Club, 60 Pasir Ris Drive 3, Singapore 519497, Tel: (+65) 6584 6811, www.arandaclub.org.sg

2. The Chevrons: Chalet with family-friendly activities

While most chalets in Singapore sit on the east coast, The Chevrons is a chalet nestled in the heart of Jurong East. This chalet could be one of the cheapest chalets in Singapore. For active kids, this chalet features the biggest bouldering gym in Singapore. Boulder+ is open to kids above 7 with any level of fitness. While the kids sweat it out at rock climbing, you can unwind by the pool, challenge your partner to a game of darts or pool, or melt into the massage chairs to de-stress!

The double-storey chalets sleep up to four people and come with a private BBQ pit, so you can cook alfresco while the kids play. If you want to unwind in a more luxurious space, the double-storey bungalows sleep up to five people with a private BBQ pit and a spacious dining room for an evening of board games and family dinners! This cheap Singapore chalet is just $155 per night and sleeps up to 5 pax (meaning it’s just $31 per person)!

Singapore chalet prices: From $155 (members) and $270 (public) per night for double-storey chalets; $255 (members) and $370 per night for double-storey bungalows.
The Chevrons chalet booking: Click here to book a chalet.

The Chevrons, 48 Boon Lay Way, Singapore 609961, Tel: (+65) 6668 8888, www.chevrons.org.sg

3. Civil Service Club @ Changi I: Chalet for large groups + BBQ

Are you looking for a more spacious chalet in Singapore to include your extended family? CSC @ Changi features two-bedroom family chalet suites that can sleep up to eight people. Your kids will love the swimming pool that is equipped with water play features and an awesome pirate ship-themed playground (at CSC I), while the parents can relax by the infinity pool with a breathtaking view of the sea.

If your kids are old enough to participate in a family cookout, then you can make use of the BBQ pits! Enjoy a game or two of bowling or head over to the tennis court for a sweat sesh. The chalets and facilities at CSC @ Changi have something for the whole family, regardless of age and interests!

Please note that all chalets in Singapore under CSC are only available to Singaporean citizens. 

Singapore chalet prices: from $302.58 per night for the public (Suite Plus Family).
CSC @ Changi chalet booking: Click here to book a chalet.

Civil Service Club @ Changi, 2 Netheravon Road, Singapore 508503, Tel: (+65) 6709 4709, www.cscchangi.sg

4. Civil Service Club @ Changi II: Seafront chalet + BBQ pit

If you’re planning a getaway with extended family, then this is the chalet for you! CSC @ Changi II (formerly Aloha Changi) has huge chalets, cottages and bungalows – some chalets can sleep up to eight people or host a party of 50 during the day. Each chalet comes with sheltered BBQ pits so you can enjoy BBQ chicken wings and the kids can roast marshmallows. These chalets also have a dining area and a fully equipped kitchen.

Whether you’re hosting a big birthday party or just want to plan a getaway with your family, Civil Service Club @ Changi II has rooms of every size. And if you want to wake up to the sound of waves crashing on the shore, book the Changi Seafront chalets. Each unit has four bedrooms, a living room, dining area, a fully equipped kitchen and sheltered BBQ pits.

Please note that all chalets in Singapore under CSC are only available to Singaporean citizens. 

Singapore chalet prices: from $202.23 for members and $291.21 for public (Fairy Point Bungalow, 3 bedrooms)
CSC @ Changi II chalet booking: Click here to book a chalet.

Civil Service Club @ Changi II, 30 Netheravon Road, Singapore 508522, Tel: (+65) 6545 2343, www.cscchangi.sg

5. Civil Service Club @ Loyang (CSC Loyang): Chalet + kids’ pool

For an adventure staycation with sea, sand, and water sports, check out CSC Loyang Point chalets with its two-bedroom terraces and four-bedroom bungalows that overlook the Pasir Ris beach (kids will go wild for the bunk beds!). Your family can kick back and relax by the swimming pool, get a tan on the beach, or head over to E!Hub at Downtown East for an evening of shopping.

The key feature of these chalets in Pasir Ris is the swimming pool with a built-in water play as well as the children’s playroom! CSC @ Loyang Point is one of the most family-friendly chalets in Singapore, and we love how it’s so close to the beach! And for those with furbabies, you can now book one of the four pet-friendly chalets and bungalows so you can bring your dog along.

Please note that all chalets in Singapore under CSC are only available to Singaporean citizens. 

Singapore chalet prices: Two-bedroom Garden Terraces from $282.74 per night (for public); four-bedroom Sea View Terraces from $498.96 (for public).
CSC @ Loyang Point chalet booking: Click here to book a chalet.

Civil Service Club @ Loyang Point, 159W Jalan Loyang Besar, Singapore 507020, Tel: (+65) 6581 9033, www.cscloyang.sg

6. D’Resort: Pasir Ris chalet at Downtown East + BBQ pit

D’Resort is more of a resort than a chalet, as many of its rooms are standalone (some with a king-sized bed and bunk beds). But D’Resort is still popular amongst those searching for chalets in Singapore because their double-storey family bungalow has a kitchenette, living room, and private BBQ pit. Located in Downtown East, D’Resort is a chalet that features newly renovated spacious family-friendly rooms that sleep up to four people for $232 per night. Wild Wild Wet Waterpark is within walking distance from the chalets, and kids will have a blast on the different water slides.

For indoor entertainment, you can head over to Downtown East for the rollerskating rink Hi Roller, watch the latest blockbuster at Cathay Cineplex, get active with the rock climbing wall, or sing your heart out at HaveFun Karaoke! The chalets are also five minutes from Pasir Ris Park, which is equipped with BBQ pits for your next seaside meal.

Singapore chalet prices: From $232 per night for up to four pax.
D’Resort chalet booking: Click here to book a chalet.

D’Resort, Downtown East,  1 Pasir Ris Close, Singapore 519599, Tel: (+65) 6582 3322, www.dresort.com.sg

7. Kranji Sanctuary Resort: Kampung chalet + BBQ pit

Looking for a getaway from the city? Kranji Sanctuary Resort is a beautiful kampung-style chalet, where you will be surrounded by lush greenery. This chalet has a BBQ pit, and the BBQ rental package comes with charcoal and other equipment. For a large family, the Family Room chalet is a spacious villa with two queen-sized beds and a balcony with tables and chairs, so you can soak in the serenity.

For a unique experience, you can spend the day at Bollywood Farms, Singapore’s largest planet-friendly farm, explore Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve and Kranji Marshes. If you have young kids, plan a trip to Hay Diaries Goat Farm, where kids will get to feed goats and learn about sustainable farming practices.

Singapore chalet prices: From $270 for a Family Room.
Kranji Sanctuary Resort chalet booking: Click here to book online or call Tel: (+65) 8811 9889 or email reservations@kranjiresort.com.

 Kranji Sanctuary Resort, 10 Neo Tiew Lane 2, Singapore 718813, Tel: (+65) 8811 9889, www.kranjisanctuaryresort.com

8. Tee Side Chalet @ Pasir Ris: Cheap east coast chalet in Singapore
