Not the cheapest sushi in town but one for special occasions!

Sushi Sato, 6B Dempsey Road, Singapore 247662, Tel: (+65) 6971 8265, sushi-sato.com

Sushi Yujo: Omakase restaurant in Singapore

When you step into Sushi Yujo, you’re transported into a different world, one that revolves around authentic Japanese flavours created from premium ingredients. The dinner omakase menu features the Chef’s seasonal signatures like the hairy crab served in whole yuzu or Awabi abalone with house-made liver sauce. Book a table here for a fine dining experience. Sushi takeout is available for online orders.

Sushi Yujo, 165 Tanjong Pagar Road, Amara Hotel, #02-26,  Singapore 088539, Tel: (+65) 8877 8831, www.sushiyujo.sg

Umi Sushi: Cheap sushi in Singapore

You can get sushi for as cheap as $1 per box (on selected days) at Umi Sushi! This is a great grab-and-go option if you’re looking for a quick sushi takeout during your lunch break, or even if the kids just need a quick snack. For a more filling option, opt for donburi (rice bowl), Japanese bento or a sushi platter. Sushi takeout and islandwide sushi delivery are available with a minimum order of $30.

Umi Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Changi, Sengkang, Holland Village www.umisushi.com.sg

Conveyor Belt Sushi Restaurants in Singapore:

Sakae Sushi: Classic conveyor belt sushi

Think ‘sushi in Singapore’ and Sakae Sushi will probably come to mind. The award-winning conveyor belt sushi restaurant group is probably what started our love for Japanese food here in SG! Their value-for-money sushi options and dishes are available on Foodpanda and on their e-store. Best of all, they offer islandwide sushi delivery!

Sakae Sushi, 217 E Coast Rd, #01-01, Singapore 428915, www.sakaedelivery.com

Genki Sushi: conveyor belt sushi train

Genki Sushi needs no introduction because they have 22 sushi restaurants in Singapore! Genki Sushi is best known for the conveyor belt sushi, where a train that looks like Japan’s famous speed trains delivers food right to your table. Dig into Aburi Sushi, a variety of Handrolls, fresh sashimi and more. Islandwide sushi delivery available with a minimum order of $35 and sushi delivery fees from $5.

Genki Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Tampines, Bishan, Jurong East, Bugis, Orchard, www.genkisushi.com.sg

Sushi Express: Cheap conveyor belt sushi

Sushi Express is the place to go if you’re looking for affordable sushi from $1.50++ per plate. From cute bento boxes to sushi party platters and unique Korean-inspired creations like Kimchi Tamagoyaki, there’s a great variety of sushi that will satisfy every palate. Sushi delivery via Food Panda and Grab Food.

Sushi Express, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Jurong East, Bukit Panjang, sushiexpress.com.sg

Sushiro Sushi: Affordable sushi in Singapore

Sushiro is Japan’s #1 conveyor belt sushi chain, and our kids adore the fresh sushi here! The sushi is very affordable and there’s a wide variety–everything from Shrimp with Avocado to Grilled Eel, Seared Bonito, Pickled Yellowtail and lots of different salmon sushi. It’s one of those sushi restaurants where you can let the kids go wild selecting dishes without worrying too much about the bill, so for that reason we reckon it’s one of the best sushi restaurants in Singapore!  Sushiro’s value-for-money sushi platters are available for islandwide delivery (through Foodpanda and Deliveroo).

Sushiro Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, Woodlands, Orchard, Jewel, www.instagram.com/sushirosingapore

Sushi Tei: conveyor belt sushi

Sushi Tei manages to balance low prices with fresh, tasty fish and a massive sushi menu. There’s always some sort of special or promotion on such as member’s deals and lunchtime deals. For islandwide sushi delivery, Sushi Tei is available on all the major food delivery platforms.

Sushi Tei, multiple locations in Singapore including Changi Jewel, Holland Village, Jurong East and Serangoon, www.sushitei.com

Closed Sushi Restaurants In Singapore:

Sens Dining (Closed)

SENS Sushi in Holland Village boasts four incoming cargo shipments with fresh produce straight from Japan. They take traditional Japanese cuisine and transform it with an innovative spin. Look for super fresh imported specials like Striped Mackerel or Sea Bream; our kids also love the yummy garlic fried rice. There’s always something for the whole family. For sushi delivery, look for them on Food Panda, Deliveroo and GrabFood.

Sushi Jiro (Closed)

Sushi Jiro at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay offers an exquisite sushi dining experience and promises premium ingredients for every dish. Indulge in an omakase course, assorted sashimi like ika, salmon, uni and more, or order a rice bowl for a more filling option. To make sure that you get to enjoy the freshest sushi, only dine-ins are available as Sushi Jiro does not offer sushi delivery.

Unkai Sushi: omakase experience

If you want to get real fancy, perhaps for a big birthday celebration or a special date night, head over to Unkai Sushi in Tanglin for fine Japanese cuisine. Feast on a gourmet multi-course menu with premium sashimi, a variety of donburi bowls and omakase creations that will blow you away. Since this is a unique dining experience, Unkai Sushi does not offer sushi delivery.

You might be interested in:

The post 20 Sushi Restaurants In Singapore For Affordable Japanese Cuisine appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To See Dinosaurs In Singapore: Dinosaur Parks, FREE Dino Playgrounds & More!
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for where to find dinosaurs in Singapore? Little dinosaur fans will roar with excitement when you take them to these dinosaur playgrounds, dinosaur museums and dinosaur parks in Singapore! Looking for dinosaur parks in Singapore for your little dino fan at home? From dinosaur parks like Dinoland in Yishun and Jurassic Park at USS, […]

The post Where To See Dinosaurs In Singapore: Dinosaur Parks, FREE Dino Playgrounds & More! appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for where to find dinosaurs in Singapore? Little dinosaur fans will roar with excitement when you take them to these dinosaur playgrounds, dinosaur museums and dinosaur parks in Singapore!

Looking for dinosaur parks in Singapore for your little dino fan at home? From dinosaur parks like Dinoland in Yishun and Jurassic Park at USS, to free dinosaur playgrounds in Singapore– we list all the best places to find T-rex skeletons, life-sized dinosaurs that make real dinosaur sounds, and dino fossils in Singapore! Some of these dinosaur parks have dinosaur rides, plus there’s a dinosaur-themed food hall with shows, exhibits with animatronic dinosaurs that roar, and even virtual dinosaur experiences. We break down all the places where you can bring the kids to see dinosaurs in Singapore!

Read more: Where To See Wild Animals In Singapore: Crocodiles, Dolphins, Otters & More

Jump to:
– Pop-up Dinosaur parks in Singapore
– Permanent Dinosaur parks & exhibits in Singapore
– FREE Dinosaur playgrounds in Singapore

Pop-up Dinosaur Parks, Exhibitions & Experiences in Singapore:

NEW! Jurassic World: The Experience in Cloud Forest

This is the latest dinosaur park in Singapore to turn heads! You can now rub shoulders with life-sized dinosaurs at Gardens by The Bay, because Jurassic World: The Experience lands at the misty landscapes of Cloud Forest on 29 May 2025! There are plenty of exciting zones and interactive exhibits that you can look forward to, including an 8.5m tall Brachiosaurus (that’s almost three stories high!), a life-sized animatronic Tyrannosaurus rex, a Petting Zoo area with baby dinosaurs and more!

Look forward to more than 72,000 plants and over 50 species that date back to prehistoric times. Many of these plants once thrived alongside dinosaurs. Plus, don’t miss the exclusive Evolution Walk experience, where you can travel back in time to learn about ancient plant species that existed long before the flower-bearing plants you see today.

When: From 29 May 2025, 9am – 9pm
Where: Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay, 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953
Price to see dinosaurs: $26 per adult and $22 per child. Get tickets here.

COMING SOON! Dinos Alive: Dinosaur exhibition in Singapore

There’s a new dinosaur exhibition coming to town and it’s going to be an immersive one that really takes you back to a time when these magnificent reptiles ruled! At Dinos Alive: An Immersive Experience, you’ll journey through the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods and see over 80 dinosaur replicas that move. You’ll meet all your favourites: the T-Rex, Stegosaurus, Ankylosaurus, velociraptors and more–all life-sized.

This dinosaur exhibition in Singapore also includes a giant virtual aquarium, where you can observe prehistoric marine life. Want something even more realistic? Check out the VR experience at Dinos Alive! Kids will also get to become palaeontologists and become dinosaur tamers at the “Budding experts” interactive experience.

When: TBA
Where: TBA
Price to see dinosaurs: TBA – Join the waitlist here!

Permanent Dinosaur Parks, Exhibitions & Experiences In Singapore:

NEW! Ancient Waters & Conquering Land at Singapore Oceanarium (opening 23 July)

What’s possibly cooler than dinosaurs in Singapore? Marine dinos! The Singapore Oceanarium (former S.E.A. Aquarium) is back, and it’s three times bigger than before. We’re super excited about the Ancient Waters and Conquering Land Zone that spotlights prehistoric ocean creatures and living fossils! There’ll be replicas of prehistoric marine creatures as well as life-sized animatronics. The Singapore Oceanarium opens on 23 July 2025, so stay tuned for more info on its prehisotric zone.

When: Opening 23 July 2025
Where: Singapore Oceanarium, Resorts World Sentosa
How much: TBA

Read more: Guide To Singapore Oceanarium: Zones, Opening Dates & More

NEW! clubFACE: Dino Putt dinosaur golf

Mini golf with dinosaurs? We’re here for it! Bring the little ones to Dino Putt at clubFACE to see dinosaurs in Jurong. This 18-hole putting golf course has dinosaurs waiting for you at every corner, including animatronic ones to make you feel like you’re in a dinosaur resort in Singapore! Spot all your faves such as the T-Rex, Pterodactylus, Brachiosaurus, Stegosaurus and more.

You can also hop onto Dino Rides to explore the whole dino golf course in a fun way! Take your pick from a Triceratops, Parasaurolophus and more. Just be sure to lather on sunscreen and stay hydrated because this mini golf course is not sheltered.

When: Open daily, 10am – 11pm
Where: clubFACE, 511 Upper Jurong Road, #02-05, Singapore 638366
Price to see dinosaurs: 18-hole golf from $12/child & $25/adult; Dinosaur rides from $3 – more info here.

NEW! Wan To Play @ T3: Dinosaur playground Singapore

Bring the kids for lots of wholesome dino fun at the new Wan To Play indoor playground at Changi Airport Terminal 3. Toddlers can dig in at the kinetic sand pit, while older kids head straight for the slide that lands in a giant ball pit.

Don’t miss the giant pink T-Rex – it’s a great photo op. There’s also a merry-go-round to keep the little ones busy, plus role-play areas and battery-operated cars for kids to take for a spin around the indoor track. For those with energy to spare, the rock climbing wall is a solid bet.

When: Friday – Saturday, 10am – 9pm; Monday – Friday 10am – 8pm
Where: Changi Airport Terminal 3, 65 Airport Boulevard, B2 North, #B2-14-18, Singapore 819663
Price to see dinosaurs: $18 for a one-hour pass; $35 for a two-hour pass – more info here.

Dinoland: Yishun Dinosaur park

Dinoland Singapore at SAFRA Yishun offers kids the largest display of life-sized animatronics dinosaurs in an indoor air-con forest trail. The 1.5 hour guided tour at this dinosaur adventure park starts with getting dressed as a ranger, then get stuck into hands-on activities such as fossil digging and climbing through an underground cave. At Dinoland Yishun, you’ll be able to get up close with these different types of life-sized dinosaurs at Dinoland too.

There are over 20 dinosaurs at this Singapore dinosaur park so you can learn about the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Brontosaurus, Pterodactyl, Triceratops, Velociraptor and more. Do note for little ones – the animatronic dinosaurs at Dinoland are super realistic and can be quite loud so warn them in advance!

When: Saturday – Sunday, PH & School Holidays, 10am – 8pm; Tuesday – Friday, 5pm – 8pm (Closed Mondays)
Where: Dinoland, SAFRA Yishun, 60 Yishun Ave 4, #02-01, Singapore 769027
Price to see dinosaurs: $35 per Dinoland ticket. Dinoland tickets on sale now for $32. (SAFRA members get additional 10% off Dinoland entry). Get tickets here.

Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum: Singapore Dinosaur museum

Did you know you could see real dinosaur fossils in Singapore? The best place for your kids to learn about dinosaurs in Singapore is the Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum. This Singapore dinosaur museum has a Dinosaur Zone which features three real diplodocid sauropod fossils that were among the largest and heaviest animals to ever walk on land.

These fossils dwarf even the biggest theropods such as the Tyrannosaurs. The dinosaur fossils at Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum are estimated to be between 149 and 156 million years old and are more than 80% complete. Two of the dinosaur skeletons come with skulls which we are told is a rarity!

When: Tuesday – Sunday, 10am– 6pm (Closed Mondays)
Where: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum, National University of Singapore 2 Conservatory Drive, Singapore
Price to see dinosaurs: Singapore Residents $17/adult, $9/child; Standard Rates $24/adult, $15/child – Get tickets here.

Read more: Guide To Kid-Friendly Museums & Exhibitions In Singapore

Jurassic Park USS: Dinosaur adventure park with rides

Looking for a dinosaur adventure park in Singapore? Take a step back in time into the world of dinosaurs in Singapore at The Lost World in Universal Studios Singapore. Home to Singapore’s very own Jurassic Park, this dinosaur park features lots of adrenaline-fuelled fun for dino lovers.

Three USS rides are of note; the Canopy Flyer for a prehistoric bird’s eye view of Jurassic Park, Dino-Soarin’ where kids can ride on the back of flying Pteranodons, and the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure for a thrilling river raft ride through dinosaur habitats – expect to get soaked! You can even meet a Velociraptor from Jurassic World at the Raptor Encounter and watch a baby raptor hatch from its egg.

When: Monday – Saturday, 10am – 7pm; Sunday 10am – 8pm
Where: Universal Studios Singapore, 8 Sentosa Gateway, 098269
Price to see dinosaurs: Entry to USS: $76/adult & $59/child for Singapore residents – Get tickets here.

KidsSTOP Singapore: Dig up dinosaur fossils

The Dino Pit at KidsSTOP (part of Science Centre Singapore) is a must-visit for budding palaeontologists! Preschoolers and little ones love taking off their socks and getting stuck in the sand here while they dig out dinosaur fossils.

Designed to provide kids with a memorable sensory experience, this Dino Pit activity will have your kids identifying the different parts of dinosaur fossils, as they role-play at being a palaeontologist. There’s also an interactive board that booms out dinosaur facts to test your kids’ knowledge about these prehistoric creatures.

When: Tuesday – Sunday 10am – 1pm, 2pm – 5pm (Closed Mondays)
Where: KidsSTOP, 21 Jurong Town Hall Rd, Singapore 609433
Price to see dinosaurs: KidsSTOP entry from $20/adult & $10/child – Get tickets here.

Jewel-rassic Quest: Dinosaur AR Experience

Dinosaur lovers will be excited to know that you can even see dinosaurs in Singapore at Jewel Changi Airport’s Jewel-rassic Quest! This dinosaur-themed augmented reality experience takes you back 89 million years to the Cretaceous period.

Kids aged 6 years old and above can look for augmented reality dinosaurs with a TimeLens. Hunt through Shiseido Forest Valley and Canopy Park and see if you can spot the dinosaurs. Complete the mission and participate in activities and games.

When: Daily, 10:30am – 5:30pm
Where: Jewel-rassic Quest, Jewel Changi Airport Level 1 Concierge, 78 Airport Boulevard
Price to see dinosaurs: From $18 – get tickets here.

DinoVenture: VR dinosaurs in Singapore

DinoVenture is a Virtual Reality ride at Sentosa that’s great for some family dino fun. All you have to do is don your VR headset, sit back and relax as the ride takes you through a rugged jungle filled with dinosaurs on the hunt. You’ll experience a rush as the ride zooms through the prehistoric world. Take note, though, that the ride is only about seven minutes long, so do check out the other attractions at Sentosa when planning a day here.

When: Open daily, 10am – 10pm (last ride at 9.40pm)
Where: Beach Station, Sentosa
Price to see dinosaurs: $15 per ticket – get tickets here.

Amazonia Singapore: Woolly Mammoth & dinosaurs

Amazonia Singapore may not be a dinosaur park per se, but you can spot some dinosaurs and a Wooly Mammoth at this indoor playground! It’s more ice-age than a dinosaur playground, and kids can’t quite interact with the prehistoric creatures here, but lots of fun nonetheless if you’re looking for dinosaurs in Singapore.

When: Sunday – Friday, 9.30am – 7.30pm; Saturday 9.30am – 9pm
Where: Amazonia Singapore, Great World
Price to see dinosaurs: From $28.80 (inclusive of 1 adult and minimum of 2.5 hours play) – get tickets here.

FREE Dinosaur Playgrounds & Exhibits In Singapore:

Changi Jurassic Mile: 20 Dinosaurs in Singapore (FREE!)

Head over to Changi Jurassic Mile for Singapore’s largest permanent outdoor display of 20 different types of life-sized dinosaurs. This one-kilometre dino-themed adventure park has a cycling and jogging track along the 3.5km Changi Airport Connector path that links the Jewel Changi Airport to East Coast Park and the Park Connector Network (PCN). Look out for the Tyrannosaurus Rex, dinosaur eggs, the Brontosaurus and the bright blue Velociraptors.

Handy information panels show facts about these dinosaurs along that path while outdoor speakers play safari-themed music for the complete Jurassic Park-style experience. Full deets here. If you are heading to the Changi Jurassic Mile with little dinosaur-fan kiddos, do be warned that it is a walk of 2 km from HUB & SPOKE car park to the start of Jurassic Mile (which is a one-kilometre path)! So you may want to bring scooters or cycle instead.

When: Open 24 hours daily
Where: Changi Jurassic Mile, Airport Boulevard (alight at Changi Airport Terminal 4, Car Park 4A and follow signage). Deets here.
Price to see dinosaurs: Free!

Causeway Point Dinosaur Water Playground (FREE!)

The playground at Causeway Point is not only a water playground, it’s dinosaur-themed! There’s a 2.2m hollow dinosaur rib cage with water jets, a Toddler Dino Zone, Adventure Volcano and Crater Zone, two long slides (best for kids age 5 and up!), giant rocks and even a mist-spraying volcano that ‘erupts’!

In the evening, this dinosaur park wet play area even lights up in cool neon colours. Watch the video here for a sneak peek before you go! Entry to this wet play dinosaur park in Singapore is free and no pre-booking is required, however, do note that each entry is limited to an hourly session of 45 minutes of playtime and 15 minutes of changing time.

When: Open daily, 10.30am – 9pm
Where: Causeway Point, 1 Woodlands Square Level 7, Singapore 738099
Price to see dinosaurs: Free!

Read more: Best Water Playgrounds & Water Parks In Singapore

Jurassic Nest dinosaur food hall at Gardens by the Bay (FREE Entry!)

Jurassic Nest is a dinosaur-themed food hall in Gardens by the Bay, Singapore. You’ll find 18 dinosaurs at Jurassic Nest at Supertree Grove including a Tyrannosaurus Rex and Brachiosaurus, the two fiercest and tallest dinosaurs which will come alive roaring (for approximately three minutes each time). Catch the dinosaur ‘show’ with free admission every hour from 11:30pm to 8:30pm. This dinosaur-themed food court is where you’ll also find Michelin-starred brands serving up a range of Asian cuisine from Hawker Chan’s Chicken Rice and Tsuta Ramen to Mama by Putien.

There’s also an outdoor alfresco area JN Café, where you can see an Oviraptor that comes alive nine times a day at hourly intervals from 11.30am to 8.30pm. In between, catch 15 other static dinosaurs from the Velociraptor and Dilong Paradoxus to the Corythosaurus and Parasaurolophus, scattered across the food hall while you dine on your favourite foods. Pssst! Don’t miss the new educational trail that takes you around the gardens on a prehistoric adventure to learn more about the unique diets of herbivorous dinosaurs!

When: Jurassic Nest Cafe: 9am – 9pm, Mon to Sun; Jurassic Nest Food Hall: 11am – 9pm, Mon to Sun (last order at 8:30pm)
Animatronic dinosaurs ‘shows’: Alfresco Area 11:30am º 8:30pm (hourly); Dining Hall (Indoor) 12pm – 9pm (hourly)
Where: Jurassic Nest, 18 Marina Gardens Drive #01-02, Singapore 018953
Price to see dinosaurs: free to enter. Food priced individually from $8.80 to $10 per dish. More info here.

Kim Keat Dinosaur Playground at Toa Payoh (FREE!)

You’ll find dinosaurs in Singapore at this super old-school heartland outdoor playground! The Kim Keat Dinosaur Playground in front of Block 27, Kim Keat Avenue, features two dinosaurs that are probably the oldest dinosaurs in Singapore. They were installed by sculpture specialists Hong Hai Environmental Arts in 2000.

The gigantic, three-metre-tall Tyrannosaurus rex is at the centre of this Toa Payohh dinosaur playground surrounded by white dinosaur eggs with a baby T-rex nearby. Kids can’t really interact with these dinosaurs, but there’s some play equipment nearby with a small slide, activity panel and climbing handholds.

When: Open 24 hours daily
Where: Toa Payoh Dinosaur Playground, Block 27 Toa Payoh East, Singapore 310027
Price to see dinosaurs: Free!

Fu Shan Garden Dinosaur playground (FREE!)

If your kids want to get up close and personal with dinosaurs in Singapore, head over to the dinosaur slides and stone dinosaur sculptures at the free-to-enter dinosaur playground Fu Shan Garden. Kids can clamber all over the dinosaurs here unlike at other dinosaur installations.

Can you find the dimetrodon, sauropod, pteranodon, triceratops, and tyrannosaurus rex? There are tunnels to explore and some newer additions to this dinosaur playground include the colourful wooden stegosaurus and triceratops with hollowed-out tummies to hide in.

When: Open 24 hours daily
Where: Fu Shan Garden, 81 Woodlands Street 81, Singapore 730827
Price to see dinosaurs: Free!

Read more: Best FREE Outdoor Playgrounds In Singapore

Sky Terrace @ Our Tampines Hub: Lone dinosaur (FREE!)

We found a lone dinosaur at the Level 2 Sky Terrace free outdoor playground at Our Tampines Hub! While not exactly a dinosaur playground, it’s a cute dino surprise for kiddos who love these prehistoric creatures. The dinosaur is a realistic-looking raptor and is “trudging” amongst the vines where you’ll also find giant fruits. Kids cannot interact with the raptor, but the sheltered playground has plenty of space for running around and small play structures that offer lots of fun with a dinosaur in presence!

When: Open 24 hours daily
Where: Level 2 Sky Terrace, Our Tampines Hub, 1 Tampines Walk, Singapore 528523
Price to see dinosaurs: Free!

Closed dinosaur parks in Singapore:

Roarr! Dinosaur Adventure Park 2.0 at Marina Square (Closed)

Roarr! Dinosaur Adventure Park 2.0 at Let’s Play @ Marina Square is a pop-up for kiddos with plenty of thrilling activities. Journey through a spectacular Jurassic world featuring life-sized animatronic dinosaurs at this Marina Square dinosaur park. Older kids can get competitive with arcade and PlayStation 4 games, while younger ones can ride on an adventure car to explore the dinosaurs in the forest, jump into a dinosaur-themed ball pit and bounce around on dinosaur inflatables.They can even put on their thinking caps and pretend to be a palaeontologist to dig up dinosaur fossils in the sand pit. Plus, snap photos with the giant dinosaurs to remember this exciting dinosaur adventure with the kids!

Every effort has been taken to ensure details are correct. However, as venues may close without warning, it’s always best to check with each venue directly before heading down.

Read more:

The post Where To See Dinosaurs In Singapore: Dinosaur Parks, FREE Dino Playgrounds & More! appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Find the Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore: Unicorn Cakes, Ice Cream Cakes, Halal Cakes & More
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
On the never-ending quest for the best kids’ birthday cakes in Singapore, we’ve rounded up unicorn cakes, halal cakes, ice cream cakes, birthday cakes with names on them, 3D Fondant cakes and more! Looking for the best birthday cakes in Singapore for your little one’s upcoming birthday party? Whether it’s for a discerning kiddo or […]

The post Where To Find the Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore: Unicorn Cakes, Ice Cream Cakes, Halal Cakes & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
On the never-ending quest for the best kids’ birthday cakes in Singapore, we’ve rounded up unicorn cakes, halal cakes, ice cream cakes, birthday cakes with names on them, 3D Fondant cakes and more!

Looking for the best birthday cakes in Singapore for your little one’s upcoming birthday party? Whether it’s for a discerning kiddo or something a bit more adult, there’s a huge range of birthday cakes in Singapore to choose from. We’ve separated the wheat from the chaff (or the eggs from the flour, as the case may be) to highlight some of our personal faves. Bear in mind that this list of where to get birthday cakes in Singapore is not exhaustive, in fact, there are loads of home bakers across the island (many of them hard-working mamas) who can hook you up. Now all you need to do is host the party at home (or find a good party venue), decide if you need a party entertainer or magician, organise party games, send out invites and you’re all set! Also, check out these great birthday deals in Singapore while you’re at it!

Jump to:
– Customised cakes and personalised kids’ birthday cakes 
– Halal cakes
– Gluten-free cakes & dairy-free cakes
– Off-the-shelf cakes

      Read more: Best Kids’ Birthday Party Venues

Where to get a birthday cake in Singapore

Pinch Bakehouse: Halal-certified birthday cakes

The bakers at Pinch Bakehouse believe that birthday cakes should be the star of the party. They deliver mind-blowing flavours in a fun, playful package, while keeping your health and dietary needs in mind. Just because the birthday child has dietary restrictions doesn’t mean that they can’t enjoy a sweet treat! Choose from a wide range of sugar-free, allergen-free and halal cakes to suit your party’s dietary preferences.

Pinch Bakehouse also has choices to delight the grown-ups, such as the classic Ondeh Ondeh Cake, which is available as a gorgeous customised birthday cake. Want extra treats for the party? Pinch Bakehouse also has brownies, cupcakes, cake pops and macarons!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $158 – $568

Pinch Bakehouse, 218 Pandan Loop #05-09, Singapore 128408, Tel: (+65) 8380 6722, www.pinchbakehouse.com 

Bob The Baker Boy: Over 400 designs & custom-made cakes

Bob the Baker Boy, a persona created by the founder, MayEe, is fond of moist and cottony-soft cakes using natural ingredients. Bob the Baker Boy’s cakes are lower in sugar than many regular birthday cakes in Singapore, so you won’t have to worry about the sugar crash after the party! Choose from their extensive menu of customisable birthday cakes featuring over 400 past designs including Blue and White Ombre Anna and Elsa Snowflakes Cake for Frozen fans, a Cocomelon Bus Themed Birthday Cake for friends of JJ and more.

Bob the Baker Boy can even accommodate any request for the perfect children’s birthday cake; all you have to do is submit a request online. With their truly Insta-worthy birthday cakes in Singapore, it’s no wonder they have over 1,000 five-star Google reviews from happy customers.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $118 – $498.90

Bob the Baker Boy, 218 Pandan Loop, Xpace@218 05-06, Singapore 128408, Tel: (+65) 8380 6722, www.bobthebakerboy.com

Henri Charpentier: Elegant French-inspired birthday cakes

If you’re looking for a classier birthday cake in Singapore, Henri Charpentier is where you want to go. A French-inspired bakery selling financiers, madeleines, petits gâteaux assortis (assorted little cakes) and more, Henri Charpentier designs minimalistic birthday cakes in Singapore for every occasion. Don’t let the simple design fool you, as each cake is meticulously handcrafted and infused with a variety of fresh flavours for a delightful treat.

Henri Charpentier’s Fresh Cream Birthday Cake is light, airy, and made with the finest ingredients, offering a melt-in-your-mouth experience. The Chantilly Fraise is adorned with fresh strawberries and their signature fresh cream, creating a harmonious balance of flavours. The Shortcake, topped with strawberries, blueberries, and their signature fresh cream, is another popular choice that highlights the freshness and deliciousness of the ingredients used.

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $31.40 – $220

Henri Charpentier, six locations in Singapore including Orchard Central, PLQ, Ngee Ann City, Great World, 100AM, and VivoCity, www.henricharpentier.oddle.me

Bloomsbury Bakers: Customised birthday cakes made from scratch

Each birthday only happens once in a lifetime, so your little one certainly deserves a memorable birthday cake to celebrate another year around the sun. Since every child is different, Bloomsbury Bakers specialises in customised birthday cakes in Singapore. With a repertoire of hundreds of designs for kids’ birthday cakes, you’re sure to find one that will put a smile on your child’s face.

From mermaids to unicorns, dinosaurs, transport vehicles and more, there are plenty of designs to choose from. Bloomsbury Bakers make birthday cakes in small batches from scratch with high quality ingredients including Danish butter, sustainably sourced cocoa power and French chocolate without additional preservatives or additives, so you know you’ll be giving your child the best.

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: from $40 onwards

Enjoy free delivery for orders above $200!

Bloomsbury Bakers, 30 Bendemeer Road #01-889 Singapore 330030, WhatsApp: (+65) 8308 9396, www.bloomsburybakers.com

Abite Atelier: Kid’s birthday cakes & event planner

This jack-of-all-trades event planning group does everything from conceptualising dreamy parties to creating gorgeous cakes. Abite Atelier can accommodate pretty much any cake design request (we’ve seen cool Paw Patrol birthday cakes, whimsical mermaid cakes, and lots of pretty floral cakes for adults or too-cool teens), all freshly baked in their NEA-approved kitchen located at Duxton Hill.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $250 – $388

Abite Atelier, 10A Duxton Hill, Singapore 089594, Tel: (+65) 8499 3463, www.abite.sg

Baker’s Brew: Customised birthday cakes

The talented bakers at Baker’s Brew are known for their creative customised cakes for every occasion. Whether you’re looking for a kid’s birthday cake or one for a special occasion like Mother’s Day, just say the word and watch them bring your dream to life! They offer islandwide delivery for just $15, as long as you make your order three days in advance. Their classic cakes feature flavours such as Salty Matcha Cake and Gula Melaka Salted Egg Cake, and they also do amazing custom bakes.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $48 – $368

Baker’s Brew, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Great World, Jurong East, www.bakersbrew.com

Read more: Where to Find Party Planners in Singapore

Butter Studio: Less-sweet halal birthday cakes

The team at Butter Studio put a local and playful spin on familiar home-style bakes, taking inspiration from their grandmothers’ recipes to create photo-worthy cakes that will make every birthday celebration picture-perfect! From their award-winning Salted Caramel Red Velvet Cake to the fun Netflix and Chill Cake, all their cakes are halal-certified and made less sweet, without artificial preservatives or stabilisers. You can customise birthday cake or choose a predesigned cake if you’re time-pressed!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $168

Butter Studio, multiple locations in Singapore including Takashimaya, Bugis Junction, Tampines Mall www.thebutterstudio.com

Cake Avenue: Customisable halal birthday cakes

Cake Avenue specialises in customised birthday cakes for any occasion. Whether it’s a Cocomelon cake or Paw Patrol cake for kids or even a beautiful cake to celebrate your 50th anniversary, this bakery can create any type of cake that you’re looking for. This is also a good bakery to get halal-certified birthday cakes. If you want to do a customised children’s birthday cake design that’s not on their website, simply email them a picture of what you’re looking for, and they’ll respond with a quote. Same-day delivery available with a four-hour notice.

Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $185

Cake Avenue, 33 Lor Kilat, #01-01 Kilat Centre, Singapore 598132, Tel: (+65) 6877 9008, www.cakeavenue.com.sg

Caked By Seraphina: Vegan birthday cakes available

Seraphina launched her business to balance her passion for baking with being at home with her two daughters. Not only can Seraphina take any challenge you throw at her – cakes with delicate flowers, intricate piping, moulded fondant – but her cake flavours go way beyond your basic chocolate and vanilla. Some of her 21 flavours offered include White Chocolate Matcha, Black Sesame Honey Cake, Rose Lychee, Chocolate Salted Caramel, and even vegan cake options like Swiss Meringue Buttercream.

Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $55 – $700

Caked by Seraphina, WhatsApp: (+65) 9672 4583, www.instagram.com/cakedbyseraphina

The Cake Shop: Eggless cakes available

We love The Cake Shop’s cute 3D fondant cakes! Kids will love the Mario Surprise Knock-Knock birthday cake, the Poke Ball birthday cake and the Unicorn Special birthday cake. They do also offer more economical options like the adorable Sunshine Floral birthday cake. They also offer Eggless Cakes for those with dietary restrictions.

Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $42 – $168

The Cake Shop, multiple locations in Singapore including Jurong East, City Square Mall, Admiralty, WhatsApp (+65) 9662 0303, www.thecakeshop.com.sg

Cake Spade: Customised birthday cakes

We’ve always loved the clever name of this pretty pink cake shop on Tanjong Pagar Road, and it turns out their birthday cakes are just as colourful and vibrant as their storefront! Cake Spade offers everything from crumbles to cupcakes, brownies and takeaway cake slices. Their customised cakes include both 3D fondant and beautifully piped icing options. They generally recommend ordering a week in advance.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $120 – $238

Cake Spade, 28 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089135, Tel: (+65) 6444 3868, www.cakespade.com

Chubby Bubs: Has dairy-free kid’s birthday cake

Looking for creative children’s birthday cakes in Singapore with stellar ingredients? Chubby Bubs uses only cage-free eggs and unrefined sugar in their cakes and cupcakes (with the exception of the cake decor). Customised dairy-free cakes are available too! Chubby Bubs encourages you to share your cake requirements, ideas and preferences when placing an order so their cake artisans can help to create a work of edible art for your special occasion.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Chubby Bubs, The Fernhill, Singapore 259049, Tel: (+65) 9299 1840, www.chubbybubssg.com

Creme Maison Bakery: Themed birthday cakes

Looking for something other than a traditional birthday cake? Choose from a range of beautifully decorated cakes, cupcakes, and desserts to complete your celebration. Creme Maison also specialises in customised children’s birthday cakes, whether it’s a Chanel-inspired cake for that teen or a dinosaur-themed birthday cake. Simply reach out to them with your desired cake design and watch them turn it into reality. They offer a cake delivery service, though do note that cupcakes need to be preordered.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $92 – $450

Creme Maison Bakery, 30 Tai Seng Street #08-03C Singapore 534013 Tel: (+65) 8181 3689, www.crememaison.com

Edith Patisserie: Birthday cakes with local flavours

Edith Patisserie (home to the bubble tea tart!) is a patisserie dedicated to providing recipes tailored to the local palate – think less sugar, unique flavour pairings, and options for a range of dietary requirements. The Lychee Rose Cake (pictured above) is a bestseller, and they also do stunning customised cakes, including the ever-popular Unicorn Cake.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $120 – $360

Edith Patisserie, four locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, Dhoby Ghaut, Holland Road and New Bahru, Tel: (65) 6443 7150, www.edithpatisserie.com

Fitri Creations: Halal birthday cakes

Looking for a halal birthday cake? Fitri Creations is a halal bakery in Singapore with a wide range of delicious desserts like cupcakes, birthday cakes, doughnuts, tarts, macarons and brownies! If you’re looking for a colourful birthday cake for your little one, the Rainbow Marshmallow Birthday Cake is sure to satisfy. Or try the Ferrero Rocher Birthday Cake or the Brownies Indulgence Birthday Cake for chocolate fans. Pick up the cake from one of their outlets or request birthday cake delivery for a flat rate of $25.

Price of halal birthday cake: $45 – $90

Fitri Creations, 361 Sembawang Crescent, #01-02, Sun Natura, Singapore 750361 & 11 Tanjong Katong Rd, #B1-34/35, Kinex, Singapore 437157, www.fitricreations.com

The Frosted Chick: Has rainbow birthday cakes

With easy online ordering, the Frosted Chick specialises in customisable cakes, cupcakes, macarons, cake pops, and other artisanal desserts. The bakery was actually started by two parents who were struggling to bake a cake for their son’s first birthday – how far they have come! The Frosted Chick offers all manner of 3D Fondant cakes, along with personalised cakes with your kiddo’s name. They also have a great selection of ready-made standard birthday cakes, including the ever-popular rainbow cake.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $115 – $330

The Frosted Chick, 41 Opal Cres, Singapore 328428, Tel: (+65) 6969 3368, www.thefrostedchick.com.sg

Happy Oven: Halal birthday cakes with local flavours

Happy Oven bakes delicious Halal birthday cakes and pastries. They are known for adding a modern twist to traditional local flavours, so you can choose from a unique range of handmade cakes with local flavours like the Signature Ondeh Ondeh Birthday Cake, Mango Pomelo Birthday Cake or even the Chendol Birthday Cake. If you’re ordering for a chocolate lover, pick up the indulgent Chocolate Ganache Birthday Cake or Black Forest Birthday Cake. Free delivery for orders above $200.

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $25

Happy Oven, 40 Beo Crescent, #01-08, Singapore 160040 and 678 Hougang Avenue 8 #01-505, Singapore 530678, www.happyoven.com.sg

HoneyPeachSG Bakery: Customised gourmet birthday cakes

Honeypeachsg has everything from beautiful gourmet cakes like a Golden Wings Cake to scrumptious desserts like fudge brownies, macarons, cupcakes, fruit tarts and more! They can also create customised birthday cakes for kids (and adults!) according to your desired cake design or theme. They are not halal-certified, but they do not use lard, alcohol or gelatine in their cakes. For other cakes, the standard three-hour delivery fee is $15. Don’t miss the mouth-watering Sea-Salt Chocolate Salted Caramel Cake!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $148 – $268

Honeypeachsg, 11 Irving Place, #01-01, Singapore 369551, WhatsApp: (+65) 9088 4932, www.honeypeachsg.com

LÉLE Bakery: Low-sugar kid’s birthday cakes

LÉLE Bakery is known for their cute cake designs for all types of occasions like birthdays, weddings, baby showers and more. All birthday cakes are created with a soft chiffon sponge base that is low in sugar but equally delectable. Every cake is carefully made from scratch to make sure that you get the freshest cake for your celebration. From Chi Cha Bubble Tea Drinkable Cake to a Pinata Cake, there’s a birthday cake for everyone. They offer cake delivery at a flat rate of $10 or free delivery for orders above $150.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $98 – $238

LÉLE Bakery, 5 Mandai Link, Mandai Foodlinkm#05-01 Singapore 728654, Tel: (+65) 8776 1510, www.lelebakerysg.com

Little House Of Dreams: Themed birthday cakes

This oh-so-pretty shop offers both signature and bespoke cakes along with all manner of other confections like cupcakes, macarons and “bloom pots”. We love that you can order signatures like Fondant Earl Grey and the Over the Rainbow cake online (note that 3 days’ advanced notice is required), while imagination is your only limit when it comes to their absolutely gorgeous custom fondant cakes available in 9 different cake flavours – just be sure to order at least a week ahead of time!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Little House of Dreams, www.instagram.com/littlehouseofdreams

Miss Muffet: Unique themed birthday cakes

If you’re looking for something completely unique and a centrepiece for your party, Anita from Miss Muffet is the person to call. The Sassy Mama team has had the pleasure of diving into one of her delicious cakes, but not before colouring in the edible colouring sheet that wrapped around the cake’s buttercream exterior – a fun idea for kids and families!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $115 – $540

Miss Muffet, WhatsApp: (+65) 8801 0671, www.missmuffetcakeboutique.com

Monice Bakes: Kids’ birthday cakes, cupcakes & cookies

Got a last-minute request to bring cupcakes to the school fair, or did you forget to buy your co-worker a birthday cake? Monice Bakes does customised cakes, cookies and cupcakes for all occasions, freshly made with quality ingredients with no preservatives or artificial flavourings. We also love that their cakes aren’t too sweet – good news for kids’ birthday parties! NB: Monice Bakes is not Halal-certified, but there is no pork or lard in any of the ingredients.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Monice Bakes, 6 Bedok Reservoir View, The Clearwater, Singapore 479234, Tel: (+ 65) 9815 0022, www.monicebakes.com

Plain Vanilla: Affordable birthday cakes

Plain Vanilla makes custom cakes in delectable flavours. Try the Raspberry Vanilla Bean Layer Cake (pictured) filled with raspberry compote, frosted with a vanilla bean buttercream and decorated with fresh raspberries! You can even customise your cake with a hand-piped message and your choice of sprinkles. Chocolate lovers can indulge in the Chocolate Truffle Layer Birthday Cake. Plus, don’t miss their signature cupcakes!

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $42 – $68

Plain Vanilla, multiple locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, ION Orchard, East Coast, www.plainvanilla.com.sg

River Ash Bakery: Character birthday cakes for kids

River Ash Bakery specialises in creating trending cakes and customised birthday cakes for kids and grown-ups. From Frozen to Baby Shark, Pokemon, Mario and more, their birthday cakes are sure to put a smile on your child’s face! If you’re in a pinch, they also offer same-day delivery or collection for selected birthday cake designs.

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $268

River Ash Bakery, The Promenade @ Pelikat, 183 Jalan Pelikat #B1-40 Singapore 537643, Tel: (+65) 8700 3352, riverashbakery.com

Sinsations By Radhika: Elegant birthday cakes

Baking gorgeous cakes in both fondant and buttercream varieties, Radhika is equally adept at making adorable kids’ birthday cakes or elegant floral confections for grown-ups. She offers a variety of delicious cake flavours, including mango, orange ricotta, and Meyer lemon curd, and can also deliver gluten-free, dairy-free, and refined-sugar-free cakes upon request!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Sinsations by Radhika, 139 Cavenagh Road, Singapore 229627, Tel: (+65) 9673 4562 www.sinsationsbyradhika.com

Susucre: 3D birthday cakes

SuSucre has really nailed kids’ birthday cakes (and adult cakes too!). They can literally make anything out of icing, so no request is too silly for your concept. They also offer a wide selection of filling and frosting flavours, and the taste is just as good as the look. Lastly, they’ll deliver your birthday cake to your door at the time they say they will, so you don’t need to stress on party day (any more than you already are!).

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Susucre, 5 Ontario Ave, Singapore 576193, Tel: (+65) 9867 2176, www.susucre.net

Temptations Cakes: Customised 3D birthday cakes

If you’re looking for a 3D birthday cake in Singapore, Temptations, a gourmet bakery in charming Joo Chiat, has a reputation for their delicious special occasion 3D cakes! We’ve had a little peek at their gallery and we’ve seen a few jungle-themed cakes, Captain America’s shield, as well as a variety of Frozen styles. Modern reinventions of classics like a creamy Oreo cheesecake and a fun strawberry shortcake are on the shelves if you don’t have the time for a customised birthday cake.

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $39 – $130

Temptations, 199 Sims Avenue, Singapore 387503, Tel: (+65) 6440 9200, www.temptationscakes.com.sg

Whyzee: 1-hour express same-day delivery

With more than 100 different cake designs to choose from, Whyzee will surely have a cake to suit! One of their biggest perks is their 1-hour express birthday cake delivery that’s perfect for anyone who may have forgotten to order a birthday cake in advance! Chocolate lovers can enjoy indulgent cakes like the Chocolate Praline Cake or the Chocolate Desire Cake, while those looking for something lighter can opt for the Lavender Earl Grey Cake with aromatic lavender cream infused into each layer of the chiffon cake.

Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $48.90 – $188

Whyzee, multiple locations in Singapore including Bugis, Jurong East, Serangoon, Plaza Singapura, www.whyzee.com.sg

Halal Birthday Cakes In Singapore

If you have dietary requirements, or your kiddo can only bring Halal-certified cakes or cupcakes into school, these are the top spots to contact.

All Things Delicious
Cat & The Fiddle
Chocolate Origin
Del’s Sweetness Delights
Fluff Bakery
The Malayan Council
The Royals
Sooperlicious (pictured above)
Swee Heng Bakery
Swensen’s

Gluten-Free Cakes & Dairy-Free Cakes In Singapore

Delcie’s Desserts And Cakes

Known as “The Sensitive Chef”, Delcie launched her business 10 years ago with innovative natural cake recipes that are free of eggs, dairy products, chemicals, and egg-aiding products. Her cakes contain no white cane sugar or honey and are wonderful for diabetics. She also offers specific allergy-free options including soy-free, nut-free, and wheat-free cakes, and even makes a keto cake and special baby cake. She’s basically the go-to cake shop for when you need a ‘free-from’ birthday cake in Singapore!

Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop.

Delcie’s Desserts and Cakes, 34 Whampoa West #01-83, Singapore 330034, Tel: (+65) 6282 2951, www.delcies.com

In addition to the above-mentioned cake shops (The Cake Shop and Sinsations by Radhika), other birthday cake bakeries that specialise in allergen-free alternatives (but with fewer kid-centric customisable options) include Bakening (pictured above) and Oh My Goodness.

Off the Shelf Birthday Cakes in Singapore

Did you leave the party planning to the last minute? Or at least miss the deadline for an OTT custom cake creation? No worries, there are plenty of places to find a birthday cake in Singapore, many of which you can pick up from the shop (some even offer Deliveroo!). With some creative frosting and cake toppers, kiddo will never know the difference (and you’ll have saved yourself some dough!).

Here are some of our fave off-the-shelf cakes in Singapore:

Awfully Chocolate
Bengawan Solo
Cat & The Fiddle
Cedele
Lady M
Marks & Spencer
Polar Cake
PS.Cafe

Good luck with the celebrations!

Read more:

The post Where To Find the Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore: Unicorn Cakes, Ice Cream Cakes, Halal Cakes & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Fab Restaurants To Book For Father’s Day Singapore 2025
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
We’ve got some great suggestions of restaurants to book for Father’s Day in Singapore with special menus for Father’s Day dinner or family brunch! Father’s Day in Singapore is on Sunday 15 June 2025, so mark it down peeps! Aside from awesome gifts for Father’s Day, you can also order Dad’s fave ingredients and get […]

The post Fab Restaurants To Book For Father’s Day Singapore 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve got some great suggestions of restaurants to book for Father’s Day in Singapore with special menus for Father’s Day dinner or family brunch!

Father’s Day in Singapore is on Sunday 15 June 2025, so mark it down peeps! Aside from awesome gifts for Father’s Day, you can also order Dad’s fave ingredients and get cooking at home. But if you’re hoping to outsource the cooking and washing up, then celebrating Father’s Day in Singapore at a restaurant is ideal! We asked lots of sassy Dads for their favourite places to be taken out to for a Father’s Day meal – steak restaurants feature heavily – here are the spots that made our list.

Psssst! Click here if you’re looking for Father’s Day gift ideas!

Best Restaurants For Father’s Day 2025 In Singapore

Little Farms: Papa’s Platter for Father’s Day

It’s all about juicy chargrilled meat and crisp sides at Little Farms this Father’s Day! Papa’s Platter is crafted for sharing between two to three diners, and it’s got everything Dad will love: a 250g chargrilled sirloin steak, tenderloin cubes with garlic crumbs and sticky sambal-glazed short ribs. This hearty platter also comes with crisp wedges, charred broccolini and sweet Dutch carrots.

As with every Little Farms meal, every ingredient is carefully selected to meet their high standards. You can expect to be indulging on premium, grass-fed beef and thoughtfully sourced produce–all free from over 200 harmful additives and rooted in sustainability, flavour and care.

Father’s Day dinner: 14 & 15 June 2025, 5pm onwards
How much: $88++ for Papa’s Platter (serves 2 – 3 pax). Click here to book a table.

Little Farms, various locations including Tanglin Mall, Holland Village & Sentosa Cove, www.littlefarmscafe.com

Crowne Plaza Changi Airport: Dads dine for free at Allora

This Father’s Day, thank Dad for all of his hard work with an indulgent buffet at Allora. Start off with a fresh seafood spread featuring prawns, mud crab, scallops, mussels, lobsters and oysters. Plus, don’t miss the Japanese corner where you can fill your plate with salmon and tuna sashimi, sushi and green tea soba noodles. Savour rich flavours with Braised Porchetta, Beef Ribeye with Mustard and Herbs, and Oven-Roasted Herbal Chicken.

Pasta lovers, make a beeline to the crowd-favourite cheese wheel pasta, and enjoy authentic Mediterranean flavours from the Lamb Shawarma station. For local delights, look forward to Roasted Five-Spice Pork Belly and Fragrant Chicken Rice. No meal is complete without dessert! End off on a sweet note with classic Italian Tiramisu, Black Velvet Cake, New York Cheesecake, Apple Crumble Tart and warm Chocolate Pudding with Vanilla Sauce, in addition to a variety of gelato and sorbets.

Dads dine for free with every two paying adults, and kids aged 6 and below dine for free too! Plus, enjoy 1-for-1 on selected house pours and cocktails during happy hour from 12pm to 7pm.

Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm
How much: $98++ per adult (Dad dines free with a minimum of two paying adults. Do indicate the number of dads in the reservation notes.) & $49++ per child (aged 7 and above). Click here to book a table.

Allora, Crowne Plaza Changi Airport, 75 Airport Boulevard, #01-01, Changi Airport Terminal 3, Singapore 819664, www.changiairport.crowneplaza.com

Read more: Best Buffets In Singapore For The Family

Lawry’s The Prime Rib: Father’s Day five-course meal

Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore is known for their succulent and indulgent prime rib. This Father’s Day, celebrate Dad with an extravagant five-course Father’s Day meal that will leave him brimming with joy. Begin with Grilled Halloumi Cheese with Smoked Duck, and sip on a comforting Roasted Garlic Creme Fraiche soup. Then cleanse your palate with a BerryFruit Sorbet as you prepare for the star of the show.

For your entree, choose from one of three options. The Gentleman’s Choice features Signature Roasted USDA Prime Rib of Beef with Mashed Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding and Whipped Cream Horseradish. The Heirloom Braised Short Ribs comes with a side of Mashed Potato, Roasted Pearl Onions, Broccolini and Pearl Tomatoes. For a lighter entree, opt for Dad’s Sunday Catch featuring Seared Halibut with Crispy Japanese Leeks & Garlic Kale. End your celebration on a sweet note with Grandpa’s Favourite Carrot Cake.

Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 14 & 15 June 2025
How much: $169++ per guest. Click here to book a table.

Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore, 333A Orchard Road, #04-01/31, Singapore 238897, www.lawrys.com.sg

Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore: Father’s Day feast with steak

Does Dad love steak? Book a table this Father’s Day at Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore for the ultimate steakhouse dining experience. Treat Dad to a three-course Father’s Day meal that starts off with 100% USDA Prime Short Rib in French Onion Soup. Then choose from one of two entrees: USDA Prime Black Angus Ribeye Steak served with Mashed Potatoes, White Asparagus and Trio Peppers Sauce or USDA Colorado Lamb Chops served with Mashed Potatoes, White Asparagus and Chimichurri Sauce.

For dessert, indulge in a decadent Pecan and Raisin Pie for a grand finale to your Father’s Day celebration! To complement this meal, top up $24 for The Butcher’s Pour, a blend of Porterhouse-infused vodka and Rittenhouse Rye cocktail. Fancy other alcohol? Check out their Wine Cellar for a carefully curated selection of new and old age bottles. Plus, take home a complimentary Polaroid photo to capture cherished memories with Dad.

Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 11 – 18 June 2025
How much: $168++ per guest. Click here to book a table.

Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore, 1 Nanson Road, Robertson Quay, #02-01 InterContinental Singapore, 238909, www.wolfgangssteakhouse.sg

Read more: Best Steakhouses In Singapore

Edge: Lavish Father’s Day buffet

Book a table at Pan Pacific Singapore’s Edge for a lavish Father’s Day buffet. Start with fresh seafood on ice with highlights such as Snow Crab Leg, Sustainable Boston Lobster, Tiger Prawns and more. Then make a beeline for the Charcoal Barbecue Pit Live Station where you’ll find Marinated Lamb T Bone, Smokey Baby Pork Rib, Garlic Butter Tiger Prawn and more. Other highlights include hand-stretched pizza, local delights Penang Hawker’s live station and an array of sweet treats.

Father’s Day lunch & brunch: 14 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm (lunch) & 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm (brunch)
How much: $128++ per adult & $64++ per child aged 6 and up (Father’s Day Lunch); $158++ per adult & $79++ per child (Father’s Day Brunch). Click here to book a table.

Edge, Pan Pacific Singapore, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595, www.menu-ppsin.panpacific.com

Food Capital: Father’s Day brunch buffet

Celebrate Dad’s unwavering strength with an extravagant international brunch buffet at Food Capital. From fresh seafood on ice including shucked oysters and snow crab legs to hearty protein like Josper-grilled Wagyu Beef Ribeye and a comforting Seafood Stew, this Father’s Day buffet is one for the books! Plus, all fathers will take home a complimentary keepsake framed photograph, a memento of your joyful Father’s Day celebration.

Father’s Day brunch: 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm
How much: From $128++ per adult & $64++ per child aged 6 and up. Click here to book a table.

Food Capital, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663, www.millenniumhotels.com

KWEE ZEEN: Father’s Day seafood dinner

Does Dad love seafood? This one’s for him! Book a table at KWEE ZEEN to treat dad to a Father’s Day seafood buffet spread featuring the best catches of the sea! From fresh seafood on ice to Asian and Western seafood dishes like Singapore Laksa with Slipper Lobster to Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Seafood and more, he’ll be in for a treat. Meat-lovers will enjoy Roasted Ribeye with Roasted Potato, Butter Chicken and more.

Father’s Day brunch: 13 & 14 June 2025, 6pm – 10pm
How much: $140++ for two adults & $88++ per adult. 50% off for kids aged 7 – 12 years old. Complimentary dining for kids aged 6 and below. Click here to book a table.

KWEE ZEEN, Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & Spa, www.sofitel-singapore-sentosa.com

Keep scrolling for more ideas for a fab Father’s Day 2025 celebration!

The post Fab Restaurants To Book For Father’s Day Singapore 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Top Tuition Centres In Singapore 2025 For All Education Levels
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for a top tuition centre in Singapore? We round up established tuition centres in Singapore offering primary school tuition and beyond in key subjects from Maths to English, Science and Chinese If your child is struggling in school, getting extra help from an expert at a top tuition centre in Singapore might help! Whether […]

The post Top Tuition Centres In Singapore 2025 For All Education Levels appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a top tuition centre in Singapore? We round up established tuition centres in Singapore offering primary school tuition and beyond in key subjects from Maths to English, Science and Chinese

If your child is struggling in school, getting extra help from an expert at a top tuition centre in Singapore might help! Whether your child needs tuition in Chinese, English, or Maths or whether you just want your child to have increased confidence in their studies or be better-prepped for preschool, there’s a tuition centre that can help.

With plenty of tuition centres in seemingly every shopping mall, we’ve done the heavy lifting to round up tuition centres in Singapore for all ages. Here are some tips on how to choose a tutor for your child. When searching for a top-ranking tuition centre in Singapore it’s always good to check if the enrichment centre is MOE-registered or operated by MOE Teachers, so you can be sure the tuition centre is best qualified for the subject.

Many tuition centres offer English tuition, creative writing classes, Physics, Chemistry and Biology lessons, as well as Chinese tuition and Maths tuition classes, too. Some even offer online tuition classes for those who want the convenience of learning from home. When considering a tuition centre, ensure the location works for you and ask to do a trial tuition session before purchasing any long-term tuition programs so you and your child can check that the tutor is a good fit.

Read more: All Things Enrichment & Tuition For Kids 

Find a top tuition centre that suits your child’s needs:

TLS Tutorials: Customised lessons to enhance performance

Looking for a tuition centre in Singapore that provides personalised educational support? Thanks to TLS Tutorials’ small class sizes with a maximum of four students, each child receives the attention and guidance they need, so the teachers can address academic challenges and foster a motivating group dynamic and supportive learning experience. Because every child is unique, the tutors at this tuition centre in Singapore take the time to understand each child’s personality, motivations and learning style to craft customised lessons that will enhance comprehension and performance.

By building critical exam skills and techniques, students will not only catch up to their peers but also excel in key topics and areas of weakness. Their experienced tutors are not only experts in the subjects they teach but also continuously update their knowledge to align with the latest educational standards and exam requirements, ensuring the most current and effective educational practices.

Quote 400OFFSASSY to get $400 off if you sign up for one year of classes. Only valid for new customers.

TLS Tutorials, 10 Windstedt Road, Block A, #02-04, Singapore 227977, www.tlstutorials.com

SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA: Learn from award-winning teachers

Looking for subject-specific tutors with more than a decade of experience? SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA is a top tuition centre in Singapore that has been offering effective lessons to Upper Secondary and JC students since 2015. Specialising in Physics, Chemistry, Math and Principles of Accounts (POA), their experienced tutors are former MOE teachers in top IP schools. Some are also established authors of GCE O-level & GCE A-level Physics, Chemistry and Math textbooks and assessment books!

Learning materials here include pictorial notes that simplify complex concepts, and this tuition centre in Singapore updates its study materials frequently to match the latest syllabus. Aside from being recipients of multiple educational awards (even being invited as speakers in conventions!), SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA also boast 80-85% of their students scoring distinctions in the national exams. Each tutor specialises in a subject and is a master of communication and education, so you can rest assured that your child is in good hands. The rates are also reasonable, considering you’re getting a no-frills learning experience at this top tuition centre in Singapore.

Quote SASSYMAMA to get FREE registration.

SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA, multiple locations in Singapore including Bishan, Bukit Timah, Jurong East, Marine Parade, Tel: (+65) 8135 6556, admin@wynnedu.com, www.sgphysics.com

Tutor Next Door: Max 2 – 3 students per class for personalised sessions

Tutor Next Door offers personalised tuition for students from primary school to JC. Regardless of what type of learning support your child needs, they will be inspired to explore, learn and solidify foundational concepts in all subject areas with the help of Tutor Next Door’s experienced and passionate tutors. Tutors are selected not only based on their academic qualifications but also on their character and interpersonal skills to ensure they can engage effectively with the students.

With an exceptionally small student-to-teacher ratio (four students per class for primary levels and two students per class for Secondary 3 to JC), your child will get personalised teaching to help them thrive and excel. From concept-based sessions (summary) to engagement sessions (application) and exam preparation sessions (reviewing past-year papers), Tutor Next Door will help your child reach their academic goals.

Enjoy a 10% discount if you register with friends or siblings. The discount is applicable for both!

Tutor Next Door, 66 East Coast Road, The Flow Building, #05-09, Singapore 428778, Tel or WhatsApp: (+65) 8909 6789, www.tutornextdoor.sg

AGrader Learning Centre: Improvement rate of over 83.4%

Established in 2013, AGrader Learning Centre is one of the most comprehensive tuition centres in Singapore. It offers high-quality English, Mathematics, Science, Chinese and Creative Writing tuition for pre-primary, primary and secondary school levels across 20 convenient locations islandwide. We love that every class size is limited to 12 students, so each child can get personalised attention and have all their questions answered. To date, AGrader has impacted over 30,000 students with an impressive improvement rate of over 83.4%–it’s no wonder they have over 2,200 raving reviews by parents!

In addition to their effective tuition lessons, AGrader students will get free and exclusive access to five EverLoop After-Class Modules: LessonTube for lesson catch-up or revision, Past Year Paper Practice Packs (PYP) to excel in exam formats and answering techniques, Revision Packs to revise on each term’s learnings, Basic Build-Up to strengthen core concepts, and Topical Packs for in-depth topic mastery.

Get complimentary access to extra learning resources for up to three previous levels when your child signs up!

AGrader Learning Centre, multiple locations in Singapore including Yishun, Jurong West and Sengkang, enquiry@agrader.sg, www.agrader.sg

Read more: Best Chinese Tuition Centres In Singapore

EduFirst Learning Centre: Award-winning tuition centre

With over 15 years of experience and more than 20 outlets across Singapore, EduFirst Learning Centre has earned its reputation as one of the top choices for tuition centres in Singapore. They’re also MOE-registered and a proud four-time winner of the Best Enrichment & Learning Schools award. Students can look forward to a comprehensive range of programmes, from tuition, enrichment classes and more. Classes here cater to different age groups, ranging from preschoolers to secondary school students.

Parents will love that this tuition centre offers personalised learning. By identifying individual strengths and weaknesses, EduFirst Learning Centre tailors its teaching methods to support each child’s learning journey. And with small class sizes of just four to eight students, your child will receive the attention they need to excel. Every tutor is carefully selected through a rigorous process, too, ensuring a each child reaches their full potential.

EduFirst Learning Centre, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Bedok and Bukit Timah, www.edufirst.com.sg

The Eton Academy by EtonHouse: MOE-aligned curriculum

The Eton Academy by EtonHouse is part of the distinguished EtonHouse International Education Group, offering English, Maths and Science lessons for children aged 3 to 12 years old (Nursery 1 to Primary 6). Their tutors equip children to succeed by nurturing their innate curiosity and building their confidence. Crafted by a team of teaching specialists, their MOE-aligned curriculum is enriched with engaging, exploratory teaching methods that help foster independent learners and encourage children to think outside the box.

Apart from academic skills, they empower children to find their voice as learners so that children can develop their identity and confidence. This top tuition centre in Singapore values parent-teacher partnerships and emphasises a personalised approach to unlock each child’s full potential, so parents are important players in their child’s progress too! They have five centres islandwide, so you’re sure to find one near you.

The Eton Academy, multiple locations in Singapore: Canberra Plaza, Great World, Sengkang Grand Mall, The Woodleigh Mall and  223@Mountbatten, enquiry@theetonacademy.com.sg, www.theetonacademy.com.sg

Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall

Crucible Tuition Centre: MOE-registered tuition centre in Singapore

This MOE-registered tuition centre in Singapore provides customised tuition classes and small class sizes for primary and secondary school students and Junior College students. Subjects on offer include English tuition and Maths tuition, Physics, Biology, Geography and Chemistry tutoring and IB tuition in Singapore. They also offer online tuition trial lessons so you can get a feel of their teaching techniques.

Crucible Tuition Centre, multiple locations in Singapore, including Serangoon, Tanglin and Buona Vista, www.crucible.com.sg

Edufront Learning Centre: Former MOE teachers

The tutors at Edufront Learning Centre are NIE-qualified and former MOE teachers from top schools, so you can be certain that they will be able to give your child a learning boost to achieve their academic goals. You can sign your child up for PSLE Maths, PSLE Science or PSLE tuition classes.

Edufront Learning Centre, multiple locations in Singapore including Pasir Ris, Choa Chu Kang, and Woodlands, www.edufront.com

Read more: Guide To Mandai ZooSchool

The Edu Experience: Unlimited tuition classes

Looking for unlimited tuition classes? The Edu Experience offers your child access to as many tuition classes as they need. Simply pay one fee and unlock your child’s potential with unlimited tuition classes that promise unlimited growth. Sign up today for English, Math and Science tuition classes in Singapore.

The Edu Experience, 3 Tampines Central 1, #07-02, Tampines Plaza 1, Singapore 529540, www.theeduexperience.com

Eye Level: One-on-one tuition classes

Award-winning Eye Level tuition centre currently enrols more than 2.5 million children ages 4 to 14 at tuition centres within Singapore and worldwide. Covering both Math tuition and English tuition, Eye Level guides students with one-on-one coaching and focuses on their individual needs and abilities.

Eye Level, multiple locations in Singapore including Admiralty, Bukit Panjang, and Novena, www.myeyelevel.com/Singapore

Happy Tutors Learning Centre: Multi-subject tuition centre in Singapore

Happy Tutors Learning Centre offers small group tuition classes across six centres in Singapore. Tuition courses range from English, Maths, Physics and Chemistry to IB and IGCSE tuition. They also offer online tuition classes if your child prefers to take classes from the comfort of your home.

Happy Tutors Learning Centre, multiple locations in Singapore including Jurong West, Bukit Batok and Tiong Bahru, www.happytutors.edu.sg

JustEdu: Science, English and Maths tuition

Covering science, English and Maths tuition in Singapore, JustEdu philosophy is all about fun learning from nurturing, dedicated teachers. Tuition classes start from pre-primary and go right up to Junior College levels.

JustEdu, multiple locations in Singapore including Bukit Gombak, Punggol, and Sembawang, www.justedu.com.sg

Kent Ridge Education: Junior College tuition & multi-subjects

Kent Ridge Education has all sorts of fun tuition classes for children aged 3 and up; English tuition, Physics, Maths tuition in Singapore, E-Mathematics, Higher Chinese and much more. They even offer Junior College tuition classes.

Kent Ridge Education, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Choa Chu Kang and Tiong Bahru, www.krtc.com.sg

Keystone Tutors: Entrance advice for UK schools & universities

This tuition centre helps to advise families on the entrance requirements to UK schools and universities. They provide the unique service of giving families in Singapore access to the UK’s leading private tutors through their online learning platform.

Keystone Tutors, 1 George Street, Singapore 049145, www.keystonetutors.com

Kumon: Math, English & Mandarin tuition centres in Singapore

Kumon is among the most popular Math, English and Mandarin tuition centres in Singapore with programmes for preschool-aged kids and up. With more than 80 tuition centres in Singapore, it’s easy to find a learning centre that is close to you.

Kumon, multiple locations in Singapore including Sembawang, Ang Mo Kio and Serangoon, www.sg.kumonglobal.com

The Learning Lab: Online and in-person tuition

The Learning Lab offers tuition classes at the preschool, primary, secondary and Junior College levels, plus online tuition in Singapore if you’d rather your child learns from home.

The Learning Lab, multiple locations in Singapore including Sengkang, Choa Chu Kang and Thomson Road www.thelearninglab.com.sg

Mavis Tutorial Centre: Tuition centre with 40 years of experience

Mavis Tutorial has been helping students since 1986! With a comprehensive curriculum of English, Writing, Maths, Science, Chinese and Writing, the tutors here help students build the foundation for PSLE, GCE ‘O’ and ‘A’ levels.

Mavis Tutorial, multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Sengkang and Tampines www.mavistutorial.com

Miracle Learning Centre: Maths, Science, Chemistry & Physics tuition

Offering tuition classes for Primary, Secondary and JC students, Miracle Learning Centre helps students through Maths, Science, Chemistry and Physics tuition classes. The experienced tutors simplify complex concepts to help students achieve academic success.

Miracle Learning Centre, 144 Upper Bukit Timah Road, #03-01 Beauty World Centre, Singapore 588177, www.miraclelearningcentre.com

RMSS: Raymond’s Math & Science Studio: Primary, secondary & JC tuition

RMSS specialises in tuition classes for English, Chinese, Math and Science for students in primary school, secondary school and even JC. The tutors here aim to bring out the best in every student through passionate teaching and dedicated guidance.

Raymond’s Math & Science Studio, mutliple locations in Singapore including Bishan, Punggol and Marine Parade, www.rmss.com.sg

SmartLab Education Centre: Interactive, hands-on lessons

This tuition centre offers one-of-a-kind Physics, Chemistry, Biology and Maths tuition in Singapore. They also provide tuition classes for Humanities and Science. Each class is activity- and problem-based, so children can develop essential problem-solving skills. Students will receive well-structured notes, making it easy to revise, highly interactive hands-on lessons and even exam-oriented worksheets with real questions from previous years’ exam papers.

SmartLab Education Centre, multiple locations in Singapore: Bishan, Marine Parade and Woodlands, www.smartlab.com.sg

The Science Academy: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry & Biology tuition

With an emphasis on rationality, numeracy, and the spirit of inquiry, The Science Academy aims to impart advanced skills in Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and Biology. Lessons cater to students in Primary 5 (Science) up to Junior College 2 (Science and Math). Group settings are the default for all tuition classes here, but you can also choose private, one-on-one classes if your child requires more attention.

The Science Academy, two locations in Singapore including Toa Payoh and Tampines, www.thescienceacademy.sg

Stalford Learning Centre: English, Mathematics, Chinese & exam-prep

With tuition classes for Preschool, Primary, Secondary and JC students, Stalford Learning Centre provides a helping hand for kids who need a learning boost. The centre offers courses for multiple subjects including English, Mathematics, Chinese and even exam-prep courses for older students.

Stalford Learning Centre, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Sengkang and Choa Chu Kang, www.stalford.edu.sg

The Think Tank: Tuition centre for preschoolers and up

This tuition centre is all about growing inquisitive, independent and informed learners, starting at preschool right on up through secondary. The curriculum approach is holistic, structured, and child-centred, and you can sign up for English, Chinese or Maths tuition and much more.

The Think Tank, 25 Binjai Park, Singapore 589829, www.thethinktank.sg

Wonderlit: English tuition centre with speech and drama programmes

This English tuition centre in Singapore empowers students to find their own voice and transform the way they read, write and speak the English language. The curriculum encompasses literacy (phonics and reading), communication skills (writing and public speaking), and speech & drama programmes that meet internationally recognised certifications, as well as fulfilling the demands of syllabuses in Singapore schools.

Wonderlit, 442 Orchard Road, #03-08 to #03-12, Claymore Connect, Singapore 238879, www.wonderlitworld.com

Boutique Education: Online and home-based tuition

Boutique Education offers online and home-based tuition services across English, Maths, Mandarin and Science. With a focus on international school students (they’ve served thousands of families in Singapore!), they offer tailor-made lessons that are engaging for children. Their team of experienced tutors have a wide range of skills but all share the same goal to instil the love of learning in their students.

Boutique Education, 9 Mohamed Sultan Road, #02-01, Singapore 238959, www.boutiqueeducation.asia

Smiletutor: Home tutors for preschools, JC, special needs & more

Want a reliable home tutor who can offer English, Maths, and Chinese tuition as well as academic help for writing, science and more? The friendly home tutors at this tuition centre in Singapore offer lessons for a variety of subjects from preschool right up to Junior College, and can also tutor students enrolled in special needs schools, IGSCE  and International Baccalaureate (IB) schools, as well as AEIS, polytechnic and university programmes.

SmileTutor, 21 Bukit Batok Crescent, #22-76, Singapore 658065, ww.smiletutor.sg

Read more: Best Music Schools in Singapore

Scroll through our list to find other educational activities and lessons for your little ones

The post Top Tuition Centres In Singapore 2025 For All Education Levels appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: This Bali Resort Has A 17,000sqft Kids’ Playground & Exclusive Perks For Guests
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
RIMBA by AYANA introduces the new RIMBA Jungle Adventure, a massive playground spanning over 17,000sqft. With access to all of AYANA Bali’s resort facilities and stunning cliffside views, here’s why you should plan your next family vacay here. Holidaying with the kids always brings about two big questions: What’s fun for the kids? And how […]

The post This Bali Resort Has A 17,000sqft Kids’ Playground & Exclusive Perks For Guests appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
RIMBA by AYANA introduces the new RIMBA Jungle Adventure, a massive playground spanning over 17,000sqft. With access to all of AYANA Bali’s resort facilities and stunning cliffside views, here’s why you should plan your next family vacay here.

Holidaying with the kids always brings about two big questions: What’s fun for the kids? And how do the adults get to squeeze in their own fun? Well, we can attest that you can check both boxes off at AYANA Bali. Tucked away on a cliff overlooking Jimbaran Bay, AYANA Bali comprises a cluster of four award-winning luxury resorts. Stay at any of these resorts and you’ll get access to the facilities of all four resorts, which is why you’ll never run out of things to do here.

Now, the resort introduces its latest addition: the massive RIMBA Jungle Adventure at RIMBA by AYANA, with a playground that spans over 17,000sqft. With rates from $226/night*, here’s why this resort makes a failproof getaway for the family:

*Rate based on the lowest nightly rate during the summer 2025 season at the time of writing.

New indoor & outdoor playgrounds for young explorers
