The post This App Gives You Access To 1-For-1 Dining, Activities & More For The Ultimate Savings Hack appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for budget-friendly ways to enjoy your favourite food and activities? The ENTERTAINER app offers 1-for-1 deals on dining, activities, and more, so you can create memories that are easy on your wallet.

With the cost of living on the rise, you might be scouring for ways to work within your budget while making memories with the kids. Thankfully, the ENTERTAINER app makes all this possible. This go-to dining and lifestyle app spotlights fabulous 1-for-1 deals from your favourite restaurants, spas, salons, gyms, and activity centres so you can still enjoy great food, fun activities, and quality family time with good value for money. Read on to find out what’s in store for you:

Read more: Best Singapore Deals & Promos: 1-For-1 Dining, Promo Codes & More 

Get access to thousands of 1-for-1 offers

With the ENTERTAINER app, you get access to unbeatable deals across Singapore right at your fingertips. Beyond featuring buy-one-get-one deals, this app also tracks how much you save. Whether you’re planning a lunch out, a yoga and coffee morning with a friend, or a much-needed spa break, you’ll know exactly how much you’re saving—no hidden costs, no surprises. Plus, you can look forward to monthly bonus offers and keep an eye out for new outlets that are added weekly.

Looking for weekend activities with the kids? You can get 1-for-1 deals on family-friendly spots such as BOUNCE, Forest Adventures and Polliwogs at VivoCity, so everyone can join in the fun. When tummies start to grumble, look out for deals on your favourite restaurants, including PAUL Bakery, Harry’s, Plain Vanilla, Mo & Jo Sourdough Burgers and more.

For date night, book a table at premium restaurants like Ginkyō by Kinki, Bedrock Origin, Noa by Olivia, Les Bouchons Rochester and more to enjoy quality time without the hefty price tag.

Download the ENTERTAINER app for big savings

Ready to enjoy life while living within your budget? Download the ENTERTAINER app today for just $72 for the whole year, so you can always return to your favourite restaurants and discover new spots while making the most of every dollar you spend. Plus, you can add up to three family members to your account, so everyone can enjoy the benefits.

Whether you’re planning a family day out or a romantic date night with your partner, the ENTERTAINER empowers you to make memories without spending more than you need to.

Quote SASSYSAVER at checkout to get $20 off your annual subscription (U.P. $72).

The ENTERTAINER, www.theentertainerme.com

The post This App Gives You Access To 1-For-1 Dining, Activities & More For The Ultimate Savings Hack appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: International School News 2025: New Academic Offerings, Student Achievements, Educational Facilities & More
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Get up to speed with what’s happening at SG’s top international schools with our 2025 school news updates! Last year was a standout year for international school students, with numerous achievements in academics and international competitions. Schools also introduced exciting new educational facilities and programmes aimed at enhancing the learning experience and offering students more […]

The post International School News 2025: New Academic Offerings, Student Achievements, Educational Facilities & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Get up to speed with what’s happening at SG’s top international schools with our 2025 school news updates!

Last year was a standout year for international school students, with numerous achievements in academics and international competitions. Schools also introduced exciting new educational facilities and programmes aimed at enhancing the learning experience and offering students more opportunities beyond the classroom. Looking ahead to 2025, many international schools are eager to roll out even more exciting developments, including new Senior Schools, outdoor learning initiatives, and a host of innovative programmes!

Read more: Guide to the Best International Schools in Singapore

International School News May 2025:

XCL World Academy: Upcoming early & primary years building & new outdoor learning programme

News: New Early & Primary Years building opening in 2025 + New ‘Little Xplorers’ Outdoor Learning programme

XCL World Academy (XWA) is known for its strong academic outcomes, outstanding IBDP scores, and a warm, close-knit community. They’re also one of the first international schools in Singapore to comprehensively integrate AI education into the curriculum, offering programmes such as the AI Surestart programme, covering AI fundamentals, machine learning, and ethics. This year, they’ve introduced the new ‘Little Xplorers’ Outdoor Learning programme, where students get to enjoy hands-on exploration, nurturing creativity, teamwork, and a lifelong passion for discovery in an outdoor setting.

Later this year, the school will also launch its new Early & Primary Years building, which was purposefully designed to spark curiosity and joy. The building will feature age-appropriate science labs, dedicated dining areas, and exclusive outdoor learning spaces. Explore the campus, meet the school’s academic leaders and learn about how their International Baccalaureate programmes and innovative approach are designed to empower future-ready learners at the Open House! Contact the admissions team at 6230 4230 or admissions@xwa.edu.sg to book your slot today.

XCL World Academy, 2 Yishun Street 42, Singapore 768039, Tel: (+65) 6230 4230, www.xwa.edu.sg

La Petite Ecole in Singapore: Selected as a finalist for the Palmes de l’EFE 2025

News: Selected as a finalist for the prestigious Palmes de l’EFE 2025

La Petite Ecole offers a unique co-teaching approach, allowing seamless and frequent transitions between French, Mandarin, and English. Rooted in the core values of the French Republic, its rigorous academic programmes nurture independence, critical thinking, and a lifelong love of learning, where children can thrive in a multilingual world.

This year, La Petite Ecole has been selected as a finalist for the Palmes de l’EFE 2025! With 291 applications from 181 schools worldwide, this prestigious award celebrates the dedication, innovation, and excellence of French schools across the globe. The school’s nomination in the “Linguistic Promotion and/or Openness to the Host Country” category recognises its French-English-Mandarin co-teaching programme, which begins as early as 2 years old in kindergarten. Enrollment is now open for the September 2025 intake. La Petite Ecole will also be welcoming its first cohort of Grade 5 students, completing the full journey through Primary School.

Enjoy 30% off on first-time enrolment fees until 30 May 2025!

La Petite Ecole in Singapore, 7 Holland Village Way, #07-02 to 06, Tower B, Singapore 275748, www.lpesingapore.com

Chatsworth International School: Student-led conference and Primary Expresstival

News: A Successful Student-Led Conference and Upcoming Primary Expresstival

Each year, Primary students at Chatsworth International School look forward to taking the lead at Student-Led Conferences (SLCs), where they celebrate their learning, reflect on their growth, and showcase their achievements to their parents, and its March 2025 edition was no exception. SLCs also provide a valuable opportunity for parents to gain deeper insight into their child’s learning process and progress. Students select and present a piece of work that they feel best represents their growth, demonstrating ownership of their learning and a strong sense of responsibility.

As the school year draws to a close this June, the Primary Expresstival will celebrate student learning and self-expression. A highlight of the week is the highly anticipated Sing and Dance Off competition, where all Primary students are encouraged to express themselves and build confidence. Throughout the week, there will also be displays of student work and celebrations of their units of inquiry, with parents warmly invited to join as audience members or even participate in the various activities.

Chatsworth International School, 72 Bukit Tinggi Rd, Singapore 289760, Tel: (+65) 6463 3201, www.chatsworth.com.sg

Australian International School: New Creative Hub and Examination & Exhibition Centre

News: Launched Creative Hub in March 2025 + Orchid Hall, a purpose-built Examination and Exhibition Centre

The Australian International School (AIS) successfully launched its state-of-the-art Creative Hub in March 2025, designed to spark hands-on exploration and creative thinking. Students will get access to opportunities to innovate across Design, Technology, Music and the Culinary Arts. From high-tech design studios to fully equipped kitchens and specialised creative spaces, students are encouraged to experiment, ideate, and bring their visions to life in an inspiring real-world environment.

AIS has also introduced Orchid Hall, a purpose-built Examination and Exhibition Centre. This multi-functional space offers a focused environment for academic assessments while also serving as a gallery to showcase the exceptional work of AIS student artists. AIS continues to set new benchmarks in international education, empowering students to excel academically, socially, and emotionally in a future-focused learning environment. These values are further amplified by their extensive range of world-class facilities, including the Early Learning Village: The largest purpose-built early childhood facility in Singapore, its multiple sports facilities such as swimming pools, fitness studios, a 300-seat theatre and more. Plus, students have over 300 CCAs on campus to choose from! Read more here.

 Australian International School, 1 Lorong Chuan Singapore 556 818, Tel: 6517 0247, www.ais.com.sg

Read more: Guide To International Schools In Singapore

Astor International School: Open House in May 2025

News: Open House on 31 May 2025

Astor International School is a boutique international primary school that offers a personalised education for children aged 5 to 12 (Years 1 to 7). Established in 2019, Astor was founded on the belief that every child is unique and that education should reflect that. With small class sizes capped at 20 students and a low teacher-to-student ratio, the school provides a nurturing environment where children are supported to grow academically, socially, and emotionally.

As a close-knit, community-based school, Astor focuses on developing lifelong learners with a genuine passion for knowledge. The curriculum is designed to be both engaging and accessible, with a strong emphasis on individualised learning and holistic development. Astor also stands out for offering quality international education at an affordable price, with annual fees starting from just $16,900! Discover what makes Astor different at their upcoming Open House on Saturday, 31 May 2025. You’ll get to explore the campus, meet the team, and more.

Mention Sassymama on your admissions form to get an admissions fee waiver for 2025-2026 academic year! Promotion is valid until 14 June 2025. Terms and conditions apply.

Astor International School, 1 Kay Siang Road, #05-01/02, Singapore 248922, www.astor.edu.sg

Brighton College (Singapore): Year 10 IGCSE programme and upcoming A-Level courses

News: Launch of Year 10 IGCSE programme in August 2025 + Upcoming A-Level courses

Brighton College (Singapore) offers an exceptional foundation for learners aged 18 months to 15 years, underpinned by a school culture built on three key pillars: curiosity, confidence, and kindness. In line with its commitment to academic excellence, the College is excited to announce the launch of its Year 10 IGCSE programme, beginning in August 2025. This marks a significant milestone in Brighton’s continued growth and dedication to shaping bright, ambitious young minds. The internationally recognised IGCSE curriculum is designed to ignite a lifelong love of learning, encouraging pupils to think critically and explore their unique strengths. With a wide range of subjects and the flexibility to personalise their academic journeys, students will be equipped with the skills and confidence to thrive in a rapidly changing world.

Following the IGCSEs, the College will introduce A-Level courses, completing its full academic pathway and ensuring pupils are exceptionally well-prepared for entry into the world’s leading universities.Brighton College (Singapore) is now accepting applications for Year 10 IGCSE Academic Scholarships! Successful applicants will enjoy up to 50% off tuition fees, exclusive membership in the Brighton Scholars’ Society, and access to enrichment programmes designed to foster confidence and academic excellence.

Brighton College (Singapore), 1 Chuan Lane, Singapore 554299, Tel: (+65) 6505 9790, www.brightoncollege.edu.sg 

Canadian International School (CIS): Academy of Music programme

News: CIS Academy of Music programme + Scholarships in Academics, Performing Arts, and Athletics

The Canadian International School’s (CIS) Academy of Music programme is designed to provide a dynamic and enriching musical education. The programme features advanced training and world-class performance opportunities that set students up for success on the global stage. Students in the programme have performed at prestigious venues such as Marina Bay Sands for the Andrew Lloyd Webber Symphonic Gala alongside internationally renowned artists. They also benefit from masterclasses conducted by Yamaha Music School and faculty from leading conservatories, gaining mentorship from some of the world’s top musicians. Students also enjoy access to global opportunities, including international competitions and an exclusive summer music programme at the renowned Berklee College of Music in Boston.

To celebrate student achievements, CIS recently launched its inaugural scholarships in Academics, Performing Arts, and Athletics. These scholarships are designed to recognise outstanding ability and provide opportunities for students to reach new heights. With recent university placements at top conservatories including Berklee College of Music and the Royal Academy of Music, the CIS Academy of Music is fast becoming the gateway for the next generation of musical talent.

Canadian International School, Lakeside Campus: 7 Jurong West Street 41, Singapore 649414, Tel: (+65) 6467 1732, www.cis.edu.sg

EtonHouse International School: Celebrating 30 years of quality education across Asia

News: 30th anniversary of providing quality education across Asia + new Nursery 1 class at EtonHouse International School Broadrick

2025 marks a huge milestone for EtonHouse International Education Group as it celebrates 30 years of delivering quality education across Asia! Etonhouse started with just 30 students in a single school, and today, it has grown into a global education group with over 100 schools in 9 countries. Excitingly, EtonHouse International School Broadrick will launch a brand-new Nursery 1 class from August 2025! The school is also proud to celebrate the achievements of its Year 11 students, who have been accepted into the prestigious John Locke Institute programme, affiliated with Oxford and Princeton Universities. Set to take place in Singapore this December, the programme empowers bright young minds to stretch their academic and intellectual boundaries.

In other news, Sixth Form students at Etonhouse have been kept busy with service projects through the EtonCore programme, collaborating with organisations like ACRES, Thye Hua Kwan Nursing Home, and EtonHouse International Pre-School Claymore. These projects include supporting wildlife conservation, engaging with the elderly and mentoring younger children, and more, where students gain invaluable real-world experience while building empathy, leadership, and a deep sense of social responsibility outside of the classroom. The EtonCore programme at EtonHouse International School Orchard also provides senior school students with a holistic education through key elements such as the externally accredited Extended Project Qualification, the Duke of Edinburgh Award, community service projects, partnerships and residential programmes for real-world experiences, and collaborations with other overseas schools. This comprehensive approach fosters student agency, growth, and future-ready skills while enhancing students’ CVs for university admissions.

EtonHouse is offering enrolment promotions at selected campuses, with savings of up to $1,300 until 3 June 2025! Families can join an Experience Day on 14 or 24 May or book a tour to find out more. Register here.

EtonHouse International School Orchard, 10 Tanglin Road, Singapore 247908, Tel: (+65) 6513 1155, www.etonhouse.edu.sg/orchard

EtonHouse International School Broadrick, 51 Broadrick Road Singapore 439501, Tel: (+65) 6346 6922, www.etonhouse.edu.sg/broadrick

Holland International School: New second language options

News: New second language options

With over 100 years of experience, Holland International School offers education for children aged 1.5 to 12 years old. Inspired by the International Primary Curriculum (IPC), Holland International School offers both Dutch and English streams, with second language options in Dutch, French, and Mandarin. The school’s new second language offerings – French and Mandarin – will be launching this August!

This expansion aims to empower students to connect across cultures and thrive in an international world. Students can choose English or Dutch as their primary language, and preschoolers will take Mandarin as their second language. Interested to learn more? Join their upcoming Open Houses on 26 April, 9 May, or 21 June to explore the new offerings, dive into the curriculum, meet the school staff, and more! Register early to secure your spot here.

Holland International School, 65 Bukit Tinggi Road, Singapore 289757, Tel: (+65) 6466 0662, www.hollandinternationalschool.sg

International Community School: Career Days and Advanced Learning Opportunities

News: Career Days + Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth (CTY) programme

In line with its commitment to providing enriching, future-focused learning experiences, ICS recently launched its first-ever Middle and High School Career Days, which gave students exposure to a wide range of professions through interactive talks and breakout sessions led by industry experts. Students connected with professionals across diverse fields such as aviation, healthcare and more. Students also had the opportunity to ask meaningful questions and explore different career paths.

At the Elementary level, ICS also introduced the Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth (CTY) programme, offering two advanced academic courses for students in Grades 3 to 5: Household Chemistry and the Young Reader’s Series. These globally recognised programmes allow advanced learners to dive deeper into science and literature through innovative, hands-on learning experiences. Whether conducting experiments in the kitchen or exploring literary themes through engaging texts, students are developing critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills from an early age.

Enjoy $500 off application fees when you apply to ICS within a month of the Virtual Open House!

International Community School, 27A Jubilee Road, Singapore 128575, Tel: (+65) 6776 7435, www.ics.edu.sg

International French School (IFS): New kindergarten campus

News: New kindergarten campus to open September 2025

A brand-new IFS Kindergarten campus is set to open in September 2025! This upcoming campus will integrate eco-conscious innovations that minimise environmental impact while creating an inspiring, nurturing environment for young learners. One of its standout features is that it will be 100% solar-powered. Its Climate-Optimised Architecture includes low-emissivity double-glazed windows that block heat and UV rays while maximising natural daylight. These elements work hand-in-hand with intelligent cooling systems to ensure a comfortable learning environment in Singapore’s tropical climate, all while keeping energy consumption low.

The campus will also incorporate an Integrated Water Management System, capturing 100% of rainwater and passing it through a biomimetic purification process, which will, in turn, nourish the campus greenery with minimal environmental impact. Designed with a beautiful villa concept, the new campus will feature clusters of four spacious classrooms interconnected by a central communal area. At the heart of it all is a child-centric educational philosophy that emphasises autonomy, responsibility, emotional security, and social development. This approach supports each child’s individual rhythm of growth, helping them build confidence, independence, collaborative skills, and a lifelong love of learning.

International French School, 3000 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 3, Singapore 569928, Tel: (+65) 6805 0000, www.ifs.edu.sg

 

Middleton International School: National Youth Achievement Awards and student-led initiatives

News: Students achieve Silver Award in the National Youth Achievement Award + Middleton Reads

Middleton International School is proud to celebrate the achievements of two of its students – Grade 12’s Shreya Charpe and Grade 11’s Arielle Mascarenhas – who have been awarded the prestigious Silver Award in the National Youth Achievement Award (NYAA). This respected youth development programme builds resilience, leadership, and community service. From early morning volunteering at soup kitchens to leading sustainability projects–such as advocating for plastic-free living and launching a school composting initiative–Shreya and Arielle have gone above and beyond. Their efforts reflect a strong sense of purpose and social responsibility, turning classroom learning into meaningful real-world impact. The NYAA programme aligns with Middleton’s core values of resilience, responsibility, and mindfulness, while also helping students build robust portfolios for university and beyond.

Beyond NYAA, another student-led initiative, Middleton Reads, has been started by Grade 12 student Shalibeth Tiffany. The sustainable book-sharing platform is inspired by a simple yet powerful question: “What if students could get the books they want from fellow readers?” Designed to promote reading and reduce waste, the initiative enables students to exchange books within the school community. The school quickly embraced the idea, providing promotional support, mentorship, and a dedicated on-campus space to house the book exchange. What began as a personal project has blossomed into a vibrant, school-wide literacy movement. Fuelled by its success, Shalibeth expanded the initiative into School Reads and SG Reads. Her story has even been featured in the news!

Middleton International School, 2 Tampines Street 92, Singapore 528889, www.middleton.edu.sg

Nexus International School (Singapore): Year 9 Community Project Fair, international competitions

News: Innovative ideas at the Year 9 Community Project Fair + Achievements at international competitions

Nexus International School (Singapore) fosters an entrepreneurial mindset defined by initiative, confidence, and the drive to innovate and become changemakers. This is reflected across its curriculum and learner projects. At the Year 9 Community Project Fair, learners tackled real-world issues like ocean preservation and elderly support, turning ideas into action. Learner leaders also met with Mr. BK Gan, President of Taylor’s Schools, to present sustainability initiatives such as food waste reduction. This showcases how they are encouraged to think critically and contribute meaningfully to their community.

In the past year, Nexus learners have continued to stand out in competitions. At the Junior Achievement Company of the Year (JA COY), teams Greentopia and OjO showed strong leadership and innovation, with Greentopia advancing to the regional finals in Japan. Nexus science teams were named Grand Champions at Science Castle Asia 2024 in Malaysia and went on a study tour in Japan. At the Lenovo Hackathon, Nexus teams secured 1st and 3rd place with solutions in sustainable tech. These achievements reflect how Nexus equips learners to turn ideas into real-world impact.

Nexus International School (Singapore), 1 Aljunied Walk, Singapore 387293, www.nexus.edu.sg

Sir Manasseh Meyer International School: Overseas trips to Thailand and Vietnam

News: Overseas trips for Secondary School students + Service-learning activities

At SMMIS, the annual Overseas Service Journey is a highlight for Secondary School students. Each trip is designed to broaden perspectives, foster empathy, and encourage students to discover the world around them. During the trip to Northern Thailand, students visited an orphanage, taught English at a local school, explored the famed Tham Luang Caves, and cared for elephants at an Ethical Elephant Sanctuary. Students also enjoyed breathtaking hikes, bike rides, zip lining, waterfalls, and a visit to the Night Market. More importantly, students gain a deeper understanding of their role in healing the world.

In Vietnam, students spent time at the Village of Hope, where they painted classrooms, planted gardens, and worked alongside local children and teachers to improve the school environment. It was a heartwarming exchange of cultures and kindness, made even more memorable by creating handmade gifts for the children they met. These overseas trips are a reflection of SMMIS values – teamwork, global citizenship, community responsibility, and service. For students who remain in Singapore, they take part in service-learning experiences. From sports to the arts, students engage in local initiatives that build leadership, empathy, and a strong sense of social responsibility. Last year, they partnered with Waterway Watch to clean up local waterways and participated in inclusive sports activities, learning how young people with physical challenges experience play and competition.

Receive subsidies worth up to $4,000! Terms and conditions apply. Speak to Sir Manasseh Meyer International School’s Admissions Representative for more details.

Sir Manasseh Meyer International School, 3 Jalan Ulu Sembawang, Singapore 758932, www.smmis.edu.sg

SJI International Preschool: Newly completed campus

News: Newly completed Shalom House + Monthly Open Houses

SJI International Preschool has recently unveiled its recently completed Shalom House, which is a thoughtfully designed preschool space nestled in greenery and offers a calm, nurturing setting where young learners can flourish. SJI International Preschool also prides itself on its inclusive international community, welcoming both local and expat families of all faiths and backgrounds into a warm and supportive space. SJI International Preschool now hosts Monthly Open Houses where families are invited to discover the school’s offerings, curriculum and more.

The school’s holistic, child-led approach encourages real-world learning, collaboration, and a deep love for discovery. Character development is at the heart of the preschool experience, guided by The Virtues Project: a globally recognised framework that helps children build strong self-esteem and the values they need to thrive in an increasingly global world. Learning extends far beyond the classroom, with sustainable outdoor experiences such as urban farming, which not only connect children to nature but also foster environmental awareness in support of Singapore’s Green Plan 2030.

SJI International Preschool, 49A Holland Road Singapore 258850, www.sji-internationalpreschool.com.sg

Tanglin Trust School: Launch of Tanglin Highlands Programme

News: The Tanglin Highlands Programme is live!

Tanglin Trust School has marked a major educational milestone with the official launch of the Tanglin Highlands Programme, a four-week immersive learning experience for Year 9 students at the school’s new 15-acre campus in Gippsland, Australia. Tanglin’s CEO, Craig Considine explained, “Preparing young people for an unpredictable future requires educational experiences beyond traditional models. The Tanglin Highlands Programme demonstrates our collective belief in the power of adaptation and innovation in education.”

The first cohort of students is now enjoying life at Tanglin Gippsland, embracing the immersive Highlands Programme with a true adventurous spirit. Alongside daily classes, students have limited access to devices and are thriving in this unique natural environment. With a focus on outdoor pursuits and communal living, they are sharing responsibilities, trying new experiences, and embarking on overnight expeditions in the stunning Australian outdoors. Each day, they are building curiosity, community, and confidence – the core values at the heart of the Highlands Programme.

Tanglin Trust School, 95 Portsdown Road, Singapore 139299, Tel: (+65) 6778 0771, www.tts.edu.sg

Read more: Guide To International Schools In Singapore

The Perse School: New Senior School in August 2025

News: Newly Senior School to launch in August 2025

The Perse School (Singapore) is an international school for students from Nursery to Senior School. Surrounded by nature, the campus features modern classrooms, dedicated arts, music, and drama spaces, and extensive outdoor facilities. In August 2025, The Perse School (Singapore) will expand its academic offering with the launch of specialist teaching for Years 7 to 9 in its newly introduced Senior School. This development builds on the school’s strong academic foundation and close ties with The Perse School in Cambridge, a leading UK institution with over 400 years of educational excellence.

With a focus on academic rigour, intellectual curiosity, and holistic development, The Perse School (Singapore) mirrors the teaching philosophy and pastoral care of its Cambridge counterpart. Its leadership team includes experienced educators from the UK, ensuring consistency in values and quality of learning across both campuses. Students enjoy subjects like entrepreneurship, robotics, coding, and global perspectives. This approach equips students with the knowledge and skills necessary to thrive in an ever-evolving world. There are over 50 extracurricular activities available, including sports, arts, and STEM clubs. In addition, the strong language programme at The Perse School (Singapore) offers Mandarin, Japanese, and an immersive bilingual Mandarin-English programme from Nursery onwards, with French introduced from Year 3.

The Perse School (Singapore), 58 Chestnut Drive, Singapore 679301, (+65) 6233 2183,  www.perse.edu.sg 

The Winstedt School: New Young Explorers Programme

News: Young Explorers Programme for Year 1 and Year 2 students

This year, The Winstedt School introduced the Young Explorers Programme (YEP), specially designed for students in Years 1 and 2 (Early Years). Created for children who may benefit from additional support in accessing the foundational curriculum, the programme offers a nurturing and structured learning environment tailored to each child’s needs. With a small class size of just eight students to two teachers, and additional guidance from a Behavioural Therapist and School Psychologist, students benefit from highly individualised attention and care. The YEP also integrates a holistic Exploration and Life Skills component. This includes the teaching of executive functioning skills, and embedded Occupational Therapy and Speech and Language Therapy. Social and Emotional Learning is also woven throughout the programme, supporting the development of empathy, collaboration, and inclusivity among peers.

Alongside the launch of YEP, The Winstedt School has also updated its Vision, Mission, and Values to better reflect its inclusive approach and commitment to innovative education. The school’s new mission is to provide equity in education through innovative teaching and learning. Its vision is to create inclusive education for those who think and learn differently. Underpinning this are Winstedt’s refreshed values: Creativity – Thinking beyond the ordinary; Courage – Facing your challenges with purpose; Excellence – Being empowered learners who strive to do their best; Respect – Being kind while appreciating others’ values and beliefs; Resilience – Staying determined and strong through setbacks

Enjoy a 50% early bird discount on enrolment fees for all Early Years programmes (Year 1, Year 2 and YEP) when you enrol by 1 June 2025!

The Winstedt School, 1208 Upper Boon Keng Road, Singapore 387312, www.winstedt.edu.sg

Do you have some interesting school news to share? Send it to our team at partnerships@sassymamasg.com 

Read more:

The post International School News 2025: New Academic Offerings, Student Achievements, Educational Facilities & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Find Party Entertainers & Party Planners In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Find birthday party entertainers and hire a fab party planner in Singapore with a little help from our ultimate 2025 party planning guide! Looking for a party planner in Singapore to create the most fabulous birthday party for your kiddo? If you’re thinking of hosting it at home, there’s a lot to think about from […]

The post Where To Find Party Entertainers & Party Planners In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Find birthday party entertainers and hire a fab party planner in Singapore with a little help from our ultimate 2025 party planning guide!

Looking for a party planner in Singapore to create the most fabulous birthday party for your kiddo? If you’re thinking of hosting it at home, there’s a lot to think about from the birthday cake (homemade or store-bought), to party invites, entertainment or party games. There’s also the dilemma of whether to do party bags or not (these ethical party favours are a good middle ground!). It’s no wonder that many of us like to outsource the whole thing with a cool birthday venue or hire a party planner extraordinaire! We’ve rounded up a list of party entertainers and party planners in Singapore, because sometimes, a little professional help can take your kid’s party up a notch without having the extra stress on your shoulders!

 Read more: Best Kids’ Birthday Party Venues

Jump to:
Party Planners in Singapore
Party Entertainers in Singapore

Where to Find Party Planners in Singapore

Jellybean Party: Hassle-free birthday party packages 

Jellybean Party has been putting smiles on kids’ faces at birthday parties since 2010! An in-demand kids’ party planner in Singapore, Jellybean Party’s team of professional entertainers not only wow the kids with award-winning magic shows but also provide bouncy castles, party rentals and more. Their hassle-free birthday party packages are a godsend for busy mamas and a vendor of choice for many fortune 500 companies. It’s no wonder they have raving reviews!

With a variety of options for different age groups, you’re sure to find one that your child will love. Choose from their signature magic shows, pool parties, NERF celebrations and and more, all of which come with fuss-free fringe activities like balloon sculpting, face painting and live caricatures. They even offer party entertainers and hosts, party games, birthday decorations and fun-filled goodie bags. Jellybean Party is truly a one-stop shop for an unforgettable birthday party.

Jellybean Party, www.jellybeanparty.sg

Party Heart: Kids’ party entertainment & decorations

A one-stop kids’ party planner and entertainment service, Party Heart has everything imaginable to put a big smile on your child’s face. The team strives to be the heart of your party with entertainment options such as magic shows, balloon sculpting and face-painting, plus a ton of high-energy activities and games to keep every guest occupied throughout the party.

Need a little help getting the party planning started? Party Heart can help you pick out the right entertainment according to your child’s interests, and can even supply added touches such as popcorn, candy floss, piñatas, and awesome party decorations. Better still, you can even hire their photographer to capture all the best moments of the day! They come highly recommended – just read their Google reviews to see what other parents have to say. Party packages start from just $150.

Party Heart, enquiry@partyheart.com.sg, Tel: +65 9736 8494, www.partyheart.com.sg

Daisy Entertainment: Themed birthday party decorations

Bespoke party planners in Singapore, Daisy Entertainment comes complete with unique birthday party decorations, birthday cakes, entertainment, photography, catering and more. They’re especially good at kids’ birthdays and also do a mean dessert table with special spreads to add sparkle to any party!

Daisy Entertainment, Tel: (+65) 8181 6482, www.instagram.com/daisyentertainment

Electric Dreamz: Experienced event planner in Singapore

This event organiser in Singapore isn’t just skilled at handling kids’ birthday parties; they can also do VIP or private parties, pool parties, weddings and much more. They claim to keep costs low and service quality high and offer every party service imaginable, from lights and venue rental to table and chairs and other party supplies in Singapore too.

Electric Dreamz, Tel: (+65) 8586 0502, www.electricdreamz.com

Fizazzle: Themed kids’ birthday party planner

Fizazzle’s party planning services in Singapore are almost legendary, as they can transform any venue with their stunning birthday party decorations. Fizazzle can also help source party entertainers in Singapore and performance artists. Whether you want clowns, stilt-walkers, Disney princesses or Harry Potter at your child’s party, this party planner can customise your party to suit your needs, whatever the occasion.

Fizazzle, Tel: (+65) 8121 4922, www.fizazzle.com

Hip Hip Hooray: Party planner with bouncy castle rental

Hip Hip Hooray is a party planner in Singapore that offers a variety of party packages for kids aged 1 to 12 years old. Look forward to bouncy castles, kiddy rides, ball pits, bubble makers and more. Plus, you can even hire a balloonist and face painter to add to the birthday party fun!

Hip Hip Hooray, Tel: (+65) 8889 8706, hiphiphooray.com.sg

Mr. Bottle’s Kids Party: One-stop kids’ party planner

Mr. Bottle’s Kids Party is a one-stop party planner in Singapore, where you’ll find plenty of decorations, entertainment, fringe activities and even goodie bags for the kids! From a dinosaur-themed party to jungle-themed party and more, you’re sure to find the perfect party package that your child will love!

Mr. Bottle’s Kids Party, Tel: (+65) 6515 5921, www.kidsparty.com.sg

PartyAllo: Themed birthday party packages

Looking for a reliable party planner in Singapore? PartyAllo is just what you need. Choose from a range of themes that will delight your child and let them take care of the rest! From face painting to mascots, props, birthday party decorations and more, you can rest assured that your child’s birthday party is in good hands. Psst…we hear they even have delicious dessert stations!

PartyAllo Singapore, Tel: (+65) 9025 1902, www.partyallo.com.sg

PartyMojo: Party planner & event organiser

Specialising in kids’ parties and corporate carnival events, Party Mojo is the party planner and event organiser in Singapore you call when you need to add some jazz hands to your party – think photo booths, glitter tattoos and candy floss cart rentals! The team is always professional and friendly, and we’ve heard they do a pretty delish dessert table too.

PartyMojo, Tel: (+65) 6569 6992, www.partymojo.com.sg

Tiara Society: Princess-themed party planner

A make-believe, royal-themed creative playground, Tiara Society is known for its stunning Princess Parties. These party planners in Singapore can make the magic happen at a venue of your choice, in your home or in their own space. There are several party packages on offer, each with themes such as Majestic Glamour, Whimsical Tea Party and more.

Tiara Society, 902 East Coast Parkway, Coastal Play Grove, Level #02-02, Singapore 449874, WhatsApp: (+65) 8462 7763, www.thetiarasociety.com

Whizz Kidz: Party planner with dedicated party host

Want the party to come to you? Whether it’s at home, in a condo function room or in any event space you fancy, Whizz Kidz can take the party there! Choose your desired theme, and these savvy party planners in Singapore will come ready with party supplies, fun activities and very experienced (not to mention entertaining!) party hosts.

Whizz Kids, Tel: (+65) 9188 4081, www.whizzkidz.com.sg

Where to Hire Party Entertainers in Singapore

Captain Dazzle: Award-winning magician

Want to hire a magician for a birthday magic show? Captain Dazzle offers customised birthday magic shows based on children’s ages (anywhere from 2 to 12), Captain Dazzle comes with massive bona fides: he’s a member of the International Brotherhood of Magicians in the USA, has more than 12 years of experience performing full-time for kids and won Best World Clown in 2017 and 2018!

Captain Dazzle, Tel: (+65) 9366 7156, www.captaindazzle.com

Lucy Sparkles & Friends: Kids’ party entertainment

If your child loves singing, dancing and pretending, then Lucy Sparkles & Friends have the party entertainers in Singapore for you! They cater to children aged 1 to 6, and can tailor your party entertainment to run for 45 minutes, one hour or two hours. Lucy Sparkles’ party entertainment packages can include a professional singer, actor or musician (dressed in a costume of your choice), themed games and more.

Lucy Sparkles & Friends, Tel: (+65) 8112 6564, www.lucysparkles.com.sg

Fantasy Parties: Superhero and princess-themed party entertainment

Celebrate your birthday with your favourite princess, superhero or cartoon buddy! Fantasy Parties will make your little one’s dreams come true with over 100 different types of costume characters, lots of fun and games on offer, and party entertainment add-ons like bubble play and bubble shows!

Fantasy Parties, Tel: (+65) 8180 0240, www.kidsfantasyparties.com

Happier Singapore: Unique kids’ party entertainment services

This party entertainer in Singapore knows exactly what kids love, and they excel at putting a smile on children’s faces with face painting activities (we love their neon UV body paint!), balloon art, glow in the dark tattoos, sensory play, mascot rental, digital art and even henna and mobile nail service sessions! Happier Singapore’s party entertainment services are great for big and small kids, and there’s something to suit every want.

Happier Singapore, Tel: (+65) 8832 6726, www.happier.sg

We’ve got more birthday party ideas just for you!

The post Where To Find Party Entertainers & Party Planners In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 8 Best Places For Glamping In Singapore + NEW Colugo Camp At Mandai Wildlife East
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Have you tried glamping in Singapore? Whether you want to go outdoor glamping on the East Coast, Sentosa, Lazarus Island, indoor glamping or even glamping at the zoo, here’s our guide to glamping in Singapore with fairy lights, plush mattresses and even air-con! Glamping in Singapore is basically super posh camping! If you’re keen to […]

The post 8 Best Places For Glamping In Singapore + NEW Colugo Camp At Mandai Wildlife East appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Have you tried glamping in Singapore? Whether you want to go outdoor glamping on the East Coast, Sentosa, Lazarus Island, indoor glamping or even glamping at the zoo, here’s our guide to glamping in Singapore with fairy lights, plush mattresses and even air-con!

Glamping in Singapore is basically super posh camping! If you’re keen to take the kiddos camping but just can’t deal with setting your own tent up, or sleeping on a hard surface with no aircon, then you’ll want to try glamping! It combines the wonders of sleeping outside with the creature comforts of a chalet or hotel staycation. Glamping in Singapore is a unique way to spend the night outdoors, whether for a big birthday party, a romantic getaway, or good old-fashioned family bonding. Check out our roundup of all the best spots to take the kids glamping in Singapore!

Read more: Best Kids’ Activities & Things To Do In Singapore 

What does it mean to go glamping?
Glamping is a word blend of “glamorous” and “camping” — taking all the fun of camping in a tent but elevating the experience. It’s basically a more glamorous form of camping that includes already set up tents, often proper beds or plush mattresses, electricity (and sometimes air-con!), cushions, picnic tables and at one glamping spot a BBQ or pizza offer!

How is glamping different to camping?
Glamping is definitely a more comfortable experience! But if you’re keen to teach the kids how to set up a tent, make your own food on a campfire, and rough it for the night, glamping won’t quite cut it. You’ll defo get a better night’s sleep glamping though! As with proper camping, when you go glamping in Singapore you’ll still need to apply for an NParks camping permit for free.

How much is glamping in Singapore?
Glamping in Singapore is not as cheap as camping but more affordable than a hotel stay. The cheapest outdoor glamping we found is from $210 per night for 2 pax, and the most expensive glamping at Singapore Zoo is a whopping $1,699 per tent!

Read more: Pulau Ubin Camping Trip with Kids!

Best Places for Glamping in Singapore:

Ready to go glamping in Singapore? These glamping providers offer glamping in East Coast Park, Pasir Ris Park (home to one of our very fave playgrounds in Singapore!), Sentosa, Singapore Zoo, Lazarus Island, and during certain times of the year, indoor glamping at Jewel! Plus, we found some glamping options for the kids to enjoy in the comfort of your own home!

1. Colugo Camp: Glamping at Mandai Wildlife Reserve

There’s a brand-new glamping experience at Mandai Wildllife Reserve, opening in Q3 2025! Colugo Camp puts you right near all the action at the Singapore Zoo, the new Rainforest Wild Asia and all of the fab wildlife parks in the area. This glamping experience in Singapore is drizzled with convenience and luxury. Colugo Camp is an all-inclusive experience, meaning that everything, including accommodation, dining, guided tours and wildlife encounters, is included in your stay! Best of all, Colugo Camp will be a permanent site with 20 safari tents, so you can get closer to nature year-round.

Glamping location: Mandai Wildlife East
Glamping rates: TBA – opening in Q3 2025.

Colugo Camp, Mandai Wildlife EAST
80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com

2. Glamping City Singapore

Glamping City Singapore offers chic glamping tents in the vibrant East Coast Park. Whether you are organising a glamping trip for a birthday celebration or a romantic evening, Glamping City Singapore has something for every occasion. Glamping City also has a movie screening add-on, where you can view movies in the comfort of your spacious tents or under the stars. Looking to organise a kids’ birthday party sleepover in your backyard or living room? You can also book the slumber party package for indoor glamping or backyard glamping fun.

Glamping locations: East Coast Park
Glamping rates: From $219 per night for the Couple Deluxe (Sea View) Package

Glamping City Singapore, 1500 East Coast Park, Singapore 468963, Tel: (+65) 9830 3090, www.glampingcity.com

3. Glamping Society

Singapore’s first glamping provider, Glamping Society offers glamping tent packages in both East Coast Park and Pasir Ris Seaside. They offer simple couple glamping staycations (with fairy lights, a candlelit picnic, and a pizza) to a glamorous proposal package or a birthday celebration glamping package. Pasir Ris Seaside glamping tents are air-conditioned, and glam tents are kitted out with beds, rugs and colourful cushions. We think the Glam Birthday Party Package (including pizzas, balloons, birthday cake, an outdoor cinema and a float for up to 6 people), would be a big hit for a kid’s birthday party.

Glamping locations: East Coast Park (Area G/D) and Pasir Ris Seaside Glamping.
Glamping rates: From $299 per night, which includes a picnic set-up, drinks and pizza. Guests are required to secure their own camping permit for East Coast Park. Camping permits are not required for Pasir Ris Seaside glamping.

Glamping Society, 1500 East Coast Park, Singapore 468963, Tel: (+65) 9040 1817, www.glampingsociety.com

4. Go Glamping SG

Looking for a staycation near East Coast Park but hoping for something more affordable than a hotel or chalet? Go Glamping SG rents out fully-equipped waterproof bell glamping tents complete with air beds, comfy indoor and outdoor seating, and beautiful lights. Go Glamping SG also provides a BBQ starter bundle at $52 and the BBQ food (for 5 pax) at an additional $52. If you’re feeling extra hungry, opt for the additional Premium package, which comes with Satay and Otah!

Glamping locations: East Coast Park (Area G) 
Glamping rates: $320 per night for Family Tent. Guests are required to secure their own camping permit.

Go Glamping SG, Tel: (+65) 9179 0416 (WhatsApp only) www.goglampingsg.com

5. Glamping Kaki Singapore

Looking for an affordable glamping experience in Singapore? Glamping Kaki Singapore has you covered! Located at East Coast Park, this glamping experience will allow you to escape from the hectic city life and return to nature for a relaxing getaway. Bell Glamping tents are available in three different sizes and come with queen sized beds as well as fairy lights. Enhance your experience by booking the outdoor glam picnic table add-on for $70 (for 6 pax)!

Glamping location: East Coast Park
Glamping rates:From $210 per night for 2 pax; the Superior Large Tent (sleeping 6 pax) is $290. Guests are required to secure their own camping permit for East Coast Park. 

Glamping Kaki, 1500 East Coast Park, Singapore 468963, Tel: (+65) 8431 9137, www.glampingkaki.com

6. Heavenly Glamping Singapore

Heavenly Glamping Singapore offers luxurious glamping that will have you feeling like royalty. Expect a spacious, beautifully decorated tent with a cosy set-up for you and your special someone. If you have a larger group, check out the Grand Deluxe Glamping Tent for six with three queen-size air beds, a BBQ pit, a large gazebo, fairy lights and more. You can book glamping experiences at East Coast Park and Heritage Chalet at Pasir Ris, with tents for two, four and six people. Be sure to check out their glamping add-ons from birthday celebration packages (+ $60)! You can even book a super fancy glamping picnic at East Coast Park, Fort Canning or at Gardens by the Bay East from $180 (3.5 hours).

Glamping locations: East Coast Park and Heritage Chalet at Pasir Ris
Glamping rates: From $240 per night for Deluxe Package for 4 pax. Guests are required to secure their own camping permit for East Coast Park. 

Heavenly Glamping, www.heavenlyglamping.com

7. Kids’ Indoor Glamping

Have you ever considered indoor glamping for a fun kids’ birthday celebration? From setting up boho floral teepees to creating a Star Wars-themed glamping sleepover with iconic Star Wars cushions and light sabres, an indoor glamping experience is an exciting way to throw a birthday celebration! These cute glamping teepees make great photo ops, and the kids are sure to have a blast having a sleepover with their friends. If you want to give your child’s bedroom a magical makeover for their birthday bash, check out Estilo & Co! You can choose from a range of enchanting themes, such as the whimsical fairy forest theme!

Glamping location: Your living room!
Glamping prices: from $490 for 3 tents.

Estilo & Co, www.estiloandco.com

8. Glamping at Lazarus Island

Into The Woods is an exciting new glamping experience on the serene Lazarus Island in Singapore, serving as a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the Lion City. There are 9 glamping units, including 3 family accommodations spanning 36 sqm that can accommodate up to 4 people. Each unit is equipped with air-conditioning, and guests will receive a welcoming kit filled with eco-friendly products from local businesses. While the grown-ups indulge in rejuvenating yoga sessions, the little ones will be enchanted by the watercolour painting sets, all part of Into The Woods’ commitment to promoting slow living and ensuring guests enjoy low-intensity activities during their stay.

Glamping location: 15A Pulau Seringat, Lazarus Island, Singapore 099551
Glamping prices: from $430 per night for Family Tent

Into the Woods, intothewoods.life

Glamping experiences in Singapore that have since closed:

Indoor Glamping at Jewel Changi Airport (Closed)

Ever dreamed of falling asleep to the sound of Jewel’s magnificent waterfall? During certain times of the year, you can go indoor glamping at Jewel Changi Airport. While you don’t get a glamorous tent with fairy lights, you’ll get a spacious camping tent from Decathlon that sleeps up to three people, a fun itinerary with exciting family-bonding activities and access to the Changi Experience Studio. Our glamping experience included rock climbing at Climb@T3, a family quest through the mall, and a craft workshop for the kids. Meals are not included, though, so be sure to find the best spots for food at Jewel here. We’d recommend this indoor camping experience for families with kids between 7 to 13 years old. Read all about our experience at Jewel here!

Glamping location: Jewel Changi Airport
Glamping prices:$85 (adult) & $95 (child – 5 years and up). Do note that this is only available for limited times during the year. Be sure to check back here for their upcoming dates!

(Closed) Changi Experience Studio, Jewel Changi Airport, 21 Airport Boulevard, Singapore 819666, www.changiairport.com

Read more: The Best Spots for Glamping in Asia and Australia

Glamping at Singapore Zoo (Closed)

Fancy spending the night with Asian elephants, white tigers and rhinos? For limited periods each year, you can book a glamping staycation at Singapore Zoo. Keep an eye out on their website for the next glamping period. This glamping experience in Singapore includes a night’s stay in an air-conditioned dome glamping tent at the Pavilion by the Lake for up to four people. This glamping option is far more expensive than any other glamping tent rentals in Singapore, but here you’ll get dinner and breakfast thrown in, along with park admission to Singapore Zoo, guided animal tours and animal encounters. Do note that kids must be at least 5 years old to join in the glamping fun.

Glamping location: Singapore Zoo
Glamping rates: From $1,699 per tent, up to 4 pax (U.P. $2,000)

Singapore Zoo, 80 Mandai Lake Rd, 729826, www.mandai.com

Wondrous Glamping Singapore (Temporarily Closed)

With plots in East Coast Park, Wondrous Glamping Singapore offers a unique seaside glamping experience, combining a cosy glamping tent with a rare opportunity for stargazing. Bell glamping tents come with a queen-size air mattress and bed, bed linens, pillows, and stylish touches like rugs and fairy lights. We love that they even provide a board game as a standard amenity with each glamping tent! They also do specially tailored packages for birthday celebrations, anniversaries and more. If you don’t want to spend the night there, you can book a glamping picnic package in their glamping tents for $250 for five hours. Be sure to book your glamping tent rental slot ahead as Wondrous Glamping Singapore is only open for bookings from Thursdays to Sundays.

Glamping locations: East Coast Park (Area D)
Glamping rates: From $220 per night for 2 pax; the Deluxe Family Package (sleeping 6 pax) is $310. Guests are required to secure their own camping permit for East Coast Park. 

(Temporarily Closed) Wondrous Glamping Singapore, East Coast Park, 356, Siglap Road, Singapore 455929, Tel: (+65) 9623 2950

Read more:

The post 8 Best Places For Glamping In Singapore + NEW Colugo Camp At Mandai Wildlife East appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Singapore Theatre Shows, Musicals, Comedy & Live Concerts To Book In 2025
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
From energetic theatre shows and musicals in Singapore to live concerts and comedy, read on to find all the best live shows hitting Singapore in 2025. Curtains up! Singapore’s entertainment scene is buzzing in 2025 and you can save this lineup of international award-winning musicals in Singapore, live theatre shows in Singapore, comedy shows, live […]

The post Singapore Theatre Shows, Musicals, Comedy & Live Concerts To Book In 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
From energetic theatre shows and musicals in Singapore to live concerts and comedy, read on to find all the best live shows hitting Singapore in 2025.

Curtains up! Singapore’s entertainment scene is buzzing in 2025 and you can save this lineup of international award-winning musicals in Singapore, live theatre shows in Singapore, comedy shows, live concerts and more. We’ve listed down some highly-anticipated theatre productions, including ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘The Lord Of The Rings: A Musical Tale’ and more, plus ballet performances, classical music performances and more. We’re also super excited for all the upcoming concerts in Singapore!

Read more: Kids’ Theatre Shows & Musicals In Singapore

Jump to:
– Musicals & Theatre Shows In Singapore
– Live Music Concerts In Singapore

Musicals & theatre shows in Singapore

Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert

Disney fans, mark your calendars because World-renowned Chinese concert pianist Lang Lang will be making his long-awaited return to Singapore, with Lang Lang Plays Disney in Concert! Lang Lang first garnered fame as a child prodigy, and has since captivated global audiences, performing with leading orchestras and making classical music more accessible to younger generations through collaborations with artists such as Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, and Andrea Bocelli.

The album, which was recorded in honour of Disney’s 100th anniversary, features Lang Lang’s take on some of Disney’s most iconic tunes with his innovative piano-focused arrangements, blending impressionist, romantic and virtuosic styles to give them a whole new life. With hits such as ‘Let It Go’, ‘We Don’t Talk About Bruno’, ‘You’ll Be in My Heart’, and ‘When You Wish Upon a Star’, this performance will be a treat for fans and non-fans alike!

His upcoming concert will be extra special because not only will the performance showcase a live symphony orchestra, the concert will also be accompanied by special guest artists, including the talented pianist Gina Alice, who is also Lang Lang’s wife! Read all about it here.

When: 12 & 14 June 2025, 7:30pm
Where: The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre
How much: $38 – $388. Purchase tickets here.

Read more: Kids’ Theatre Shows & Musicals In Singapore

The Phantom of the Opera: Award-winning musical in Singapore

Andrew Lloyd Webber’s The Phantom of the Opera is returning to Singapore next year, and we couldn’t be more excited! This award-winning musical has been hailed as one of the most stunning productions in history since its premiere in 1986. With over 70 major theatre awards to its name, it holds the record as the longest-running show in Broadway history! The beloved musical will take the stage at Sands Theatre for a strictly limited season, and the waitlist is already open!

When: 9 May – 15 June 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: from $93. Get tickets here.

The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee

Presented by Sing’theatre Academy’s Showstoppers, this feel-good musical comedy follows quirky middle schoolers (played by adults) in a high-stakes spelling competition. With catchy songs, laugh-out-loud moments, and audience participation, the show blends humour and heart as each character navigates childhood insecurities and dreams. Directed by Dr Caleb Goh with music by Joanne Ho, Spelling Bee is a charming, family-friendly performance about growing up and standing out.

When: 13 – 15 June
Where: Goodman Arts Centre Black Box Theatre
How much: $39 – get tickets here.

The Music of Studio Ghibli Original Singers Symphony

The Studio Ghibli fever isn’t over just yet! This June, fans of the beloved Japanese animation studio are in for a treat because for one night only, The Music of STUDIO GHIBLI – Original Singers Symphony makes its Singapore debut. Experience the original singers and voice talents behind the iconic soundtracks of Studio Ghibli’s most beloved films, accompanied by a live orchestra direct from Japan!

When: 11 June 2025
Where: The Star Theatre
How much: $88 – $268. Get tickets here.

Read more: Theatre Shows & Musicals For Kids In Singapore

Burn The Floor: Musical theatre show in Singapore

Burn The Floor is a world-famous Latin and Ballroom dance theatrical spectacular that has captivated audiences in 180 cities since 1999. Featuring a simple message of the joy of dance, this passionate theatre show in Singapore integrates Samba, Salsa, Waltz, Foxtrot, Swing, Tango, Cha-Cha, Hip Hop, Contemporary and more.

When: 2 – 6 July 2025
Where: Singtel Waterfront Theatre, 8 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039802
How much: $102 – $192. Tickets via Ticketek.

S.O.S. (Save Our Singapore) Kumar: Comedy show in Singapore

One of Singapore’s most beloved comedians, Kumar, returns to Marina Bay Sands with his brand-new show, S.O.S. (Save Our Singapore)! In celebration of SG60, this performance will take you through Singapore’s six-decade journey, complete with quirky takes on current affairs, cheeky nods to our cultural icons, and more.

When: 17 July – 3 August 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $68 – $168. Tickets via MBS.

The Lord Of The Rings: A Musical Tale

Exciting news for Lord of the Rings fans! In August 2025, this iconic tale will come to life, in the form of a musical! The Lord of the Rings – A Musical Tale will be making its highly anticipated Asian debut in Singapore, featuring a breathtaking production that promises to bring the cult-favourite story to the stage. While ticket details are still under wraps, be sure to join the waitlist to secure your spot!

Enjoy a special bundle – 4 tickets for just $400! (Save $272)

When: 12 – 24 August 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $68 – $238. Tickets via SISTIC.

Explorers – the Age of Discovery with James May

Fans of Top Gear will be glad to know that James May’s landmark live theatre show is heading to Singapore! Join James May as he gives his take on extraordinary explorers, their life stories and journeys through the unknown at this unique storytelling discovery.

When: 22 – 23 August 2025
Where: Capitol Theatre
How much: $95 – $175. Tickets via SISTIC.

Monster Jam: Live truck show in Singapore

Monster Jam returns to Singapore for yet another thrilling show featuring high-flying action and jaw-dropping stunts. Be amazed as 12,000-pound trucks stand on two wheels and fly through the air to showcase their speed and skill. Plus, don’t miss the pre-event Monster Jam Pit Party where you can get up close and personal with these trucks, meet the drivers and collect autographs!

When: 23 August 2025
Where: National Stadium
How much: From $37 – $135. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

Deets: 23 August 2025, National Stadium, 1 Stadium Drive, Singapore 397629

Douglas Lim: Made In Malaysia: Comedy show in Singapore

Douglas Lim, often called the King of Malaysian Comedy, is bringing his live show Made In Malaysia to Singapore. If you’ve seen him as Steven the Stylist on Kopitiam, you’ll know his sharp humour and quick wit. He’s been making audiences laugh for over 20 years—on TV, in theatre, and everywhere in between. Now’s your chance to catch him live for a night of laughs and totally relatable comedy.

When: 30 August 2025, 6.30pm
Where: Singtel Waterfront Theatre at Esplanade
How much: From $88 – get tickets here.

SWAN LAKE – State Ballet of Georgia

The acclaimed State Ballet of Georgia will make its Singapore debut this September with a stunning performance of Swan Lake! In its 175-year history, this marks the company’s first-ever show in Singapore. Expect exquisite sets, breathtaking costumes, and a mesmerising display of ballet mastery.

When: 11 – 14 September 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $68 – $198. Tickets via SISTIC.

Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic

After a sold-out season in 2022, this iconic tribute concert is making a return to Marina Bay Sands, bringing the electrifying energy of Queen’s legendary concerts right to our shores! Get ready to rock out to anthems like We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Radio Ga Ga, I Want to Break Free, Somebody to Love, Don’t Stop Me Now, Another One Bites the Dust, A Kind of Magic, Bohemian Rhapsody, and more.

When: 19 – 20 September 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $68 – $158. Tickets via SISTIC.

Ballet Under The Stars: Outdoor ballet performance

Ballet Under The Stars, presented by the Singapore Ballet, is a great way to enjoy an evening out with the family. Set in a relaxed, picnic-style atmosphere, Singapore Ballet performs highlights like ‘Paquita’, ‘Momentum’ and ‘Incomparable Beauty’. Just pack some snacks, lay out a mat, and settle in for a night of beautiful dance under the open sky.

When: 19 – 21 & 26 – 28 September 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Fort Canning Green
How much: $48 – get tickets here.

Read more: Kids’ Theatre Shows & Musicals In Singapore

Dear Evan Hansen: Musical in Singapore

Dear Evan Hansen is a multi-award-winning musical that has impressed audiences all over the world, and will be making its way to Marina Bay Sands for the first time this October! The story follows Evan, an anxious high school kid who tries his best to fit in, but faces challenges along the way.

When: 30 October – 16 November 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: Frpm $68 – get tickets here

Cirque Alice: Live circus in Singapore

From the brilliant minds behind Cirque du Soleil’s Mad Apple and the Broadway hit The Illusionists comes a new must-see theatre performance – Cirque Alice! Prepare to be amazed as Lewis Carroll’s timeless tale is reimagined into a spellbinding circus experience, featuring breathtaking stunts and gravity-defying feats!

When: 9 – 19 October 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $78 – $238. Tickets via SISTIC.

Read more: Kid-Friendly Musicals & Theatre Shows In Singapore

JOANNE KAM – Malaysia’s Queen of Comedy

As part of Comedy Masala, Malaysian comedy icon Joanne Kam is set to take the stage for two nights, where you can witness her razor-sharp wit, infectious energy, and commanding stage presence that has rightfully earned the title of Malaysia’s Queen of Comedy. With a track record of sold-out shows, this is one performance you won’t want to miss!

When: 9 – 19 October 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $78 – $238. Tickets via SISTIC.

Beauty and the Beast The Musical: Musicals in Singapore

This December, treat the family to a spellbinding evening with Beauty and the Beast The Musical, making its only Asia stop right here in Singapore. From the creators of The Lion King and Aladdin, this reimagined stage production dazzles with stunning visuals, beautiful costumes, and those unforgettable songs we all grew up with. It’s the perfect mix of nostalgia and family magic.

Where: From 11 December 2025
Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands
How much: $70 – $300. Tickets via SISTIC.

Read more: Kids Theatre Shows, Musicals & Concerts In Singapore 2025

Live Music Concerts in Singapore

Jason Derulo – Nu King World Tour

Known for his genre-blending sound, chart-topping hits, and viral presence on social media, Jason Derulo is undoubtedly one of today’s top pop artists. Performing in Singapore for one night only, here’s your chance to listen to his viral songs such as “Wiggle,” “Talk Dirty,” “Trumpets,” “It Girl,” “In My Head,” “Marry Me,” live!

When: 25 June 2025
Where: The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre
How much: $148 – $228. Tickets via SISTIC.

The Chainsmokers in Singapore

EDM powerhouses The Chainsmokers are set to perform in Singapore this June! Known for their chart-topping hits like Closer, Don’t Let Me Down, and Something Just Like This, you can witness the Grammy-winning duo light up the stage with these fan-favourite anthems live.

When: 27 June 2025
Where: Arena @ EXPO
How much: TBC. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

Ayumi Hamasaki Asia Tour 2025: I am ayu -ep.II- Singapore

Ayumi Hamasaki is finally bringing her 2025 Asia tour to Singapore, and fans here have been waiting for this. After launching the “I am ayu – Episode II” tour in Tokyo with a revamped setlist and stunning visuals, she’s now set to light up Southeast Asia. If you’ve followed her since the early days or just love J-pop, this is your chance to be part of Ayu’s iconic return to the international stage.

When: 5 July 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium
How much: From $188 – get tickets here.

James Blake Live in Singapore

UK singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and producer James Blake will be performing live in Singapore for the first time ever! James Blake broke out as one of pop’s most unique artists, turning heads with his one-of-a-kind sound on his 2011 debut, and he’s about to release his seventh studio album.

When: 22 July 2025
Where: The Star Theatre
How much: $148 to $168. Tickets via SISTIC.

Xdinary Heroes <Beautiful Mind> World Tour

Bringing their explosive energy and genre-bending sound to the stage, Xdinary Heroes are set to rock Singapore with a concert this July! Known for their powerful performances and boundary-pushing music, this rising band is the second band of JYP Entertainment following DAY6, and have carried on the legacy of live instrumental performance while forging their own unique identity with a dynamic blend of rock, pop, and electronic elements.

When: 26 July 2025
Where: The Star Theatre
How much: $158 to $298. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

2025 Jay Park World Tour: Serenades & Body Rolls

Global music icon Jay Park is making his long-awaited return to Singapore and yes, it’s been six whole years since his last solo show here! Known for his R&B vocals and hip-hop moves, fans can catch Jay Park in his one-night-only concert at Capitol Theatre. Singapore is just one of the 13 stops across the APAC leg of his tour, aside from Melbourne, Sydney, and Osaka.

When: 19 July 2025
Where: Capitol Theatre
How much: $148 to $348. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

Elijah Woods: Give Me The Sunlight in Singapore

With multiple platinum and gold records and award nominations, Elijah Woods has established himself as one of the biggest solo acts in Hollywood. He has also amassed over 1 billion streams across his discography, and his upcoming concert in Singapore is already selling fast! Secure your tickets before you miss out!

When: 10 August
Where: The Theatre at Mediacorp
How much: $88 – $268. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

Camila Cabello: Yours, C Tour in Singapore

Camila Cabello is coming to Singapore! She’ll be performing live at The Star Theatre on August 12, 2025, as part of her Yours, C tour. After playing big festivals like Glastonbury and Rock in Rio, she’s bringing her energetic show and hits like “Señorita,” “Havana,” and songs from her latest album C,XOXO. It’s a great chance for fans to see her up close and enjoy all her catchy tunes in one night.

When: 12 August 2025, 8pm
Where: The Star Theatre
How much: From $118 – get tickets here.

STAYC: Stay Tuned Singapore tour

High Up Entertainment’s six-member group STAYC is hitting the road with their much-awaited “STAY TUNED” world tour, produced by Live Nation! They’re bringing their world tour to Singapore where fans can jam to hits such as “Teddy Bear” and more live!

When: 16 August 2025
Where: The Star Theatre
How much: $138 – $308. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

Le Sserafim: Easy Crazy Hot world tour

K-pop girl group powerhouse Le Sserafim, known for hits like Antifragile and Smart, has achieved global fame, even performing at the renowned Coachella music festival last year! This August, they’ll be bringing their highly anticipated concert to Singapore. While venue and ticket details have yet to be revealed, there’s no doubt this event will be a major highlight for fans!

When: 16 August 2025
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium
How much: TBC

Black Eyed Peas live in Singapore

25 August is gonna be a good night as the Black Eyed Peas take the stage at Singapore Indoor Stadium! Millennials will remember the group’s critically successful party hits such as “Pump It”, “I Gotta Feeling”, “Let’s Get It Started” and more, from hit albums such as “Elephunk” and “Monkey Business”.

When: 25 August 2025
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium
How much: $158 – $228. Tickets via SISTIC.

WaterBomb Singapore 2025

WATERBOMB Singapore 2025 is coming back to rock Siloso Beach, Sentosa! Singapore’s largest water music festival promises an unforgettable experience with an exciting line-up of high-energy performances by JAY B, EXID, TEAM BEBE, Lee Minhyuk (HUTA), ASH ISLAND, Anson Lo and more. Get your tickets so you don’t miss out on epic water fights and eclectic performances.

When: 30 – 31 August 2025
Where: Siloso Beach, Sentosa
How much: From $201.80. Tickets via Pelago.

Mayday Parade: Three Cheers For 20 Years

After a sold-out show in 2023, Mayday Parade is making their epic return to Pasir Panjang Power Station this September! Get ready to sing your heart out as the band marks 20 years of emo anthems. This special milestone tour will feature songs from every album, so whether you’ve been there since the very beginning or jumped on somewhere along the way, this night’s for you.

When: 21 September 2025
Where: Pasir Panjang Power Station
How much: $108. Tickets via Eventbrite.

STING 3.0 In Singapore

17-time Grammy Award-winning artist STING is bringing his highly anticipated “STING 3.0” World Tour to Singapore this September! Fans can look forward to a night of electrifying hits from his iconic discography. While ticket details are still under wraps, presales kick off on 17 April 2025!

When: 23 September 2025
Where: Arena @ EXPO
How much: TBC. Tickets via Ticketmaster.

F1 Singapore GP: Elton John, Foo Fighers, Alan Walker and more

The Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix is more than fast cars and good vibes: each year, the three-day-long race brings with it world-class music acts and this year’s lineup is just as exciting! G-DRAGON takes the stage on Day 1, while Day 2 is filled with heavy-hitters such as Foo Fighers and Alan Walker. Day three will see Elton John and The Smashing Pumpkins take the stage. View the full entertainment lineup for Singapore F1 here.

When: 3 – 5 October 2025
Where: Various zones around the Singapore Grand Prix circuit
How much: Tickets from $148 here.

Mew: The Farewell Shows

Mew, the Danish indie rock band known for their unique sound and stunning live shows, is saying goodbye with a global farewell tour. Marking their 30th year and the departure of frontman Jonas Bjerre, they’re celebrating their journey with fans one last time. If you love dreamy, powerful music and want to experience their magic live, this tour is the perfect chance to join the farewell.

When: 18 November 2025, 8pm
Where: Esplanade Theatre
How much: From $75 – get tickets here.

BLACKPINK: 2025 “DEADLINE” World Tour

The queens of Kpop are making their highly anticipated return to Singapore for the BLACKPINK 2025 “DEADLINE” World Tour. Look forward to a full unit as Jisoo, Jennie, Rosé, and Lisa light up the stage following their sold-out tour two years ago! There will also be solo performances from each member’s successful solo releases, including “APT” by Rosé!

When: 29 – 30 November 2025
Where: Singapore National Stadium
How much: TBC.

Past Theatre Shows, Musicals, Comedy Shows & Live Concerts In Singapore: 

Lady Gaga: Long Live Mayhem concert

Lady Gaga is set to make her long-awaited return to Singapore this May with a spectacular 4-day concert at the Indoor Stadium! This marks her first concert in Singapore since 2012 and her only stop in Asia this year. Tickets aren’t on sale yet, but expect another ticket frenzy similar to that of Coldplay and Taylor Swift!

When: 18, 19, 20 & 21 May 2025
Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium
How much: From $148.

Shakespeare in the Park: Outdoor theatre show in Singapore

Shakespeare in the Park is back with Macbeth, and it’s happening at Fort Canning. It’s one of those nights where you grab a blanket, pack some snacks, and settle in with the kids or your partner under the stars. The play dives deep into ambition, power, and the mess it can create—classic Shakespeare. P.S. Try the new Macbeth on Roblox game where you can step into the shoes of the titular character himself!

When: Now till 1 June 2025, 7.30pm
Where: Fort Canning Park
How much: From $60.

Disclaimer: These theatre shows in Singapore are not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the organiser for changes or cancellations before heading down.

Read more:

The post Singapore Theatre Shows, Musicals, Comedy & Live Concerts To Book In 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.content:encoded:
Looking for activities and things to do during the weekend or school holidays? From outdoor fun to indoor activities and even staycation inspiration, here’s our guide to kid-friendly fun in Singapore!

Need ideas to keep the kids entertained? Don’t worry, we’ve rounded up our best family content across five categories – Outdoor Fun, Eat & Play, Indoor Fun, Learn and Be a Tourist at Home – to help keep you and the kiddos busy and having a blast while they’re home on the weekends or on school holidays!

And as we know many of you are always hunting for Holiday Camps for your kiddos – we will be updating this with all the best multi-sports, drama, coding, art camps and more!
