item.title: i Light Singapore 2025: IG-worthy Interactive Piano Walk, Flower Meadow & More
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
i Light Singapore 2025 (29 May – 21 June 2025) returns to Marina Bay and neighbouring precincts and features IG-worthy interactive art and multi-sensory light experiences! Read on for what to expect. The highly anticipated annual event, i Light Singapore 2025, is back at Marina Bay, South Beach, Raffles Place, the Singapore River and more, […]

The post i Light Singapore 2025: IG-worthy Interactive Piano Walk, Flower Meadow & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
i Light Singapore 2025 (29 May – 21 June 2025) returns to Marina Bay and neighbouring precincts and features IG-worthy interactive art and multi-sensory light experiences! Read on for what to expect.

The highly anticipated annual event, i Light Singapore 2025, is back at Marina Bay, South Beach, Raffles Place, the Singapore River and more, from 29 May – 21 June 2025. This SG60 edition is specially designed around the theme of To Gather and features the colour red, in celebration of SG60. 17 new light installations and an array of activities will aim to unite people from all backgrounds and generate conversations for a more sustainable future through eco-friendly habits. Like its previous editions, you can expect plenty of creative artwork, exciting programmes and dazzling light displays.

i Light Singapore 2025 highlights

1. Illuminated garden with 300 flowers

The name Take a walk through the meadow with me speaks for itself. This i Light Singapore 2025 art installation by Singapore artists Megan Tan and Shao Xuan features over 300 illuminated flowers, all made from acrylic waste from fabrication studios and workshops. Take your time to explore this whimsical meadow; we hear the flowers will even say “hello” with light and music!

Location: The Lawn beside the NTUC Building

2. Piano Walk, where you can make music

Another interactive light installation at i Light Singapore 2025 is the Piano Walk by Amigo & Amigo from Australia. Step on the piano keys and get as creative as you like. The installation will automatically play an original composition every 10 minutes, based on all your steps!

Location: Event Plaza by the Marina Bay waterfront

3. Elementary: An interactive screen

This one’s sure to be a hit with the little ones. Elementary by Tonoptik from Montenegro may look like a normal flat screen. But move around in front of it and observe how your movements transform the virtual landscape of the screen. It’s inspired by the ocean and represents the human relationship with the unpredictable rhythm of nature. Pretty deep!

Location: Clifford Square (next to Fullerton Bay Hotel)

4. Urban Oracle: Light reflections on water

This one’s a really cool use of AI. Urban Oracle by Italy artist Ultravioletto uses the reflection of the water to highlight AI-generated messages from 24 illuminated letters. Press one of the three buttons along the boardwalk to find messages inspired by the past, present and future of Singapore’s past.

Location: Pontoon near Red Dot Design Museum

5. Reverse Waterfall: Gravity-defying water

This one doesn’t need much explanation, but is definitely worth a look. After all, it is a waterfall flowing in the reverse direction! Take time to observe it; the artist UxU Studio from Taiwan (presented by UOB) intend for festival-goers to reflect on what really is “natural”?

Location: UOB Plaza, by the Singapore River

6. Bridge of 1,000 Dreams: Illuminated bamboo sticks

Also presented by UOB and DesignSingapore Council, the Bridge of 1,000 Dreams transforms the Cavenagh Bridge into a feast for the eyes with bamboo sticks illuminating it. It’s meant to represent how Singaporeans dream of a future that’s stronger.

Location: Cavenagh Bridge along the Singapore River

7. The Guardians: Inflatable garden

Another one the kids will love! The Guardians is an inflatable garden that’s incredibly Instagrammable. Australian artists Matthew Aberline and The Beautiful and Useful Studio are putting Singapore’s amazing flora on display, and this one’s certainly a show-stopper.

Location: Raffles Place Park

8. Saulux: Light installation with sound

Saulux isn’t just any ol’ light installation; it creates an “auditory experience” with the wind transforming willow twigs into light and sound. So, be sure to listen out for the magic when you encounter this installation by SPACES.STUDIO from Malta.

Location: Fountain Plaza, South Beach

9. This is Not a Screen: Made from digital waste

This is Not a Screen invites visitors to ponder how digital technology can present different realities to each individual. Is what we see a shared perception? Take a moment to reflect on all that at this installation made from recycled electronic waste.

Location: Near South Beach’s entrance to the Esplanade MRT station

10. Fantastic Planet: Larger-than-life humanoid figures

This one’s probably the highlight of i Light Singapore 2025, because Fantastic Planets features towering humanoid figures that you can easily spot from a mile away. This installation by Amanda Parer aims to reframe one’s perception of scale and space, inviting visitors to think deeper about humanity’s place in the universe and our impact on the planet.

Location: Along Marina Bay waterfront

11. Sign: Campfire-like installation

Sign is an artwork installation by Vendel & de wolf that features a supersize “campfire” that is actually an illusion of flames. Visitors are encouraged to pause and witness the unique spectacle of fire catching light around it, invoking thoughts of igniting radical change through destruction.

Location: Near The Promontory

11. In Tandem: Immersive installation by students from NUS

In Tandem, created by Nanyang Technological University students Lee Si Heidi, Rae Koh, and Leela Rao (Singapore), uses biometric sensors to transform visitors’ heartbeats into synchronised light and sound patterns displayed on a glowing sphere.

Location: Near The Promontory

12. Mozart: Deconstructed piano

Located along the steps of The Helix Bridge, Mozart features a glowing white sphere symbolising a deconstructed piano. This interactive light installation comes alive with every footstep, generating compositions that mirror its fragmented form. Festival-goers are invited to step into the role of performer in this vibrant reimagining of classical music that highlights how disruption can spark new forms of creativity.

Location: Helix Bridge

i Light Singapore 2025 Programme

Apart from the artworks and light displays, i Light Singapore 2025 will also feature a range of complementary activities and programmes.

GastoBeats: Gastronomic delights & musical experiences

Get ready for GastroBeats, the Festival Village of i Light Singapore 2025, where you’ll be spoiled for choice with a variety of gastronomic delights as you bask in impressive musical experiences. Check out the pet-friendly zones and retail booths, and keep an eye out for Let’s Trouble The Water!, where visitors can take a stand against marine pollution.

Where: Bayfront Event Space
When: 29 May – 22 June 2025, 4pm – 11pm Daily
How much: General admission to the Festival Village is free, but charges apply for selected activities.

Campfyre @ Nomads Pop-Up: Lounge in camping chairs

Bask in the electric atmosphere of i Light Singapore 2025 and unwind in camping chairs under the glow of the light art installation Sign. Pick up some light bites and drinks from GastroBeats, and enjoy a magical night of connection and conversation with friends and family at Campfyre.

Where: The Promontory at Marina Bay
When: 29 May – 1 June, 6 – 8 June, 13 – 15 June, 20 and 21 June 2025
How much: General admission is free, but charges apply for food and beverage.

Silent Disco Parade: Join an open-air dance party

Put on wireless headphones playing feel-good music and join a giant dance procession through the heart of Marina Bay. This immersive route will take you through i Light Singapore’s breathtaking art installations against the backdrop of Singapore’s magical nightscapes.

Where: Marina Bay (meeting point is outside ArtScience Museum)
When: 20 June 2025, 7:30pm – 9:30pm
How much: $35. Register here.

i Light River Cruise Shuttle Service: Magical boat ride

Hop into a river cruise that will take you through Marina Bay and Singapore River so you can marvel at the illuminated artwork from a different perspective. Be sure to get your cameras ready, because there will be plenty of picturesque, IG-worthy moments along the way. More info here.

Where: Bayfront South Jetty, Clifford Pier Jetty and Raffles Place Jetty
When: 29 May to 1 June, 6 to 8 June, 13 June, 15 and 20 June 2025
How much: $6 – $18

Glow PAddle 2025: LED-illuminated dragon boat

Join an enchanting night expedition across Marina Bay as you paddle away on LED-illuminated dragon boats. Beyond sightseeing, this is a unique opportunity to discover a blend of culture and community spirit as you join other paddlers. Learn from certified dragon boat trainers and discover fascinating stories about Singapore’s iconic landmarks.

Where: PAssion Wave @ Marina Bay, 11 Rhu Cross, Singapore 437440
When: 8 and 15 June 2025
How much: $30 per PAssion card member and $45 per non-PAssion card member. Get tickets for 8 June here and 15 June here.

Sunset Silent Flow: 90-minute yoga at The Promontory

Let your stress melt away as you join Sunset Silent Flow, a 90-minute yoga session against the iconic skyline at The Promontory. You will get to put on a wireless headset so you can tune out the buzz of the city and move with every beat of the music.

Where: The Promontory at Marina Bay
When: 21 June 2025, 7pm – 8:30pm
How much:$42 per pax or two Yoga Movement credits. Register your interest here.

A Meadow Memory Workshop: Create a personalised charm

Get creative at a sustainable workshop, where you will create a unique keychain while reflecting on sustainability and upcycling. Discover how commonly discarded materials can be repurposed to create gorgeous pieces with thoughtful design.

Where: Lawn beside NTUC Building
When: 31 May 2025 and 7 June 2025, 6pm & 7:30pm
How much: $3 per pax. Register your interest here.

i Light Singapore 2025 dates, tickets & more

When: 29 May – 21 June 2025, 7:30pm – 11pm daily with extended hours to midnight on Fridays and Saturdays
Price: Admission is FREE, but certain programmes will have separate charges.
Where: Marina Bay, South Beach, Raffles Place and Singapore River

i Light Singapore 2025, www.ilightsingapore.gov.sg

Discover more fun things to do with kids in Singapore!

The post i Light Singapore 2025: IG-worthy Interactive Piano Walk, Flower Meadow & More appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Students From Singapore Can Join Exclusive Summer Courses At The UK’s Most Elite Boarding Schools
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
This summer, students aged 8 to 17 studying in Singapore can experience elite British boarding school life at Eton College, Wycombe Abbey, Downe House and other prestigious schools in the UK. Find out how BE Education is empowering students to become future leaders with this unmatched opportunity. Keen for your child to discover the beauty […]

The post Students From Singapore Can Join Exclusive Summer Courses At The UK’s Most Elite Boarding Schools appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
This summer, students aged 8 to 17 studying in Singapore can experience elite British boarding school life at Eton College, Wycombe Abbey, Downe House and other prestigious schools in the UK. Find out how BE Education is empowering students to become future leaders with this unmatched opportunity.

Keen for your child to discover the beauty of elite British education? These unique two-week summer courses by BE Education offer an authentic ‘micro-study abroad’ experience. Your child will immerse themselves in world-renowned British education at prestigious schools known for academic excellence. They’ll engage in courses designed, hosted and taught by these institutions, ensuring an academically rigorous and culturally enriching experience.

Beyond exploring the school’s magnificent campus, your child will get the opportunity to fully immerse themselves in British boarding life. Through expert-led classes and activities, students will learn independence and gain global connections. This is an opportunity for your child to focus on personal growth and create lasting memories in an environment that has shaped many leaders and innovators.

Experience life at a top UK boarding school for two weeks

Summer Programme At Eton College
Eton College’s summer courses allow students aged 12 to 17 to take a deep dive into the philosophy of British education and get a first-hand experience of British culture through a two-week programme at top UK boarding schools. Eton College is one of the world’s most renowned boarding schools in the UK. This summer, students can join a summer programme at Eton College to improve English proficiency and hone skills in leadership, creativity and resilience for future success.

When: 4 – 7 July & 20 July – 3 August 2025
Where: Eton College UK, Windsor SL4 6DW, United Kingdom
How much: S$10,600 (excluding flights)

Summer Programme At Wycombe Abbey UK
Wycombe Abbey UK specialises in unleashing the talents of each student by offering a diverse range of core academic courses and electives in arts, sports and science. With exceptional sports and arts facilities including 20 tennis courts, dance studios, 30 music practice rooms and more, Wycombe Abbey is the ideal location for a summer programme where students aged 12 to 17 can discover their passion and strengths.

When: 2 – 16 July, 16 – 30 July, 30 July – 13 August 2025
Where: Wycombe Abbey, Wycombe Abbey Frances Dove Way, High Wycombe HP11 1PE, United Kingdom
How much: S$9,800 (excluding flights)

Summer Programme At Downe House
For STEM enthusiasts, Downe House is the place to be. Designed for students aged 10 to 15, this summer course sparks students’ interest in science, inspiring them to find creative solutions to real-world challenges through experiments and exciting excursions. Known for nurturing royal elites and renowned female leaders, Downe House continues its legacy of equipping students to advance to top universities, make a global impact and form lasting friendships.

When: 6 – 20 July 2025
Where: Downe House, Downe House, Hermitage Rd, Cold Ash, Thatcham RG18 9JJ, United Kingdom
How much: S$10,200 (excluding flights)

Let BE Education handle every detail with end-to-end support

Sending your child overseas doesn’t have to be daunting! With over 19 years of experience in helping students in Asia study at the UK’s most elite boarding schools, BE Education has earned the trust of hundreds of families who value top British education. When it comes to these summer courses, BE Education can help with:

End-to-End Support: Flights, visas, and logistics will be expertly managed by BE’s professional team.

Exclusive Access: BE Education’s partnership with these top UK boarding schools allows them to offer you exclusive access.
Stress-Free Planning: BE’s expert team will deliver a seamless and stress-free experience for your family.

Click here to learn more about these exciting summer courses. Spaces are limited–we hear that spots for one of their summer courses have already sold out! If you’re ready to take the next step, register your child today, so they can get an exclusive glimpse of the beauty of British education and step into a whole new world of experiences and possibilities!

Enquire today to get a free consultation with one of BE Education’s Premium Consultants to learn more about elite British education and which boarding school would be the best fit for your child.

BE Education, pragya.sethi@be.co, Tel: (+65) 8950 2617, www.beeducation.com

The post Students From Singapore Can Join Exclusive Summer Courses At The UK’s Most Elite Boarding Schools appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Guide To Baby Classes & Playgroups In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for a bilingual playgroup, drop-off playgroup or parent-accompanied playgroup near you? Take your bub to one of these organised baby playgroups so your baby can learn and explore while you meet other parents! Whether you want to spend some quality time with your baby, meet other parents with similar-aged bubs or want to start […]

The post Guide To Baby Classes & Playgroups In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a bilingual playgroup, drop-off playgroup or parent-accompanied playgroup near you? Take your bub to one of these organised baby playgroups so your baby can learn and explore while you meet other parents!

Whether you want to spend some quality time with your baby, meet other parents with similar-aged bubs or want to start their education at a young age, checking out a baby playgroup in Singapore is your best bet. While the newborn phase can definitely feel like a bit of a sleep-deprived blur at times, soon enough, you’ll be itching to get out of the house and do something more than just stare at your adorable munchkin on a play mat. From music and movement baby classes (even newborns like listening to songs!) to swimming and messy play, there are heaps of playgroups out there to stimulate babies – not exactly enrichment classes, but bubs will develop in leaps and bounds in a nurturing, age-appropriate manner. We’ve included parent- and caretaker-accompanied baby playgroups, as well as drop-off infant care facilities for working parents to cover the full range of possibilities out there!

Read more: Guide To Childcare & Infant Care Centres in Singapore

Our Fave Baby Classes & Playgroups in Singapore:

NAFA Arts Preschool: Arts-focused playgroups

Playgroup for: 19 months – 6 years old

NAFA Arts Preschool isn’t just another preschool, it’s where young children grow and thrive through the enriching power of the arts. Their unique arts-integrated curriculum blends visual arts, music, dance, speech and drama into every aspect of early childhood development. In the Playgroup programme (2 years old), children enjoy imaginative play and sensory exploration, all supported by artistic experiences. From storytelling with music to finger painting that enhances fine motor skills, each activity is designed to nurture communication, curiosity and confidence.

As children move into Pre-Nursery and Nursery, they explore more structured learning while continuing to explore the world through creative expression. Early literacy and numeracy are introduced through hands-on arts experiences that encourage independence, collaboration and a joy for learning. In Kindergarten, children at NAFA Arts Preschool are immersed in a rich environment where academic and social-emotional growth go hand in hand with artistic discovery. Whether composing rhythms, expressing feelings through movement, or creating their own artworks, they build essential life skills that prepare them for primary school and beyond.

NAFA Arts Preschool, 80 Bencoolen Street, Singapore 189655 and 70 Bendemeer Road, #02-02/03, Singapore 339940, www.preschool.nafa.edu.sg

Read more: Best Art Classes For Kids In Singapore 

Centre Stage School of the Arts: Storytelling, puppetry, drama, and music playgroups

Playgroup for: 6 months to 3.5 years old

This well-known performing arts centre offers a range of fun-filled programmes perfect for energetic little ones! Centre Stage’s Early Years Programme features three types of parent-accompanied classes tailored to different age groups: Baby Stage (6 to 18 months), Play Stage (18 months to 3 years), and Drama Tots (2.5 to 3.5 years). These classes encourage active parent participation while strengthening the parent-child bond.

Designed to create a joyful and enriching environment, the Early Years Programme blends interactive storytelling, puppetry, drama, and music to nurture creativity in a safe and supportive space. Children will develop essential social and communication skills while gradually progressing toward independent learning and building a strong foundation for school and beyond. Plus, parents will become part of a warm, welcoming community and gain access to helpful resources for navigating the ups and downs of early childhood!

Quote SASSY10 to enjoy 10% off all Early Years Programmes! Simply apply the code under the ‘Any additional comments or specific class requests?’ at checkout!

CentreStage School of the Arts, Block 15 Woking Road, Singapore 138694 and 50000G Marine Parade Road, #01-32, Singapore 449290, Tel: (+65) 6732 7211, www.centre-stage.com

Read more: Dance Classes For Kids In Singapore

VOCA Academy playgroups: Singing and storytelling music classes

Playgroup for: 6 months – 6 years old

Did you know that immersing your child in the world of music and singing from an early age can work wonders for their speech, brain development, and social skills? That’s exactly what VOCA Academy’s Bouncing Bubs (6 to 18 months) and Tiny Tots (16 months to 3 years) playgroups are all about! Their baby and toddler music exploration classes aim to strengthen the bond between parent and child while nurturing communication, motor skills and emotional development. Babies and toddlers engage in themed classes, whether it’s exploring animal sounds through Farmyard Fun, making waves in the Ocean Orchestra, or revving up fun in Transport Tunes.

Through activities such as singing, dancing, instrument play and storytelling, kiddos learn about music and language in a sensory-rich experience. What’s more, VOCA Academy incorporates basic sign language to encourage pre-verbal babies to communicate effectively. Each 45-minute baby class invites two adults to join the fun and is priced from $40. They have recently launched a new programme Singing Superstars (3.5 – 6 years old) to ignite your little one’s inner superstar through fun and engaging singing and musicianship training. Also, if you’re looking for a place to host your child’s birthday party, VOCA Academy offers packages, too! They even have school workshops in-house and externally.

 VOCA Academy, 2 Havelock Road #03-13 Havelock II Singapore 059763, Tel: (+65) 8906 4434, www.vocaacademy.co

Read more: Kids’ Birthday Party Venues In Singapore

Agora Colearning: Playgroup with Preschool Transition Programme

Playgroup for: 6 months to 3 years old

Agora Playschool offers flexible, play-based programmes for little ones, with the option of parent-accompanied or drop-off sessions. For the littlest bubs, sign them up for Play & Bloom, which includes music and movement, sensory play, water fun, tech time, sports, and snacks. Kids get to build confidence, social skills, and body awareness through fun, hands-on activities.

For older toddlers, the Mini Explorers programme features music, sensory play, sports, and more, including quiet activities for those who prefer a slower pace. Parents receive a monthly activity sheet and a keepsake Passbook filled with teacher notes and memories! We love that Agora Colearning also offers a Preschool Transition Programme, where kids can attend preschool-style sessions for fewer days per week or shorter daily sessions over a six-month period. This gentle introduction helps your child feel safe, secure, and confident as they ease into a structured learning environment.

Agora Playschool, HarbourFront Centre, 1 Maritime Square, #04-01 Lobby C, Singapore 099253, Tel: (+65) 6252 5585, www.agora-colearning.space

Read more: Bilingual Schools In Singapore

Little Joy Play: Sensory play, storytelling, and music movements (available in Mandarin too!)

Playgroup for: 8 months to 3 years old

Little Joy Play’s Sensory Play Programme lets your little ones go on an immersive sensory exploration packed with music, movement, storytelling, and more. This child-led, open-ended programme is crafted by early childhood development experts and led by experienced educators with at least 3 years and more teaching experience. Each month, this sensory play programme features a brand-new theme complete with inviting small-world setups designed to spark imagination, creativity, and meaningful exploration. Little Joy Play uses only safe, food-grade sensory materials with varying textures, colours, temperatures, and properties.

Little Joy Play has also recently launched Mandarin Sensory Play classes that are perfect for children to develop a love for the language. For mamas with toddlers 18 months and up, there’s also a 2.5-hour School Preparation Playgroup with a drop-off option focusing on early independence and school readiness through engaging play. Little ones will enjoy a rich mix of water play, sensory stations, process art, mud kitchen fun, and outdoor obstacle courses. Additionally, Little Joy Play provides birthday and private playdate packages at your preferred venue, ensuring engaging activities for all occasions, even in the comfort of your home.

Little Joy Play, multiple locations in Singapore, including Upper Bukit Timah Garden, Pasir Ris and Potong Pasir, Tel: (+65) 9820 4155 (Upper Bukit Timah Garden), www.littlejoyplay.sg

Mosaic PLAYgroups: Multi-sensory playgroups for 6 months and up

Playgroup for: 6 months to 3 years old

Mosaic PLAYGroups offers parent-accompanied playgroup classes that blend structured and unstructured activities with hands-on, active play. Parents can look forward to guiding their little ones through movement, music, and taste-safe sensory play, and classes are held in both indoor and outdoor playspaces. We love that the classes here are designed to keep both parent and child in mind, making it a perfect opportunity for parents to bond with their child.

Each playgroup is curated to support whole-child development through a multi-sensory approach, combining messy play with activities that nurture focus and attention. For toddlers aged 2 to 3, Mosaic PLAYGroups also offers a drop-off programme with classes featuring independent exploration, sensory experiences, outdoor adventures, and imaginative play. Held in both indoor and outdoor settings, these playgroup classes give children plenty of opportunities to make new friends, socialise, and build self-confidence.

Mosaic PLAYgroups, The Yards@ 402 Joo Chiat Place, Singapore 428082, Tel: (+65) 8031 2371, www.mosaicplayacademy.sg

Open Doors Montessori: Parent-accompanied Montessori classes

Playgroup for: 2 months to 2 years old

Open Doors Montessori believes that education starts with a strong family bond. Their mission is to make authentic Montessori education accessible and simple to integrate into daily life. Here, parents gain valuable insights into their child’s development while bonding through fun, hands-on activities. This playgroup in Singapore welcomes little ones as young as 2 months old with parent-accompanied classes led by experienced Montessori educators.

Each week, teachers share practical knowledge and introduce new topics, offering parents plenty of opportunities to bring Montessori practices into their homes. Classes are conducted in a specially curated environment that sparks curiosity and supports exploration, where babies can develop movement, communication, and self-help skills through a wide range of activities. There’s also guided interaction between the kids, helping them build social skills from an early age. There will also be Montessori-based snack times, which encourage independence and healthy habits!

Open Doors Montessori, two locations in Singapore: 66 Namly Place, Singapore 267211 and 175A Joo Chiat Road, Singapore 427446, Tel: (+65) 8899 8341, www.opendoors.sg

The Music Scientist: Multi-sensory, thematic music playgroups

Playgroup for: 4 months to 6 years old

The Music Scientist offers a thoughtfully designed programme for children aged 4 months to 6 years, blending music, movement, sensory play and science to support cognitive, physical, and emotional development in a fun and engaging way. This playgroup in Singapore is known for its multi-sensory, hands-on approach that encourages kids to explore their surroundings while building essential skills such as social interaction, confidence, and self-expression. With an experiential learning style that taps into multiple intelligences including musical, bodily-kinesthetic, logical, naturalistic, and linguistic, children enjoy activities like singing, dancing, acting, and collaboration, all while discovering the joy of music and science.

We love that each themed module (refreshed every four weeks!) comes with exclusive in-house songs that can be used at home during daily routines like mealtimes or bedtime. These songs also infuse general knowledge and educational aspects that can help nurture early brain development. For toddlers aged 18 to 47 months, there’s even a Preschool Ready programme available in both English and Chinese to help ease the transition into formal learning.

The Music Scientist, 300 Tampines Avenue 5, #06-03 NTUC Income, Singapore 529653 and 80 Marine Parade Road, #19-01, Singapore 449269, Tel: (+65) 6909 6350,  www.themusicscientist.com

Aquaducks: Swimming playgroup for babies

Playgroup for: 4 months and above

Introduce your tinies to the water with an AquaDucks parent-accompanied swim lessons. For babies from 6 months of age, their infant programme teaches little ones how to be comfortable in the water through playing games, singing songs and having fun! Light submersion is also practised once your baby is ready. Read more about swim classes for kids here.

Aquaducks, multiple locations in Singapore including Queenstown, Turf City and Newton, Tel: (+65) 8852 5809, www.aquaducks.com.sg

Beloved Bumps: Playgroups for babies

Playgroup for: Newborn to 12 months

Beloved Bumps does some fab postnatal courses that are great for mamas with newborns! The 0 to 12 Months Playgroup provides a safe space for new mums and dads to meet other parents and babies going through the same thing at the same time. It’s a great way to practice getting out of the house with the baby on your own. Playgroups are led by a midwife, with scales available on hand to weigh babies.

Beloved Bumps, 237 Alexandra Road, #04-10 Singapore 159929, Tel: (+65) 8298 1375, www.belovedbumps.sg

BibiNogs: Bilingual baby playgroups

Playgroup for: 9 months to 17 months

Specialising in bilingual and Chinese education, BibiNogs’ playground programme caters to young children in particular, with parent-accompanied playgroups starting from just 6 months. With a curriculum inspired by Multiple Intelligences Theory, each class incorporates various “intelligences”, including movement, music, linguistics, math and more.

BibiNogs, Tides, 217 East Coast Road, Singapore 42891, www.bibinogs.com

Blue House: Playgroup in Bukit Timah

Playgroup for: 18 months – 2.5 years old

With a wide range of parent-accompanied playgroups, classes and drop-in sessions for children, Blue House is hands-down one of our very favourite playgroups for magical, enriching bonding time with your bubs. The stunning Atelier provides little ones with interactive, sensory-driven experiences, whether through storytelling, songs, musical instruments, or the creative use of materials and textures.

Blue House Nursery, multiple locations in Singapore, including Tanglin, East Coast and River Valley, www.bluehouseatelier.com

Brainy Child Montessori Learning Centre: Bilingual and trilingual playgroups

Playgroup for: 18 months to 3.5 years old

Brainy Child Montessori Learning Centre adopts the Montessori method and offers two types of playgroups for little ones. The weekday playgroup is a drop-off programme with bilingual or trilingual options that feature Montessori lessons to help your little one gain independence. There is also the the 90-minute weekend playgroup, where you and kiddo will use Montessori materials to practice fine and gross motor skills, build concentration and spark curiosity.

Brainy Child Montessori Learning Centre, 150 Orchard Road, Orchard Plaza #05-38/43, Singapore 238841, Tel: (+65) 6733 7669, www.brainychild.sg

Read more: Guide To Montessori Preschools In Singapore

Creative Hearts: Music playgroups

Playgroup for: 4 months and above

Creative Hearts runs playgroup programmes such as Musical Bubs (4 to 9 months) and Musical Babies (6 ro 18 months) that are perfect for parents to bond with their babies while exposing them to music and movement. There will be interactive songs, percussion instruments, and creative movement activities. The playgroup integrates English and Mandarin into its sensory play, art and craft and story time activities.

Creative Hearts, 2 Pandan Valley and 428 River Valley Singapore, Tel: (+65) 8767 9761, www.creativehearts.as.me

The Early Brain Academy: Playgroups in Marymount

Playgroup for: Newborn to 3 years

The Blooming Joy class at The Early Brain Academy (for expectant parents through 3 months of age) is all about providing sensory stimulation and shows parents how to create a home environment that enhances and enriches bub’s brain development to foster physical and intellectual growth.

The Early Brain Academy, 37 Jalan Pemimpin, MAPEX #03-08, Singapore 577177, www.theearlybrainacademy.com

HAHA Chinese: Parent-accompanied Mandarin playgroups

Playgroup for: 14 – 30 months

HAHA Chinese is a boutique Mandarin Chinese language school that draws inspiration from the Reggio Emilia Approach for its classes. The school offers a 45-minute Mandarin Immersion playgroup for children from as young as 14 months. This baby playgroup uses sensory play, crafts, and other engaging activities to make language learning fun and interactive. The parent-accompanied programme also includes a unique mix of Mandarin songs and nursery rhymes to further engage little ones.

HAHA Chinese, 232A River Valley Road, Singapore 238290, Tel: (+65) 8890 4920 (WhatsApp), www.hahachinese.co

Read more: Chinese Tuition Centres In Singapore

Julia Gabriel PlayNest: Drama & music playgroups

Playgroup for: 6 to 3 years old

The Julia Gabriel playgroup is where little ones can first discover the joy of learning in a safe environment and develop social skills through meaningful interactions with caretakers, teachers and even puppets! With a specially-created Story Time and Music Time series, babies can stimulate their imagination and sense of wonder while they build sensory abilities through arts and crafts and other hands-on discovery activities.

Julia Gabriel, multiple locations in Singapore, including Forum Mall, Tampines Mall and Greenwich V, www.juliagabriel.com

Juzmusic Academy: Music playgroups in East Coast

Playgroup for: Newborns and above

With an East Coast location, the brilliant Early Childhood playgroups at this popular music school employ a multi-sensory approach that involves singing, playing, moving, listening and watching. Suitable for babies as young as newborns, the Junior Discovery programme is based on the Suzuki ECE and Suzuki Method, utilising everything from nursery rhymes to singing and percussion playing (might take your bub a few months to get a handle on that part of things!).

Juzmusic Academy, 1 Marine Parade Central, #09-04, Parkway Centre, Singapore 449408, Tel: (+65) 6344 4420, www.juzmusic.com

Read more: Music Schools In Singapore For Kids’ Music Classes

Kindermusik: Music playgroups

Playgroup for: Newborn to 7 years old

The welcoming environment at the Kindermusik Village is perfect for new babies. Parent-accompanied playgroup classes start from birth and instil a love of music in little ones. Classes are hands-on and designed to promote bonding with your babe—expect creative movement, vocal play, object and instrument exploration in each class. Toddlers from 18 months of age can join one of their Our Time classes and learn music through song, sound imitation, rhyming and creative dancing.

Kindermusik, multiple locations in Singapore, including Rochester Mall, Katong i12 Mall and United Square, Tel: (+65) 6684 8064, www.kindermusikwithlovestudios.com.sg

The Little Gym: Gymnastics playgroups

Playgroup for: 4 months to 12 years old

The Little Gym has got you covered with learning activities for energetic babies! Their parent-accompanied developmental gymnastics class for babies from 4 months of age promotes movement and motor development with plenty of songs, ball play and group games–it’s all about having fun while learning here!

The Little Gym, 583 Orchard Road, #B1-24, Singapore 238884 and 6 Raffles Boulevard, #03-163/164, Singapore 039594, Tel: (+65) 6238 6331, www.thelittlegym.com.sg

Read more: Kids’ Gymnastic Classes In Singapore

Little Paddington Preschool: Playgroup with indoor gym

Playgroup for: 3 to 6 years old

Perfect for working mamas, this highly specialised bilingual programme for infants at Little Paddington’s two beautiful infant care facilities has a low staff-child ratio to ensure plenty of individual attention. Along the way, educators encourage language and sensorial development, and babies get plenty of play at both the beautiful indoor gym and the lovely outdoor playground. And did we mention the petting zoo, water play and dedicated picnic spots?

Little Paddington, multiple locations in Singapore including Bartley, Turf Club and Kovan, www.littlepaddington.com

Les Oliviers: Montessori playgroup in Singapore

Playgroup for: 2 months to 2 years

Les Oliviers’s Montessori, You & Me is a programme that welcomes babies and their caregivers to discover Montessori philosophy. Run by a Montessori-trained educator, the programme’s main goal is to provide little ones with a safe, beautiful and prepared environment to explore. During playgroup hours, they’ll work with Montessori materials that aid in developing their fine and gross motor skills, concentration and curiosity.

Les Oliviers, 66 Namly Place, Singapore 267211, Tel (+65) 9145 3656. www.oliviers-french-montessori.com

Little Forest: Bilingual playgroup with outdoor farming activities

Playgroup for: 6 months to 3 years old

Little Forest offers child-led creative programmes to help your child reach their greatest potential. Choose from a variety of programmes that include bilingual playgroups to nurture your child’s love for language. Those who love the outdoors can try their hand at outdoor farming and learn how to grow their favourite fruits and veggies. Little Forest also offers trial playgroup classes where parents get to explore the programmes and experience the benefits before enrolling their little ones.

 Little Forest, 396 Joo Chiat Place, #02-03, Singapore 428079, www.littleforest.sg

Read more: Bilingual Schools In Singapore

Muckypups: Affordable parent-accompanied playgroups

Playgroup for: 4 months – 4 years old

This weekly 45-minute accompanied playgroup (parents and helpers both welcome!) is a super-fun creative outlet for little ones, with everything from circle time to singing, dancing, storytime, games, and lots of awesome art projects. These baby playgroups with sensory and messy play are great for exploratory learning with bubbles, songs, and music. We love that the first playgroup is at an affordable trial price and reasonably priced at about $35 per class thereafter (with no long-term commitment; just pay as you go)!

Mucky Pups, multiple locations in Singapore including River Valley, Katong and Holland Village, Tel: (+65) 9006 4216, www.muckypups-kids.com

Mother & Child: Prenatal classes, yoga & more

Playgroup for: Newborn and above

Practically a must-visit for parents-to-be and new mamas, Mother & Child offers all sorts of prenatal classes, newborn parenting classes, and drop-in well-baby clinics at its Tanglin location. You’ll also find first aid and infant massage classes for parents, helpers, and babies; yoga for pregnant women and new mamas; and postnatal classes for mamas and babies! And we haven’t even mentioned their legendary lactation specialists!

Mother & Child, 163 Tanglin Road #03-11, Singapore 247933, Tel: (+65) 6836 0063, www.motherandchild.com.sg

Marsden Swim School: Swimming playgroups

Playgroup for: 4 months and above

Marsden is highly sought-after by parents because the AUSTSWIM instructors do a great job motivating the kids at all levels—baby classes are small and the teachers are first-rate! The playgroups are all about getting little ones comfortable in the water through songs, games, and gentle splashing. Read more about swim classes for kids here.

Marsden Swim School, 102 Jalan Jurong Kechil, Singapore 598602, Tel: (+65) 6015 0637, www.marsdenswimschool.com

My Gym: Music & movement playgroups

Playgroup for: 7 months to 8 years old

In these parent-accompanied classes, mamas and papas (and helpers) gently introduce babies to music and movement through exercises, songs, dances, infant-safe rides and even unique swings. This unique playgroup for the littlest MyGym students even includes a parent discussion with tips on babies’ physical development. Bonus points for super-enthusiastic teachers whom kiddos seem to universally adore.

My Gym, multiple locations in Singapore including Tampines, Great World and Jurong East, www.mygym.com.sg

Our Music Studio: Music playgroups

Playgroup for: Newborn to 6 years

Musical Babes (0 to 1.5 years) and Rhythmic Tots (18 months to 3 years) classes for mini musicians teach small ones about music through vocal play, creative movement and instrument exploration. Classes have plenty of time for dancing, singing and giggling and are a lovely way for mama and bubba to spend some quality time together learning about music.

Our Music Studio, 163 Tanglin Road, #03-113 Tanglin Mall, Singapore 247933, Tel: (+65) 6467 1789, www.ourmusicstudio.com.sg

Sunflower Baby House & Preschool: Outdoor sand & water play

Playgroup for: 2 months to 3 years old

Geared toward providing a safe, loving, stimulating, and emotionally nurturing environment for babies from 2 months onwards, Sunflower Baby House infant care allows littles to explore and discover with daily activities like both indoor and outdoor play, creative arts, sand and water play, music & movement, and rhymes and songs.

Sunflower Baby House & Preschool, 600 Lorong 4 Toa Payoh, #02-03 600@Toa Payoh, Singapore 319515, Tel: (+65) 6022 1877, www.sunflowerbabyhouse.com

SWISH Swimming: Baby swimming playgroup

Playgroup for: 4 months and above

SWISH offers babies and children a temperature-controlled, salt-chlorinated environment that is gentler on hair, skin and eyes. Parents and caregivers accompany little ones in the water through games, songs, and gentle activities that get bubs comfortable with the water and basics like putting their face underwater. Ultimately, babies are able to explore the water and extend their abilities en route to becoming competent, safety-conscious little swimmers!

SWISH Swimming, 72 Loewen Road #01-08, Dempsey Hill, Singapore 248848, (+65) 9832 2522, www.swishswimming.com

Special Learners: Bilingual playgroup in Clementi

Playgroup for: 6 months to 3 years old

Looking for a play gym where your little one can meet new friends and grow in confidence? How about a bilingual playgroup where your child can be exposed to both English and Chinese? The holistic programme at Special Learners Gym and Art Preschool, specially curated by a professional occupation therapist, uses purposeful and sensory play to stimulate your child’s brain development and at the same time hone their physical coordination skills.

Special Learners, Blk 450 Clementi Avenue 3, #01-293 (back entrance, 2nd floor), Singapore 120450, Tel: (+65) 8927 3536, www.instagram.com/special_learners_preschool

Read more: Swimming Classes & Swim Schools In Singapore

Waldorf Early Years: Parent & child drop-in playgroups

Playgroup for: 2 months to 6 years old

Every Saturday (10am to 12pm), parents and their 18-month-old toddlers can drop in for Waldorf Early Years’ playgroup programme, where teachers will gather everyone for circle songs, rhymes and story time with puppets. Little ones will also have a safe space to learn through exploratory play with open-ended toys and get hands-on with daily activities like cutting fruit, laying the table and cleaning up – all meaningful tasks that will nurture the mind, heart and hands of these toddlers.

Get $20 off enrolment fees by emailing playgroup@waldorf.sg to register.

 Waldorf Early Years, 72 Jalan Senang, Singapore 418371, www.waldorfsingapore.com

Read more:

The post Guide To Baby Classes & Playgroups In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Tastiest Tingkat Delivery Services In Singapore For Home Cooked Meals Delivered To Your Door
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
No time to cook? Opt for a tingkat delivery service straight to your door. Whether you’re looking for halal, healthy or vegetarian tingkat sets, we’ve got you covered with this list of tingkat delivery in Singapore. Looking for tingkat delivery in Singapore to make life just a tad easier? There’s no shortage of services offering […]

The post Tastiest Tingkat Delivery Services In Singapore For Home Cooked Meals Delivered To Your Door appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
No time to cook? Opt for a tingkat delivery service straight to your door. Whether you’re looking for halal, healthy or vegetarian tingkat sets, we’ve got you covered with this list of tingkat delivery in Singapore.

Looking for tingkat delivery in Singapore to make life just a tad easier? There’s no shortage of services offering wholesome, nutritious tingkat meals daily straight to your doorstep. Getting food delivery or doing grocery shopping online for organic fruits and veggies has never been easier. But sometimes, you just crave a healthy home-cooked meal that you don’t have time to cook yourself. ‘Tingkat’ is the local term for tiffin carriers, used as lunch boxes in the olden days and now more often used to carry home-cooked dishes to friends and family. Here’s where to order the best tingkat delivery that works for you – including tingkat services that are healthy, affordable or halal – scroll through our list and take your pick!

Read more: Confinement Food Delivery Services In Singapore

Tingkat Delivery Services In Singapore:

Lagun Sari Kitchen: Halal tingkat delivery

Looking for a halal tingkat delivery service? Lagun Sari Kitchen offers delicious halal tingkat meals that allow you to come home to a freshly home-cooked meal without lifting a finger. Their healthy tingkat meals are packed with nutrition and flavour without using MSG. Thanks to their experienced in-house chefs, you can look forward to tingkat meals that are satisfying to your palate.

Each tingkat meal comes with two proteins (meat or seafood), one veggie and rice. Promising a proper meal, they do not skimp on healthy ingredients or portion, so you can rest assured that you will get great value for money. They offer free tingkat delivery, and no minimum number of days is required to order.

Quote SASSY5 to get 5% off your first tingkat meal. Minimum three-day order. Valid until 30 July 2025. New customers only.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $12.50 per person per day; free tingkat delivery service from 4pm to 6pm.

Lagun Sari Kitchen, www.lagun-sari.com.sg

Read more: Guide To Halal Restaurants & Cafés In Singapore

Ding Caters: Fresh, home-cooked tingkat meals

Ding Caters whips up nutritious yet delicious Chinese tingkat meals for diners of all ages. Made with the freshest ingredients with no added MSG, healthier condiments and canola oil, their tingkat meals can cater to those with high blood pressure, high glucose, and high cholesterol, making this a healthy tingkat delivery service for the elderly. Their tingkat meal comes with a choice of three dishes and one soup or four dishes with no additional cost.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $120 per person for five tingkat meals

Ding Caters, www.dingcaters.com

Read more: Best Chinese Restaurants In Singapore

Empress Porridge: Healthy tingkat meals for families

Empress Porridge is a popular tingkat delivery service in Singapore that caters especially to the kiddos in the family. We love their complimentary weekly speciality kids’ meal that comes with a dinner plan with two adults. The team at Empress Porridge prepares home-cooked daily meals with premium ingredients and no added MSG. Look forward to tingkat meals featuring Chinese, Thai and Japanese dishes. Plus, there’s no extra charge for brown rice!

Tingkat delivery prices: From $176.58 for two pax for a 5-day trial of their tingkat dinners

Empress Porridge, www.empressporridge.com

Best Catering: Affordable tingkat meals

Established in 2014, Best Catering is known for whipping up delicious, home-cooked tingkat meals in Singapore. They have served over 5,000 satisfied families and continue to do so daily. The word on the street is that their healthy and comforting tingkat meals taste just like home, so you can still enjoy your favourite dishes without the tedious clean-up afterwards!

Their menu features over 200 dishes, which means you can look forward to something different every day. For their Special Thursday Combo, you can look forward to local delights such as Fried Hokkien Mee, Chicken Rice, Cheng Teng and more. Curate your own tingkat meal plan and top up to enjoy premium ingredients and double-boiled soups. Each tingkat meal is freshly cooked and delivered straight to your doorstep!

Tingkat delivery prices: From $8.50 per person for a family tingkat meal

Best Catering, 30B Quality Road, Singapore 618826, www.bestcatering.com

FoodLine: Tingkat delivery portal with tingkat reviews

FoodLine is one of Singapore’s largest catering and tingkat platforms with over 180 tingkat menus from 24 tingkat caterers. They serve as a one-stop hub for all your tingkat delivery needs. Browse the different packages, tingkat subscriptions and menus to suit your tastebuds and households. There are also halal tingkat menus available.

If you need more assurance, you can also browse over 126,000 reviews, videos, and photos left by past customers before purchasing. You’ll also receive $400 worth of Huat! Together Vouchers, once you’ve placed your orders, which you can use to offset your next purchase. Simply order your tingkat meal online and get it delivered straight to your door. 

Sassy Mama readers get a free one-month Tingkat Savings Plan consisting of 5 x $8 Tingkat vouchers with no minimum spend. Click here to claim! Terms and conditions apply.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $3.80 per person per day

Foodline Tingkat Delivery, www.foodline.sg

Fatty Daddy Fatty Mummy: Healthy tingkat delivery for elderly parents

Helmed by a professional chef and his wife, Fatty Daddy Fatty Mummy does a variety of healthy Chinese-style tingkat dinner menus that all have less sodium, healthier oil and zero MSG. Their Love, Tingkat! menu is the healthiest of the bunch, made without processed foods and is Singapore Healthier Choice-certified, perfect for families who want to cater tingkat meals for their elderly parents.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $98 (1 pax) for a 5-day trial of their Regular Tingkat menu.

Fatty Daddy Fatty Mummy, www.fattydaddyfattymummy.com

Read more: Must-Try Chinese Restaurants In Singapore

Fresher Dinners: Weekly international tingkat menus

Fresher Dinners is a tingkat delivery service in Singapore which features an array of international cuisine options through its weekly menus. Their tingkat meals are perfect for families seeking to introduce the kiddos to new foods and cultures. Each meal is crafted using only olive oil, free from preservatives, processed meats, or MSG. You can enjoy a variety of cuisines from Chinese to French, Western, Italian and more. 

Tingkat delivery prices: From $14.90 per person per dinner

Fresher Dinners, www.fresherdinners.com.sg

Jessie’s Catering: Home-cooked tingkat

Jessie’s Catering proudly serves up delicious Chinese home-cooked meals for happy tummies! A typical tingkat dinner meal includes one meat, one veggie, and one or two side dishes or soup, depending on your preference. And they rotate the dishes regularly, so you won’t receive the same dish twice in a row. Choose from a 5-day, 10-day or 20-day tingkat delivery option to suit your family’s needs.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $52.97 per person for 5 days

Jessie’s Catering, www.foodline.sg

KCK Food Catering: Affordable halal tingkat delivery

KCK Food Catering boasts more than 30 years of experience in the catering industry, serving quality, healthy and halal dishes at affordable prices. Their halal tingkat service currently only serves dinner and features a different menu every week. The menus feature a mix of international, fusion and Asian food, and you can look forward to enjoying an array of different cuisines daily.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $133 for 2 pax for 5 days

KCK Food Catering, www.kckfood.com

Read more: Halal Restaurants & Cafes In Singapore

Kim Paradise: Home-cooked tingkat meals

Kim Paradise prides itself on being one of Singapore’s largest tingkat delivery companies, serving up to 6,000 customers daily! If you’re looking for healthy tingkat delivery options, you’re in good hands because Kim Paradise’s Chinese-style dishes are light on salt and oil and free of added MSG. You can also opt for the Healthy Tingkat Plan, which comes with premium ingredients. Each meal is packed with nutrition and is well-balanced.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $8.50 per pax for the Family Tingkat plan.

Kim Paradise, www.kimparadise.com.sg

Read more: Must-Try Chinese Restaurants In Singapore

Le Xin Catering: Convenient tingkat delivery

Le Xin Catering offers tasty tingkat meals for lunch and dinner, depending on your family’s needs. Their Family Deluxe Lunch Delivery comes with three Chinese stir-fried dishes and rice, three dishes and one soup or four dishes. We love that you can also upgrade your carbs to brown rice for a healthier choice. All of their food is low in cholesterol and salt, and they use pure vegetable oil and no MSG.

Tingkat delivery prices: From $133 (1 pax) for a 10-day trial of their Asian Delights menu.

Le Xin Catering, www.lexincatering.com.sg

Neo Garden: Tingkat meals with international cuisines

Do you crave a different cuisine once a week? Neo Garden is the tingkat delivery service you need! Offering international cuisines from Korea, Japan, and Thailand, Neo Garden includes dishes like Bibimbap, Thai Style Green Curry Chicken and more to spice up the menu. Neo Garden is a popular caterer in Singapore that offers an omakase tingkat plan for big families, as well as buffet and event menus for special occasions. 

Tingkat delivery prices: From $7.25 per person for the Family Omakase daily meals with a minimum 10-day subscription.

Neo Garden, www.neogarden.com.sg

Savoury Catering: Healthy tingkat delivery

Savoury Catering prides itself on serving only quality, nutritious food. Each tingkat meal is curated to consist of the Essential Five: Grain, Poultry, Vegetable, Fish and Soup, ensuring that each meal is well-balanced for the whole family. Choose from 2 choices: the Everyday Staples, or if you’re looking for a healthier option, The Healthier Choice. Their menu rotates weekly, and they also serve tingkat meals for 1 pax!

Tingkat delivery prices: From $185.30 (with GST) for a 10-day tingkat delivery trial

Savoury Catering, www.savourycatering.com.sg

Select Catering: Healthy tingkat delivery in Singapore

Select Catering has been serving up nostalgic home-cooked dishes for over 30 years. With affordable tingkat prices from $5.50 per person, Select Catering helps busy mums and dads check meals off their to-do lists so they can focus on spending time with their families. The chefs at Select Catering whip up comforting, Chinese home-cooked meals and pride themselves in using less salt, less oil and no added MSG. 

Tingkat delivery prices: From $5.50+ per person per day

 Select Catering, www.selectcatering.com.sg

Shiok Kitchen Catering: Halal tingkat delivery

Shiok Kitchen Catering offers a Shiok Healthy Tingkat. These halal tingkat meals that are packed with flavour. We love that you can choose what you would like to eat for the day from Chinese to Malay and even Teochew dishes, giving you the flexibility to customise the menu to your liking. Their tingkat meals are lower in fat, calories and sodium, and they use higher wholegrains to ensure balanced nutrition.

Tingkat delivery price: From $26.80 for two pax per meal for three dishes, one soup and rice

Shiok Kitchen Catering, www.shiokkitchencatering.com.sg

Tingkat Delivery by Richfood: No MSG

Tingkat Delivery brings you the taste of Chinese home-cooked meals that are both delicious and nutritious, made fresh and without MSG. Their tingkat menu is updated weekly on their website, so you can have a look at what’s on offer for the week. They also have a healthy tingkat menu option!

Tingkat delivery prices: From $111.18 (2 pax) for a 5-day trial meal package.

Tingkat Delivery, www.tingkatdelivery.com

Keep scrolling for more food and dining options!

The post Tastiest Tingkat Delivery Services In Singapore For Home Cooked Meals Delivered To Your Door appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Best Nail Salons In Singapore For Your Much-Needed Mani-Pedi, Nail Art & Gelish Manicures
item.dc:creator: Cherilyn
item.description:
Keen to get your nails done? We round up the best nail salons in Singapore that offer express gel manicures, classic pedicures, nail art and more. Looking for a nail salon in Singapore to give your nails a fresh look? We’ve got you covered. Whether you’re looking to do a classic manicure, a Gelish manicure […]

The post Best Nail Salons In Singapore For Your Much-Needed Mani-Pedi, Nail Art & Gelish Manicures appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Keen to get your nails done? We round up the best nail salons in Singapore that offer express gel manicures, classic pedicures, nail art and more.

Looking for a nail salon in Singapore to give your nails a fresh look? We’ve got you covered. Whether you’re looking to do a classic manicure, a Gelish manicure or need to give your feet some tender loving care with a pedicure, you’ll be sure to find a nail salon near you with our list of the best nail salons in Singapore! So, take this as your sign to make an appointment at one of these nail salons and treat yourself for tirelessly taking care of your family. You deserve it, mama!

Read more: Mobile Beauty Services In Singapore That Come To Your Home

Best Nail Salons In Singapore:

1. Nail Palace: Popular nail salon with 20+ outlets

Nail Palace is one of the most popular nail salons in Singapore, thanks to their creative and gorgeous nail art and mani-pedis. Whether you’re in a pinch and need an express gel manicure or would like to indulge in a deluxe pedicure, Nail Palace has what you need. They also offer a variety of treatments, including sole renewal treatment and corn treatment, plus hair removal and eyelash services.

Nail Palace, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Bugis and Bukit Panjang, www.nailpalace.com.sg

2. Pixie Nail Spa: Comfy nail salon with friendly staff

Pixie Nail Spa has 15 outlets across Singapore, so this is another popular nail salon that you can easily find near you. Their nail salons have super comfy seats that will make you feel like a queen, while their expert manicurist turns your dream nails into a reality. Opt for a classic manicure or a Gelish manicure for something more durable. They also offer lash extensions and brow embroidery services.

Pixie Nail Spa, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Tampines and Yishun, www.pixienailspagroup.com

3. N20 Nail Spa: Award-winning nail salon

Looking for a nail salon in Singapore with a track record of satisfied customers? N20 Nail Spa has been voted the “Best Spa Manicure” and “Best Nail Salon Services”. They use high-quality, dermatologist-certified nail polish from brands including Chanel, Morgan Taylor and Orly. Their long-lasting nail polishes produce gorgeous colours that are resistant to chipping and smudging.

N20 Nail Spa, seven locations in Singapore including Jurong East, Sengkang and Dhoby Ghaut, www.n20.com.sg

4. Maco Nail Spa: Gel manicure & nail extensions

Managed by Pixie Nail Spa, you can rest assured that you will get quality manicure and pedicure services at Maco Nail Spa. Conveniently located at Holland Village, you can easily pop by during a lunch break to treat yourself to a mani-pedi. They offer classic manicures, gel manicures, acrylic nails, hybrid nails and gel nail extensions and more.

Maco Nail Spa, 200 Holland Avenue, #B1-01, Singapore 278995, www.pixienailspagroup.com 

5. Nail Addiction: Nail salon with affordable manicure

Nail Addiction is more than just a nail salon in Singapore. In addition to an affordable express manicure, this nail salon also offers massages, foot reflexology and ear candling. If you want to treat yourself, try their manicure spa, pedicure spa or top-up for a nail mask treatment. Need to de-stress? You can also get a head massage here!

Nail Addiction, multiple locations in Singapore including Temasek Boulevard, Ang Mo Kio and Kovan, www.nailaddiction.sg

Read more: Best Spas In Singapore

6. Nailz Gallery: Affordable nail salon for a mani-pedi

Nailz Gallery is a nail salon you can’t miss when you walk past it in a mall. We love their bright and spacious nail salons that offer a comfortable environment to get your nails done. Known for their affordable nail services, Nailz Gallery is a top choice for a classic manicure and classic pedicure. They also offer Gelish manicures and other beauty services, including eyelash extensions and eyebrow embroidery.

Nailz Gallery, multiple locations in Singapore including Jurong East, Woodlands and Raffles City, www.nailzgallery.com

7. The Nail Arcadia: Beauty salon for nails & lashes

Looking for a fuss-free nail salon in Singapore? The Nail Arcadia is nestled in Our Tampines Hub and offers a clean, minimalistic space. We love their super cute nail art designs that suit every mood and preference. Whether you want a simple classic manicure or fancy nail art for a special occasion, The Nail Arcadia can make it happen. They can also do eyelash extensions.

The Nail Arcadia, Our Tampines Hub, 1 Tampines Walk, #B1-37, Singapore 528523

8. For Duchess, By Duke: Cheapest nail salon in Singapore

On a tight budget? Believing that every woman deserves a treat, For Duchess, By Duke is one of the cheapest nail salons in Singapore, yet they do not compromise on quality. Their nail technicians are trained and certified by Après in the USA, specialising in the advanced Gel-X system that creates natural-looking nail extensions that last. Try their 10-minute one-step express manicure or opt for their nail art for a special occasion.

For Duchess, By Duke, 11 Tanjong Katong Road, #02-15, Kinex, Singapore 437157, www.forduchessbyduke.com.sg

9. The Nail Social: Non-toxic nail salon

The Nail Social is a socially conscious nail salon in Singapore that uses only non-toxic, eco-friendly and cruelty-free products. They use Zoya & Coat nail lacquers and AngelPro & Jacqueline Burchell gel nail polish, all of which are free from all of the nasty chemicals that harm your nails, so they’re safe for children and expectant mums! As Singapore’s first socially-conscious salon, they offer vocational training and employment to local marginalised women.

The Nail Social, 333 Kreta Ayer Road #02-15, Singapore 080333, www.thenailsocial.co

10. [BONUS!] Nail Wonderland: Shop for nail art, nail polish & tools

If you love doing your nails at home, this one’s for you. Nail Wonderland is the go-to place for high-quality gel nail polish, nail art and more. From clear gels to colour gels, nail stickers and even nail art tools like brushes and gel lamps, this one-stop shop has everything you need to create a mini nail salon at home. Plus, they also offer nail art courses.

Nail Wonderland, 209A Lavender Street, Level 2, Singapore 338767, www.nailwonderland.com

Read more:

The post Best Nail Salons In Singapore For Your Much-Needed Mani-Pedi, Nail Art & Gelish Manicures appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: What’s New In May: NEW Artground Playground, A Train Hotel, Mario Kart @ Jewel & More!
item.dc:creator: Aisyah Amin
item.description:
This month, race over to Jewel Changi Airport for the Mario Kart and Nintendo pop-ups, explore a brand new innovation hub in the West, and discover an exciting new indoor playspace for the little ones! New month, new finds! This month, Jewel Changi Airport welcomes Mario Kart and Nintendo pop-ups, and there’s an exciting new […]

The post What’s New In May: NEW Artground Playground, A Train Hotel, Mario Kart @ Jewel & More! appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
This month, race over to Jewel Changi Airport for the Mario Kart and Nintendo pop-ups, explore a brand new innovation hub in the West, and discover an exciting new indoor playspace for the little ones!

New month, new finds! This month, Jewel Changi Airport welcomes Mario Kart and Nintendo pop-ups, and there’s an exciting new innovation hub in the West that’ll have you planning your visit ASAP! Plus, we explored a refreshed indoor playspace at The Artground, packed with hands-on fun that the kids will love.

Click here for past What’s New Mama finds!

Disclaimer: These are external events not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the organiser for changes or cancellations.

Singapore Oceanarium: Opening July 2025

The news of the S.E.A. Aquarium closing just before the school holidays might be a bit of a bummer (we’re sad too!), but don’t worry, because Resorts World Sentosa has just shared that the all-new Singapore Oceanarium is making a splash in July 2025! And it’s not just a regular upgrade, it’s going to be three times bigger, with 22 thematic zones that take you through the wonders of the ocean, from shallow shores to the deep sea, and even back in time to prehistoric waters. You can look forward to zones like Whale Fall and Sea Mount, where you’ll find a life-sized recreation of a whale fall ecosystem, and Ancient Waters and Conquering Land, featuring massive prehistoric creatures and living fossils. Plus, the iconic Open Ocean zone will be home to Reef Manta Rays and Zebra Sharks!

Deets: Singapore Oceanarium, opening July 2025 in Resorts World Sentosa

Train Pod: New train hotel using upcycled MRTs

If you’re a fan of trains, the new Train Pod at one-north is your next must-visit staycation spot. Opening in the second half of 2025, this new co-living hotel has eight tiny pods, each converted from a decommissioned MRT carriage and designed to sleep up to two guests. Look forward to MRT elements inside, including LCD panels in the driver’s compartment that play real footage of the train’s previous tunnel journeys. Guests can also enjoy a 24/7 vending machine café, an outdoor dining area, and public benches repurposed from actual MRT seats! Read all about the Train Pod @ one-north here!

Deets: Train Pod @ one-north, 69 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139961, www.tinypod.com

Lotte Mart Express: First store in SG opens at VivoCity

If you’ve ever visited South Korea, you’ve probably set foot in their popular hypermarket chain Lotte Mart. We’ve got good news–they have just opened its first store in FairPrice Xtra VivoCity, so you can satisfy your cravings for tasty Korean snacks, instant noodles and treats. From choco pie to soju highballs, corn chips and fried chicken, Lotte Mart Express has everything you need to put a smile on your face.

Deets: Lotte Mart Express, FairPrice Extra VivoCity, 1 HarbourFront Walk, #01-23 & #B2-23, 1 HarbourFront Walk, #B2-23 VivoCity, Singapore 098585, www.vivocity.com.sg

Geneo @ Singapore Science Park: New integrated Work-Live-Play hub

Westies, there’s a new hangout spot to add to your list! Geneo @ Singapore Science Park is a new live-work-play hub that comprises offices, labs, serviced apartments and retail spaces. Here, you’ll find familiar F&B favourites like Luckin Coffee, Swensen’s, and BreadTalk. While you’re there, be sure to check out Singapore’s first-ever distributed cooling system, which is powered by rooftop solar panels (over 1,800 of them!)

Deets: Kinokuniya, opening August 2025, Raffles City, Level 3, www.kinokuniya.com.sg

Civic District Children’s Season: Little Explorer’s Trail, hands-on workshops & performances

Children’s Season in the Civic District is back with exciting activities that promise fun for the whole family! Step into a world of wonder and discover the world through the eyes of little ones through thrilling performances, hands-on workshops and interactive exhibits designed to spark curiosity and imagination. Drop by The Arts House at the Old Parliament, Asian Civilisations Museum, Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay, National Gallery Singapore and Victoria Theatre & Victoria Concert Hall for family-friendly activities.

For the first time, Children’s Season will introduce the Little Explorer’s Trail, where kids can embark on an adventure trail in the Civic District. Drop by any of the three (out of the five) arts venues to collect three stamps on the trail map to redeem a free sticker sheet. This family-friendly activity allows families to explore Singapore and discover cultural gems in the heart of the city. Plus, don’t miss various arts programmes happening within the precinct such as the ‘Look At The World’ concert by the Singapore Symphony Youth & Children’s Choir at the Victoria Concert Hall and The Arts House Story Tour (part of Monstrous Fun! at The Arts House).

Deets: Children’s Season, May to June 2025 (The Little Explorer’s Trail is from 30 May – 29 June 2025), various locations in the Civic District, www.artshouselimited.sg

Kinokuniya: New store at Raffles City this August!

Kinokuniya is opening a brand-new outlet at Raffles City Shopping Centre this August! Spanning 3,433 sqft on the third floor, this cosy new space promises quiet moments of discovery with Kinokuniya’s signature blue shelves and a dedicated Blue Room, a serene nook for immersive reads and literary escapes. The announcement follows news that the brand’s iconic 38,000 sqft flagship store at Ngee Ann City will be downsized. Additionally, the brand has also closed its other outlets in recent years, reflecting the challenges of the shrinking book retail scene. Still, we know that this new store is a dose of good news for book lovers, and we’re all for it!

Deets: Kinokuniya, opening August 2025, Raffles City, Level 3, www.kinokuniya.com.sg

Yamaha Music School: New primary course for ages 3 to 5.5

Got a little musician at home? Yamaha Music School, AKA one of Singapore’s most popular music schools, has just launched a brand-new Yamaha Primary Course for kiddos as young as 3! Designed for ages 3 to 5, this refreshed programme is packed with catchy new tunes, updated content, and new digital learning tools. Kids will benefit from Yamaha’s distinctive teaching method: “Listening,” “Singing,” “Playing,” and “Reading.” With instruments like the Piano or Electone in hand, they’ll build a solid musical foundation while learning to express themselves with confidence.

The Yamaha Primary Course also helps little ones build social skills, teamwork, and other lifelong skills. Lessons are led by certified Yamaha teachers who possess extensive musical knowledge and excellent communication skills, ensuring high-quality instruction. Yamaha Music School is hosting an Exclusive Primary Experience Corner at Plaza Singapura branch from April to June, which includes hands-on activities and more. More information here.

Deets: Yamaha Music School, www.app.yamaha.sg

Mandai ZooSchool: Singapore’s first wildlife adventure school for kids

This school holidays, kids can look forward to a brand-new experience at Mandai Wildlife Reserve. Launching on 2 June 2025, ZooSchool will be Singapore’s first wildlife adventure school for kids, inviting young explorers to step into unforgettable outdoor adventures. From animal encounters to mission-based challenges and basic first aid courses, the WILD Rescue Rangers programme will nurture empathy, responsibility and confidence, equipping kids to tackle real-world challenges.

Deets: ZooSchool, 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, www.zooschool.mandai.com

The Cathay: Revamped mall after 2-year renovation

Everyone’s go-to hangout spot in Dhoby Ghaut has just reopened following a 2-year renovation! The revamped 16-storey Cathay Building features a shopping mall from Levels 1 to 6, and from Levels 7 to 16, The Cathay Residence. While the iconic cinema is no longer there, there’s still plenty to do. From a 24-hour gym to burn off those snacks to delicious F&B spots to satisfy every craving. One of the main highlights is the new three-story, 360-degree multimedia screen featuring dynamic visuals in HD! Check out our full guide of The Cathay at Dhoby Ghaut here.

Deets: The Cathay, 2 Handy Road, Singapore 229233, www.thecathay.com.sg

PropNex Family Zone: Free outdoor playground @ Gardens by The Bay

Heading to the iconic Gardens by the Bay soon? Good news because there’s a brand-new outdoor playground, and it’s inspired by the Supertrees themselves! This sizeable play space features towering wooden structures that mimic the look of the Supertrees, and yes, they even light up at night! Older kids will love the climbing structures and tall slide, while little ones will enjoy the giant sandpit that glows after dark. There’s even a mini marketplace that is perfect for pretend play. Check out our full review of the Propnex Family Zone at Gardens by The Bay here and watch our Reel here.

Deets: Propnex Family Zone, Gardens by The Bay Active Garden, www.gardensbythebay.com.sg

The Artground @ GAC: New “Lost Islands” indoor playspace

The Artground has just unveiled its newest playspace, and we guarantee you’d want to check this one out! This play space presents three different interactive exhibitions for kids throughout the year, and its latest exhibition – Lost Islands – invites little adventurers to journey across the islands of Singapore and Indonesia, where myths, folklore, and legends come to life. Just opened in April, this new indoor playground features climbing elements and a sensory path set along the back of a majestic mythical sea dragon! Watch our reel here.

Deets: The Artground @ GAC, Goodman Arts Centre, www.theartground.com.sg

Revamped Museum of Ice Cream: New installations including a Banana Maze

Possibly one of the most colourful, kid-friendly museums in Singapore, the Museum of Ice Cream has just reopened after a sweet revamp, complete with new interactive installations that’ll have you chasing your next sugar rush. New highlights to look forward to include the adorable Animal Cookie Ride, a brand-new bouncy castle, the Infinity Mirror Party Zone as well as Singapore’s first-ever Banana Maze! The carnival area also has nostalgic games for a dose of childhood fun. Plus, you can now indulge in up to 19 ice cream flavours and 8 toppings during your visit! Check out our full review of Museum of Ice Cream and watch our Reel here.

Deets: Museum of Ice Cream Singapore, 100 Loewen Road, Dempsey, Singapore 248837, www.museumoficecream.com

Nintendo Pop-Up store @ Jewel Changi Airport: New and exclusive merchandise

The popular Nintendo pop-up is making a comeback at Jewel Changi Airport, and this year, it’s bigger than ever! Expect 150 new and exclusive merchandise items from fan-favourite games like Super Mario, Animal Crossing, The Legend of Zelda, Splatoon, Pikmin and more. Think stationery, figurines, apparel, and plenty of collectables! Plus, be sure to spot Mario-themed installations located around Jewel, including a massive Rainbow Road centrepiece!

Deets: Nintendo pop-up store, Jewel Changi Airport, www.jewelchangiairport.com

The post What’s New In May: NEW Artground Playground, A Train Hotel, Mario Kart @ Jewel & More! appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Watch The IPL 2025 In Singapore: Sports Bars With Live Coverage & Match Schedule
item.dc:creator: Cherilyn
item.description:
Cricket fans – we’ve got all you need to know about where to watch the Indian Premier League (IPL) in Singapore, so you don’t miss the final match on 25 May 2025. From match schedules to sports bars with live streaming, here’s all you need to know! The Indian Premier League (IPL) is a highlight […]

The post Where To Watch The IPL 2025 In Singapore: Sports Bars With Live Coverage & Match Schedule appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Cricket fans – we’ve got all you need to know about where to watch the Indian Premier League (IPL) in Singapore, so you don’t miss the final match on 25 May 2025. From match schedules to sports bars with live streaming, here’s all you need to know!

The Indian Premier League (IPL) is a highlight for anyone who’s a fan of cricket. The IPL is a professional Twenty20 (T20) cricket league in India that was created by the Board of Control for Cricket in India in 2008. Today, it is one of the most popular T20 leagues in the world. This cricket tournament is modelled after the English Premier League and is broadcast in over 100 countries.

So, if you want to catch the action, read on to find out how you can get a VPN to stream the IPL Tournament so you can support your favourite cricket team!

Jump to:
– When is the IPL 2025?
– When and where will the IPL 2025 final take place?
– Which cities are hosting the IPL 2025?
– How to watch the IPL 2025 with cable?
– How to watch the IPL 2025 online?
– Where to watch the IPL 2025 in Singapore?
– IPL 2025 Match Schedule

When is the IPL 2025?

The IPL 2025 began on 22 March 2025 at Eden Gardens, Kolkata, where the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fought for a chance to qualify for the next round in the IPL.

When and where will the IPL 2025 Final take place?

The final match of the IPL 2025 will take place on 25 May 2025 at Eden Gardens, a full circle moment as players return to the place where the IPL 2025 began just a few months ago.

Which cities are hosting the IPL 2025?

The IPL 2025 will take place across 13 locations in India, including Eden Gardens in Kolkata, MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai, Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bangaluru and many more.

How to watch the IPL 2025 with cable?

You can watch the IPL 2025 in Singapore if you subscribe to StarHub TV+ (the official broadcaster). Purchase the Sports+ Pass for just $25.46 a month, which allows you to watch live IPL matches via the StarHub TV+ app or the StarHub TV+ box that’s connected to your TV.

How to watch the IPL 2025 online?

If you prefer to watch overseas coverage of IPL 2025, you’ll need to get a VPN, which allows you to stream content from any part of the world. Simply connect to a server location of your choice, then stream the IPL matches through JioHotstar, YuppTV, Willow TV and ESPN+ with a subscription.

The good news is, your VPN subscription will also give you access to other shows from home that you’ve missed watching! So, the return on investment will last long after IPL 2025. Choose from a one-month, 12 months or 2 year-subscription to suit your streaming needs. With just a few steps, you’ll be just a few clicks away from connecting to servers in 105 countries and streaming IPL 2025.

Where to watch IPL 2025 in Singapore

Brewerkz: Known for their award-winning beer
