Looking for a place to pump, change a diaper or breastfeed your baby? Consult our handy list of nursing rooms in Singapore! As one of the most kid-friendly nations in the world, there are plenty of nursing rooms in Singapore to give you the privacy you need to feed and change your little one while […]

The post Handy List Of Best Nursing Rooms In Singapore To Breastfeed appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a place to pump, change a diaper or breastfeed your baby? Consult our handy list of nursing rooms in Singapore!

As one of the most kid-friendly nations in the world, there are plenty of nursing rooms in Singapore to give you the privacy you need to feed and change your little one while you’re out. It can get overwhelming when your baby’s crying for milk, but you don’t have to stress yourself out wondering where you’ll find a clean nursing room with everything you need to feed your baby. We’ve rounded up a list of the best nursing rooms in Singapore, so bookmark this for the next time you want to find the closest family room, baby care room or changing stations in your favourite mall, amusement park and even the airport!

        Read more: Ultimate Guide to Breastfeeding in Singapore

1. 313@Somerset

Location: Levels B3, 1 and 5
Expect changing stations, nursing cubicles with armchairs and benches, large waiting areas, a hot and cold water dispenser, power points at the level 1 nursing room, a microwave at the B3 and Level 5 rooms, and a child look level 1 plus a child-friendly loo at Level B3.

313@Somerset, 313 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238895, www.313somerset.com.sg

2. Anchorpoint Shopping Centre

Location: Basement 1 and Level 1 by the restrooms
There are two nursing rooms here with armchairs separated by curtains. There are also changing stations, hot and cold water dispensers and power points to charge your breast pump, phone or any other electronic device.

Anchorpoint Shopping Centre, 370 Alexandra Road, Singapore 159953, www.anchorpoint.com.sg

3. Ang Mo Kio Hub

Location: Level 3 near restrooms
The lockable nursing rooms at AMK Hub are spacious and come with benches, changing stations, a waiting area and sinks plus a hot water dispenser.

Ang Mo Kio Hub, 53 Ang Mo Kio Ave 3, Singapore 569933, www.amkhub.com.sg

4. Aperia Kallang Mall

Location: Level 1 next to the restrooms
The two nursing rooms here are separated by curtains and have no locks. There are also three changing stations, a sink (no soap), power points and a waiting area.

Aperia Kallang Mall, 12 Kallang Ave, Singapore 339511, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/aperia/en.html

5. Bedok Mall

Location: Level B1 near restrooms
Key features include two lockable nursing rooms with armchairs, but there’s no table or space to park your stroller in the room. However, there are two changing stations and a waiting area, so park your elder tots there and make use of the power points to charge your devices. There are also family toilets with a diaper-changing area at Bedok Mall, a children’s loo and a baby seat within the handicapped restrooms.

Bedok Mall, 311 New Upper Changi Rd, Singapore 467360,  www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bedokmall/en.html

6. Bugis Junction

Location: Ladies’ restrooms on Levels 1-3 (baby changing and child protection seats)
Head up to Level 3 to use the baby care room, which has two nursing cubicles separated by curtains, a changing station, hot and cold water dispensers, a waiting area and a playground for the little ones.

Bugis Junction, 200 Victoria St, Singapore 188021, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bugisjunction/en.html

7. Bukit Panjang Plaza

Location: Level 1 (within ladies’ restroom); Level 2 to 3 (next to lifts) and Level 4 (next to the library)
The nursing room on Level 1 is merely a cubicle with curtains and no locks, so head up to those on Levels 2 to 4 for lockable doors and added privacy. Other amenities include changing tables and sinks.

Bukit Panjang Plaza, 1 Jelebu Rd, Singapore 677743,  www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bukitpanjangplaza/en.html

8. Bukit Timah Plaza

Location: Level B1
The entire nursing room at Bukit Timah Plaza can be locked, guaranteeing absolute privacy. The downside? There may be longer waiting times if queues are long. The nursing room also has a changing table and a sink.

Bukit Timah Plaza, 1 Jalan Anak Bukit, Singapore 588996, www.bukittimahplaza.com.sg

9. Causeway Point

Location: Levels 1 to 5 and Level 7 (near the restrooms)
There’s not much here, but the basic amenities within the nursing rooms include sofas, curtains for privacy, changing tables, sinks, a hot and cold water dispenser and power points.

Causeway Point, 1 Woodlands Square, Singapore 738099, www.causewaypoint.com.sg

10. Central @ Clarke Quay

Location: Level 1, near female restrooms
Don’t expect luxury from Central’s nursing room, but it’s got the basics and you can lock the room to have the entire space to yourself. The nursing cubicle can’t be locked, but the entire baby care room can be locked, and there’s also a changing station and sink.

Central @ Clarke Quay, 6 Eu Tong Sen St, Singapore 059817, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/clarke-quay-central

11. Centrepoint

Location: Level 6 (one within Metro Department Store, one beside Management office and restrooms)
You can expect lockable nursing rooms with armchairs and side tables (there’s even a bed in the Metro baby room!), alongside changing tables, a hot and cold water dispenser, a sink and power points as well as a playpen and cot.

Centrepoint, 176 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238843, www.thecentrepoint.com.sg

12. Changi Airport

Location: Click here for locations across all four terminals.
Changi seriously sets a global standard for its family-friendly facilities, with a whopping 30 baby care facilities spanning its four terminals, in both public and private areas. The nursing rooms are as modern and spacious as the airport itself, offering pretty much everything you need, plus a diaper dispenser in case you forgot to pack those! Each and every room is equipped with a hot water dispenser and clean and comfy changing facilities, and many also have dedicated, private nursing stalls as well. Our hands-down fave is the Peranakan-themed nursing room in gorgeous Terminal 4. Unsurprisingly, this most modern terminal offers no less than eleven nursing and changing rooms, including five in public areas like the departure and arrivals halls.

Changi Airport, 60 Airport Blvd., Singapore 819643, www.changiairport.com

13. Changi City Point

Location: Level B1 to Level 2
Mamas will get to use the two available nursing rooms, which contain armchairs and bag hooks, changing stations, sinks and a hot and cold water dispenser. However, there are no locks on the doors, just curtains to shield you as you feed your little one.

Changi City Point, 5 Changi Business Park Central 1, Singapore 486038, www.changicitypoint.com.sg

14. Chinatown Point

Location: Level 3
The nursing room is small and does not have locks or any form of separation. There is a small armchair with a changing station and a sink.

Chinatown Point, 133 New Bridge Rd, Singapore 059413, www.chinatownpoint.com.sg

15. City Square Mall

Location: Levels 2 and 4 (nursing rooms); Levels B2 to 4 (diaper changing stations in male and female toilets)
This vast mall has several baby care rooms that can fit your stroller and offer privacy with lockable nursing rooms. The two lockable nursing rooms have a sofa, changing stations, sink, power points and a hot and cold water dispenser.

City Square Mall, 180 Kitchener Rd, Singapore 208539, www.citysquaremall.com.sg

16. Claymore Connect

Location: Level 3 (near restrooms)
Breastfeed in the lockable nursing rooms, which have benches, changing stations and power points.

Claymore Connect, 442 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238879, www.claymoreconnect.sg

17. Clementi Mall

Location: Level 3 and 4 (two baby rooms by food court and restrooms); Level 5
The lockable nursing rooms have a chair or sofa, changing stations, sinks, a magazine/reading rack and power points. There’s also a play area next to the baby room on Level 4 by the food court.

Clementi Mall, 3155 Commonwealth Ave W, Singapore 129588, www.theclementimall.com

18. Compass One (formerly Compass Point)

Location: Level B1 and Level 4
Warmly lit and spacious, the nursing room at Compass One has a hot and cold water dispenser, diaper-changing stations and a comfy long bench for bigger tots to sit and unwind while mama feeds baby.

Compass One, 1 Sengkang Square, Singapore 545078, www.compassone.sg

Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall

19. Far East Plaza

Location: Levels 1 to 5 (Next to the restrooms)
The individual parenting rooms at Far East Plaza are fitted with a bench and a changing table, and the entire room can be locked. There’s also a sink, hot and cold water dispenser, high chair, bottle warmer and a waiting area.

Far East Plaza, 14 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228213, www.fareastplaza.com.sg

20. Forum The Shopping Mall

Location: Level 1
The Mother’s Room comes complete with changing stations, two nursing rooms with armchairs (separated by curtains) and a wash basin.

Forum the Shopping Mall, 583 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238884, www.forumtheshoppingmall.com.sg

21. The Fullerton Hotel Singapore

Location: Level B1 (near the restrooms by the foot of the staircase)
Options in the CBD are few and far between, so if you find yourself on the Northern/Eastern side of Raffles Place this may be your best bet (of course, we suggest purchasing a coffee or a trinket from the gift shop if you’re not already there for a lovely afternoon tea or brunch!). Amenities include a hot and cold water dispenser, power points, a fold-down changing table and a separate nursing alcove (NB: we’ve also nursed in a comfy chair in the larger women’s restroom on B1).

The Fullerton Hotel Singapore, 1 Fullerton Square, Singapore 049178, www.fullertonhotels.com/the-fullerton-hotel

22. Great World

Location: Levels B1, 1 and 2
Great World’s baby care room is bright, colourful and comfy, with plenty of privacy and facilities such as a basin, hot water dispenser, diaper changing stations and nursing rooms. The nursing rooms can be locked, and have a cosy armchair and table, too.

Great World, 1 Kim Seng Promenade, Singapore 237994, shop.greatworld.com.sg

23. Harbourfront Centre

Location: Levels 2 and 3 (Lobby A)
This is a pretty old shopping centre, so it’s no surprise its family rooms aren’t very impressive, but they have all the basics and are often much less busy than the nursing rooms in neighbouring VivoCity! Expect changing tables, private feeding areas, as well as hot and cold drinking water.

Harbourfront Centre, 1 Maritime Square, Singapore 0992531 www.harbourfrontcentre.com.sg

24. Hougang Mall

Location: Levels 2 and 5 (near restrooms)
Nursing rooms have armchairs (no locks; separated by curtains), changing stations, sinks, hot and cold water dispenser and power points.

Hougang Mall, 90 Hougang Ave 10, Singapore 538766, www.hougangmall.com.sg

25. IKEA

Location: The baby care room is located near the restaurant
IKEA’s baby care rooms feature some of its own products with a minimalist but functional design, plus those famous white high chairs to keep bub safely strapped in while you re-pack that diaper bag! Bonus: you can get free jars of baby food upon request and there are microwave ovens for warming up milk at the restaurant, too! Other must-haves include a waiting area, nursing cubicles, changing tables, sinks, water dispensers, bottle warmers, and a disposable diaper dispenser.

IKEA, three locations in Singapore including Tampines, Jurong East and Alexandra Road, www.ikea.com/sg/en

26. IMM

Location: Level 2 (behind Kohong Health Care Centre and near OSIM); Level 3 (near car park entrance)
Rejoice if you’ve got a pram with you because there is plenty of space for prams and daddies! In addition to lockable family rooms with nursing and changing areas, the nursing rooms here have baby holders to prop older babies up, power sockets and sinks.

IMM, 2 Jurong East Street 21, Singapore 609601, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/imm/en.html

27. ION Orchard

Location: Levels B4, B3, B1 and Levels 3 and 4
ION has some of our favourite restrooms in Singapore so it’s little wonder that their nursing rooms are just as nice. In addition to standard amenities like a hot water dispenser and changing tables, on B3 and B4 you’ll also discover a bottle warmer and handy diaper vending machine if you find yourself in a pinch (has definitely happened to us on more than one occasion)! We also like that these rooms have plenty of room for a stroller. Other amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, cushioned changing tables, bottle warmer, diaper vending machine and separate nursing alcoves. Their baby rooms can only accommodate one family, but you can lock the entire room and have it all to yourself.

ION Orchard, 2 Orchard Turn, Singapore 238801, www.ionorchard.com

30. JEM

Location: Level B1, Level 3 and Level 5 and the family toilet on Levels 2 to 5
Spacious and clean, these are truly family care rooms with child-sized toilets for your older bubs! There are three spacious lockable nursing rooms with armchairs and a small table, as well as three diaper changing stations (the changing table is at the family toilet on Level 2), a sink, hot and cold water dispenser, bottle warmer, children’s loo and power points. The family toilet includes a children’s loo and baby holder.

JEM, 50 Jurong Gateway Rd, Singapore 608549, www.jem.sg

31. Jewel

Location: every level from B2 to Level 4
We just have to rave about the nursing rooms at Jewel because it is one of the most spacious, clean and beautifully designed nursing rooms in Singapore. There are padded diaper changing stations, hot and cold water dispensers, and private cubicles for nursing your little one in peace. There are even charging outlets for your phone in case you end up being nap-trapped when your little bub falls asleep in your arms!

 Jewel, 78 Airport Boulevard, Singapore 819666, www.jewelchangiairport.com

32. Junction 8

Location: Level B1, 1, 2 and 3
In addition to complimentary baby stroller rentals, Junction 8 also has two lockable nursing rooms with chairs and a small table, a changing station, a bottle warmer, a high chair and more.

Junction 8, 9 Bishan Pl, Singapore 579837, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/junction8/en.html

33. Jurong East Bus Interchange

Location: Jurong East Bus Interchange
This beautiful, calming nursing room was created by a partnership between Tower Transit Singapore (TTS) and Hegen. There’s a padded changing table, sink, hot and cold water dispenser and a nursing room with a lock (and a comfy nursing chair!).

 Jurong East Bus Interchange, 17A Jurong Gateway Road, Singapore 608513, www.towertransit.sg

34. Jurong Point

Location: JP1, Level 3 (near Kopitiam), JP2 Basement 1 (opposite Samsung) and Level 3 Mongkok Street
The Jurong Point nursing rooms are decently sized with padded diaper changing stations, a sink, hot and cold water dispenser and a nursing room (only on Levels 2 and 3).

 Jurong Point, 1 Jurong West Central 2, Singapore 648886, www.jurongpoint.com.sg

35. KINEX

Location: Level 2
The nursing room at KINEX is clean, bright, and modern with three locked nursing rooms, a comfy waiting area for family, and plenty of room for parking strollers. We deem this the best nursing room in the East; it’s exceptionally clean and tidy, with three handy, private nursing stalls as well as multiple changing rooms and plenty of room for multiple strollers. Amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, cushioned changing tables, three separate nursing alcoves with comfy chairs and shelves, three lockable nursing cubicles with comfy chairs, sinks and a bench for those waiting.

KINEX, 11 Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore 437157, www.kinex.com.sg

36. Mandarin Gallery

Location: Level 2, Level 3, Level 4 near restrooms
Key amenities include a nursing area with a sofa (the entire room can be locked), a changing table and a sink.

Mandarin Gallery, 333A Orchard Rd, Singapore 238897, www.mandaringallery.com.sg

37. Marina Square

Location: Level B1 and Levels 1 to 3 (near restrooms)
What will you find here? Think lockable nursing rooms with sofa, a changing station and sink, hot/cold water dispenser, power points and a waiting area.

Marina Square, 6 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039594, www.marinasquare.com.sg

38. Marina Bay Link Mall

Location: Level B2
There’s nothing particularly special about this nursing room except that it’s in the basement of a mall connected to one of Singapore’s biggest office buildings – we’ve had a few working mama friends who’ve pumped in the Marina Bay Financial Centre at lunchtime. It’s too small to fit a pram, but it does have a seat for nursing, a fold-down changing table, a sink, and the all-important power point.

Marina Bay Link Mall, 8A Marina Blvd, Singapore 018984, www.marinabaylink.com.sg

39. Millennium Walk

Location: Level B1 (next to lift lobby B)
These two nursing rooms aren’t the fanciest, but we like how bright and spacious they are, with plenty of room to park strollers. There are also two toddler high chairs in case you’ve got multiple kiddos in tow and one is hankering for a different kind of snack! Amenities include power points, separate nursing alcoves, toddler chairs and cushioned changing tables.

Millennia Walk, 9 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039596, www.milleniawalk.com

40. National Gallery Singapore

Location: One nursing room per floor on level B1, and levels 1 to 5
The nursing rooms at National Gallery Singapore are particularly sleek, and you’ll find one cosy nursing room per floor (that’s six in total!). Each has a comfy chair and enough room for a stroller – except on Level 5, which only has a small stool, and no sofa –  as well as a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, cushioned changing table and sink. And while the nursing rooms have step-free access, they are not wheelchair accessible.

National Gallery Singapore, 1 St Andrew’s Road #01–01 Singapore 178957, www.nationalgallery.sg

41. NEX

Location: Level B2 (near Holland & Barrett and Jean Yip Lifestyle); Level B1 (near MoneyMax); Level 1 (near G2000); Level 2 (near Isetan and Giordano); Level 3 (near Isetan and QB House); Level 4 (near Food Junction); Sky Garden (near the Serangoon Public Library)
A nursing room with a Yakult vending machine to distract older bubs? We’re loving the convenience! Other bonus points include two lockable nursing rooms with chairs, sink, hot and cold water dispenser, power points and high chairs.

NEX, 23 Serangoon Central, Singapore 556083,  www.nex.com.sg

42. Ngee Ann City

Location: Level B1 (inside female restroom); Level B2
Ngee Ann City’s nursing rooms are functional but minimal, so head over to the nearby Takashimaya baby care room (see entry no. 63) if you’re looking for a premium nursing room experience. The nursing room here has an armchair and a table, a changing table and sink. Locks and power points are only available in the rooms on Level B2.

Ngee Ann City, 391A Orchard Rd, Singapore 238873, www.ngeeanncity.com.sg

43. Northpoint City

Location: B2 to Level 3 (North Wing) and B2 to Level 2 (South Wing)
The nursing rooms are fitted with a small armchair and table. You can lock the door for privacy. The rooms also have changing stations, a sink and a hot/cold water dispenser. Power points are available, too.

Northpoint City, 930 Yishun Ave 2, Singapore 769098, www.northpointcity.com.sg

44. One Raffles Place

Location: Level 4 (next to restrooms)
We hear horror stories about workin’ mamas lining up to pump here – the only nursing room in the heart of Raffles Place (we know offices should all have their own pumping facilities, but sadly that just isn’t the case right now). That said, for mamas who find themselves needing to pump (or toting their babies around the CBD), head to Level 4 to get the job done (but try not to go at peak times like lunch!). Note that this room is also too small to fit a pram. Amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, changing table, sink, chair for nursing and power points.

One Raffles Place, 1 Raffles Pl, Singapore 048616, www.onerafflesplace.com.sg/shopping

45. Orchard Central

Location: Levels 3, 4 and 7
Believe it or not, there are NO changing tables available at Orchard Central, but if you simply want to nurse, it’s got you covered!

Orchard Central, 181 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238896, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/orchard-central

46. OUE Downtown Gallery

Location: Level 2
The nursing room at this shiny mall and office building on Shenton Way is a welcome addition to the CBD area (though nursing rooms are still too far and few between!). Here, the nursing room is separate from the changing area, which is good for efficiency’s sake but does create some pretty tight quarters (there’s just enough space to fit a stroller into each, though). The nursing rooms also have a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, a padded changing table and sink, as well as separate nursing alcoves with one seat.

OUE Downtown Gallery, 6A Shenton Way, Singapore 068815, www.downtowngallery.com.sg

47. Palais Renaissance

Location: Level 2 restroom
The amenities are basic – there’s one nursing cubicle with a changing table. The entire room can be locked, and you’ll also have access to a sink, child toilet and power points.

Palais Renaissance, 390 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238871, www.palais.sg

48. Paragon

Location: Level 3 or level 5 (near the restrooms)
Paragon’s nursing rooms match the high-quality interior of the mall itself, with comfy nursing chairs and complimentary baby toiletries! Clean and spacious, these stylish, lockable nursing rooms match their upscale mall surrounds with marble appointments and comfy seating. Amenities include a hot water dispenser, power points, separate nursing alcove with comfy seating, two cushioned changing tables and diaper disposal bags.

Paragon Shopping Centre, 290 Orchard Road, Singapore 238859, www.paragon.com.sg

49. Parkway Parade

Location: Basement (near Japan Home); Level 2 (next to the ladies’ washroom and 6 Elements Hair Spa); Level 3 (next to the ladies’ washroom and Robert Piano).
Wow, someone put some playful thought into Parkway Parade’s nursing rooms, with toys scattered about to distract the bubs! Key amenities here include nursing cubicles with armchairs and small tables, changing stations, a sink, power points and a hot/cold water dispenser. There are also high chairs and toys on certain levels.

Parkway Parade, 80 Marine Parade Rd, Singapore 449269, www.parkwayparade.com.sg

50. Paya Lebar Square

Location: Level B1 and Level 1
This bare-basics nursing room is lockable and can fit one pram only. However, there’s only one nursing room on each floor, so odds are, you’ll need to wait to use it. That said, the room is clean enough for a quick feed!

Paya Lebar Square, 60 Paya Lebar Rd, Singapore 409051, www.payalebarsquare.sg

51. Plaza Singapura

Location: Levels 2, 3, 4 and 6 (next to the ladies’ restroom)
These baby nursing rooms are nicely decorated and clean, but there’s only one lockable nursing area per baby room so you might need to wait a while. There is also a changing table inside the nursing room and outside, a sink; power points and a hot and cold water dispenser.

Plaza Singapura, 68 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238839, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/plazasingapura

52. Raffles City

Location: Level B1 (next to the restrooms near Marks & Spencer and Crumpler); Level 3 (next to restrooms near PS. Cafe).
The lockable nursing room has an armchair and key amenities include a hot and cold water dispenser, changing station, baby diaper dispenser, sofa and nursing rooms with an electrical point.

Raffles City, 252 North Bridge Rd, Singapore 179103,  www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/rafflescity/en.html

53. Resorts World Sentosa (RWS)

Locations: Click here for a full list of nursing rooms at RWS
There are four nursing rooms scattered around RWS, and each one is within walking distance of the attractions here. There’s even a special Baby Centre at Universal Studios Singapore, complete with a microwave, coin-operated dispensers for diapers and bed liners and even a cute play space for older tots. The nursing areas include either lockable nursing cubicles or curtained nursing spaces, changing stations ad tables, hot and cold water dispensers and power sockets.

Resorts World Sentosa, 8 Sentosa Gateway, Singapore 098269, www.rwsentosa.com

54. River Wonders

Location: Near the entrance, Giant Panda Forest, Boat Plaza and Amazon Flooded Forest.
The nursing rooms have diaper-changing facilities and plastic chairs. They can be locked, and also contain changing tables, sinks and power points.

River Wonders, 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com/en/river-wonders.html

55. Scotts Square

Location: Level 2 and 3 (near restrooms)
Large and new-ish, these rooms look nice but considering how fancy the mall itself is, they are pretty minimalist in terms of amenities! Key features include one lockable nursing room with a bench, sink, changing area and a waiting area.

Scotts Square, 6 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228209, www.instagram.com/scottssquaresg

56. Sentosa Island

Location: Festive Walk (single rooms on B1 and Level 1, double rooms on Level 1 near Osia); Galleria (three nursing rooms).
We hear the best nursing facilities on Sentosa Island are at Universal Studios – see the RWS entry above! But within public areas, you’ve got a few choices with necessary amenities like sinks, power points, changing tables and separate nursing alcoves. The Galleria nursing room is a little tricky to find; it’s tucked along a long hallway behind the shops! If you can’t find the nursing rooms, just check in with the friendly ground staff for directions.

Sentosa Island, www.sentosa.com.sg

57. Shaw Centre

Location: Level 4 (inside Isetan children’s department)
The two lockable nursing rooms have basic amenities like chairs and small tables, changing stations, hot water dispensers and power points. Want to warm your baby’s food up before feeding them? Check in with the cashier just outside the nursing room to see if the food warmer is available. There are also high chairs available.

Shaw Centre, 1 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228208,  www.shawcentre.sg

58. The Shoppes at MBS

Location: Levels B2 (next to Club Monaco and Rasapura Masters); B1 (next to Dior and Fila Kids) and Level 1 (next to Orient Crown or Imperial Treasure Fine Teochew Cuisine)
These oh-so colourful rooms (peep that bold, stripey wallpaper!) offer plenty of privacy (limited to one family per room, although we’ve shared the changing tables in a pinch), along with a handy seat where you can strap in a wiggly toddler if need be. The nursing rooms at MBS are spacious enough to fit one stroller at a time, and are nice and quiet. The nursing rooms have chairs and tables, cushioned changing tables, a sink, baby seats and more, and there are two floors per level.

The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, 8 Bayfront Ave, Singapore 018955, www.marinabaysands.com

59. Singapore City Gallery

Location: Level 2 near Gallery room (accessible via glass lift or escalator from the ground floor)
The nursing rooms at the Singapore City Gallery include stroller parking, diaper changing facilities, a hot and cold water dispenser, a sink and hand soap. Both nursing rooms are lockable and you can get comfy on the sofas and tables.

Singapore City Gallery, 45 Maxwell Road The URA Centre, 069118, www.ura.gov.sg

60. Singapore Zoo

Location: Rainforest Kidzworld, Reptile Garden and at the main entrance. Diaper-changing facilities are available at Rainforest Kidzworld, main entrance, Wildlife Learning Centre, Ah Meng Restaurant, Reptile Garden and Pavilion by the Lake.
Spending the day at the Singapore Zoo? Take a break from the heat and pop into these air-conditioned baby rooms to feed and change your own little monkeys! Key perks include nursing cubicles separated by curtains, changing stations, sinks, a hot and cold water dispenser, power points and a waiting area.

Singapore Zoo, 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com

61. SingPost Centre

Location: Levels B1 and L3
The nursing room here is clean but minimalist at best. There’s a sink and diaper-changing station, and a child-friendly toilet within, which is perfect if you have older kids.

SingPost Centre, 10 Eunos Rd 8, Singapore 408600, www.singpostcentre.com

62. Suntec City Shopping Mall

Location: Levels 1 (near the Suntec City Tourist Hub and the Adidas Store) and 2 (near Toys R Us and the Convention Centre).
Clean and very spacious, the main Suntec nursing room on Level 1 offers two nursing alcoves with comfy chairs, along with multiple padded changing tables, and even a bottle steriliser. NB: The nursing room on Level 2 is much smaller, with just a single nursing seat. You can expect sinks, a bottle steriliser in the Level 1 nursing room, separate nursing alcoves with comfy chairs, a hot/cold water dispenser, cushioned changing tables and power points.

Suntec City Shopping Mall, 3 Temasek Boulevard Singapore 038983, www.sunteccity.com.sg

63. Suntec City Convention Centre

Location: Levels 1 and 2; Tower 3 (next to Toys R’ Us)
There are multiple nursing rooms scattered across Suntec, but with it being a hub for a lot of working mamas, it’s a real shame there aren’t any power points to help with expressing milk. The nursing cubicle has curtains instead of locks, and there are changing stations and a hot and cold water dispenser.

Suntec City Convention Centre, 1 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039593, www.suntecsingapore.com

64. Takashimaya

Location: Children’s Department, Level 4
This has long held the crown as the single best nursing room in Singapore, and in our humble opinion, no one’s come for it yet! Super clean, spacious, and comfortable, this family lounge has room for a whole gaggle of strollers. The five separate nursing areas each feature a comfy seat and a dedicated changing table. You’ll also find toddler high chairs (with trays!) and even a Huggies diaper dispenser. There’s also a spacious seating area with a TV where you can send bored older kiddos if need be. This room is worth seeking out if you find yourself on Orchard, and your bub needs a breather. And if – due to its popularity – it’s crowded, you’ll be relieved to know there are additional nice nursing rooms elsewhere in Ngee Ann City. Other amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, power points and sinks.

Takashimaya, 391 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238872, www.takashimaya.com.sg

65. Tampines Mall

Location: Level 2 (near Lift Lobby A)
Key features in the two lockable nursing rooms include armchairs, small tables and a baby holder, two changing stations a sink and a hot and cold water dispenser.

Tampines Mall, 4 Tampines Central 5, Singapore 529510, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/tampinesmall/en.html

66. Tampines 1

Location: Levels 2 and 5
You’ll find two lockable nursing rooms with benches, changing stations, a sink and a hot and cold water dispenser.

Tampines 1, 10 Tampines Central 1, Singapore 529536, www.tampines1.com.sg

67. Tanglin Mall

Location: Level 3 (baby care room near restrooms); Level 2 (diaper changing room)
Spacious – with enough space to wheel in a couple of strollers – this nursing room is usually pretty jumping due to all the baby-friendly amenities nearby. The decor is slightly dated, but it’s comfortable and has all the amenities a mama could need, including nursing armchairs and a table, changing stations, sink, hot and cold water dispenser and power points.

Tanglin Mall, 163 Tanglin Road, Singapore 247933, www.tanglinmall.com.sg

Read more: Guide To Tanglin Mall Shopping, Food & More

68. Thomson Plaza

Location: Level 3
Key features of the lockable nursing area include a bench, changing table, sink and a waiting area.

Thomson Plaza, 301 Upper Thomson Rd, Singapore 574408, www.thomsonplaza.com.sg

69. Tiong Bahru Plaza

Location: Levels B1, 1 to 3
The nursing room area has a bench but no locks. There are also facilities such as a changing station, sink, waiting area, hot/cold water dispenser and power points.

Tiong Bahru Plaza, 302 Tiong Bahru Rd, Singapore 168732, www.tiongbahruplaza.com.sg

70. United Square

Location: Level 1
This popular kids’ mall has a pretty nice baby care room that can accommodate a couple of strollers and is kept very clean. The three lockable nursing rooms come with comfy armchairs, changing stations, a waiting area, hot water dispenser, sink, high chairs and power points.

United Square, 101 Thomson Rd, Singapore 307591, www.unitedsquare.com.sg

71. Valley Point Shopping Centre

Location: Level 1
There’s one nursing cubicle (no locks; separated by curtains), a changing table, sink and a hot and cold water dispenser.

Valley Point Shopping Centre, 491 River Valley Rd, Singapore 248371, www.valleypoint.com.sg

72. Velocity @ Novena

Location: Levels 2 (near NOVITA)
Nice, clean and bright, the baby room in Velocity has everything you need, but it’s a bit out of the way from the more popular stores. The two lockable nursing rooms have a sofa, changing station, sink, and power points. There are also hot and cold water dispensers on levels 2 and 3.

Velocity @ Novena, 238 Thomson Road, Singapore 307683, www.velocitynovena.com

73. VivoCity

Location: Levels 2 (Lobbies Q and H) and 3 (Lobby H)
You won’t be disappointed with these clean, spacious baby rooms, but, fair warning, the queues can be long during the weekend rush! There are four large nursing areas with armchairs; the one with locks and a waiting area is near the playground on Level 2. There are also changing stations, sinks, power points, and hot/cold water dispensers.

VivoCity, 1 HarbourFront Walk, Singapore 098585, www.vivocity.com.sg

74. Waterway Point

Location: B2 to Level 2
The spacious nursing room at Waterway Point comes with a padded diaper changing station, hot and cold water dispenser, a sink, and a breastfeeding room with a bench and an electrical point to charge your phone. This nursing room can fit up to two strollers and even has a bench for your husband to wait while you nurse your baby.

 Waterway Point, 83 Punggol Central, Singapore 828763, www.waterwaypoint.com.sg

75. West Coast Plaza

Location: Level B1
Key features within the one lockable nursing room include a bench, changing table, sink, power points and a hot/cold water dispenser.

West Coast Plaza, 154 West Coast Rd, Singapore 127371, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/west-coast-plaza

76. Wheelock Place

Location: Level 1
This one is a bit difficult to get to with a stroller, with the lift to level 1 as your only option. Key features in the single, lockable nursing room include a changing table, sink and power points.

Wheelock Place, 501 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238880, www.facebook.com/wheelockplacesg

76. Wisma Atria

Location: Level 3
The baby room at Wisma Atria is really just a small area inside the female restroom so it’s not particularly pleasant, but it has the basics in a pinch! Think armchair and changing table (no locks), a sink and a hot/cold water dispenser.

Wisma Atria, 435 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238877, www.wismaonline.com

The Grandstand (closed)

Location: Level 1 (near Lift 7)
Located just around the corner from Dancing Crab, the nursing room here is not particularly peaceful, but it’ll do for a quick change and feed. The nursing room has no locks, but you’ll find a changing table, sink, power points and a hot and cold water dispenser, so your basic needs are covered.

The Grandstand

Want more help? Considering downloading the Nursing Room app, which helps you find the closest nursing room to you and all the amenities in it.

Did we miss a public nursing room in Singapore? Please tell us (and send a snap) to sassy@sassymamasg.com

Read more:

The post Handy List Of Best Nursing Rooms In Singapore To Breastfeed appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Go For Tufting Classes In Singapore: Rug Tufting Workshops
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Tufting is the art of making your own unique rug! Visit these tuft clubs and studios for carpet tufting workshops in Singapore to learn how to tuft a rug designed by you in just a few hours. Tufting, along with other artisanal hobbies like crocheting and knitting, has recently enjoyed a resurgence of interest, courtesy […]

The post Where To Go For Tufting Classes In Singapore: Rug Tufting Workshops appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Tufting is the art of making your own unique rug! Visit these tuft clubs and studios for carpet tufting workshops in Singapore to learn how to tuft a rug designed by you in just a few hours.

Tufting, along with other artisanal hobbies like crocheting and knitting, has recently enjoyed a resurgence of interest, courtesy of TikTok. Perhaps it is the authenticity of handmade crafts that appeals to many, especially in this age of mass manufacturing. Tufting – the latest addition to viral DIY crafts ­– refers to a method of weaving textiles where yarn is looped through fabric, usually to make rugs.

Rug tufting for beginners:

Trending clips have made modern rug tufting look so satisfyingly simple, which is perfect for beginners. You don’t even need sewing experience to create tufting designs of every conceivable shape, size and colour. All that’s required is some patience in manoeuvring an automated tufting gun that rapidly punches needle into fabric, transforming loose threads into eye-catching designs. If you are looking for a bonding activity to do with your teen, why not join a tufting workshop in Singapore? Get ready to craft your own masterpieces at these local studios offering tufting classes.

Best Rug Tufting Workshops In Singapore:

1. Tuft Club: rug tufting and tuft mirror workshops

Want to snazz up your floor, wall or mirror with some lovely bespoke pieces? Tuft Club offers two types of tufting classes – their rug tufting and tuft mirror workshops. The former allows you to make a rug or wall hanging up to 60 x 60cm, while the latter guides you on tufting mirror frames. The tufting workshops are both four and a half hours long and include detailed instructions on different tufting techniques for your designs. You can also book private tufting classes. Do note that the minimum age to sign up is 16.

Tufting class: $75. Book here.
Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Tuft Club: at 57 Circular Rd, #03-01, Singapore 049412

2. Everytuft: Tufting workshops for kids and adults

Everytuft is a tuft studio that was started by a pair of friends who quit their jobs in pursuit of their dream and love of tufting! Tufting workshops at Everytuft are more than just lessons in tufting – they provide a community and space for those with the same passion for art and crafts to share their knowledge and tips on tufting. Tufting workshops are based on themes and purpose. If you are a newbie, start with the 1 and half hour workshop. There’s even a tufting workshop for kids with the Tiny Tuftie session for kids aged 10 and below!

Tufting class: from $$90/person. Or try Tufting Jamming sessions at $28/hour. Book here.
Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Everytuft: 16A Lim Tua Tow Rd, Singapore 547752

3. Hueplay Studio: Rugs N’ Tuft tufting classes

A homey space for artistic escapes, Hueplay Studio has art jamming experiences, punch needle workshops and tufting classes that they affectionately call Rugs N’ Tuft. There are over 30 yarn colours to inspire ideas for your tufting designs. For those who intend to work on more ambitious tufting patterns, upgrade to a 70 x 70cm frame at the store. It’s time to sip on tea, listen to some good music and tuft a customised rug with your loved ones.

Tufting workshop: From $88. Book here.
Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Hueplay Studio: at 77 Kampong Bahru Road, #02-01, Singapore 169376

4. beadbadwolf: rug and mirror tufting classes

Cheryl, who is a textile artist and mother of two, is the founder of beadbadwolf. What she loves most is colours, and you’ll have plenty of those to play with in her workshops. Tufting classes at beadbadwolf are only available upon request. Not only does Cheryl teach rug and mirror tufting, but she also conducts workshops for tufting coasters and stools! At the tufted rug/mirror workshop, select your design, then make it come to life in a 55cm-65cm long piece. Leave it at the studio after class to be completed with glue and felt backing before picking it up a few weeks later.

Tufting class: $135. Book here.
Rug Tufting in Singapore with beadbadwolf: 195 Pearl’s Hill Terrace, #02-10, Singapore S168976

5. HelloRugs: tufting workshops with fun tuft designs

Embark on four-hour therapeutic tufting sessions at HelloRugs. The studio has two class slots 10am-2pm and 4pm-8pm every day of the week except Tuesdays. Materials such as the tufting frame, cloth and yarn are provided and you’ll create rugs or wall hangings up to 55 x 55cm. Past participants have tufted Spongebob, Pokemon and Kermit rugs! Within the same week, HelloRugs will mail the finished work to you at no additional cost.

Rug Tufting class: From $50/person. Book here.
Carpet Tufting in Singapore with HelloRugs: 29 Paya Lebar Road, #02-01, Singapore 409005

Rug tufting workshops in Singapore that have closed:

BoKkAna’s Club: bonding tufting classes (Closed)

BoKkAna’s Club is a cosy studio nestled in the heart of Singapore. Teaching cream glue craft and rug tufting, BoKkAna’s Club’s workshops are a fun way to bond with family and friends. At rug tufting classes, prepare an image for reference, choose your yarns and then operate the tufting gun to make your desired tufting design. Bring the rug home or leave it at the studio to dry for two to three weeks before getting it delivered to you.

Rug Tufting class: $125/person (50x50cm frame), $155/person (70x70cm frame)
(Temporarily closed) Rug Tufting in Singapore with BoKkAna’s Club: 729 North Bridge Road, Singapore 198697

Studio An: four-hour tufting workshops (Closed)

At Studio An’s four-hour tufting workshops, you can choose to tuft rugs for your floor, or to hang on a mirror or wall. Have a tufting design on your phone that you wish to see materialised? Project it on the tufting frame, then trace over the image with a permanent marker. This tufting studio is great for parent-child tufting classes as you’ll only be charged an additional $30 for a second person to work on your tufting design with you. Studio An provides more than 50 colours of cotton blended yarns for your tufting designs – feel free to experiment! Experienced tufting instructors will guide you through how to use the tufting guns and after completion, your rug will be given some finishing touches before being sent to your home in about three weeks.

Tufting class: $185/person for a single session. Additional $30 if a second person is coming to work on the same tufting piece.
(Closed) Rug Tufting in Singapore with Studio An: at 18 Kaki Bukit Road 3, #02-19, Singapore 415978

 Read more: Fun Activities for Teenagers

Cutloop Studio: regular tufting class (Closed)

Cutloop Studio is a fun place to get creative. Attend the standard rug workshop, mirror tufting workshop, or, if you’re looking for something more digestible, try their 2.5hr mini rug tufting workshop instead. This is a condensed version of Cutloop’s regular 4-hour sessions, and you’ll be making a smaller rug with less complicated details – an affordable option offering the same enjoyable tufting experience.

Tufting class: $188/person (Standard Rug and Mirror Tufting Workshops). $120 (Mini Rug Tufting Workshop).
Rug Tufting in Singapore with Cutloop Studio: 14D Keong Saik Rd., Singapore 089121

Read more: 

The post Where To Go For Tufting Classes In Singapore: Rug Tufting Workshops appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Find Kids’ Dentists & Family Dental Clinics In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
‘Help! I’m looking for a dentist near me!’ Don’t worry, we’ve got you. Scroll through our list of dental clinics, family dental surgeries and kids’ dentists in Singapore. Looking for a caring kids’ dentist near you since your mini-me is afraid of visiting the dental clinic? Thankfully, dentist visits don’t have to be a stressful […]

The post Where To Find Kids’ Dentists & Family Dental Clinics In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
‘Help! I’m looking for a dentist near me!’ Don’t worry, we’ve got you. Scroll through our list of dental clinics, family dental surgeries and kids’ dentists in Singapore.

Looking for a caring kids’ dentist near you since your mini-me is afraid of visiting the dental clinic? Thankfully, dentist visits don’t have to be a stressful experience anymore, as there are loads of kids’ dentists, dental surgeries and dental clinics in Singapore that are family-friendly! Some have tellies so kiddos can watch cartoons before (or during!) an appointment, colourful decor and even little stickers and rewards.

Whether you are looking for your child’s first dental checkup, scaling and polishing or have a dental emergency like a chipped tooth or root canal treatment, use our guide to find a family-friendly dental clinic in Singapore near you. Plus, scroll to the end for our useful tips to ease nerves before a dental check-up in Singapore.

Family-Friendly Dental Clinics & Kids’ Dentists In Singapore:

Burlinson Dental Surgery: Kids’ dental clinic in the East

Burlinson Dental Surgery is a dental clinic in the East that has served families for the past 14 years. They offer quality dental care to locals and expatriates and are dedicated to ensuring that your smile is always at its best. Their highly experienced team of dentists have over 20 years of experience in the field, so you can rest assured that your child is in good hands.

Equipped with the latest dental technology, the dentists at this family dental clinic provide efficient and effective treatments. They prioritise comfort and satisfaction, tailoring each visit to their patient’s needs.

They offer the usual suite of dental care services including general scaling and polishing, fillings, crowns and bridges, root canals, implants, braces and more. Families in the East also trust them with their kids’ dental needs. Whether you’re looking for routine care or specialised treatments, this kids’ dental clinic in Singapore is ever-ready to help.

Burlinson Dental Surgery, 55 Siglap Road, B1-28, Singapore 455871, Tel: (+65) 6241 3088, www.burlinsondental.com

Atria-City Dental Group: Kids dental care

Atria-City Dental Group is a well-established multi-disciplinary dental practice which offers a comprehensive range of general and specialised dental services for both children and adults since 1994. Conveniently located in Ngee Ann City at Orchard Road, With over 3 decades of experience, Atria-City is a trusted dental clinic in the community.

Their paediatric department, Atria-City Junior Dental, is led by experienced specialists, including orthodontists and paedodontists, who focus on creating a welcoming and positive environment for young patients, from infancy to adolescence. The clinic features vibrant children’s treatment rooms with decor designed to put children at ease, including ceiling-mounted TVs.

They offer general dental care for children which includes a child’s first dental check-up and assessment at 12 months old, preventive dental care maintenance with prophylaxis, fluoride treatment, sealants, oral hygiene instruction, tooth decay treatment, treatment of traumatic injuries, oral rehabilitation of very young children under sedation and general anaesthetic, dental care of those handicapped including children with special needs and specialised procedures unique to young children.

They also deal with orthodontic assessment of growth and development of jaw and teeth, early treatment and intervention to prevent developmental problems. For adults, they offer a wide array of both general and specialist dental services, including dental checkups, scaling and polishing, dental implants, root canal treatments, gum therapy, wisdom tooth surgery, cosmetic dentistry, as well as restorative treatments such as crowns and bridges.

Atria-City Dental Group, 391B Orchard Road, #08-08, Ngee Ann City Tower B, Singapore 238874, Tel: (+65) 6737 2777, www.atria-city.com

Raintree Dental: Family dentist in Katong

Raintree Dental Clinic is led by Dr Kuek Yit Liang, who has close to 20 years of experience practising dentistry in the East. His cheerful team of dentists and nurses are pros at helping little ones feel at ease at every dental appointment. The dentists and hygienists at Raintree Dental are known for their gentle touch, ensuring a comfortable experience for you and your family.

Besides the usual suite of dental services such as cleaning and polishing, they also offer adult, teen and child orthodontics, wisdom tooth surgery, implants, crowns, bridges and more. They use state-of-the-art polishing, scanning and modelling technology so you will get accurate results for your treatment.

Kids especially love Raintree Dental Clinic’s play corner which includes a video game console and an in-chair entertainment system. So, it will be a piece of cake to convince your little one to return for regular dental check-ups to keep their pearly whites healthy.

Raintree Dental Clinic, 107 East Coast Road, Singapore 428799,  www.raintreedental.com.sg

Canaan Dental Surgery: Kids’ dentist in East Coast

Not only is this dentist in Singapore absolutely kid-friendly, Canaan Dental Surgery is also known for its laid-back atmosphere, personalised service and state-of-the-art technology. The team comprises highly experienced and qualified dentists, all of whom offer a wide range of dental services such as paediatric dentistry and orthodontics to sports dentistry, teen Invisalign, smile rejuvenation, dental implants and teeth whitening.

Canaan Dental Surgery, 29 Upper East Coast Road Crescendo Building, Singapore 455291, www.canaan.com.sg

Azure Dental: Kid’s dentist in Bukit Timah

Azure Dental treats every child like their own. This Bukit Timah family-favourite dental clinic is situated right next to Sixth Avenue MRT. Dr Sebrina Abdul Malik leads the experienced dental team to make sure your kids have a comfortable, fun-filled dentist experience. Before beginning any procedure, the kids’ dentists explain every stage of the treatment for a safe and stress-free experience.

Azure Dental, 781 Bukit Timah Road, Singapore 269759, www.azuredental.com.sg

Dental Icon: Kids’ dentist at Marine Parade

Dr. Scott Chao at Dental Icon gets rave reviews from East Coast mums for being gentle and patient with little ones, so it’s a great spot for your tot’s first dental check up. Treatments on offer include paediatric dentistry, as well as dental services for adults including teeth whitening, dental implants and more. This dentist in Singapore also accepts Baby Bonus funds.

Dental Icon, 80 Marine Parade Road, #05-03 Parkway Parade, Singapore 449269, www.dentalicon.org

Expat Dental: Premium dentist with comfort perks

Expat Dental’s group of dentists and hygienists are internationally trained, and the team offers a comprehensive suite of services. These range from general and paediatric dentistry to oral surgery, orthodontics, facial aesthetics and even sports dentistry for when your kiddo has a sporting accident. We love the complimentary comfort perks to help you relax during your dentist visit from streaming TV to noise-cancelling headphones, refreshments, and even a warm towel and lip balm!

Expat Dental, 10 Sinaran Drive, Unit 08-15/16, Novena Medical Center, Singapore 307506, www.expatdental.com

Gentle Dental Group: Kids’ dentist with cartoons

This family-oriented group of dental clinics has three convenient locations across the island that are spacious and kid-friendly. Gentle Dental Group features state-of-the-art technologies such as cone-beam CT scans, soft tissue lasers for gum treatments and much more. Kiddos love getting to watch cartoons on overhead TV screens while child-friendly dentists do their thing!

Gentle Dental Group, three locations in Singapore including Bukit Timah, River Valley and Tanjong Katong, www.gentledental.com.sg

GPA Dental: Dentist for kids with special needs

This kids’ dental clinic has internationally qualified and trained dentists and oral health therapists, and their goal is to encourage a positive attitude towards dental care. GPA Dental also provides quality dental care for children with special needs. The dentists are flexible in how treatments are carried out, too! For example, if your child is in a wheelchair, they can perform the check-up without needing to shift your child.

GPA Dental, two locations including Parkview Square and United Square, www.gpadental.com

The Kids Dentist: Fun kids dentist with movies

At The Kids Dentist, it’s all about fun! This popular kids’ dental clinic at the Camden Medical Centre has video games, a foosball table and a playhouse. During their appointment, kids can watch movies while sitting on the dental chair. The main doctors at this kids’ dental clinic are Dr Rashid Tahir, a trained paediatric dentist providing oral health care solely for children since 1997, and Dr Sylvia Koh who practises paediatric dentistry.

The Kids Dentist, 1 Orchard Boulevard, Camden Medical Centre, #13-06, Singapore 248649, www.thekidsdentist.com.sg

Kids Dental World: Specialised kids dental clinic

Dr. Ong is a founding member of Singapore’s Society of Paediatric Dentistry, and her practice specialises in working with children from infants through adolescents. Thus, she has paediatric tools tailored for a child’s small mouth. Kids Dental World also offers a fun and colourful environment for kiddos. This kid-friendly dentist engages kids through playful educational techniques to teach good dental habits in a fun way.

Kids Dental World, Mount Elizabeth Novena Hospital, 38 Irrawaddy Road, #08-33, Singapore 329563,  www.kidsdentalworld.com.sg

Le 乐 by An Dental: Kids dentist at Orchard Road

Le 乐 by An Dental, located in the heart of Orchard Road, is a family clinic that has something for everyone. Their paediatric dentists are specially trained to help young children feel at ease during dental visits. This kids’ dental clinic offers an in-house library, so kids can pick up a book on keeping teeth clean. Plus, kids often receive a personalised balloon when they get their teeth done while watching TV shows!

Le 乐 by An Dental, International Building (next to Lido), 360 Orchard Road #03-06/07, Singapore 238869, www.andental.sg

National Dental Centre Singapore: Comprehensive oral care for kids

The Paediatric Dentistry Unit in the National Dental Centre Singapore (NDCS) provides comprehensive oral health care for children from birth to adolescence. Specialities and services include the Infant Oral Health Programme (NDCS Infant Oral Health Programme), caries risk assessment, dental treatment under general anaesthesia, fillings, crowns, root canal treatments and more. They also provide dental treatment for kids with special healthcare needs.

National Dental Centre, 5 Second Hospital Avenue, Singapore 168938, www.ndcs.com.sg

National Healthcare Group Dental Polyclinics: Basic dental services

If you’re just looking for a cheap kids’ dentist in Singapore, the National Healthcare Group dental polyclinics offer subsidised basic dental services. Their team of dental specialists deal with examination and diagnosis, scaling & polishing, fillings and tooth extraction under local anaesthesia. The National Healthcare Group dental polyclinics are some of the cheapest dental clinics in Singapore. Simply make an appointment through the HealthHub app or by phone.

National Healthcare Group Polyclinics, multiple locations including Woodlands, Yishun and Toa Payoh Polyclinic, www.nhgp.com.sx

Nuffield Dental: Experienced kids dentists

Nuffield Dental’s eleven clinics offer dental check-ups, scaling and polishing, fillings, bite therapy and paediatric dentistry. Nuffield Dental founder, Dr. Samintharaj Kumar, is big on the holistic approach and is always ready to adapt to clients’ growing needs for alternative treatments. The nurses and dentists at Nuffield Dental are specially trained in handling children, and they offer emergency and night dentistry in case of an emergency.

Nuffield Dental, multiple clinics including Raffles Place, Serangoon, Holland Village, www.nuffielddental.com.sg

NUP Dental Polyclinics: Basic dental services

National University Polyclinics (NUP) offer cheap dental services at Bukit Panjang NUP Dental Polyclinic and Jurong, Queenstown NUP Dental Polyclinic. Offering subsidised rates, these are some of the cheapest dental clinics in Singapore. You can visit this dental clinic for basic detal services including scaling and polishing, filings, extractions and minor surgery undre local anaesthesia. Book a dental appointment at a polyclinic via the HealthHub app.

NUP Dental Polyclinics, three locations in Singapore including Bukit Panjang, Jurong and Queenstown, www.nup.com.sg

Q & M Dental Group Singapore: Affordable dental services

Q & M Dental is one of the more affordable dental clinics in Singapore offering subsidised services. Q & M Dental specialises in paediatric dentistry, nerve treatments, general dentistry and more. Q & M Dental provides dental services for pregnant women too, and with more than 100 Q & M Dental outlets islandwide, it’s easy to find an affordable dentist near you.

Q & M Dental Singapore, multiple locations in Singapore, including Bugis, Bishan and Chinatown, www.qandm.com.sg

SingHealth Polyclinics: Affordable dental services

SingHealth dental polyclinics offer dental services at selected SingHealth Polyclinic locations. These are some of the cheapest dental clinics in Singapore. You can book a dental appointment at a polyclinic via the HealthHub app. ​SingHealth Polyclinics can attend to dental emergencies such as bleeding from extraction, facial swelling, intense pain from advanced tooth decay or other conditions and dental trauma.

SingHealth Polyclinics, four locations in Singapore including Bedok, Eunos, Punggol and Tampines, www.polyclinic.singhealth.com.sg

Specialist Dental Group: Award-winning dental clinic

This award-winning dental group in Singapore is popular with families and has an internationally qualified and experienced team of dental specialists and dental surgeons. Many of them are actively training specialists and dentists in Singapore and regionally in their respective areas of speciality. Specialist Dental Group covers five speciality areas of dentistry including dental implants, gum treatment, braces and clear aligners, and many more.

Specialist Dental Group, two locations at Mount Elizabeth and Napier Road, www.specialistdentalgroup.com

T32 Dental: Kids dentist with TV & kids’ games

This dental clinic in Singapore has a dedicated paediatric department called T32 Junior. Facilities are designed to make children feel at ease during dental visits and include ceiling TV monitors to watch shows during treatment, an entertainment area and even kids’ games. Paediatric dentists can advise on issues related to your child’s oral health including the removal of baby teeth that are blocking the erupting permanent teeth and dealing with issues like thumb sucking.

T32 Dental, multiple locations in Singapore including Camden, Jurong and Bedok,  www.t32dental.com

TP Dental Surgeons: Kids dental surgery

Perched atop Ngee Ann City in an ultra-modern penthouse, TP Dental Surgeons offers advanced equipment and an outstanding dental team comprising general dentists in Singapore, endodontists, paediatric dentists, periodontists, oral and maxillofacial surgeons as well as orthodontists. If it’s your kiddos’ first dentist visit, there will be an examination involving “counting teeth”.

TP Dental Surgeons, 391B Orchard Road, #26-01 Ngee Ann City Tower B, Singapore 238874, www.tpdental.com.sg

Cheapest Dentist in Singapore

Looking for the cheapest dentist in Singapore? Did you know that The Health Promotion Board’s School Dental Service provides free basic dental services in school dental clinics and mobile dental clinics at Preschool, as well as Primary, Secondary and ITE Year 1 schools? Click here for more information.​​​

Emergency dental services in Singapore

If you are looking for cheap emergency dental services, check with the following dental clinics. However, do note wait times vary according to the number of specialists available each day:

  • National Dental Centre Singapore
  • National University Hospital
  • Khoo Teck Puat Hospital
  • National Healthcare Group (NHG) dental polyclinics
  • SGH’s Department of Emergency Medicine (A&E)
  • NUH Accident and Emergency Department where a Dental Officer on-call will attend to you

Visiting a dentist in Singapore: FAQs

When should I make the first visit to a paediatric dentist?

The American Academy of Paediatric Dentistry (AAPD) recommends that you schedule an appointment at a kids’ dentist or family dental clinic within six months from when their first tooth erupts or by the age of one. However, there are also paediatric dentists who recommend visits around the age of three, unless your child has specific dental concerns.

Dental experts agree that the earlier you begin this routine of visiting the dentist, the healthier their teeth, gums and mouth will be. In fact, early visits to the dentist can also help prevent cavities and tooth decay and other serious dental issues later on in life.

What should I do if my child is scared of visiting the dental clinic?

Several paediatric dentists have observed that parents may project their own fears onto their children. Instead of asking your kids to be brave or to not worry–these phrases can instil fear or doubt that may not have been present–let them read a book or a watch a video on visiting the dentist.

This can help calm their nerves, which can also help develop healthy dental habits in the long run. You can also prep your child at home by practising how to open their mouth for the dentist or by pretending to count their teeth with a flashlight.

What can we expect on a first visit to a paediatric dentist or dental clinic?

It’s important to schedule your child’s first visit with a paediatric dentist, as these experts are trained to manage children in the areas of children’s growth and development, behaviour management and child psychology. Many paediatric dentists will do simple things like count your child’s teeth and offer a lighthearted introduction to the purpose of a dental visit.

Some dentists may discuss your child’s diet with you and offer tips for good oral hygiene and teeth cleaning. This is also a good time to ask your kid’s dentist about any concerns you may have. Once your child is comfortable with their paediatric dentist, stick to a routine and bring them to the same dentist for subsequent dental appointments.

How can I encourage good dental hygiene at home?

It’s important to maintain good oral hygiene after your child’s first visit to a dental clinic in Singapore. Start by making brushing a habit twice a day. Invest in kid-friendly toothbrushes that are soft to medium in strength and teach your little one how to floss, too. The best way to cultivate good oral habits is to start by brushing your own teeth with your kids to set a good example.

You can also use reward systems or turn brushing and flossing into a fun game. Positive reinforcement is always a great way to hone good dental habits. Set a routine by ensuring your child brushes their teeth at the same time and place every day, or make it part of their nightly bath time. Sometimes, letting them watch a fun and helpful video can motivate them to brush their teeth regularly.

The most important way to help your child overcome their fear of the dentist is to look for kids’ dentists that take the time to explain or patiently answer any questions your child may have. Make sure your child gets plenty of rest prior to the visit, and if they are shy or nervous at the first visit, it is perfectly alright to stop and try again another day.

Now that you’re prepared for your child’s first visit to the paediatric dentist, consider making an appointment at these dental clinics to keep their pearly whites shiny and bright!

Read more: Orthodontists in Singapore

Check out more healthcare essentials below!

The post Where To Find Kids’ Dentists & Family Dental Clinics In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: 29 Fab Venues For A Kid’s Birthday Party In Singapore
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for a kid-friendly space to celebrate a birthday party in Singapore? These cool kids’ party venues are perfect for any budget! If you are planning your kid’s birthday party in Singapore, but aren’t sure if you can deal with hosting at home – then you’ll be looking for a kids’ party venue to rent […]

The post 29 Fab Venues For A Kid’s Birthday Party In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a kid-friendly space to celebrate a birthday party in Singapore? These cool kids’ party venues are perfect for any budget!

If you are planning your kid’s birthday party in Singapore, but aren’t sure if you can deal with hosting at home – then you’ll be looking for a kids’ party venue to rent out! Whether you’re hiring a pro party planner or organising your child’s birthday party yourself, this list of fab party venues in Singapore will help with outsourcing the birthday craziness! Then all you need to do is make or order a birthday cake, send out the party invites and decide on whether you are doing party bags (check out these eco-friendly party favours).

Organising a birthday party in Singapore is so much easier when you book one of these party venues that cater to different budgets and birthday party themes – there are princess parties, obstacle course birthday parties, a thrill-seeking luge party venue, gym fun birthday parties, you name it! For an extra special birthday party in Singapore, many of these kids’ party venues take care of the birthday party activities, decor, setup, party games and more to take a load off your shoulders! Also check out these great Birthday Deals while you’re at it.

Read more: Best Bakeries for Birthday Cakes in Singapore

Kids Birthday Party Venues: Where To Celebrate Your Kid’s Birthday Party In Singapore: 

Little Artists Art Studio: Artsy birthday party in Singapore

Looking for a unique and laid-back birthday party idea in Singapore? How about an artsy celebration where kids can get creative and paint? At the award-winning Little Artists Art Studio, little ones can explore their inner Picasso with fun activities like canvas painting, printmaking, t-shirt or tote bag printing, terracotta clay sculpting, pastel sketching, and more. We love that the space has ample parking and is well connected to the nearby Siglap MRT, making it a convenient and accessible venue for a birthday party!

Choose from their signature birthday party packages: the Very Van Gogh Party and the Distinctly Dali Party. Both offer 2 hours of art-filled fun in a spacious open-plan studio. Each package includes welcome drinks, birthday banners, cupcakes, goodie bags, and even a special gift for the birthday child! All art sessions are led by professional artists, so every child goes home with a unique masterpiece. You can also make the birthday celebration extra special with add-ons like personalised themes, a piñata, face-painting and more.

Best for: Artsy birthday party in Singapore for kids aged 3+

Little Artists Art Studio, The Siglap Centre, #02-18, 55 Siglap Road, Singapore 455871 and The Mandarin Gardens, #01-07, No 15, Siglap Road, Singapore 448912, Tel: (+65) 8879 2097, www.little-artists.com

The Play Scene: Birthday party venue with private access to play areas

Planning a birthday party for your little one but prefer a more bespoke celebration with private access to play areas kids can explore freely? The Play Scene might be just what you’re looking for! Centrally-located, this cosy venue offers exclusive use of its Montessori-inspired play area and immersive function rooms that are perfect for ideal for pre-schoolers, toddlers and little bubs. Each 2-hour birthday package is fully customisable to your child’s favourite theme – whether they’re into mermaids, dinosaurs or fairytales.

You’ll also get a dedicated party host to lead themed games and hands-on craft activities, keeping little guests entertained before they enjoy some free playtime. Parents can sit back and relax knowing there’s an in-house pantry equipped with a fridge, microwave and water filter, plus a convenient changing area for diaper duty. You can also level up the fun with add-ons like a magician, face-painting, and balloon artists!

Quote SASSYMAMA at checkout to enjoy $50 off your birthday party packages!

Best for: Birthday party in Singapore for kids aged 1 – 6 years old

The Play Scene, 75 Hillcrest Road, Singapore 299848, Tel: (+65) 9823 8349, www.theplayscene.com

Agora Colearning: Large birthday party venue with views of Sentosa

Planning a big birthday bash with a long guest list? Agora Colearning has you covered! This spacious venue offers both indoor and outdoor event spaces, including a spacious 5,000 sqft terrace with breathtaking views of Sentosa. Indoors, you can choose between spaces like play areas, studios, and even maker spaces. Their dedicated events team will be on-site to make sure everything runs smoothly from start to finish.

Want a fuss-free experience? Go for one of their pre-planned themed party packages, where everything from decor and entertainment to games and activities is taken care of for you. If you prefer a more personalised touch, their Build-Your-Own Party option lets you customise every detail, from the theme and decorations to goodie bags and activity line-up. Choose from exciting add-ons like bouncy castles, balloon sculpting, magic shows and more. You can even bring in your favourite external vendors to make the party extra special.

Best for: Large kids’ birthday parties

Agora Colearning, HarbourFront Centre, 1 Maritime Square, #04-01 Singapore 099253, www.agora-colearning.space

Clare’s Corner: Birthday party venue opened by fellow Mama

Clare’s Corner was founded by a fellow mama who, while searching for an affordable space to celebrate her daughter’s first birthday, decided to create one herself! Named after her daughter, Clare’s Corner is a clean, minimalist space that feels just as warm as it looks. The 1,700 sqft shophouse venue is filled with natural light and features a dedicated kids’ play area (a ball pit, soft play pretend kitchen and more), mum and baby-friendly amenities (diaper changing station, baby chairs water dispenser) and even adult-friendly perks like mahjong, card/board games, claw machine and a Switch!

Weekends are perfect for birthdays and milestone celebrations, with fuss-free packages like the Busy Mum Package (think cake and decor, all done for you), plus add-on MagicPainters entertainment at an exclusive 15% discount! On weekdays, Clare’s Corner transforms into a cosy mum community hub, hosting private play dates, Mummy & Me photo sessions, and Mum & Bub Pilates!

Best for: Busy Mamas who want a special celebration, without the stress

Clare’s Corner, 82 Jalan Senang, Singapore 418452, Tel (+65) 9737 1613, www.clarescorner.co

Crafty Whizz Studio: Creative, hands-on birthday parties

Planning a birthday party for a kid who loves to get creative? Crafty Whizz Studio offers a range of hands-on home party packages that come with creative activities perfect for kids aged 6 and up. Known for its creative programmes, including sewing classes, DIY crafts, and art workshops, Crafty Whizz Studio brings over 20 years of experience, with studios in both Kuala Lumpur and Singapore.

Choose from popular options like canvas art jamming, candle or soap making, dreamcatcher crafting, and even sewing workshops. Each package is designed to keep kids engaged while also unleashing their creativity. All packages include up to 3 instructors, games (with prizes!) and hosting. Some also offer face painting or balloon sculpting, while the All-in-One package even comes with full party decor. Prices vary depending on group size and activity choice, with a small additional fee for locations without lift access or parties held on public holidays.

Best for: Little ones who love hands-on, creative fun

Crafty Whizz Studio, 231 Mountbatten Road, #01-02B, Blk D, Singapore 397999, www.craftywhizz.com

Pixie Trixie Playhouse: Birthday party with kids’ spa and makeover

Nothing says pampering quite like a dedicated spa day! Little ones also deserve a bit of luxury! If you’re looking for a unique birthday celebration, a kids’ spa-themed birthday party is the perfect treat. Pixie Trixie Playhouse, Singapore’s first kids’ spa and makeover haven, offers just that with fun-filled birthday packages designed to make every child feel like royalty.For the girls, the Ultimate Pixie Spa Experience delivers the full princess treatment. It includes a mini shopping trip where they can pick out spa goodies, adorable bathrobes and slippers, a DIY chocolate facial, welcome drinks, footbath with fizzy bath bomb, fancy tattoos, a mini manicure and pedicure, and hairstyling with colourful hair extensions and a princess tiara to complete the look!

And don’t worry, the boys aren’t left out! The Boys-Only Fun Spa offers a pampering session too, featuring a DIY chocolate facial, foot bath with bath bomb, fun tattoos, and cool hairstyling. All party packages come with complimentary playtime in our play zone, which includes a ball pit, train set, board games, Barbie dream house, and more. There’s even a Pixie Trixie Mascot meet-and-greet session and catering available! Watch our Reel here.

Best for: Girls and boys ages 2 and up

Pixie Trixie Playhouse, 926 East Coast Road, Singapore 459116, Tel (+65) 8493 9949, www.instagram.com/pixietrixieplayhouse

SCURO: Neon slime & neon painting birthday party in Singapore

A glow-in-the-dark birthday party? Now that’s a birthday party to remember! SCURO takes your child’s birthday celebration to the next level with their one-of-a-kind Neon Slime and Neon Painting Workshops that are perfect for kids who love to get creative. Backed by 5-star reviews on Google, SCURO’s all-inclusive birthday packages are designed for a stress-free experience. Their dedicated team handles everything so you can focus on the fun.

Each 2–3 hour neon birthday party includes your choice of two main activities: neon canvas art or neon slime-making. With 2–3 dedicated party hosts on hand, kids will also enjoy party games like Simon Says, Balloon Games, Pass the Parcel, Ring Toss and more. Every party package comes complete with e-invites, themed decorations, a photo booth, and even a 10% discount on catering from SCURO’s trusted partners. And for the birthday kid, they’ll get their very own glowing neon crown to wear during the celebration! SCURO also does off-site parties where they bring the same amount of UV and neon fun to your preferred location! Reccee is required, so be sure to check with the team first!

Best for: Unique birthday parties for 3+

SCURO, 79 Kampong Bahru Road, #02-01, Singapore 169377, Tel (+65) 8033 4682, www.scuro.sg

All To Gather: Space for teen birthday parties

If you’re looking for event space rental in Singapore for birthday parties for teenagers or older kids (or any social occasion), check out All To Gather! They have a huge indoor birthday party space suitable for 120 people, but they also carry party supplies, party décor like balloons, printables, and dessert tables. There are plenty of party entertainment options at this kids’ party venue too – from an Air hockey table, to a Foosball table, PlayStation, and pool table. If your party gang is younger, this indoor birthday party venue also has a kids’ play area with a rocking horse and slide.

Best for: Event space rental in Singapore for older kids

All To Gather, 10 Jalan Besar, #16-03 Sim Lim Tower, Singapore 208787, WhatsApp: 8836 7084, www.alltogather.sg

Read more: Best Birthday Deals In Singapore: Freebies, Treats & More 

Adventure HQ @ HomeTeamNS Khatib: Birthday party with obstacle courses

There’s nothing but thrills to be found at this indoor birthday party space (there’s no air con – it is open-air but sheltered) that hosts a fab kids’ birthday party in Singapore. Great for older kids (there’s a minimum height of 1.25m) – the huge indoor playspace at Adventure HQ features 10 adventure installations spread out across four storeys. There’s a Bouldering Wall, 8 rock climbing lanes (with the guidance of trained personnel), an elevated 15-metre high Sky Venture plus an Urban Climb section with 24 interactive elements that provide plenty of thrills.

Best for: Active birthday party for older kids
Adventure HQ @ HomeTeamNS Khatib, 2 Yishun Walk, Singapore 767944, Email: advhq@hometeamns.sg, Tel: (+65) 6705 9420, www.hometeamns.sg

Amazonia Singapore: Snow-themed birthday party

This snow-themed playground doubles up as an indoor birthday party space for super fun kids’ birthday parties in Singapore. Aside from climbing structures and slides, there are themed 4D birthday party rooms and a variety of play areas. Their birthday party packages include invites, a professional host, kiddie entertainment (ventriloquists, magicians etc), and you can add other fun elements like face painting and tattoos, photography and videography, and much more.

Best for: Little kids up to around 9 years old looking for an indoor birthday party venue

Amazonia Singapore, 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #03-113 Great World, Singapore 237994, Tel: (+65) 6836 2544, www.amazoniafun.com

Buds by Shangri-la: Indoor birthday party venue with outdoor water play

Planning a birthday party in Singapore for tots and little kids? If you’re looking for an indoor space with a play area plus activities – check out Buds indoor playground within Shangri-la Hotel. There’s so much fun to be had at this kid’s birthday party venue which includes an arts’ room, indoor climbing playground, outdoor splash zone and more!

Best for: Indoor birthday party space for little kids up to around 9 years old

Buds by Shangri-la, Shangri-La Singapore, 22 Orange Grove Road, Singapore, Tel: (+65) 6213 4833, www.shangri-la.com

Read more: Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages

Escape Rooms: Adventurous birthday party for the older kids

Why not consider an escape room for a birthday party venue? Designed with different themes, escape room games are incredibly immersive with detailed storylines that get your problem-solving skills working. Want to find an escape room to suit your kid’s interests (there’s even a Harry Potter one!)? Check out our list of escape rooms here.

Best for: Indoor birthday party with escape room challenge for kids 10 yrs+

Forest Adventure: Birthday party at an outdoor obstacle course

Kiddos will love zipping through the air and balancing on bridges and obstacles at Forest Adventure! This outdoor obstacle challenge has three different age-appropriate courses (there are minimum height requirements for each course). It’s Singapore’s largest treetop adventure park with 69 obstacles and 6 zip lines! Forest Adventure has just recently resumed its birthday party packages, perfect if you’re planning a birthday party for your active kiddo.

Best for: Outdoor birthday party fun for older kids
