Forest Adventure, 825 Bedok Reservoir Park, Singapore 479244, Tel: (+65) 6206 9744, www.forestadventure.com.sg

Kidz Amaze @ SAFRA: Indoor water playground birthday party

Kidz Amaze @ SAFRA is no stranger to throwing exciting and fun-filled birthday parties, making it a top pick for celebrations in Singapore. With three convenient locations: SAFRA Toa Payoh, SAFRA Jurong, and SAFRA Punggol, this indoor playground offers giant slides, ball pits, climbing structures, and themed zones that promise endless fun for kids of all ages. Planning a party with a splash? The water-themed playground at SAFRA Punggol is a perfect choice!

Best for: Birthday parties for all ages

Kidz Amaze @ SAFRA, three locations in Singapore including SAFRA Punggol, SAFRA Toa Payoh and SAFRA Jurong, www.safra.sg

Kinder Klasse: Indoor birthday party with gym

From dancing and games to the open gym and more, there’s plenty of fun to be had at Kinder Klasse’s organised birthday parties in Singapore. Their 90-minute birthday party packages include free play time such as the trampoline, bouncy castles, ball pit sessions, rock wall and relays on the gym floor. The obstacle courses are also part of the Kinder Klasse birthday parties and contain various elements and equipment, so your kiddos will always be engaged in an activity during the party.

Best for: Birthday parties for small tots (1 – 5 years old) with organised soft play gym activities

Kinder Klasse, 11 Rhu Cross, #02-01, PAssion WaVe @ Marina Bay, Singapore 437440, Tel: (+65) 8893 3694, www.kinderklasse.com

McDonald’s: Affordable birthday party in Singapore

McDonald’s is the easiest kids’ birthday party venue in Singapore. After all, their birthday party packages include food, a party host, decor and games, plus every child gets a Happy Meal toy. You can also bring your own cake (as long as it’s halal-certified) or order a birthday cake for a small fee. There’s also an option for a takeaway McDonald’s party if you’re celebrating at home. Why not let the kids have fun at West Coast’s playgrounds or organise some lawn activities then head to McDonald’s for a meal afterwards?

Best for: A McDonald’s birthday party in Singapore will please most kiddos!

McDonald’s, multiple locations in Singapore, including Ang Mo Kio, West Coast, and VivoCity, www.mcdonalds.com.sg

Mosaic Play Academy: Outdoor and indoor birthday party venue

Looking for a birthday party venue for your little one that offers indoor playspaces (toddler soft play, ball pit, pretend play section) as well as outdoor playtime complete with a climbing frame and space to run? Mosaic Play Academy has a venue for birthday parties plus you can also hire additional play equipment (bouncy castles, inflatable pools) and book the other indoor playspaces to make your birthday party more memorable!

Best for: Outdoor and indoor birthday party venue with playtime for little tots

Mosaic Play Academy, 402 Joo Chiat Place Singapore 428082, Tel: (+65) 8031 2371, www.mosaicplayacademy.sg

Power Kids Gym: Gym birthday party in Singapore

We’ve been to numerous birthday parties at this colourful gym at its UE Square branch and are quite impressed by the team’s ability to wrangle large groups of high-energy toddlers (they actually cater to babies from the age of 4 months!) and kids. The team at this kids’ birthday party venue in Singapore will take care of everything – decor, setup, activities etc! – and you can choose from three different birthday party packages.

Best for: Organised gym activities for little kids up to 6-year-olds

Power Kids Gym, 81 Clemenceau Avenue and 4 Dairy Farm Lane, Tel: (+65) 6333 8511, www.powerkidsgym.com

Rhythm in Me: Dancing birthday parties

If you’re looking for a high-energy celebration for kids of all ages, the Rhythm in Me team will sort everything for you – they host parties of 15 kids up to parties of 85. Kids’ birthday party packages include various themes, two hours private party room hire, entertainment, e-invitations, themed decorations, and kid-friendly snacks. You can also choose other fun add-ons like photography, personalised banners and birthday celebration piñatas for a small fee, too.

Best for: High-energy birthday parties with dance, singing and fun for kids of all ages

Rhythm in Me, Depot Heights Shopping Center, 108 Depot Road, #01-16 Singapore, WhatsApp:9325-6653, www.rhythminme.com

Singapore Zoo: Birthday party in the zoo (Coming soon)

With lots of amazing animals, the Singapore Zoo is an excellent kids’ birthday party venue in Singapore! The Wild Birthday party package includes a buffet lunch, e-party invites and more. Although the birthday packages are undergoing a refresh, we can’t wait to see what new offerings the new packages come with! In the meantime, birthday peeps can check out exclusive birthday promotions through the Singapore Zoo membership programme. Read all about the Singapore Zoo here.

Best for: Birthday parties at Singapore Zoo will please animal-loving kids of all ages.

Singapore Zoo, 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com

Splat Paint House: UV paint birthday party in Singapore

This kids’ party venue is Singapore’s very first splatter paint studio and is a great place if your birthday boy or girl and their guests want nothing more than to get messy. The team can customise your child’s birthday party to suit your needs, and you’ll have some amazing art to hang up at home afterwards. They also do special UV paint parties each month.

Best for: birthday party venue for creative kids aged 6-16

Splat Paint House, 207A Upper Thomson Road, Singapore 574346, www.splatpainthouse.com

Swish Swimming: Poolside birthday parties in Singapore

What better idea for a kids’ birthday party in Singapore than a pool party to keep cool!? SWISH’s themed birthday parties – think mermaids, sharks, pirates, Hollywood and more – are a huge hit! Birthday party packages include 1 hour of fun-filled pool activities and games, along with 1 hour of supervised free time. SWISH offers temperature-controlled saltwater chlorination pools (one of which is indoors, in case of inclement weather!) along with safe lifeguard supervision and a passionate events staff.

Best for: Little swimmers of any age

SWISH Swimming, 72 Loewen Road, #01-08, Singapore 248848, Tel: (+65) 9832 2522, www.swishswimming.com

Timezone: Indoor party with arcade games

Timezone makes for a fun older kids’ party venue with arcade games. This indoor birthday party venue comes with an exclusive area with guided games, 90-180 minutes of playtime, and complimentary tickets for all kids to redeem a prize as well as party favours!

Best for: Indoor birthday party space for kids of all ages, especially older kids!

Timezone, multiple locations in Singapore, including Jurong Point, VivoCity and Parkway Parade, www.timezonegames.com

Waka Waka: Indoor playground party venue

Already one of our favourite indoor playgrounds in Singapore, Waka Waka is a smashing kids’ party venue, thanks to its fun birthday party packages. Simply pick a fun theme (dinos, science, or the popular Waka’s House Party), and you’ll get personalised e-vites, birthday celebration backdrop banners, goodie bags and balloons for every kiddo. Kids’ll also get to enjoy the play area, which has everything from a toddler soft play area to mazes, giant slides and even a ropes course.

Best for: Indoor birthday party venue for kids up to 6 years old

Waka Waka, Annex@furama #05-01, 407 Havelock Road, Singapore 169634, www.playatwakawaka.com

Wild Wild Wet: Water park birthday party in Singapore

One of Singapore’s largest water parks, Wild Wild Wet is home to a whopping 16 water rides for all ages, including seven new attractions. They also offer a number of birthday party packages that comes with VIP welcome entrance and VIP access to rides. Or just head to this water park with your birthday gang and get there early to grab a table with an umbrella shade. This birthday party venue will sure be a hit with the kiddos!

Best for: Celebrating a birthday with super active kids

Wild Wild Wet, Downtown East, 1 Pasir Ris Close, Singapore 519599, www.wildwildwet.com

Kiztopia: Birthday party in indoor playground

Kiztopia is one of Singapore’s most popular indoor playgrounds, with nine outlets across the island, including Bouncetopia at SAFRA Choa Chu Kang and VivoCity, as well as the ever-popular Kiztopia Club at Jewel Changi Airport. Each Kiztopia outlet features vibrant interiors filled with slides, ball pits, pretend play areas and more, making it the ultimate birthday party venue where kids can enjoy endless fun exploring the different themed play zones.

Best for: Birthday parties for tots and up

Kiztopia, multiple outlets in Singapore including Kiztopia Jurong Point, Kiztopia River Valley and Kiztopia Punggol, www.kiztopia.com

More Ideas for a Birthday Party in Singapore

Host a birthday party at home / in your function room

If you’re organising your child’s first birthday party why not keep things simple and buy a birthday cake and host in your home or have a party in your function room? There are a number of fab party entertainers you can engage if your party is for older kids. You can also consider hiring a magician instead for a birthday party full of fun party tricks.

Best for: 1-year-old birthday party /if you have access to a function room for a party

Have an artsy birthday party at home

If you’re feeling confident and have the space at home, there are heaps of DIY art activities you can do at home for a kid’s birthday party – from making slime, to mixing your own giant bubbles. Check out our guide to Singapore’s best arts & crafts stores for all the supplies you’ll need. And if you prefer to outsource the mess, many Singapore art classes offer kids’ birthday party options.

Best for: A cheap birthday party in Singapore

Party at the beach: Free kids’ party venue

If your kiddos are a little older and strong enough swimmers, why not have a fun beach party? Consider kid-friendly beach clubs like Coastes or take things up a notch at Tanjong Beach Club. And if your kiddo is up for it, why not centre their party around a group beach clean-up?

Best for: Cheap birthday party venue in Singapore

Charter a yacht: Bougie kids’ party venue

Yacht birthday parties aren’t just for adults! We’ve seen kids going for this fun (albeit more pricey!) option for their birthdays. Check out our list of yacht companies you can hire for your next birthday party.

Best for: An expensive birthday celebration in Singapore

Picnic in the park: Free kids’ party venue

If you’re going to keep things low-key why not have a small birthday party in one of Singapore’s fabulous parks or playgrounds, such as East Coast Park or Jacob Ballas Children’s Garden for a picnic! All you’ll need is delish snacks and finger food plus classic birthday party games. However, if you need more space, or want the peace of mind of having a sheltered space in the case of inclement weather, consider booking out one of NParks’ numerous venues.

Best for: Cheap birthday party venue in Singapore

        Read more: Where to Go for English Tuition in Singapore

Need more kids’ birthday party inspo? Check out these reads!

The post 29 Fab Venues For A Kid’s Birthday Party In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Where To Find The Tastiest Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival & Dragon Boat Festival 2025
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Here’s where to order celebratory bak chang/ba zhang and traditional rice dumplings in Singapore for the Dumpling Festival aka Dragon Boat Festival 2025. Don’t miss the rice dumpling promotions with early bird savings! Looking for rice dumplings in Singapore to celebrate the Dragon Boat Festival 2025 (also called Dumpling Festival 2025)? The traditional Chinese food […]

The post Where To Find The Tastiest Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival & Dragon Boat Festival 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Here’s where to order celebratory bak chang/ba zhang and traditional rice dumplings in Singapore for the Dumpling Festival aka Dragon Boat Festival 2025. Don’t miss the rice dumpling promotions with early bird savings!

Looking for rice dumplings in Singapore to celebrate the Dragon Boat Festival 2025 (also called Dumpling Festival 2025)? The traditional Chinese food for the Dragon Boat Festival is bak chang/bak zhang or zongzi — pyramid-shaped glutinous sticky rice dumplings with different fillings of pork, water chestnuts, mushrooms and other fillings wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves. Nyonya dumplings are stuffed with braised pork, five-spice powder and candied winter melon, while the rice dumpling ‘Kee zhang‘ has no filling and is eaten as a sweet, dipped gula melaka (palm sugar). Here’s where to find the tastiest rice dumplings to celebrate the Dumpling Festival in Singapore!

↓ Scroll on for where to find rice dumplings to celebrate Dragon Boat Festival 2025!

Read more: Guide To Best Dim Sum In Singapore

When is Rice Dumpling Festival 2025?

The Chinese Dumpling Festival takes place on the fifth day of the fifth month of the Chinese Lunar Calendar which is Monday, 31 May 2025.

Dragon Boat Festival History

The Dragon Boat Festival commemorates the death of Qu Yuan, a Chinese poet and minister during the Zhou Dynasty Warring States period who was banished and accused of treason. He later drowned himself in the river when the Chu capital was captured by Qin. Legend has it that he couldn’t be saved by locals who tried to race out in boats to reach him in time.

Fishermen beat their oars against the water to stop the man-eating fish in the river from devouring Qu Yuan’s body. Some say they threw cooked rice wrapped in leaves into the water, hoping that the fish would eat them instead. This legend has resulted in the celebratory Dragon Boat Festival with dragon boat races and the eating of rice dumplings wrapped in reed leaves.

How to cook Rice Dumplings

Rice dumplings are best eaten when they are steamed, but may also be eaten as sold from your favourite rice dumpling spot. If the rice dumplings are not eaten on the day of purchase, they should be placed in the refrigerator where they can be usually kept for up to four days. When you’re ready to tuck in, reheat the rice dumplings by steaming for 15 minutes or boiling for 12 minutes.

Best Bak Chang/Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival 2025

So now that you know a little about the Dragon Boat Festival history, let’s check out some of the rice dumplings and gifting options in Singapore to celebrate this festival.

1. Pan Pacific Singapore: Handcrafted rice dumplings

Indulge in succulent rice dumplings that are bursting with flavour this Dragon Boat Festival at the award-winning Cantonese restaurant Hai Tien Lo. Whether you’re looking for a thoughtful gift for business associates and friends or simply want to treat yourself to scrumptious rice dumplings at home, Pan Pacific Singapore’s Hai Tien Lo has just what you need. The exclusive Premium Rice Dumplings Set offers the highlights of their rice dumpling offerings this year including Supreme Rice Dumpling, Salted Fish and Preserved Meat Rice Dumpling and more.

For a traditional rice dumpling, order the Teochew Rice Dumpling with Yam Paste, Chestnuts and Gingko Nuts or the Hokkien Rice Dumpling with Pork and Salted Egg Yolk. The Black Glutinous Nyonya Rice Dumpling offers a perfect blend of black and white glutinous rice with lean pork, candied melon, Japanese mushrooms, shallots and garlic. Order online for delivery or opt for self-collection at Pacific Emporium’s deli counter.

Rice dumplings for Rice Dumpling Festival 2025: Order online from now to 31 May 2025 for delivery or pick-up from 1 May until 31 May 2025, 10am to 8pm. Call Tel: (+65) 6826 8240 or email specialevents.ppsn@panpacific.com for enquiries.

Hai Tien Lo, Pan Pacific Singapore, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square Singapore 039595, www.panpacific.com

2. Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel: Handcrafted gourmet rice dumplings

Celebrate Dragon Boat Festival 2025 in style with gourmet rice dumplings by the award-winning Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant. Taking rice dumplings to the next level, Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant introduces a new flavour that draws from the growing popularity of mala flavours. Their newly launched Pork Trotter & Peanut with Szechuan Green Peppercorn Rice Dumpling is packed with a slow-braised pork trotter with Chinese Herbs and marinated with green peppercorn sauce for a numbing, fiery kick.

Another rice dumpling flavour that highlights popular local flavours is Pandan Gula Melaka with Shredded Coconut & Quinoa Glutinous Rice Dumpling that evokes the flavours of the well-loved Ondeh Ondeh. For exquisite flavours, order the 5-Head Abalone with Karasumi & Iberico Pork Rice Dumpling that is sure to tantalise your taste buds. If you prefer traditional flavours, the Signature Pork & Salted Egg Rice Dumpling is a must-try item that will bring back memories from days of old. Lastly, don’t miss their wholesome creation, the nourishing Cordycep Flower & Purple Glutinous Rice Dumpling that’s perfect for vegetarians.

Quote EBRD25 to get a 25% early bird discount for rice dumplings from now until 11 May. From 12 – 31 May 2025, quote RD15OFF to get 15% regular discount for rice dumplings. For bulk purchases of 10 pieces or more, enjoy 30% off rice dumplings with promo code “BKRD30” upon check-out, from 18 April – 31 May 2025.

Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Online pre-orders start from now until 28 May 2025 for self-collection or delivery from 12 to 31 May 2025. Call Tel: (+65) 6831 4605 or email mhrs.sindt.fb.reservation@marriotthotels.com to order.

Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant, Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, 320 Orchard Road, Singapore 238865, www.celebratorydelights.com

3. Joo Chiat Kim Choo: Traditional, Nonya rice dumplings

This Dragon Boat Festival 2025, step inside Joo Chiat Kim Choo’s flagship store on Circuit Road and be greeted by trinkets and curios of nostalgia for a blast to the past. Joo Chiat Kim Choo is known for its traditional Chinese rice dumplings, such as the Teochew Rice Dumpling, Hokkien Rice Dumpling, Cantonese Bean Rice Dumpling and more. Joo Chiat Kim Choo offers rice dumpling bundles and we love that you can buy these morsels of delight all year round, not just during Dumpling Festival!

Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Joo Chiat Kim Choo rice dumplings are available all year round. Order online.

Joo Chiat Kim Choo, 30B Quality Road, Singapore 618826 and 77 Circuit Road, #01-450, Singapore 370077, www.joochiatkimchoo.com.sg

4. Man Fu Yuan: Handcrafted rice dumplings

Celebrate the traditions of the Dragon Boat Festival with a choice of seven artisanal rice dumplings from Man Fu Yuan at InterContinental Singapore. This award-winning Cantonese restaurant has two new rice dumpling flavours, along with three rice dumpling gift bundle sets. Look out for the Nonya Rice Dumpling with Plant-Based Meat, Sweetened Winter Melon, and Mushroom, the Glutinous Rice Dumpling with Red Bean, Honey Date and Red Date, and the Duo Glutinous Rice Dumpling with Japanese Sweet Potato and Black Sesame which offers a refreshing change from the usual savoury rice dumplings.

Quote RICERD15 to get 15% early-bird savings on selected items. Valid until 30 April 2025. Card members of Citibank, DBS, Maybank and UOB enjoy an exclusive 15% savings.

Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Available for purchase until 28 May 2025 via festive@ihg.com, takeaway and delivery from 1 May to 28 May 2025.

Man Fu Yuan, InterContinental Singapore, 80 Middle Road, Singapore 188966, www.singapore.intercontinental.com

5. Eastern Rice Dumpling: Dragon Boat Festival 2025

The recipe for rice dumplings from Eastern Rice Dumpling has been passed down three generations for the last 40 years. Eastern Rice Dumpling is one of the more affordable rice dumpling spots in Singapore. Rumour is that prices are cheaper the earlier you buy and then increase towards Dumpling Festival, so be sure to order your rice dumplings early. Their popular rice dumplings include Nyonya Dumpling and the Hokkien Rice Dumpling made from fried glutinous rice and a filling of chestnut, mushroom and pork marinated with five spices.

Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025: Available all year round. You can order online here.

Eastern Rice Dumpling | Dong Yuan Bak Chang, online orders, www.easternricedumpling.com

6. Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant: Rice dumplings & bak zhang for Dragon Boat Festival

Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant has a signature rice bak chang creation with Five-spiced Braised Pork Belly Meat, Salted Egg Yolk, Mushroom and Shrimp. There’s also Xin’s Signature Home-made Traditional Rice Dumpling and the Kee Chang Red Lotus Seed Paste Dumpling served with Osmanthus Sauce, as well as an Assorted Rice Dumpling Bundle set. Handcrafted in-house by Xin Cuisine’s Dim Sum Chef, these rice dumplings make a fab gift for Dragon Boat Festival 2025.

Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025: Collection Delivery available from 1 to 31 May 2025, Wednesdays to Sundays. (Orders must be made 3 days in advance) All bak chang are available for order online.

Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant, Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium, 317 Outram Road, Singapore, www.holiday-inn-singapore-atrium-estore.myshopify.com

7. Bak chang/Hokkien rice dumplings at Hoo Kee Bak Chang

Hoo Kee Bak Chang 和记肉粽 (Michelin Bib Gourmand bak chang) is a family business that has been selling Hokkien style rice dumplings or bak chang for over 60 years throughout the year and not just during Dragon Boast Festival. Bak chang flavours range from the original flavour of roasted pork with chestnuts, as well as bak chang with salted duck egg yolk and the deluxe bak chang of pork, roasted chestnuts, salted egg yolk, and shiitake mushrooms.

Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2024: Available for purchase online all year round.

Hoo Kee Bak Chang 和记肉粽, www.hookeebakchang.sg

8. Rice dumplings at 藝 yì by Jereme Leung

You can rely on 藝 yì by Jereme Leung at Raffles Hotel Singapore for exceptionally handcrafted sweet and savoury rice dumplings, in honour of the annual Dragon Boat Festival celebrations. MasterChef Jereme Leung uses traditional and unique ingredients to make their rice dumpling stand out. Whether you’re craving sweet or savoury rice dumplings, you’ll be treated to meticulously and artfully handcrafted rice dumplings that will elevate your Dragon Boat Festival 2025 celebration.

Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025: Order rice dumplings online from 1 to 31 May 2025 for delivery or self-collection 藝yì by Jereme Leung from 12 to 31 May 2025. Cardholders from DBS/POSB, Citi, and UOB Singapore may enjoy a 20% early bird reduction for online purchases between 1 to 29 May 2025. Online orders for rice dumplings must be made at least two days in advance.

Jereme Leung  #03-02, Raffles Arcade, 328 North Bridge Road, Singapore 188719, www.rafflesgrabandgo.com

9. Thye Moh Chan: Teochew bak chang

Rice dumplings here are expertly hand-wrapped with quality bamboo leaves and slow-cooked for over two and a half hours to ensure a plump and moist parcel with hidden delights. Tuck into Thy Moh Chan’s Teochew Double Delight Bak Chang and the Teochew Salted Egg Bak Chang, alongside exclusive rice dumplings like a flavourful Teochew Vegetarian Chang and BreadTalk’s subtly-sweet Sun Cake. Individual packs or rice dumpling bundle sets are also available, presented in a complimentary limited-edition bag – perfect for gifting.

Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Thye Moh Chan’s Teochew Bak Chang are usually available at selected BreadTalk, Toast Box and Thye Moh Chan stores and online via Grabfood, Foodpanda and Deliveroo. Stay tuned for deets on when orders open.

Thye Moh Chan, available at various stores in Singapore, www.thyemohchan.com

So which rice dumpling will you be choosing to celebrate Dumpling Festival 2025?

The post Where To Find The Tastiest Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival & Dragon Boat Festival 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.

item.title: Guide To Kids’ Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore In 2025
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
What are your kids doing during the June school holidays? Here’s our list of 2025 kids’ summer holiday camps in Singapore to suit every interest from gymnastics to drama arts, sports, coding, cooking, and more. Planning your kids’ Summer school holiday camps? Look out for early bird discounts for school holiday camps plus, we have […]

The post Guide To Kids’ Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore In 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
What are your kids doing during the June school holidays? Here’s our list of 2025 kids’ summer holiday camps in Singapore to suit every interest from gymnastics to drama arts, sports, coding, cooking, and more.

Planning your kids’ Summer school holiday camps? Look out for early bird discounts for school holiday camps plus, we have extra special Sassy Mama discount codes where you can get as much as 20% off certain summer school holiday camps. If you’re looking for some fun June holiday activities, keep scrolling to check out the wide range of holiday camps, for toddlers as young as three to school holiday camps for teenagers!

Read more: Year-End Holiday Camps In Singapore

Click to jump to themed school holiday camps…
– Multi-activity Summer Holiday Camps
– Sports Summer Holiday Camps
– Coding Summer School Holiday Camps
– Music, Dance & Performing Arts Summer Holiday Camps
– Cooking Summer Holiday Camps
– Language (English & Mandarin) Summer Holiday Camps
– Science Summer Holiday Camps
– Art Summer Holiday Camps

Read more: Ultimate Guide to Summer in Singapore: Activities + Things to Do

Disclaimer: Sassy Mama does not own or manage these holiday camps. All programme information is supplied by the camp and is subject to change. Check directly before booking. Unless mentioned, discounts are not stackable.

Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages:

Multi-Activity Summer Camps In Singapore 2025

Camp Asia: Multi-activity & STEM summer camps

Camp Asia is known for their legendary summer camps filled with thrilling activities for kids aged 3 to 16 years old. From sports and science to arts and tech, kids can explore and discover what excites them most! These multi-activity summer holiday camps in Singapore take place at Stamford American International School, offering a safe place for kids to learn through play with state-of-the-art facilities.

Their team is fully trained in first-aid and risk management, so you can drop your child off with peace of mind. Watch your child light up every morning excited for another day of camp because the fun never ends! At this summer holiday camp, there are plenty of opportunities for kids to build confidence, independence and friendships that will go the distance.

Quote SASSYMAMA50 to get $50 off your child’s summer holiday camp booking from now to August 2025.

Age range: 3 – 16 years old
Holiday camp dates: 9 June – 8 August 2025 (excluding public holidays)
Where: Stamford American International School Singapore, 1 Woodleigh Lane, Singapore 357684.
Holiday camp prices: $730 – $860. Click here to register.

Camp Asia, www.campasia.asia

Camp Beaumont: Sports, STEAM & language summer holiday camps

Want your kids to have an action-packed summer holiday? Sign them up for Camp Beaumont’s summer holiday camps that will get them moving, playing and unleashing creativity while making new friends. Offering a variety of summer camps for kids aged 3 to 12 at Tanglin Trust School and Nexus International School in Singapore and 17 other locations in Southeast Asia, you can easily find a summer camp near you!

For a summer camp that has the best of everything, sign up for the Multi-Activity Day Camp. Budding scientists will love the STEAM camps, while language enthusiasts can get a learning boost at the English Language Day camps. For a rich, cultural experience to enhance English language skills, register for the English Language Residential Camps and British Summer Residential Camps held in Johor and Penang in Malaysia, as well as Chiang Mai in Thailand.

Quote PRSASSY10 to get 10% off your child’s summer holiday camp!

Age range: 3 – 15 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 22 August 2025
Where: Tanglin Trust School & Nexus International School and 17 other locations for both day & residential camps in Johor, Penang, Kuala Lumpur, Hong Kong, Bangkok, Pattaya and Chiang Mai.
Holiday camp prices: Prices vary depending on locations and programmes. Click here to register.

Camp Beaumont, Tanglin Trust School & Nexus International School in Singapore and 17 other locations, www.campbeaumont.asia

XCL World Academy: Multi-activity summer holiday camp

XCL World Academy (XWA)’s wildly popular multi-activity summer holiday camp is back, offering unforgettable summer adventures for kids aged 3 to 16. Passionate about helping kids discover their interests, skills and talents, they offer a wide range of exciting activities for kids to explore, learn and grow. Popular camps include Entrepreneurship 101, Esports camp, Engineering Explorers, Stage Drama and more!

Prefer for a summer holiday camp that offers a little bit of everything? Sign up for The All-Rounder, where kids can get hands-on at creative classes, get active with sports and learn the secrets to becoming successful entrepreneurs. To keep things exciting, XCL Camps offers different activities every week, so your child can keep coming back for more!

Enjoy an early bird 10% discount on all summer holiday camps when you book before 31 May 2025.

Age Range: 3 – 16 years old
Holiday camp dates: 23 June – 1 August 2025
Where: XCL World Academy, 2 Yishun Street 42, Singapore 768039; Transportation to and from selected locations will be provided at nominal cost.
Holiday camp prices: From $710 (camp fees include lunch and snacks, six hours of activities, quality childcare, supplies and an exclusive XCL Camp T-shirt). Click here to register.

XCL World Academy, www.xclcamps.com

Adventure Camp at Hollandse Club

Give your kids a chance to try a variety of experiences this summer! Sign them up for Hollandse Club’s exciting Adventure Camp that offers the best of everything. Choose from full-day and full-week summer holiday camps that will keep your child coming back for more. Each day, your child can look forward to a wide range of activities that will spark curiosity, inspire imagination and promise loads of fun and laughter.

Kids can beat the heat with swimming lessons and get a sweaty workout with racket sports. They will also get to discover how to express themselves through musical theatre, and kids can join a LEGO-building activity that will hone fine-motor skills and enhance creativity. Non-members are also welcome to join this summer holiday camp! Lunch and snacks are also provided daily for all participants.

Age range: 5 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 16 – 20 June; 23 – 27 June; 30 June – 4 July; 7 – 11 July; 14 – 18 July; 21 – 25 July; 28 July – 1 August; 4 – 8 August; 11 – 15 August 2025
Where: 22 Camden Park, Singapore 299814
Holiday camp prices: $165 per day & $825 per week. Click here to register.

Hollandse Club, 22 Camden Park, Singapore 299814, www.hollandseclub.org.sg

aquaDucks: Multi-sport summer holiday camp

Is your child constantly full of energy? They won’t want to miss the Bijou Holiday Camp jointly organized by aquaDucks, Metamorph, TT Lab and Cube Cubs. aquaDucks is known for its world-class swimming programmes for babies as young as four months old. This summer, their Bijou Holiday Camp gives kids a chance to try multiple sports and activities under one roof!

Kids can sweat it out with Muay Thai and learn essential self-defence skills that they will use for life. They can also learn how to play table tennis, which makes for a fun family activity. Plus, they can dive into the pool to beat the heat and hone their swimming techniques while having a ton of fun with Lego. Kids can enjoy drinks, snacks and lunch for full-day participants.

Age range: 5 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 – 20 June 2025
Where: aquaDucks Pasir Panjang, Bijou, 4 Jalan Mat Jambol, Basement 1, Singapore 119555
Holiday camp prices: $92.65 (half-day camp) & $165 (full-day camp). Click here to register.

aquaDucks, 4 Jalan Mat Jambol, Basement 1, Singapore 119555, www.aquaducks.com.sg

Chess At Three: Chess, speech & communication holiday camps

At Chess at Three’s summer holiday camp, kids as young as 4 can learn how to play chess. Learning to play chess will help your child develop focus, concentration, critical thinking and sportsmanship, essential life skills that will help them thrive in school and beyond. Choose from eight different types of camps to suit your child’s age and experience level for the best learning experience.

In addition to chess, kids can also sign up for their signature Speech & Communications camp that is based on an original, role-playing game called Birchguard Quest. In this holiday camp, kids will create their own characters, participate in role-playing adventures, and pitch and debate ideas to solve puzzles and complete missions as a team.

Quote SASSYMAMA10 to get 10% off Birchquard Quest camp sign-ups in pairs or more. Get 10% off for chess camp sign-ups in groups of four or more.

Age range: 4 – 12 years (International Chess), 5 – 12 years (Birchguard Quest)
Holiday camp dates: All weeks throughout summer, starting 2 June to 26 September 2025
Where: United Square, Newton, Katong, Beauty World, Tampines and Harbourfront
Holiday camp prices: $500 for 5 days, 3 hours per day (subject to 9% GST). Inclusive of all activities, snacks, T-shirt and goodie bag. Click here to register.

Chess at Three, www.chessat3.sg/holiday-camps

Get GungHo: Multi-activity camps & excursions

Designed by former IB international school leaders, Get Gungho’s weekly school holiday multi-activity camps offer a balanced array of activities including thrilling activities and excursions to Adventure Cove Water Park, Nestopia and Gardens by the Bay. With a perfect blend of STEM, arts and crafts, sports and outdoor play, their award-winning summer holiday camps are a huge hit with kids aged 5 to 12 years old.

This year, Camp GungHo Sentosa features exciting themes inspired by Harry Potter, Moana, Minecraft and Jurassic World. From creating a Moana Wayfinder Raft Model to enjoying beach play and practising gross motor skills at Nestopia, there’s plenty of fun for everyone! Kids who want to sharpen their football skills will love the Celtic Soccer Academy Camp led by Glasgow Celtic coaches from the UK.

Quote SASSY5 to enjoy 5% off. Quote HANGOUT to enjoy 8% off (for sign-ups of three or more). All stackable on top of prevailing early bird discounts.

Age range: 5 – 12 years
Holiday camp dates: Camps run throughout the school break from June to August 2025 (Camp GungHo Sentosa & Kovan); 16 – 20 & 23 – 27 June 2025 (Celtic Soccer Academy UK)
Where: Camp GungHo Sentosa (drop-off and pick-up from either VivoCity or Beach Station Sentosa), Camp GungHo Kovan, KickOff Arena Kovan, Celtic Soccer Academy Camps at KickOff Arena Kovan and Rainforest Hub West Coast (Haw Par Villa MRT)
Holiday camp prices: Camp GungHo: early bird price $408 (U.P. $430) for 3-day camp and $620 for a 5-day camp (U.P. $650). Click here to register; Celtic Soccer Academy UK: $550 (U.P. $660) for a 5-day camp. Click here to register.

Get Gungho, www.getgungho.com

Impressions Kids Club: Themed holiday camps with weekly field trips

Looking for a June holiday camp that will keep your kids well entertained? Sign them up for Impressions Kids Club’s themed summer camp that features plenty of exciting hands-on activities and weekly field trips! Kids will love exploring their creative and interactive play areas that will stimulate all of their senses and give them a learning and developmental boost without them even realising it! Whether it’s learning about animals in the forest, travelling beyond the stars, or diving into a fairy tale adventure, there’s something in store for everyone!

Due to popular demand, their half-day holiday camps are now open for toddlers aged 18 months to 3 years, so the little ones can join in the fun too! Plus, if you’d prefer to save the time and hassle of commuting, simply top up $35 per trip for private transport. The half-day holiday camp includes either a morning or afternoon snack, while the full-day holiday camp includes a morning snack, lunch and an afternoon snack.

Get 10% off when you sign up with one buddy or 15% off when you sign up as a group of five. Discounts valid only for a full-week sign-ups (Monday to Friday).

Age range: 18 months – 3 years old (Toddler Camp) & 4 – 12 years old (Kids Camp)
Holiday camp dates: 26 May – 15 August 2025
Where: Tanglin Mall
Holiday camp prices: From $120 for a one-day camp & $700 for a full-week camp. Click here to register.

Impressions Kids Club, 163 Tanglin Road, #03-136/7/8 Tanglin Mall, Singapore 247933, www.impressionskidsclub.com

The Olympia Camp: Multi-activity summer holiday camp

Looking for a summer holiday camp that has the best of everything? This summer, Olympia Camp invites kids aged 5 to 12 to join a unique multi-sport, multi-activity experience led by camp experts aquaDucks, The Mindful Camp and 40XV. Held at the lush Swish Club Singapore, campers will enjoy top-notch facilities and a wide range of engaging activities.

Mornings kick of with swimming or tennis lessons led by experienced coaches, while afternoons are packed with indoor and outdoor group games, arts, cooking and other activities that nurture essential life skills in an engaging way.

Age range: 5 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: From 7 July 2025
Where: Swiss Club Singapore, 36 Swiss Club, Singapore 288139
Holiday camp prices: $960. Click here to register.

The Olympia Camp, 36 Swiss Club, Singapore 288139, www.themindfulcamp.com

Objectifs: YouTuber & photojournalist summer holiday camps

Got a kid who loves taking photos and videos? They’ll love Objectifs’ summer holiday camps this year because they are bringing back their popular Young YouTubers camp and introducing a brand-new Young Photojournalist Camp. Young content creators will be able to hone the art of storytelling and develop essential videography and editing skills while building their on-camera presence.

In their brand-new photojournalist camp, kids aged 8 to 14 will get the chance to explore what it means to be a photojournalist and try their hand at documenting the stories of Waterloo Street. Kids will get to embark on photo walks, get competitive at interactive games and get hands-on with projects that will expose them to the fundamentals of photography and sharpen their storytelling skills. No experience is required, so all kids are welcome!

Quote SASSYMAMAJUN to get 5% off your summer holiday camp today!

Age range: 6 – 14 years old
Holiday camp dates: Young YouTubers Workshop: 2 – 4 & 18 – 20 June 2025, 3pm – 5:30pm; Young Photojournalist Workshop: 4 – 6 June, 10am – 12:30pm & 11 – 13 June 2025, 3pm – 5:30pm
Where: Objectifs – Centre for Photography & Film, 155 Middle Road Singapore 188977
Holiday camp prices: $220. Click here to register.

Objectifs – Centre for Photography & Film, 155 Middle Road, Singapore 188977, www.objectifs.com.sg

Read more: Best June Holiday Activities For Summer Fun

Prodigy by ProActiv Sports: Themed multi-activity summer holiday camps

Prodigy by ProActiv Sports offers exciting multi-activity summer holiday camps for kids aged 4 to 12! Their sports and movement programmes help kids develop fundamental skills in a fun and engaging way, so they always keep coming back for more. In addition to sports, kids will also get hands-on with plenty of STEAM activities, giving them a learning boost without even setting foot in a classroom!

Campers can look forward to an outdoor excursion that will give them a much-needed dose of vitamin D as they explore nature. No matter what your child’s favourite character is, you’re sure to find one they’ll love. The themed camp activities feature popular characters and movies like Pokemon, Minecraft, and Super Mario, plus new movie-inspired themes like Among Us, How To Train Your Dragon and more!

Book with a sibling or a friend to enjoy 10% off!

Age range: 4 – 12 year olds
Holiday camp dates: 1 May – 15 August 2025
Where: Prodigy, Level 3 Katong Point, 451 Joo Chiat Road, 427664
Holiday camp prices: $130 for one day; $575 for five days. Lunch and snacks included. Click here to register.

Prodigy by ProActiv Sports, Level 3 Katong Point, 451 Joo Chiat Rd, 427664, www.sg.proactivsports.net

Saturday Leadership: Summer holiday camp with essential life skills

On a mission to raise future-ready kids, Saturday Leadership is not your run-of-the-mill summer holiday camp provider. True success is more than just grades; their goal is to empower kids for the future by shaping their mindset and building leadership, resilience, and confidence to spot a problem and take action. Their signature holiday programmes are packed with high-energy fun and real-world value that will equip kids with the tools and skills they need for future challenges.

Their Leadership and Entrepreneurship Camps empower kids and teens to pitch bold ideas, solve real problems and take initiative. The Resilience Camps are filled with movement, challenge and fun through team games, physical activities and mindset missions that inspire kids to take risks and persevere even when the going gets tough!

Age range: 7 – 18 year olds
Holiday camp dates: 30 May to 1 August 2025 (Dates vary for each course. Choose from 2-day camps to 4.5-day camps.)
Where: 444A Joo Chiat Road, Singapore 427657
Holiday camp prices: Contact Saturday Leadership to enquire. Click here to register.

Saturday Leadership, 444A Joo Chiat Road, Singapore 427657, www.saturdayleadership.com

Read more: Guide To Mandai ZooSchool

Sports Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore 2025

Sports Schooling: Karate, swimming & tennis holiday camps

Started by Singapore’s Olympic swimming champion Joseph Schooling, Sports Schooling aims to help kids experience the joy of movement through sports. This June, give your child a chance to get off the screens and get their bodies moving with Sports Schooling’s summer holiday camps designed for kids aged 5 to 12. Each programme will inspire, challenge and nurture new skills in a fun and engaging environment.

In the Spy Adventure Camp, kids will embark on top-secret missions filled with agility training, problem-solving challenges and confidence-building activities through martial arts or swimming. Make a splash as a superhero, join a pirates’ quest or unleash skills in a secret agent combat. Kids can also sign up for Sports Champions with a Heart to hone skills in swimming and tennis.

Register by 30 April 2025 to get $30 off the total camp fee.

Age range: 5 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 – 4 June 2025 (Sports Champions with a Heart – swim edition); 9 – 11 June 2025 (Spy Adventure Camp – superhero swim edition); 16 – 18 June 2025 (Sports Champion with a Heart – tennis edition); 23 – 25 June 2025 (Spy Adventure Camp – pirates’ swim edition); 1 – 4 July 2025 (Spy Adventure Camp – karate edition)
Where: 11 Slim Barracks Rise, #04-01, Singapore 138664
Holiday camp prices: $420 per child. Click here to register.

Sports Schooling, www.centreformovement.sg

SWISH Swimming: Themed swimming summer holiday camps

This summer holiday, let your child beat the heat with SWISH Swimming’s exciting themed summer camps! Pros at helping little ones discover the joy of swimming, the swimming instructors curate summer camps that are designed to blend water confidence with creativity, technical skills, and endless fun. Kids can choose from five different themes that elevate the summer camps with non-stop games, themed crafts and more.

Kids will enjoy island vibes and tropical-themed crafts at the SWISH Aloha Camp or dive into sunshine and beach-inspired crafts at Sandy Sunshine Camp. For lots of games, laughter and an epic Super Soaker showdown, sign up for SWISH Carnival Camp. Kids can push their limits and sharpen their strokes at the Level Up! Camp or join a five-day intensive programme at the Water Safety SwimSafer Camp.

Mention Sassy Mama and bring a buddy to the swimming summer camp where you both can get 10% off!

Age range: 4 years and up
Holiday camp dates: 23 June – 18 July 2025, 28 July – 8 August 2025
Where: SWISH Pools @ Dempsey Hill, 72 Loewen Road, #01-08, Singapore 248848
Holiday camp prices: $419 per child (excluding GST). Click here to register.

SWISH Swimming, www.swishswimming.com

Read more: Guide To Swim Schools & Swimming Lessons For Kids & Adults

Coding & Robotics Summer Holiday Camps in Singapore 2025

The Brainery Code: Artificial Intelligence and Minecraft holiday camp

The Brainery Code is known for its hands-on enrichment holiday camps in Singapore in Coding and Robotics, designed for children aged 5 to 16. With a strong track record, including students who have represented Singapore at national and international robotics competitions, their programmes focus on building real-world tech skills that can benefit your child in the dynamic world.

The Brainery Code’s Techcation holiday camp is a two-day programme that introduces kids to foundational tech concepts. Choose from two different themes, Artificial Intelligence, where kids can explore how smart systems are trained, and Minecraft Mania, perfect for the Minecraft fans! This game-based approach lets kids learn about coding in a fun setting. Kids can also choose exciting add-ons like Robotics and VR. Registration will include a free LEGO gift and vouchers, and if you sign up as a group you’ll enjoy up to 15% discounts! Lunch is provided for all participants.

Quote Sassy20 to enjoy a $20 discount on your 2025 Techcation summer holiday camp! Valid till June 2025.

Ages: 5 – 9+ years (Enjoy Early bird prices when you register before 11 May 2025)
Holiday camp dates: Multiple dates available in June 2025
Where: Jurong Gateway, Marine Parade, Sin Ming Plaza
Holiday camp prices: From $390. Click here to register.

The Brainery Code, www.thebrainerycode.com

Children’s Worklab: Robotics, coding & technology summer camps

This June and summer holiday, Children’s Worklab has lined up a whole host of exciting technology camps that blend fun and learning through LEGO and S.T.E.A.M-based activities. Children can join the popular LEGO Robotics camps, where they’ll get to construct their own robots and machines while picking up problem-solving skills. Kids with prior coding experience can level up at the SPIKE Prime Camp, while those already familiar with robotics can dive into the Robot Inventor Camp. Little builders can get in on the action with Duplo-based sessions that introduce basic building and science concepts, while honing fine motor and visual-spatial skills.

Minecraft Game Design and Minecraft Coding camps teach kids how to create their own games, while Roblox fans can explore Roblox Studio and design their own levels at the Roblox Game Design Camp. There’s even a brand-new Artificial Intelligence and Digital Citizenship Camp, where kids explore the world of A.I. while learning how to stay safe online. Meanwhile, the 3D Modeling and Printing Camp, 3D Jedi Camp, the new 3D Jewelry Camp and Designer Camp are perfect places to unleash creativity and pick up essential design thinking skills.

Sign up in groups of three to enjoy a $30 discount for the two- to four-day camps or $50 discount for five-day camps. Plus, sign up for another camp within the same season to enjoy a $50 discount if you sign up for a three- to four-day camps or $100 discount for a five-day camp.

Age range: 3 – 13 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 5 August 2025
Where: Forum The Shopping Mall, UE Square and Shaw Centre
Holiday camp prices: from $449 per camp. WhatsApp (+65) 9729 7828 (Forum) / 8513 9878 (UE Square) / 8770 1285 (Shaw Centre) to register.

Children’s Worklab, www.worklab.com.sg

Coding Lab: Coding summer holiday camps

Coding Lab invites your kiddo to discover the wonders of coding at its Summer Coding Camps! Founded by an MIT Alumnus who worked in Silicon Valley, this MIT-inspired, award-winning curriculum taught by elite instructors guarantees a fun learning programme with real-world applications.

Kids aged 7 to 9 can explore Cognitive AI, where they’ll train smart systems to think like humans through fun, hands-on experiments. They’ll also dive into digital storytelling by animating their own movie scenes! For those aged 10 to 12, they’ll dive into Machine Learning as they build their very own AI-powered recycling app, and see how tech can make a difference in a more sustainable world. Older kids aged 13 to 18 can kickstart their tech career with Python, working on practical coding projects like a grocery list app and a school database system.

Use promo code SASSY5 to get an additional 5% off the course in addition to the prevailing Early Bird Discount!

Ages: 7 – 18 years
Holiday camp dates: 2 May – 8 August 2025
Where: Bukit Timah (KAP Mall), Century Square, Parkway Parade, United Square & Seletar Mall. Online classes are available too.
Holiday camp prices: From $450.44. Click here to register.

Coding Lab, www.codinglab.com.sg

Mind Theory: Generative AI storytelling and Roblox summer camp

Do you have a digital artist at home? Mind Theory has just the camp for you! Sign your child up for Mind Theory’s summer holiday camp–Generative AI & Roblox Holiday Camps–where kids will team up with ChatGPT to craft stories, bring them to life with AI-generated art using Freepik, and turn their tales into eye-catching videos with CapCut. They’ll even add extra flair with AI voiceovers, fostering imagination and boosting storytelling skills.

Designed for kids aged 8 to 14, this five-day AI holiday camp is best for kids who love drawing, art, computers and technology. From building their own characters to shaping entire story worlds using the classic 3-act structure (beginning, middle, and ending), kids will learn to transform simple ideas into powerful narratives. It’s storytelling supercharged, with a little help from AI!

Enjoy an exclusive $120 off your summer holiday camp when you quote SASSY.

Ages: 8 – 14 years
Holiday camp dates: June – August 2025
Where: 81 Ubi Avenue 4, UB One, #08-02, Singapore 408830
Holiday camp prices: $800 (early bird price – $680). Register via WhatsApp or website.

Mind Theory, www.mindtheory.sg

Nullspace Robotics: Robotics & coding summer holiday camp

Nullspace Robotics is known for sparking curiosity and inspiring children to play and learn with robots. With a variety of robotics and coding classes tailored to kids of all ages and skill levels this summer, you’ll be spoiled for choice! From building and programming robots to developing games and exploring electronic projects, kids will gain essential robotics and coding skills that will give them a head start for the future. We love their low instructor-to-student ratio of 1:5 which ensures each child gets personalised attention.

Minecraft fans can immerse themselves in the Minecraft Education camps, or they can bring their LEGO robots to life in the Robotics Engineer Holiday Camp. Kids can also get hands-on with 3D printing and explore a variety of platforms in the popular STEM Explorer Programme. Plus, the STEM Little Explorer Programme, tailored for kids aged 5 to 6, will combine the content of two camps into one, doubling the fun!

Quote SASSY50 to enjoy $50 off your first course sign-up! Valid for minimum purchase of 10-hour course package ($480). Code is non-stackable. Terms and conditions apply.

Ages: 5 – 16 years
Holiday camp dates: June 2025
Where: Rochester Mall, Kallang Wave Mall and SAFRA Tampines
Holiday camp prices: From $100 for a 2-hour lesson. Click here to register.

Nullspace Robotics, sg.nullspace.co

Read more: Robotics & Coding Classes In Singapore For Kids

Performing Arts & Music Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore

Centre Stage School of the Arts: Creative & performing arts summer camps

A huge dose of fun is in store at Centre Stage’s multi-discipline creative and performing arts summer holiday camps! Led by a team of experienced performers, these holiday camps let kids bring their favourite characters from books and movies to life. Blending music, drama, and art, the camps encourage children to unleash their imagination and creativity while building confidence, public speaking, and performance skills along the way.

Kids who have previously joined Centre Stage’s courses will tell you that they love the energy and fun they experience, while parents love the meticulous planning and expert delivery. Plus, your child will make friends and go home with a new sense of confidence!

To celebrate 25 years of being Singapore’s most popular and longest running Creative and Performing Arts centre, Centre Stage is offering 25% off your summer holiday camp when you quote CS25 starting 21 April 2025!

Age range: 4 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 5-day camps between 2 June – 18 July 2025
Where: Block 15 Woking Road, Singapore 138694
Holiday camp prices: from $495. Click here to register.

Centre Stage School of the Arts, centre-stage.com

International School of Performing Arts (ISPA): Circus-themed performance holiday camp

Is your kid a fan of The Greatest Showman? What if we told you they could step into the spotlight and perform in their very own circus-themed show, just like in the movie? ISPA’s exciting summer holiday camp is packed with songs, dance, and drama activities, where kids will learn music, movement, and performance skills as they prepare for the “The Greatest Show on Earth” performance!

Staying true to its showbiz theme, the camp even includes auditions where kids can audition for singing solos, lead speaking roles, and ensemble parts that bring the whole performance to life. And the best part? No prior experience is needed!

Reserve your spot at this summer holiday camp by 19 May 2025 and enjoy a $50 discount when you quote SASSYJ50!

Age range: 5 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 9 – 13 June 2025
Where: St Joseph’s Institution International School, 490 Thomson Road, Singapore 298191
Holiday camp prices: from $440. Click here to register.

International School of Performing Arts (ISPA), www.ispa.com.sg

Creative Hearts: Music & Performing Arts holiday camps

This summer, Creative Hearts offers exciting holiday camps inspired by Disney, Superheroes, Wicked, The Wizard of Oz, Taylor Swift, Olivia Rodrigo, and more! With 12 different camp themes to choose from, kids can dive into age-specific, interest-based camps designed to keep them engaged and inspired this holiday. There’s also an Instrumental Exploration, Recording and Pop Piano Camp for budding artistes.

Camps at Creative Hearts are all about building confidence, nurturing creativity, and encouraging self-expression through a gentle, child-led approach. Each session blends music, drama, craft, and games, including real music education using the Orff, Kodály, and Dalcroze methods. Selected camps will also end with a showcase performance, so kids can showcase their talents and shine on stage!

Quote SASSYCH15 to enjoy 15% off your summer holiday camps!

Age range: 3 – 10 years old
Holiday camp dates: June – July 2025
Where: River Valley and Pandan Valley
Holiday camp prices: from $158. Click here to register.

Creative Hearts, www.creativehearts.sg

TreeHouse Philharmonic: Two-week orchestra holiday camp

This July and August, TreeHouse Philharmonic is hosting a two‐week orchestral adventure that offers children the opportunity to explore the world of music and performing. Under the guidance of two experienced music educators, this holiday camp in Singapore invites young talents from around the world to rehearse, learn, and perform. More than just a holiday activity, this camp nurtures expression, connection, and creativity through music.

The intensive holiday camp provides daily masterclasses and creative sessions designed to cultivate musical skills and build confidence. This immersive experience encourages teamwork and fosters global friendships in a vibrant, supportive environment. Each child receives full‐time guidance, developing both instrument mastery and stage presence. The programme culminates in a concert at Singapore’s iconic Victoria Concert Hall, where kids can proudly showcase their skills.

Register before 31 May 2025 with promo code SASSYMAMA to enjoy 5% off your holiday camp!

Age range: 8 – 18 years old
Holiday camp dates: 28 July – 1 August 2025 & 4 August – 8 August 2025
Where: Singapore Central West Region
Holiday camp prices: $1,850 for two weeks. Click here to register.

TreeHouse Philharmonic, www.treehouse-edu.com

Cooking Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore 2025

ANATTA Young Chef’s Academy: Culinary summer holiday camp

Does your child love watching you cook? ANATTA’s Young Chef’s Academy bootcamp is specially designed for aspiring young chefs aged 4 to 16 years old. At this summer holiday camp, kids will learn to create delicious dishes, while picking up practical skills in the kitchen in a fun and safe manner. This holiday camp is a fun and engaging experience your child is sure to enjoy.

Each day features a different country’s cuisine, so your child will also get to dive into global cultures through food, learn about the source of ingredients and have the confidence to share about the origin of the ingredients they used in their dishes. From braising meat to stir-frying vegetables, laminating dough and frosting cakes, your child will get to make classic dishes from scratch.

Age range: 4 – 16 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 25 July 2025
Where: 130 Neil Road, Singapore 088859
Holiday camp prices: From $100 per day & $400 per person for five days. Click here to register.

ANATTA Culinary Academy, www.anattaca.sg

Read more: Best June Holiday Activities For Summer Fun

Language Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore 2025

HAHA Chinese: Engaging Chinese holiday camp

HAHA Chinese invites young learners on a thrilling journey through ancient legends, modern tales and future dreams. Known for their highly engaging and interactive approach to teaching Mandarin, HAHA Chinese knows how to nurture a joy of learning to spark children’s interest in Mandarin and the Chinese culture.

In this summer holiday camp, children will discover mythical creatures from Chinese folklore and embark on a space-age adventure that will be filled with rich vocabulary, cultural insights and creative storytelling. As young learners become time-travelling heroes, detectives, inventors and explorers, they will play, learn and have plenty of opportunities to get a learning boost in Mandarin without even realising it!

Quote SUMSASS5 to get 5% off your child’s summer holiday camp! Stackable on top of any other promotion up to 15% off.

Ages: 4 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 22 August 2025
Where: River Valley
Holiday camp prices: $130 to $675. Click here to register.

HAHA Chinese, www.hahachinese.co

Academia: English writing holiday camps

This June, Academia is offering a series of holiday programmes designed to strengthen your child’s English skills, especially in writing. Known for its evidence-based, learner-first approach, Academia blends Singapore’s academic rigour with methods adapted from global educational research. Founded by a Princeton grad and a top local student, the centre’s curriculum is constantly refined by a team that includes Oxbridge and Ivy League educators, ensuring your child receives expert guidance to soar in their English writing skills!

From 2-day writing workshops to 3-day symposiums, these camps target key areas of the English syllabus. Younger learners will explore storytelling fundamentals like character, setting, and conflict, while Primary 3 – 4 students tackle broader themes like values and virtues. Primary 5 – 6 students will focus on refining structure, depth, and clarity in their writing. Programmes are held at Academia’s main campuses and at Coronation Plaza under the Tanglin Collective. Mathematics camps and PSLE prep sessions are also available too!

Ages: 7 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 – 15 June 2025
Where: Upper Thomson and Coronation Plaza (Tanglin Collective)
Holiday camp prices: From $218 for 2-day workshops. Click here to register.

Academia, www.academia.com.sg

Alliance Française: French holiday camp

Alliance Française de Singapour’s summer holiday camps are a great way for kids aged 3 to 11 to pick up or build on their French while having tons of fun. Each week brings a new theme designed to spark imagination and creativity through sensory and hands-on activities. These include storytelling, performance theatre, art, sports and more! Whether it’s exploring the world of oceans, experiencing the magic of the circus, or discovering drama, music and sport, these camps help build French communication skills while immersing the kids in the French culture.

Whether your child is discovering French for the first time or already speaks the language, the camps cater to both learners and native speakers. Led by passionate educators (including French theatre artist Mathilde Bagein for the drama camps!), these camps also foster teamwork and performance, helping children build essential skills such as public speaking and confidence.

Ages: 3 – 11 years old
Holiday camp dates: Held weekly throughout June, July and August 2025
Where: Alliance Française de Singapour, 1 Sarkies Road, Singapore 258130
Holiday camp prices: $410 (half day); $560 (full day). Click here to register.

Alliance Française, www.alliancefrancaise.org.sg

British Council: English language summer camps

If you want to improve your child’s spoken and written English, consider the British Council’s Summer 2025 Camps. At their holiday camps, students will study a different topic each week through a unique approach that uses hands-on experiential learning. This ignites their interest and improves their English skills, while also boosting their knowledge and awareness of the world around them. The international teachers are highly qualified and experienced so they will be able to guide your child offering individualised attention.

Each week is a complete, stand-alone camp, where students will get to join in fun games, activities and hands-on experiments, group projects and even drama games to develop their vocabulary, gain confidence in communicating, develop their world knowledge and curiosity and improve their critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

Submit your interest online to get exclusive discounts for their summer holiday camp!

Ages: 4 – 16 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 29 August 2025
Where: Napier Road and Toa Payoh centres
Holiday camp prices: $805 per week. Click here to register.

British Council, www.britishcouncil.sg/smsc

Hanziland: Chinese language summer holiday camp

Looking to give your child a little Chinese learning boost? Hanziland offers a Chinese Language & Culture holiday camp that will nurture your child’s love for the Chinese language through engaging activities, folktales, classic Chinese poems and cultural art & craft. What’s more, your child can learn about money management and problem-solving through board games that blend Chinese history and culture.

They will even get hands-on with little science experiments under Chinese instruction and learn to appreciate ancient Chinese poetry through reading, singing and writing. Little do they realise that while they’re having a blast, they will be gaining essential critical thinking skills as they engage in games with their peers. Learning Chinese is more fun than ever before!

Get 10% off with promo code SASSY10OFF. Not stackable with other promotions.

Ages: 5 – 10 years old
Camp dates: 26 – 30 May; 2 – 6 June;  9 – 13 June; 21 – 25 July; 28 July – 1 August; 4 – 8 August
Where: Hanziland School: 46 East Coast Road, #08-02, East Gate @ Katong, Singapore 428766
Holiday camp prices: $240 (3 mornings) and $360 (5 mornings). Click here to register.

Hanziland, www.hanziland.com

I CAN READ: Music, coding, literacy summer holiday camp

I CAN READ, the leading phonics-based literacy programme in Singapore, helps your child become a confident and independent reader using a structured and systematic approach. This summer, sign up for their unique holiday camp that is centred around music, blending music with literacy to encourage students to express themselves more confidently and reach their full potential. The Beat Boppers programme is designed for 5 to 6-year-olds, allowing them to groove to different beats and sounds while developing essential phonemic awareness, reading, and writing skills.

For older kids aged 7 to 9, sign them up for Tech Adventures. This beginner-friendly programme blends reading and coding through ScratchJr (Junior Coders) and Scratch 3.0 (Primary Coders) helping students develop creativity, confidence, and critical thinking skills. Students will build animations, bring ideas to life, and discover how coding can make reading stories even more exciting. Note: Participants are required to bring their own laptop or tablet.

Use code 2025JHP-EB10 to enjoy a 10% early bird discount! Register before 18 May 2025.

Ages: 5 – 9 years old
Holiday camp dates: 23 – 25 June 2025 , 10am – 12:30pm (Beat Boppers), 10am to 1pm (Tech Adventures)
Where: HarbourFront, Hillion Mall, Kovan, Novena, Punggol, Tampines, West Coast Plaza, and Yishun
Holiday camp prices: $298 (Beat Boppers) & $359 (Tech Adventures). Click here to register.

I CAN READ, www.sg.icanread.asia

Wonderlit: Reading, creative writing, public speaking, speech & drama holiday camps

Looking for a way to help your child become a confident reader and eloquent communicator? Sign them up for Wonderlit’s June 2025 Holiday Camps, where they will learn essential reading, writing and speaking skills that will empower them to excel academically and beyond. Designed for kids aged 3 to 12 years old, Wonderlit’s holiday camps will cover phonics and reading, creative writing, public speaking and speech & drama, all of which will spark your child’s imagination, encourage self-exploration and help them uncover their unique voices.

Thanks to their engaging programme and interactive activities, many children who have attended Wonderlit’s camps in the past eagerly return for more enriching experiences. Don’t miss out on the chance to give your child a learning boost and nurture a love of the English language in your little one.

Enjoy an early bird discount of 10% off when you book before 15 May 2025 or register four or more children at the same time.

Ages: 3 – 12 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 to 27 June 2025
Where: Claymore Connect, 442 Orchard Road, #03-08 to #03-12, Singapore 238879
Holiday camp prices: Refer to their website for prices. Click here to register.

Wonderlit, www.wonderlitworld.com

Science Summer Camps In Singapore 2025

Newtonshow: Character-themed science and cooking holiday camps

If you’ve got a curious kiddo who’s into science (or just loves to create and explore), Newtonshow’s Summer Camps are worth checking out this school holiday. Running all summer long from 2 June to 29 August, these camps cater to kids aged 2.5 to 14 years and cover a wide range of interests. From Sanrio Science World and Superhero Science to Harry Potter themes and World Chef Cooking Camp. Expect hands-on activities like magnetic slime experiments, colour-changing potions, and DIY potion bottles that are fun, creative, and educational all at once.

We love that meals are provided daily, and camps are kept small for more personalised attention. With four convenient locations across Singapore and an optional door-to-door bus service, logistics are a breeze. Plus, the flexible booking options – full-day, half-day, or even individual days – mean you can fit camp around your holiday plans.

Quote SASSYMAMA20 to enjoy 20% off your holiday camps!

Ages: 2.5 – 14 years old
Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 29 August 2025
Where: West, East, Novena and Central Singapore
Holiday camp prices: $100 per day. Click here to register.

Newtonshow, www.newtonshowcamp.com

Art Summer Camps In Singapore 2025

Little Artists Art Studio: Hands-on art holiday camp for kids

Do you have a creative child at home? This holiday camp is designed just for them! Known for their inspiring art lessons, Little Artists Art Studio is offering an Artrageous Summer Holiday camp, specially designed for kids aged 4 to 17 to unleash creativity. At this art holiday camp in Singapore, campers will explore various art forms from sketching to watercolour, clay sculpture, digital art, fashion design, manga illustration and more.

Led by qualified Fine Art & Design educators from around the world, this art holiday camp will give your child an opportunity to get their burning questions answered and learn from the best of the best. Kids will take home three to seven completed artworks (depending on the length of their chosen programme), a certificate of participation and a creative goodie bag to commemorate their journey. Older students can sign up for tailored workshops for SOTA/DSA preparation and international art college portfolios for customised coaching, conceptual and creative development.

Ages: 4 – 17 years old
Holiday camp dates: 31 May – 15 August 2025; (9:30am – 4:45pm for four full days; 9:30am – 2pm for four half-days; two-day camps also available)
Where: Siglap Centre, 55 Siglap Road, #02-18, Singapore 455817
Holiday camp prices: $300 – $850 (materials included, but lunch not included for full-day camps). Click here to register.

Little Artists Art Studio, www.little-artists.com

Disclaimer: Sassy Mama does not own or manage these holiday camps. All programme information is supplied by the camp and is subject to change. Check directly before booking. Unless mentioned, discounts are not stackable.

Want more educational fun for kids? Scroll below for an awesome idea or two!

item.title: UPDATED: 57 Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages
item.dc:creator: Sassy Mama
item.description:
Looking for some indoor activities for kids? Check out these awesome indoor playgrounds in Singapore for kids of all ages from soft-play centres to indoor playgrounds for bigger kids! With so many indoor playgrounds in Singapore, your kids will be totally spoilt for choice when it comes to things to do in Singapore. Use our […]

The post UPDATED: 57 Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages appeared first on Sassy Mama.
item.content:encoded:
Looking for some indoor activities for kids? Check out these awesome indoor playgrounds in Singapore for kids of all ages from soft-play centres to indoor playgrounds for bigger kids!

With so many indoor playgrounds in Singapore, your kids will be totally spoilt for choice when it comes to things to do in Singapore. Use our best indoor playgrounds list to choose your preferred play space depending on the age of your child – there’s something for tiny tots all the way up to older kids and even teens! Many of these indoor playgrounds have jungle gyms, interactive play spaces, and soft play areas plus for the bigger kids there are obstacle courses, trampolines, climbing walls, and skating zones and one even has the longest indoor slide in SG!

Bonus: some of these indoor playgrounds have cafes or working spots where you can sit and have a drink or get some work done while the kiddos play. You’re welcome!

PS: Many of these indoor playgrounds also host birthday parties and offer kids’ holiday camps! And remember to pack socks (most indoor playgrounds in Singapore usually require non-slip socks!) for everyone otherwise, you’ll end up having to buy them.

Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore:

 

1. SuperPark Singapore: Two-floor indoor playground for older kids

Indoor playground deets: The long wait is finally over! SuperPark Singapore has re-opened its doors after a revamp, and it’s bigger, better and bolder! SuperPark Singapore is the biggest all-in-one, two-floor indoor playground that has something for kids of all ages. There are 34 thrilling activities, including 13 new game stations that will give kids (and grown-ups) a chance to enjoy some friendly competition!

One of our favourite highlights is the Airbag Donut slide, where older kids can whizz down a super steep slide and soar through the air. Get moving with Super Pixel, a game of speed and strategy, where you and your friends must race against the clock to step on coloured tiles to win the game. Little ones can burn off energy at Super Dash and sprint on the spot to race around the track.

When tummies start grumbling, unwind at Super Recharge, their first-ever in-park café with kids’ faves like pizza, hot dogs, potato wedges and more. Plus, you can also plan your child’s next birthday party at one of their eight convertible party rooms. Sign up for their membership for as low as $19.90 to enjoy exclusive discounts and privileges.

SuperPark indoor playground prices: Free for infants aged 1 and below; $15.95 for kids below 100cm; from $31.90 for kids above 100 cm and adults. Grip socks are sold separately for $3.50 a pair.

Quote SPSASSY10 to get 10% off a regular indoor playground ticket.

SuperPark, 3 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec City Mall (Tower 2), #01-488, Singapore 038983, Tel: (+65) 6239 5360, www.superpark.sg

Read more: Best Kids’ Birthday Party Venues In Singapore

2. Pixie Trixie Playhouse: Indoor spa experience for kids

Indoor playground deets: If you’re on the hunt for a unique indoor playground experience in Singapore, Pixie Trixie Playhouse in East Coast should definitely be on your radar. Also known as Singapore’s first kids’ spa and makeover haven, Pixie Trixie Playhouse is where little ones can enjoy a full-on spa session that includes a DIY chocolate facial, mini mani & pedi, footbath with fizzy bathbomb and even a hair and make-up makeover.

We love that all products used are specially formulated for children, so your mini-me can indulge without worry! Once they’re all dolled up, they can explore the indoor play area that’s equipped with a mini kitchen, supermarket and doctor’s clinic. There’s also a ball pit, train set, Barbie Dream House and even board games to keep older kids engaged.

Don’t worry, there’s something for the boys too! The Boys-Only Fun Spa features a mini shopping trip to choose spa goodies, bathrobes and slippers and a welcome drink served in a champagne flute. The session includes a DIY chocolate facial, footbath with fizzy bath bomb, temporary tattoos, and cool hairstyling. Watch our Reel here.

Pixie Trixie indoor playground prices: $49 for boys, $89 for girls

Pixie Trixie Playhouse, 926 East Coast Road, Singapore 459116, Tel: (+65) 8493 9949, www.pixietrixieplayhouse.com

3. Pororo Park Singapore: Popular indoor playground

Indoor playground deets: Pororo Park Singapore is an indoor playground in Singapore spotlights the popular Korean animated series ‘Pororo the Little Penguin’! Located in the heart of the city at Marina Square, this indoor playground offers a variety of play spaces that will keep your kids coming back for more.

Kids can hop on the Pororo Express Train, or whizz down the slide into a giant ball pit! The youngest ones can park themselves at Hinoki Pit for sensory play with aromatic wooden cubes. Plus, don’t miss Pororo & Friends live shows at Tong Tong’s Theatre and meet-and-greet sessions for a memorable experience. Eddy’s Classroom hosts daily workshops and craft activities on weekdays and thematic activities every month on weekends.

While the kids have a blast exploring and learning through play, mums and dads can relax at Loopy’s Café, which offers kid-friendly meals and treats. This indoor playground in Singapore also has a birthday party room for a stress-free birthday celebration! Enjoy even more fun with their Elite membership for just $29.90 per month. Get up to 8 visits monthly and exclusive discounts and privileges.

Pororo Park Singapore indoor playground prices: Unlimited playtime on weekdays and 2-hour playtime on weekends for $38 (1 adult, 1 child); $10 per additional adult; $10 per infant below 9 months old. 3-hour playtime on weekends for $45 (1 adult, 1 child).

Quote PPSASSY10 to get 10% off a regular ticket.

Pororo Park, 6 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square, #02-29, Singapore 039594, Tel: (+65) 6239 5360, www.pororoparksg.com

4. Tayo Station: Indoor playground in the East

Indoor playground deets: Tayo Station at Downtown East is an indoor playground where the popular animated series ‘Tayo the Little Bus’ comes to life! We love the kid-sized street, Tayo’s Road Circuit, where little ones can zoom around on mini-buses and luges. This circuit comes with traffic lights, bus stops, a garage and even a car wash–a fantastic way to teach your kids about road safety.

Gani’s Playground is where you’ll find all the action and it’s the first place our little ones always zoom to. This multi-level gym offers plenty of climbing fun for kids, fun slides and lots of obstacles for a good workout. There’s also a gamified trampoline corner where young ones can test their agility by hitting the lit-up buttons. Not going to lie, we’ve spotted parents engrossed in the challenge here, too! Meanwhile, younger tots have lots of soft-play corners to explore, plus some good ol’ tactile play at Poco’s Hinoki Play, a sensory pit with wooden cubes.

For Tayo fans, keep your eyes and ears peeled for Tayo meet-and-greets! With two dedicated party rooms–Lani’s and Rogi’s–it’s also the perfect place to host a birthday party. Unlock even more fun with their Elite membership for just $29.90 per month! You’ll get up to 8 visits monthly, plus exclusive discounts and privileges.

Tayo Station indoor playground prices: Unlimited weekday playtime is $31.90 for one child below 12 years old (inclusive of 1 adult); 2-hour child ticket (including 1 adult) is $31.90 (weekends, PH, school holidays); Babies (<9 months): $10; Additional adult: $8.

Quote TYSASSY10 to get 10% off a regular ticket.

Tayo Station, E!Hub, Downtown East, 1 Pasir Ris Close, Level 3, Singapore 519599, Tel: (+65) 6239 5360, www.tayostation.com

Read more: Best Deals & Promos In Singapore: Attractions, Dining & More

5. (NEW!) Wan To Play @ Punggol Coast Mall: Ocean-themed indoor playground

Indoor playground deets: Wan To Play’s newest ocean-themed indoor playground at Punggol Coast Mall features a bright and spacious area where little ones can explore and play. Little ones can get hands-on at two sensory play areas, while older kids can test their balance and coordination at an obstacle course, get competitive with a car racing game, or hop on a duck boat ride. Plus, don’t miss the giant horn slide and LED slides that will take the kids into a giant ball pit. There’s also a merry-go-round, a rock-climbing wall, role-playing activities and a trampoline to give the kids a sweaty workout!

Wan To Play indoor playground prices: $35 for a two-hour pass for 1 adult and 1 child.

Wan To Play, 84 Punggol Way, #01-60/61/62 Punggol Coast Mall, Singapore 829911, www.wantoplay.sg

6. (NEW!) Wan To Play @ T3: Dino-themed indoor playground

Indoor playground deets: Wan To Play unveils yet another indoor playground at Changi Airport Terminal 3. Fans of dinos will love this indoor playground because they will get to spot dinosaurs everywhere they turn!
